Reviews.Title: “Huge, bustling place:like being in a small town”
Reviews.Author: montreal7565
Reviews.Content: Enormous, extremely busy hotel. Staff pleasant and helpful despite this. Rooms adequate: ask for one on the back, as there is ongoing noisy construction in front of the hotel on gerrard street. Was Dvised of this at checkin and the employee very helpfully found the quietest room possible. Very accommodating to children. Quite a lot of corridor noise at night, and many people drifting in and out of the lobby. Good location for access to subway . Many fastfood restaurantsin the rea. Groceries available nearby. Self -serve restaurant rather hectic and somewhat overpriced. Drawback: no wifi in room! Available in lobby and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: P.Shields
Reviews.Content: I must say, that I choose this hotel everytime that I visit Toronto, the staff are friendly, checkin is a breeze, getting help with luggage, fantastic, rooms are definately clean and just overall a great place to be. Now I did have a problem with my bill, but when I went to check out, it was handled so quickly that it WOWED me again, there was no questions asked, it was just handled AMAZING! I am sorry that I have to say, I dont go looking for mildew in the shower, I dont go looking for a piece of paint pealing or a scuff on the wall or a small stain on the carpet, that to me is being nit picky, and to be honest when I read those reviews it makes my blood boil, as hotels are high traffic areas, and they work very hard to keep it to where the dont have to charge you a few hundred to stay there, if you want to live in bubbles stay home and clean your own house like that, but those are silly to say the least. Now I was there this past sunday, and was woke up because of a fire alarm, I did my duty and evacuated the room, went down 26 flights of stairs, but did I complain, nope, I would rather those people keep me safe then let me burn. But it always makes me laugh when I see the reviews on here, so I just like to say for the record, to go to this hotel and enjoy it. They sure pull out all the stops to make sure that you enjoy your stay! Thank you to the management and staff of Delta Chelsea!! I will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the center of downtown...”
Reviews.Author: Jeymi M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea with some friends during the third weekend in March, and it was a great experience. We were told that it was Spring Break week, so there were a lot of children with their families there. I noticed that there were a lot of activities centered around the kids, so it's definitely a family friendly hotel. I didn't try the water slide, so I can't comment on that. When we got to our room, we had a very nice view of the city on the 23rd floor, and overall it was very clean. I didn't get the sticky feel of a poorly done housekeeping job. The beds were pretty comfy; got a good night's sleep, except for the pillows were too high for my liking, but that's just personal choice. I'm giving this rating for the good points mentioned above but more than anything, it's a great location. When we got to the hotel on the first day, we parked and didn't have to use the car the whole time we were there. It's right in the middle of downtown Toronto and everything we needed was at walking distance. The mall, the restaurants, the attractions, it was great! The pricing for the stay was not too bad; we got a discount because it was spring break week, and the fee for parking was the best in the area. The only issue I had with the pricing was that I had to pay a fee to have internet connection in our room, and it was dial-up :( Big no-no. It was a fast connection, but I didn't like to have to pay for it. If I needed wi-fi, it was only in the lobby. Other than that, it was a truly good experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent downtown Toronto child-friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emilie N
Reviews.Content: excellent downtown Toronto location . I came with an 8 year old boy who loved the pool and hot whirlpool; we were able to book two times on the day of arrival. I expected a busy hotel with children over the March break and so was not surprised. My boy liked the availability of the arcade games . Excellent meals including room service for supper, and then restaurant for breakfast. Excellent choices for food. Price is comparable to other downtown Toronto hotels but the amenities are better for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure Trip”
Reviews.Author: Ken H
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here since they opened. Best location in Toronto . Near the Subway and Eaton's Centre and walking distance to many attractions. Food is consistently good. Rooms are clean and staff is friendly. Priced right.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly...but at a price”
Reviews.Author: Madsim
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms for our family of 4 over the march break. We were looking for a "big city" get-awayand the Delta Chelsea made it clear on the web-site they were very kid friendly. My children wanted a pool and the pics of the waterslide and pool, coupled with a good price sold me. In short, it was a bad choice. The rooms they offered us were three floors apart and the pool is very small, even by Toronto hotel standards. We were assured when reserving...and paying in full, in advance, that we would have adjacent rooms yet they were unable to deliver. The hotel was so booked with families that swim times had to be arranged in advance. When we checked in at 3pm all swim times were already fully booked for the rest of the day and dispite assurances that the next morning would be "wide open...no need to book ahead" I discovered at 8:30am the only remaining time available was 45 minutes at 12 noon and even then they could not accomodate all four of us. I appreciate that march break is busy and unpredictable, but the hotel gave no indication that pre-booking swim times would be required, even at check-in and I find that unacceptable. Compounding the situation is the Delta's apparently new contact policy. There is no phone number or email available for the hotel on the web-site...or in fact anywhere, and when I asked for an email address/phone number to speak with management I was told by the conceirge that no contact information was available. Delta appear to have passed their on-line and telephone reservations to a third party and the lack of contact information for the hotel is conspicuos in it's absence. It should not be hard to call a hotel and ask about adjoining/adjacent rooms. Very dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “March 17th Break”
Reviews.Author: ellyBurlington
Reviews.Content: I was there with my daughter, my 3 yr. old grandaughter and husband. this was our second time there. I arrive early in the morning, and had a wonderful breakfast. My daughter arrived a couple of hours later and my husband late afternoon, we stayed there overnight as we were there to see Disney on ice- dare to dream at Rogers Center. our day was perfect, mangers were wonderful at all times. and always availble to help, we had a deluxe room on the 20th floor that was perfect. except the balcony needs some reno done, but bathroom was clean and tidy, and when one of us forgeot our toothbrush housekeeping immediately brought one up including toothpaste. The Pool was very clean and fresh, as well as the hot tub, My grandaughter just loved the play center, and watching a movie in the lobby with free popcorn and beverage. they really went all out to make March Break fun for all the kids, it was as if we were at a resort. The only disadvantage was that the next morning night after St> Patricks day someone on the 25th floor decided to pull the friealarm switch. first our room had bright strob lights flashing in our room, next came on the alarm, and then from the speakers in the room annoucment for floors 24,25, 26 to evacute. to follow instructions on the back door of the rooms and not to take the elevators. Our floor wa not affected. 10 minutes later announcemnt came on that the problem has been fixed. we found out later that someone pulled the firealarm for a joke. The hotel was wonderful in the way they proceeded to inform all the guests. and were quite appologetic. In the restaurant everyone was offered free coffee for the inconvience. I will definately go back to this hotel they make you feel welcomed and and comfortable to be a guest. Elly from Burlington ont. and Shari from Angus Ont.

Reviews.Title: “March break - Toronto getaway”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: Life gets so busy but its so refreshing to know I can stay at Delta Chelsea Toronto and have a solid, great hotel at a great price. Steps from Yonge/Dundas Square and Eaton centre. Smooth check-in, nice room, very pleasant staff. Next trip back to Toronto, simply pick Delta Chelsea and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Canada's largest hotel, very popular with families & groups”
Reviews.Author: jimseab
Reviews.Content: I was staying here on business and had a terrible first night's sleep as there was lots of corridor and street noise, followed by early morning music playing in a neighbouring room. Upon complaining to front desk, their first reaction was to say this is to be expected in spring break, and that I should have called security at the time to have them stop the noise. Having got past these unhelpful opening remarks, I was quickly offered a new, larger, quieter room at no extra charge. This was a more modern room than the first, but the common parts of the hotel are all looking a bit tired and old. Extraordinary but true: Internet in rooms is wired only, costs $14 per 24 hours, and is somewhat unreliable but fast when connected (I wasted a fair bit of time wrestling with the login system). Neither of my rooms had a safe or a fridge. The nicer one had 1 robe and both had a decent supply of toiletries. There's a decent gym/pool on the top floor (with another pool for families elsewhere). Overall, having stayed elsewhere in downtown Toronto, I think there are better, more comfortable places for business travellers, e.g. the Marriott on Bloor and the Holiday Inn on Carlton, both of which I have recently stayed in with fewer problems / issues.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of a bummer!”
Reviews.Author: loolica
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here during March break and were thoroughly disappointed. our 10th floor room was dark and dingy and didn't feel very clean. There were hand prints all over the windows and balcony door, the wall paper was torn in many places, there were holes in the bathroom wall where an appliance seems to have been removed. Our room faced a construction site, so we were greeted with the sound of cranes and jackhammers every morning at 7 a.m. Just what you want in a vacation! The hotel was so crammed with people that you had to BOOK TIME IN THE POOL every morning. We were allowed two 50 minute slots a day, not back to back, so swam in the evenings from 9-10 p.m. in a packed pool with 75 other people. There is no wifi available in the rooms and wired internet costs $15 a day. There is free WiFi available in the lobby, but frankly, when I can get free WiFi for the price of a cup of coffee at Starbucks or Second Cup, I expect it included with the cost of a three night stay in a hotel, too. Many of the other 3-stars in Toronto offer WiFi free, in-room. The final insult was the breakfast buffet that we had on our last day. (I'm typing from the table right now.) Horrible scrambled eggs, blah, mushy potatoes, cold rubbery pancakes. The bacon was decent, as was the cup of tea I helped myself to. Juice was served in small plastic cups. There were some nice touches, and you can see that the Delta is really courting the family crowd. There were lots of family activities planned, movie nights and bingo in the meeting rooms. In the afternoon, managers served up popcorn and iced tea (iced tea? for kids?) in the lobby, which was a nice treat when we waited in line to check in. The check-in line was enormously long, easily 45-50 people ahead of us when we arrived, but we were checked-in in under 10 minutes. Unfortunately, these little extras failed to make up for an otherwise mediocre experience.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Darth_Vukster
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't the most luxurious, but it was fairly nice, well kept, clean, and well staffed. I was a bit surprised, but the standard rooms still had the old tube type tvs. We had actually upgraded so we could have connecting rooms and the $20 upgraded rooms had the flat screens. The hotel is located within walking distance of the subway and close to the Yonge street shopping area. The indoor pool with giant water slide is great if you have kids (or if you like slides). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone but the most discriminating of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Malfunctioning bathrooms are a wash!”
Reviews.Author: Karhakeron
Reviews.Content: Toilet backed up EVERY day I stayed there during PDAC 2012 and flooded the floor! Symptoms were dealt with only (water on floor), but NOT the problem itself!! I did not emjoy my room on the 19th floor in the least!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: luvalotmom1306
Reviews.Content: well I have to say as of right now I am NOT a fan. We just checked in about an hour ago after waiting in a long line. Then our room keys didn't work as being here alone with my two kids and all the luggage I couldn't just leave them so I had to wait another fifteen minutes for security. Then we find out the kids can't go swimming until 11pm and only for 50 minutes. You actually have to book a swim time and it can only be for 50 minutes. You can go twice a day. You can not book for the following day...you have to be there at 7am to book. And we are in a kitchenette room (dated from the fiftys down to the 13" Zenith tv) and I go to make piZzas for my kids and lo and behold...no can opener!!! So I phone down to front desk twenty minutes ago. I just get a call now saying they can't find one. BUT I can get my kids shoes on and drag them down to the marketplace to have them open my cans. NEVER again. What a dump!!! There is mold in the bathroom as well. And we are facing construction. I can't believe this room was 160 bucks. This is disgusting. Room was 2150. Horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Nasus Y
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Rooms are old and in need of an updating. Difficult to regulate the temperature. Okay place to stay but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea is the best hotel to stay! I have experienced staying in different hotel, but only Delta Chelsea ROCKS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: imeejaime
Reviews.Content: We had a very wonderful stay at delta chelsea hotel Toronto!!! The staffs are very helpful and friendly, the location is wonderful and the hotel cleanliness is excellent!! We will stay here again on our next visit. Love u guys.

Reviews.Title: “Location - can't be beat; Room - much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: JRalli
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed here in several years, and I guess a several years means a long time in hotel years. The location is absolutely amazing. Literally 2 blocks from the Eaton Centre and in the heart of the action. The room however, is very very tired and definitely in need of some updates. I travel a lot for work, so I have come to have certain expectations of hotels - whether they are Travelodge, Comfort Inn, Holiday Inn or a Delta chain. The room was very small, I don't remember them being so small, but I guess they are. The ad also indicates "balcony access". The access however is blocked off with wood, so you can not actually go out the patio door. The bathroom had a lot of rust around the trim of the door and on the floor. There was no Kleenex - which doesn't sound like a big deal, but when working with a cold, toilet paper just doesn't cut it. A major deal breaker for me as a business traveler is that there are no plug ins near the bed. The alarm function on the clock did not work and I always need a back up solution to wake up calls, so it meant putting my phone in the bathroom to plug it in. Another problem was that 1 of the coffee cups had stains in it which were rather unappealing. It took 1.5 hrs to get a new cup!! 1.5 hrs!! I went to the front desk but they could not provide it to me at the desk, I had to wait for it to be delivered. So 1 front desk visit, 2 calls and 1.5hrs later, I was able to have a cup of coffee. The room is also very outdated in terms of the pictures on the wall, but that's neither here nor there, just something I thought I'd note. I really am not a picky person, but these are just easy standards that I've come to expect and would highly expect any Delta hotel to meet. It's unfortunate. It may have just been the room I had, and I will hope for that because the location really is amazing. Next time I will spend the extra money and stay at the Sheraton instead as I have stayed there recently and know they live up to their Sheraton name. I am anxious for Delta to return to their once very shining reputation as I would like to become a customer again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TheMrs314
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed for a one night stay in the Signature Club King room- The view was nice. Check it was perfect, staff were extremely friendly and I am not just saying that- We ordered room Service the filet mignon and the seafood pasta which was delicious but a bit on the expensive side but well worth it-The gentlemen that delivered our food, which I cannot remmeber his name, was so pleasant, he greated me by using my last name which was adorable. The room.... LOVED IT! The entire signature floor was fantastic! so clean and modern( Hallways) The room was sooooo nice! the king bed, the room decor, the bathroom.. Perfect. We are actually planning on going bck for an evening again soon. I have not stayed in any other room catergorie at the hotel but I would recommend staying in a Prefered room for sure. We didn't get a chance to go to the signature lounge, bt we did walk by and it was so nice- We were just to comfortable hangging out in our King sized bed... Did I mention there is a flat screen TV? Overall, I would recommend this Hotel to every and anyone, I honestly thank the staff for such wonderful customer service, we will be back again and next time we will take photos to show everyone how nice the hotel and room is

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to the Delta Chelsea in a few months”
Reviews.Author: kmsultan
Reviews.Content: I was back at the Delta Chelsea for a two week business trip. The room I was given was different this time, as it contained a kind sized bed and a kitchenette. Although the tv was smaller, I didn't mind given that I wasn't there to watch tv anyway. Having a fidge, stove, and microwave in the room made my two week trip a bit bearable. If you're going to stay there, sign up for the Delta Privilege program, as that gives you complimentary Wi-Fi (It's typically ~$14 per 24 hour period), and late checkout (6 pm vs. 11 am). Enrolling in the Delta Privilege program is free.

Reviews.Title: “I always tell people visiting Toronto to stay here”
Reviews.Author: MexicoFanatic
Reviews.Content: The price is very reasonable. The location is so handy - right on the subway, close to the Eaton Centre. The restaurants are first class. The food is delicious and the service couldn't be nicer. And the buffet - WOW!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great from the entrance and lobby. Very soon it was apparent that all monies had been spent on first appearances and not on the rooms. Paint peeling of the ceilings, windows so dirty you could not see outside, wallpaper pealing of the walls, 1970's television and dated decor. After the 3rd room it was obvious that we had not just been unlucky with the first room but that they were all of the same condition.

Reviews.Title: “2 Thumbs UP!!”
Reviews.Author: justjack16
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute and from the start it was a hit. When booking I found a cheaper price online and they matched and beat it by 10% after calling their reservation line. When we arrived it was extremely busy (first day of March Break). Maria at the front desk was EXCELLENT quick and to the point when she found out it was my daughter's birthday she asked her name and said "happy birthday" -- it pays off! When we got our room we went and signed up for swimming and saw what was available for kids to do. The hotel went out of their way to make this about them for March Break. After returning from walking around Toronto we found a surprise! They had delivered 2 glasses of milk and 2 cookies with a PERSONAL Birthday note for my daughter. IMPRESSED... The entire stay was great friendly, clean and close to T.O hot spots- Eaton Centre and food etc...

Reviews.Title: “Had to fight for decent service”
Reviews.Author: kruser_11
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is a nice hotel in downtown Toronto with a good reputation. I had stayed there once previously and had a great experience, so I expected the same this time. Me and my boyfriend arrived at 1pm and asked if we could check-in, which we could not. That was acceptable, as check-in wasn't until 3pm, but the Front Desk staff told us to come back in one hour and they would rush our room. Again, that was great. Upon return, we were told that our room was facing the construction across the street. We were tired and just wanted to lay down, so we didn't protest and went up to the room. I understand that it is not the hotel's fault that a condominium is being built across the street, but the noise level was absolutely unacceptable. Not only that, the room they put us in was old and dumpy. The TV was a tiny tube TV and the bedspread, curtains and carpet looked old and worn. I phoned Guest Services, requesting a room change and was told that the hotel had nothing else available. I protested that we were not paying the same rate as someone in one of the renovated rooms for this old, noisy room, and they put me on hold. When they came back, the woman I was speaking to told me they would put in a request for a new room for me, but would have to downgrade us from King Bed to a single Queen Bed. We were desperate to get out of our current room and agreed. She ensured me she would call me back and give me an approximate time the room would be ready. After 20 minutes, I phoned back and spoke to the same woman who said that she didn't call back because she didn't have a time for me. I mentioned that we had dinner reservations in just over an hour and would need to know if we should get ready and have the staff move our luggage to our new room, or if we should wait, move and then change. She again said she would phone back. Another 20 minutes pass and I phone again. This time I speak to a gentleman about the situation and he says that my room has been ready for a while and to come down to the Front Desk to get new keys. The new room they placed us in was great: no noise, new decor and it had a King Bed. I hate to think the worst of people, but I wonder if the woman at Guest Services lied to us about downgrading from a King to Queen bed to try to get us to remain in the first room. I am really disappointed in the Delta Chelsea, mainly because I felt that my age was a factor in the service I received. Yes, I'm a young person and not a frequent traveler, but that doesn't mean that I don't deserve to be respected. I understand that the hotel has to fill all of its rooms to make profit, even the old rooms facing construction, but it really seemed like the staff did everything possible to keep us out of a "good" room. Once I fought back, there seemed to be good rooms available. However, no one should have to fight for decent service at hotel, regardless of their age.

Reviews.Title: “A boon for the kids”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: You know what, if your going to Toronto for a break with the kids look no further than the Delta Chelsea. They have a canteen style restaurant which does food from breakfast to evening meal which is great if you want something quick and don't want to sit down and eat. The main restaurants which are a bit tricky to find from the main reception are really good, food wise. The main restaurants are a bit of an over complicated set up, you go in and on the left is a kind of fine dinning area and ahead is the main body of the restaurant which are served by the same waiting staff and the menu's are the same... Bar that, food's great. The rooms are big enough and comfortable but they are in need of a spruce up. The adult pool and gym on the top floor is a little tricky to find, and once you get there is nice and clean enough but the pool is only 20 feet long so swimming is a short affair. The gym is well equipped and the view over Toronto takes your mind off the pain of running on the tread mills. The kids area looked great, I was on business so didn't have the family with me but it looked like it had everything the would want in spade fulls. It's really central to the downtown area so handy for shopping, sight seeing etc, it's just that little bit over complicated to find things and a little tired...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy B
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, great location and wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “great service. great people”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia I
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and end up staying here a lot. they are great people, take the time to get to know you and really, really value your business I feel safe as I do travel alone, and the rooms are always neat, clean and will appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Started rough ,ended great”
Reviews.Author: HabsfanJez
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel number of times,always liked this hotel for his location,and great fully-equipped gym. I am a privilege member(gold status) and many times over the last 2 years I stayed at this hotel booking thru Priceline /Expedia ,etc.Never ever had an issue about this and always got what my membership allows me,till last time... Let's start with the bad;On my time to check in,lady at the privilege member desk,after asking me for me name(keep in mind I have a very unique name) and then started a lot of confusion,passing by seeing/dealing with the manager(which was a breeze) and ended up with a great room.My downer was that if the front desk lady at the privilege member desk would have done her job correctly,by asking me to spell my first name instead of taping on the keyboard what she thought was mine,we would have avoid lots of frustration ... As mentionned earlier,I love their gym,lots of free weights/benches /mirrors /towel which is always much appreciated when u come to think most hotels advertised "gym" when we know,huh,not really... The pool and whirlpool are great . I became a vegan not too long ago and one of my biggest challenge has been to stay in hotels where are familiar with the diet and can also accommodate me with my request and Delta Chelsea owns a 5 stars just for this part as they have a thing called (not too sure the right wording) make your own menu/meal do they have been capable of accommodating me just right . Thanks again and see you in a few weeks

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Toronto Delta Chelsey ~ Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mel r
Reviews.Content: staff are warm and welcoming, very helpful with directions and suggestions. Our room was very comfortable, loved the beds. Restaurants were great, almost don't need to leave the hotel - but why wouldn't you? you are steps from everything downtown has to offer... I'll be back =)

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE REVIEW OF THE DELTA CHELSEA TORONTO”
Reviews.Author: ccfceuropesNO1
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from the Delta Chelsea....... Firstly let me start by saying the staff are great and went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one. The hotel (as said in many previous reviews) as seen better days.Its quite dated and could do with an overall.Having said that it was cheaper than its competitors so things have to be kept in context. The room was fine with a large double bed which was extremly comfortable and a clean bathroom.The TV has around 20 channels which was also ok.We had a room overlooking the huge new development going on outside the main entrance YUK!! Our room also had a balcony but was litrally FULL of pigeons and pigeon droppings!!! not the most pleasant of sights,surely the hotel could put up some kind of netting to stop the pigeons making homes outside the bedroom balcony doors??? We did visit the pool which was on the 25th floor which was very nice. The bars and resturants were also quite pleasant although on the one time we visited the "Sports bar" pub we were sat by the window overlooking the back entrance onto Young St and a large Rat was litrally sat in the bushes directly outside the window!! We made enquires with the conciege about visiting Niagra Falls but were put off by the high price.So we walked around the corner to the main bus station and got a public bus all the way to Niagra for half price!! We also enjoyed the pub just around the corner called the Elephant & Castle which had nice staff and nice food. The location of the Delta Chelsea is pretty good with a lot of places witin walking distance.Although while we were there it was a bone tingling Minus 18 degrees!! All in all we found the Chelsea to be OK. Would we return to the Chelsea? maybe who knows....

Reviews.Title: “Good as Always”
Reviews.Author: fallsdude
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Chelsea when in Toronto for a show or shopping. It isn't the most luxurious hotel, but it is almost always the cheapest downtown large hotel, and never disappoints. Rooms are adaquet and clean, room to room noise is minimal, elevator wait time is usually pretty good, and location is great. Minor Downsides are: - the restaurant and bar prices are steep (so we just go elsewhere). - depending on your location, street noise can be a problem - lobby is always a beehive of activity (but it is Canada's largest hotel) - no wifi in rooms, just wired internet at a cost - $28+HST for parking (but thst's normal for TO)

Reviews.Title: “Family Enjoyed This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravlinMan2_99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the D.C. for a two night weekend get-away from 2/24-26.. After reading all the reviews I was pleasantly surprised to see upon arrival that the property was "a little" more upscale than what their website and the reviews had represented. Check in with my front desk clerk "Gigee" was a breeze. She exemplifies customer service with her kind and warm demeanor. As a matter of fact, all the staff treat you as if you're in a bed and breakfast with their attention to your needs, and not like they're actually in the largest hotel in Canada (which the D.C. is). Although just a few employees did give you the "I don 't see you ignore" when walking by them. But if you stopped them and asked a question then their demeanor was quite warm. I paid for my room via Expedia so the rate I got was good at 89.00 a night. It would've been a great rate but once you add the $34.00 (including tax per day) parking fee and almost $14.00 per day in-room wireless internet connection, then the rate was "ok" considering you're in the middle of downtown Toronto and a six minute walk from Toronto's Younge & Dundas Square area. The only blemish on the service was the concierge. I hate to berate people but the lady concierge was less than extraordinary. Bless her heart, you could tell she held a job that someone with more zeal and enthusiasm should have as her services were 2 out of 5 stars. I wanted to take my family to the Ontario Science Center and on the D.C. web site they boast a 20% discount at the Center if you show your room key. Well she knew nothing about it as she explained to me all the discount info. she had about the Center had expired in Dec, 2011. So I hesitated to allow her to say, "well let me give them a call". But that was her final answer. So I gave her another shot at redemption and I told her, your website for the hotel say's that I would get a 20% discount and she continued to stand-fast by her expired information from 2 months prior that "she didn't know about any discounts there".I know for a fact she had internet access to research this right in front of her and she had a phone, but just like "Deal or NO Deal - that was her final answer! Luckily enough, when we went there the ticket agents at the Center knew about the D.C. 20% discount and obliged us with it. After that I guess I was a glutton for punishment and I asked her on the following day if there was any other breakfast restaurant options outside the property like a Denny's or something and she said she didn't know of any. But did she follow up on it again, no. So apparently she must be a managers mother-in-law or something because although she was kind she was also next to useless to me. So my service rating below represents her (whom I needed for advice while there) but everyone else I came into contact with was exemplary with 5/5 stars. Pros - Great location. No car needed to access plenty shopping Eaton Center, etc, and plenty restaurants. Nice view from the 23 floor were our room was located facing the "non-construction" side of the city. Very youthful, lively and international clientele. Also the D.C. apparently is the only Toronto hotel with balconies which makes it nice to step out to for fresh air or in the winter time to substitute as a mini fridge incase you have perishable snacks in you room. Decent dollar value and join them on Facebook for $25.00 to be used there. If youi have small children then there's a Kids Zone and pool with a 4 story enclosed water-slide! Cons - old style tube televisions (C'MON D.C.), rust on the balconies rails (please hire a paint contractor D.C.), mile long caravan of cars around check-out time with everyone parked in there expensive below ground parking maze trying to leave a the same time so check out either early or late. And during the final day of our stay a fire alarm sounded witch caused everyone on the 22nd, 23rd and 24th floors to be evacuated outside the hotel. This proved to only be a minor inconvenience and something obviously out of their control but we discovered that our emergency exit point door had to be violently kicked in order to open it due to a back pressure of air flow rushing into the emergency stair well from the 1st floor up the the 23rd.. Had there been an actual emergency then someone perhaps elderly couldn't open that door!!!! Also, one evening while reading a news paper in the lobby - a young lady with a hand full of shopping bags in one hand and a designer purse sat down in a chair about 8 feet from me. After making her phone call she got up and left her purse on the floor beside her chair. Once I noticed they I contacted a bell hop and asked him for a security representative who promptly responded. I showed him the purse exactly where she left it and I described what she looked like so that the right person would get her purse back. Now granted one doesn't do good deeds in order to be rewarded but it would've been nice had the security rep. offered a gratuitous coupon or something for two free drinks at the pub or something for being an honest Joe. After all - had I asked a bellman to take my luggage up then he would stand there with his hand out right!. Anyway, it would've encouraged the hotels clientele to do other good deeds that would benefit the property if word got out that such deeds would be appreciated is all, but that's just me! In closing would we return, we're already planning another D.C. stay for 6 weeks from now because it's over-all family value was 4/5 stars. But I know not to count on the concierge service too much. Also, if you're driving to the D.C. and your car is dirty then good luck in trying to find a car wash as I wish the D.C. had this as a add on service I would paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: christie4007
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 9:40 Pm to be told my room wasn't ready. There was no hot water the next morning and so I was given a room to shower in on another floor. The manager did call to apologize which I appreciated. The hallways are dirty, the rooms itself fine. Very noisy sleep as there are lots of sports teams there. No wifi except in the lobby. Only good part is restaurant/cafe on the main floor is good for families, healthy choices available easily (fruit etc). I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SoxFan08
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were celebrating her birthday in Toronto for 1 night in December 2011 and decided to stay at the Delta Chelsea hotel since neither one of us had been there before. It was a convenient location for both the entertainment district since we were heading to Yuk Yukâ€™s, and the Eaton Centre for shopping. We received great service during arrival, check-in and throughout our stay. I was asked if there was a special occasion for our visit during check-in not thinking too much of it, and we were quite surprised to return to our room after dinner to see a complimentary bottle of wine, two glasses, and a birthday card. What a fantastic surprise, and a very memorable moment for both of us. Santa Claus in the lobby waving to guests was a very nice touch too during the holiday season. All of the rooms have been updated, and are very well appointed. The building is a little dated and that really shows during a visit outside onto the balcony, but that didnâ€™t affect our opinion of the hotel in the least. Although we didnâ€™t use them, the gym and pool facilities appeared to be modern and offered a nice view of the city from the upper floors of the hotel. We recently visited a different hotel just around the corner and wished we had returned to the Delta Chelsea. Overall the hotel is a good value in the heart of the city, with great service, and very nice rooms. We plan to return here during our next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. I wouldn't pay more than $150 per night. They have made attempts to update the look and feel of the hotel and rooms but have a way to go. My alarm clock was the same clock my dad had back in the 1970's, not that this matters much but it does give an idea that the hotel has a bit more work at modernizing its hotel. Hotel is close to lots of restaurants and the mall.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Hotel Chain in Canada”
Reviews.Author: aMarmiton
Reviews.Content: I really like the Delta hotels, not for the rooms but for the service. Having stayed often for business in Ottawa and having signed up for what is the best incentive scheme going (200$ credit for the next year for stays/meals the following year after 5 stays) I have visited the Delta Chelsea with family members every year for the past 5 or more years. The place is showing its age a bit and upkeep of a building like this must be a challenge. However the rooms are fine and it is very central. The multi-woer structure and the various colour coded elevators can be confusing for first timers I'm sure. Thru a web deal on the Delta site we got a Top Level Signature Club room for 136$ plus taxes. The room is comfortable, they put chocs on the pillow and give you bottled water. The bathrooms in most of the Deltas I've stayed in have been modest, certainly nothing to write home about. The bed was comfortable, but not nearly as good as the soft top of the Sheraton/Westin folk. As I said what makes this is the staff who answer the phone with your name, are unfailingly polite and helpful. The Club lounge has nibblies in the evening and a fine continental breakfast in the morning. I have in the past used the restaurant and it has been fine. Not on this occasion though. Ditto the pool and fitness facility which is on the top floor. Parking was ~28$ with in and out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Debby K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea as we were going to a concert at Massey Hall and this was close by. The check in was very fast with very friendly front desk personnel. I had booked this room through Air Miles and I assume that we got one of the older rooms. The furniture was very dated as was the TV. It would also have been nice to have more than just the basic cable channels. The room was however very clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at any hotel! We had dinner at B33 Bistro and it was really nice. Not too expensive and an excellent meal. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Don't accept less than what you want here”
Reviews.Author: Satis5d
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is one of Canada's largest hotels which has its advantages and disadvantages. We stayed here in February, 2012 as part of a group event. Some of us (including me) had a wonderful experience, while others were left feeling very underwhelmed. The key is in the definition of the "DELTA" room, which is the basic room at the Chelsea. There is no standardization to these rooms at all. Some of us got a decent-sized room with a balcony and a comfortable king-sized bed. Others in our group were in a small room with a queen bed and no balcony for the same price. The secret to success is to take a look at the room, decide if it meets your requirements or not, and if not immediately go back to the front desk and ask for a better room. They are well aware of the disparity among rooms and were quick to offer all guests who asked for better a nicer room. The hotel has several restaurants built in, and I can heartily recommend the all-you-can-eat bistro. It's amazing. However, the restaurants just outside the hotel are so good that eating at the hotel is a difficult choice to make. We attended as a couple and appreciated the fact that the hotel has a pool for kids/families and a pool on a completely different floor that is for adults only. The workout room is the best I've ever seen in a hotel, almost as good as the gym I pay monthly to attend. Again, it's a huge hotel and they've seen your problem before many times. If you speak up and only accept what is truly acceptable to you, you will be rewarded. The service is good. The hotel is beautiful, but they will offer you rooms and amenities that favour them, not you, so don't be pressured into taking less than you want.

Reviews.Title: “A great time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have always had great service however this time was exceptional. your location is fabulous and we will book our family weekend there again next year. the clerk at the desk as well as the concierge were so very helpful and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Sallyanncoupon
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful weekend at the Delta Chelsea. The customer service was exceptional and above and beyond what I expected. The location is great, perfectly situated a few blocks away from Dundas Square, Eaton Square and many restaraunts and boutiques. The rooms were average, very clean and comfortable. I recommend this hotel to anyone who has children and has never travelled to Toronto, everything you need is at your doorstep. Thank you Delta Chelsea SallyAnn Coupon

Reviews.Title: “great weekend thanks”
Reviews.Author: micheal154992
Reviews.Content: had a great weekend for family day the staff was more then excellent they handled the large volume of people with family day weeekend and winter follk with ease room clean and kids were treated great by staff aswell as adults . we had 2 nights booked but stayed an extra night due to the hospitality and atmoshere thanks staff at the delta

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good, just average”
Reviews.Author: vwh187
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight with a friend in a deluxe room. Hotel is quite central, and according to my friend, quite a popular hotel in the area. Could tell this from the lobby that looked quite chaotic and more like it's part of a mini-mall or conference centre. PROS: * Beds were comfy, wide, and adequate pillows. * Staff was courteous. * Express check-out option. CONS * Price was okay, though I didn't quite get the extra Â£10 charge for an additional person. It was a 2 person room and we were two people. So what the hey? * There was a somewhat stale/dank smell as we entered the room, and this persisted throughout the stay. * There were shampoo, body lotion (cream), and mouth-wash. Where was the body wash for general cleaning???? * No wifi in rooms, only in the lobby. * No mini-bar. 3 and a half star hotels usually have this. So, all in all, I'd probably stay here again, but only because of the relatively low price and without much expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: slinkymalinky143
Reviews.Content: I stayed in August 2011.The first night I stayed at the Delta Chelsea I had just flown in from Germany and was very jet lagged and tired. There were many young teenagers partying and making lots of noise in all throughout the hotel. I opened my hotel room door to see what the commotion in the hallway was and a lady from another room started yelling and swearing at me accusing me of waking her baby up. I called hotel security and they didnt do anything. The next evening i had a shower after the pool and the towel I used to dry myself with had long black hairs [I have very light blonde hair] all over it and it got all over me too! I discovered they were all over my bathtub and ceiling! disgusting! I had somebody come clean it but there were still hairs leftover.Check in was a breeze. Reception was very helpful and friendly- gave me many great recommendations on where to go, eat, what to see and do. The hotel lobby is gorgeous and the rooms are nice and comfortable. At check out I discovered that I had been charged $30 for using the internet [which I never had access to].. I talked to front desk to fix the problem and had to talk to 3 different people to sort it all out. It took over an hour but finally it was fixed. It wasnt a pleasant experience over all.

Reviews.Title: “NO HOT WATER on a cold winter trip”
Reviews.Author: Maddy52
Reviews.Content: For the amount of money one spends on this hotel one should expect to have hot water, especially when it is minus temperatures outside. This is taken for granted in all hotels isnt it? We stayed for a weekend and both Sunday and Monday morning there was no hot water. Dismal! When checking out I asked if there might be a discount or something in the way of customer service compensation such as a discount coupon- something to recognize our discomfort and was abruptly informed at the front desk that it was the city of Toronto to blame- Come on! Take responsibility for your own hotel and customers. With that attitude we are unlikely to either return or recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “It's like a madhouse in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: acculligan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Delta Chelsea on numerous occasions over the past 12 months. A total now of around 6 weeks. The good: The deli offers an option to get simple, easy takeaway food for my room GREAT location near Eaton Centre Spas out the front door on Elm street Fantastic Gym overlooking the city (a fave at sunrise) Signature suite floor is good The girls in the business suite are excellent! The bad: This seems to be the place for guy/girls weekends away under the age of 20 and over the age of 40 - big parties in the room and very loud in the hallways the air conditioning/heating is average and I was always far too hot or far too cold the rooms below the signature suite floor are average at best and fee incredibly beige and dreary The lobby is a madhouse and I hated going downstairs to get anything The gerrard street entrance is hideous Although it's a good functional hotel, I have found other hotels in the same vicinity at lesser cost and better value. I won't be staying here again and I'm a gold member. In saying that - if you are traveling on business and need a reasonable price hotel - find it on priceline - and need an apartment etc, this may be a suitable option. with the amount I travel, I want something nicer, cleaner and warmer. This is like a shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the car show & Winterfok Festival”
Reviews.Author: ScottyMontana
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with another couple for the Canadian Int'l Auto Show. This is a great location and turned out was also a host for Winterfolk music festival so we got to hear some fantastic bands. The place was fully booked and that meant it was packed. So the wait for the elevator was often a bit long. Staff were all really great though. The rooms are a little dated and we too experienced a little problem with hot water but nothing like other guests and we could certainly shower...the hot water seemed to cycle a bit that's all. And don't eat breakfast at the hotel restaurant...it's really expensive. Around the corner from the hotel is a place called EggSmart and The Golden Griddle is also only steps away. A major complaint about this hotel is that there is no wireless Internet access in the rooms...only wired.

Reviews.Title: “OK-unless you need hot water to take a shower”
Reviews.Author: Wes J
Reviews.Content: The hotel regularly has a problem with the hot water turning off. On the elevator ride down (full of unwashed hotel guests including myself) I learned that the hotel 1) Regularly runs out of hot water for the entire hotel 2) Always blames this problem on "the city of Toronto" as if the city should supply the hotel with hot water. This hotel seems on the edge of going bust-don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Lesley W
Reviews.Content: I continue to stay at the Delta, no matter what part of Ontario I travel, however, when I go to Toronto I always stay at the Delta Chelsea. It's become my home away from home. Recently, I found myself having to host a meeting mid-day, impromptu, in my room with a few other guests. As room service was not available during the day, I called down to Room services/Catering and they made a pot of coffee and a lovely cheese and fruit plate for my meeting. Had they followed their policies, they didn't have to serve me but they did. They went over and above what was expected of them, and for that, I am very appreciative. The rooms are always clean and comfortable and the service is always pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family”
Reviews.Author: Liz S
Reviews.Content: Compared to a lot of hotels we stayed at during our 3 month holiday it was Average. The service at the concierge desk was fantastic and informative. the actual hotel is centrally located and it is easy to get around. Our room is where it let it down a little for us anyway. We had a family 2 bedroom suit. The bedroom were nice but the cupboard in the kids room needed a door and more shelves. The kitchen looked like something out of the 70s that had been painted over and had new handles put on. The bathroom was much the same and really needed some TLC. Apart from that the lounge and play area were great. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “There for a hospital visit”
Reviews.Author: Tim D
Reviews.Content: Great place close to TO General The staff is really good. Security is obvious and very professional. I have stayed at your Hotel 3 times over the last 3 months as of my wife's hospital stay. I would recommend your hotel to all my friends. I do some business in Toronto a couple of times a year and would consider having our clients stay with youThanks . Tim Davis. PS. I find your points and rewards system confusing

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: pxb123
Reviews.Content: I am a regular at Delta Chelsea and they never disappoint. Last weekend I booked one overnight stay and let them know that I would be getting in late. My flight was delayed and so I got to the hotel very late and explained the situation to them and there was no question that they would give me a late checkout. They were very accommodating and the check-in agent was very pleasant. I have never had any doubts that I would book anywhere else but the Delta Chelsea when I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the center of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Christiana0564
Reviews.Content: Although the property is a bit dated, this hotel consistently provides excellent service. Great central location, clean and comfortable rooms. Rooms are on the smaller side, but have everything you need. There is some construction going on accross from the hotel but the staff were good about getting me a room away from the noise. Fitness Centre, Pool, Business Centre and some great resturants, this hotel has everything you need for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms even if a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: GMT80
Reviews.Content: Good comfortable and clean hotel, good central location with the underground not far away, and typical friendly & helpful Canadian customer service. The rooms are a bit dated but it was comfortable and clean and I was able to get rest when I wanted. The TV is small and the picture quality was poor. The bathroom is large and has a red heat lamp which operates on a timer and makes the bathroom look like a dark room when in use. There is an observation deck on the same floor as the pool and gym that offers some reasonable photo opportunities which include the CN Tower. Breakfast was a bit pricey. Good spread of food but fairly crowded and hard to find a table at times. There are plenty of places to go for food in the area though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Matthew T
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. I'm more of a hosteler and backpacker so this was a nice place to stay. Had a room with a view of dundas square. Does of shopping, restaurants, bars nearby. Within walking distance to Eaton's Centre, Nathan Philips Square, and even the ACC and Skydome, if you don't find the walk. Would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good midtown hotel but starting to show aging.”
Reviews.Author: DaveLon
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights (Friday and Saturday) and, all in all, the stay was pleasant. The room was of a good size with a king bed that was comfortable. BUT only one large comfortable chair and a smaller and less comfortable desk chair in a room designed for two! Drawer and closet space was OK but we had to call for more hangers and a second bath robe which were delivered promptly. Friday night was a mixed blessing as the folks next door partied till 4:30 am and were, off and on, quite noisy - connecting door carried the sound even though theirs and ours were closed. Saturday was fine till 7 am when there was a fire alarm and we had to go to the lobby. The hotel did not offer any reduction for either issue. TV checkout did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but beware of Abra Cleaners across the road”
Reviews.Author: Nicey2011
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, the service and location is excellent. However, beware of Abra Cleaners on 44 Gerrard Street West accross the road from the hotel. I took my brand new jacket which was only 2 weeks old for dry cleaning. When I picked up the jacket, they had melted the front main zipper and the material. My jacket is now ruined with iron marks all over the jacket. The Korean lady at the shop refused to give me a refund and denied all responsibility for my jacket!

Reviews.Title: “Getting old, but still very good”
Reviews.Author: yyjguy
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here off and on for almost 15 years, and it is still my favourite hotel in Toronto. The hotel is constantly on an upgrade program, and the well worn areas are quickly spruced up. On this last trip I saw 4 rooms of friends and my own, all were in excellent condition, with new furnishings and bedding. Public areas also in great shape. The Club floor lounge had very good hot and cold items for both breakfast and evening snacks. The coffee machine however never seems to work well, but the attendands can work wonders with it!! I especially enjoy the roof top swimming pool, hot tub and sauna. All staff were friendly and professional. Will I be back-definately.

Reviews.Title: “Delta has some issues”
Reviews.Author: wtfmatewtf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Delta between Christmas and New Years 2011. We had reserved "City View" room with kitchen. The Delta Chelsea hotel is shaped like a capital T. Our room was located at the top of the T. At about 6:00 am the following morning the jackhammers started and loud banging on steel which made it impossible to go back to sleep. Aparently there is a large structure being erected across the street and construction will continue for years to come. So the front desk personnel knew I was checking in and with 2 small children to boot but no word about construction. Down to front desk I go to change rooms. No problem. They happened to have one available at the inside of the T away from the construction. So now we have to re-pack all our gear including the kitchen supplies and get relocated to our "new" room.. We get to the new room and everything seems in order except its so cold in there you could hang a side of beef. We turn up the thermostat and after an hour my toes feel like they're going to fall off. Turns out we had to turn the thermostat up to 85 degrees F so the room could get to about 68 degrees. Another issue was the balcony door leaked air like a sieve and wouldn't open or close properly. Then around midnight I had to use the bathroom. I go to flush the toilet and no water! In fact no water in sink either. A quick call to front desk and they tell me water was being shut off from midnight to 5 am for maintenence and "didn't someone tell you on check-in?" Yeah ok. Then why am I calling you if I already knew? The hotel was very accomodating as far as comping us a free night plus $40 food voucher and free parking but the wife and I didn't care how much we spent, this was a Christmas gift and so long as we had a relaxing mini-vacation, all was well. But in reality we left feeling stressed and not rested. I will say they have a great pool area and slide for the kids but in the rec. hall most of the games are broken. The parking garage is a nightmare! I'm pretty sure it was in an episode of Nightmare on Elm Street if not it should have been! I would not recommend this hotel if you are travelling with a family or otherwise until they can invest some money into their rooms - better soundproofing, windows, heat and parking garage . I'm sure ther hotel is probably adequate for couples who want to take in a show and just have somewhere to crash afterwards but that's about all I would recommend it for.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlainaCanada
Reviews.Content: For anyone planning a visit to this popular Canadian metropolis, there is no other hotel that compares to the Delta Chelsea on Gerrard St. The staff is superb in every way, from Ben at the front desk , who suggested we enroll in the Delta Privilege Program, for additional perks on our next visit, to Daniel in the Concierge station. Everyone is friendly, helpful and above all eager to please their guests to ensure a pleasant stay. The Market Garden self-serve restaurant is amazing with the freshest food for breakfast, snacks, lunch and dinner selections. Very reasonably priced and the surroundings very relaxed. The location of the hotel is perfect. Walking distance to Yonge Street and Bloor and the Eaton Center. The rooms are very spacious and incredibly clean. It has everything and more to offer every guest. A very happy atmosphere in this hotel. They are doing everything right and we have made it our hotel of choice for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: sammi_bella
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean, the beds were really comfortable. The staff was extremely nice and the food at the restaurant was some of the best I've had! It's located pretty much in the heart of Toronto. Just minutes away from the Eaton's centre. Would definitely go back. In fact I am soon! Prices are also good depending on when you go.

Reviews.Title: “Parking sucks!!!!!! "Hotel takes no responsibility....wow!”
Reviews.Author: brandid4
Reviews.Content: The parking in this hotel is ridiculous. We were backing into our spot and smashed our back window due to their concrete overhangs. Couldn't get it replaced until 2 days later when we got home cause it happened on a weekend and no one could change it. Was our first trip away in months and had to drive around and home with a garbage bag taped to the back window. When I called to let them know that the signage for these overhangs is awful they said the apologize but they are not responsible for the parking lot.....is the parking lot not theirs....if they don't take responsibility than who does....I guess us!!! Won't ever stay their again! Maybe they should have something posted on their website about the parking, cause they told me this has happened before. I am sure it has happened lots cause when I called down to ask for duct tape and a garbage bag they didn't even ask why they told me that they would inform security to ge it for me. Lousy customer service.....sick of people not taking responsibility!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta because my son was in Sick Childrens Hospital. The service, atmosphere, was pleasant and it made for a less stressful day. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat past its prime.”
Reviews.Author: AncientMariner924
Reviews.Content: In walking into the lobby to check in, I look up to see several plaques from AAA giving the Delta Chelsea its Four Diamond award for many years, including fairly recently. Sadly, from this stay, I didn't anything to warrant a Four Diamond rating any more. Simply stated, the hotel is quite functional, but it needs a LOT of refurbishing. In looking out the windows at the balconies, I see lots of rust spots (and I'm not even in the room yet). While our room was tiny, it also had a lot of issues that were showing its age and wear, including an old Zenith 20" television (though the option did exist to upgrade to a "signature room" with a 32" LCD screen tv) and the in room loudspeaker (near the fire alarm) had rust spots on its under side. We were also suprised to find a few long hairs (not ours) in the tub, and a washcloth hanging on the shower curtain from the previous guest. Additionally, the tub was peeling it's laminate and was in need of repair. On the plus side, the mattress was wonderful--I will say I got a very solid night's sleep in the room, and I am not one who can sleep well away from home. Another plus was the adult gym, as it had a lot of great equipment in good repair, including cardio machines, free weights, weight machines and a whirlpool/pool area. Would I stay here again? Probably not; yes, I've stayed in worse places, but I've stayed in better places at the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Just upgrade the hotel....”
Reviews.Author: msg82256
Reviews.Content: So, we went there to spend the weekend with our daughter who was at this hotel for a conference. What the hotel failed to tell us was that there are a bunch of "unupdated" rooms at the rate we were given. In order to "upgrade" to a decent room, there was an additional nightly charge of around $30 US. We ended up upgrading and it was still just a decent hotel. You wouldn't want to stay in the unupgraded room. Tiny old-style televisions, dinghy furniture...just old. So, if this hotel comes up in your search and it looks like a bargain. Don't be fooled. Make sure you're getting an upgraded room. This place is nothing special

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be !!!”
Reviews.Author: lakehuronsunsets
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on January 26th for one night & that was enough. In the 70's this was THE PLACE TO STAY ~ time has moved on & The Chelsea has not. I asked for a renovated room when checking in, of course that was an upgrade $$ wise. To be fair we were given it for the price of regular room as it was going to be a problem taking original booking out of the system etc. THE CLERK CHECKING US IN WAS MOST ATTENTIVE AS WERE ALL OTHER STAFF WE ENCOUNTERED. The room was in the old section of the hotel - stains on carpet(possibly blood), trim hanging loose in one corner and very disgusting stains on duvet cover. The duvet should be replaced as stuffing was all at the top !!! Good bye Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, old rooms”
Reviews.Author: wassenas
Reviews.Content: The hotel entrances and reasaurants were nicely updated, but the rooms are very old - mine had peeling wallpaper - and small. The heat/air con was very loud and woke me every time it cycled on. That being said; the bed was comfortable, the location is excellent and the staff were friendly

Reviews.Title: “Average but good location”
Reviews.Author: cheeryukon
Reviews.Content: The delta in toronto is what I consider average I am sure if you have 1000$ to spend you will have amazing room and service being an average middle class customer wasnt the case for us our shower did not work, and took hours to have someone come to fix our toiletry bottles had been partially used the location here though is fabulous, the beds amazing comfy balcony was very grundgy, and 10$ for a bowl of chips is a little crazy but as I said bed is extremely comfy, amazing location downtown toronto staff at the front desk were useless in assisting with my issue but management did call to appologize (maybe a giftcard or credit would be nice nexttime)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: maxxtrax
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chelsea for the Tpronto Boat Show, hadn't been a guest in decades. Room was clean, although a bit small. The Bed was amazing, slept like a baby. The food in the market garden rest. was excellent, well priced and very fresh. The ladies in the kitchen were most accomodating and pleasant. The Chelsea is steps from Yonge St., and minutes walking to the Eaton Centre. There are many great restaurants and clubs within walking or cheap cab distances. Parking at the hotel was too low for my truck, but I kind of expected that, so planned ahead. Booked it on Hotwire and it was very inexpensive to say the least. Was a great random booking, traveller wins again.

Reviews.Title: “wasn't expecting much”
Reviews.Author: elien
Reviews.Content: and didn't disappoint. Room was old, even though an upgrade, dust was thick on the air vents, crumbs on the carpets, and no hot water at 6 pm. Husband often stays here for business and has never recommended it...now I know why first hand. Re parking, it says 5'6" clearance, but bellboy reassured me my honda pilot would fit (have never tried less than 6'1"). Do try Bangkok Garden's luncheon buffet, yum!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Rooms are VERY Tired.”
Reviews.Author: cassil74
Reviews.Content: I just came back from the Delta Chelsea for business and when I opened the door to my room, I was quite upset. The room seemed musty and the TV was from the 1980s. Also, there is NO wireless in the rooms. What made the hotel was the service. Also the gym was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Age is showing”
Reviews.Author: travellingshorts
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Delta Chelsea. The first time it was booked through work, the other times through hotwire, and areoplan plan. I would have to agree the hotel does need some serious upgrading. At one time it was such a beautiful, clean, and well maintained, NO MATTER what room you had. It seems as though depending on how your room is booked determines on whether you get a poor, decent, or recently renovated room. The first time we booked it was thorough work and had a corporate rate, and the room was wonderful top to bottom. The second time was trip advisor and it was under renovation so we had the older side of the hotel. Bedding, room decor, and general atmosphere of the room was run down. This final time was through areoplan and of course hoping the reno's had been completed from 2 yrs ago we booked again. It was disappointing to have a room that was in need of TLC and was noisy again. Especially when it was expected to have completed renovations. :( Staff is wonderful, and the rooms, pool and change rooms were clean. Disappointed that we still havent' been able to see an updated room. It is such a great location and long standing tradition to book the Delta Chelsea when staying in toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good Nights Sleep Just Before Knee Surgery”
Reviews.Author: T4CPlanet
Reviews.Content: My mother booked the Delta Chelsea so that she could be downtown for her knee surgery the following morning. She is quite chatty and told the front desk staff and the restaurant staff about her upcoming surgery. All of them wished her well and were very friendly. Check in was easy, parking was easy, and the lobby was nice. The room needed updating, but the bed and linens were equivalent to newer hotels. It was fun to have a balcony dowtown. I imagine our room was in an older part of the hotel, but for the discounted price, we didn't mind. We ate at the BB3 Bistro and was pleasantly surprised at the quality, presentation and price of the food. Although the decor needed a little lift :)

Reviews.Title: “Good convention hotel right in the middle of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Hardik V
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Delta Chelsea for 5 days in July 2011 . Its a big hotel with pretty decent modern facilities. The best part about the hotel is the location. Its right in the middle of Toronto. You can access the Yonge Street which is where all the action is. The Yonge - Dundas Square is a short walk. Its easy to find good bars , restaurants , shops & even sex stores close by. Rooms are decent and clean. Staff is generally helpful & most of the hop on hop off buses have a stop at the hotel. Their cafe serves good variety of breakfast too. Nice hotel for a short stay. Upside - Great Location - Helpful Staff - Reasonably priced. Downside - None

Reviews.Title: “Still a reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKDavidN
Reviews.Content: Excellently situated hotel. Large though staff are helpful. Did have a plumbing problem which was sorted quickly. Prices in their cafe have risen recently and the hotel is getting a little dated but overall would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea Toronto..love it!”
Reviews.Author: sheenazzy
Reviews.Content: As always, The Delta is my hotel of choice. We when go camping my kids always tease me because they know my style of camping is the "Delta Chelsea". It has been a large part of the ups and downs of my life. It's like a second home for us when we are in Toronto. My husband stayed here when our daughter had to be born at Mount Sinai. I have stayed for numerous girls shopping weekends, conferences, etc. We stayed there when my daughter had to get her tonsils out at Sick Kids. We stay there when my husband has karate tournaments at Ryerson. No matter what the reason- it's convenient for shopping, events, it's so close to everything, The food is great-love the banana bread and the salads. i enjoy the variety of food available-something for everyone! The rooms are clean and tidy. The hotel staff are friendly and are always more than willing to help out in any way that they can. It's a great family hotel-yet I've been there on business and find it relaxing and quiet to focus on my work. I feel like it is a safe place to stay which is comforting because I often travel there by myself with my 2 children with special needs.I love how there are so many things going on for children-We have been there when Santa has visited. Enjoyed March Break activiites with your great staff members. My son loves the bunny in the play area. This time without my littest one with me I was able to relax in the adult only time in the pool and hot tub-that was great!! Check in was fast-less than 5 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Service dropping at Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: DiveProf
Reviews.Content: Still a nice property, room and restaurants. Central location on Subway line. But, issues connecting to the Internet for e-mail in my room went unresolved (Tech support isn't even onsite? Had me reformatting my laptop that worked fine everywhere else), very slow service in the restaurant that was less than half full (waited a half-hour for my bill). I've stayed at the Chelsea a number of times. This was the first time I've complained. Called the front desk in the evening about Internet issues - no response. Was offered an upgrade next time I came by e-mail after I checked out. Really?!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but rooms needing upgrading”
Reviews.Author: C_Pennell_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location, but the room that I stayed in wasn't the nicest! the TV looked like it came from the 80's. It might be because I got a weekend deal of 89$ per/night, they probably put me in the worst rooms they had. All in all the hotel was OK!

Reviews.Title: “This old girl needs a facelift and a scrub”
Reviews.Author: CanBrit1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Delta Chelsea since it opened in the 1970s and it used to be good. Coming back after a few years we are SO disappointed. Our room was not very clean - coffee cups left with lipstick on them, bathroom not vacuum and dirty grouting. The room had no fridge - awkward when you have meds with you - we had to put them out between the windows. The heating was too high and couldn't be lowered. And it was noisy with staff sorting out sheets at 4 a.m. All in all we won't be back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LUERTW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in December for a party as we do not live in Toronto. Check in took forever. There were definitely not enough desk staff for the number of guests on a Friday. As my husband smokes and no smoking rooms were available we asked for a room with a balcony. Once this was done we made our way up to the 8th floor to our room to discover that we did indeed have a balcony but no way to get to it unless you could fit through a tiny window! I tried to take shower but for the 20 minutes I was in the shower I had no hot water. None. We ordered a simple breakfast the next morning and it came to a woping 60 dollars! Just a bit overpriced for the soggy bacon and runny scrambled eggs. Check out took nearly as long as check in. So, good location but way too pricy for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good... Except the long wait for the elevator”
Reviews.Author: AquariusShark
Reviews.Content: I knew the reputation of this hotel prior to staying... But I gave it a try anyway. Got an upgraded room for an additional $20 at check-in per night which seems well worth it as I had no qualms with the room. I've seen cleaner hotels... But also much much worse so that's not my main concern. I literally thought I was going to enjoy my stay until the 10 minute (no exaggeration) wait for the elevator at 630am the next day. After waiting for five minutes (which I think is more patience than the average business traveller) I thought I needed to call down. The button remained lit... And I could hear elevators passing but none stopped. When I went for the house phone... It was dead. I tried plugging it in... But no luck. Not wanting to walk down 26 flights with my suitcase and having left my key inside the room as I was checking out... I was forced to call the hotel from my blackberry. They sent someone, but no apology for the delay. 3 to 5 minutes later someone from Security arrived in an elevator for me and the woman who was also now waiting. A sorry would have been nice. This is a good no frills basic hotel in the heart of downtown... Take the upgrade if offered and beware the elevators!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family with kids....”
Reviews.Author: DDMAT2008
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel several times over the past 2 years, always as kids included trip. The children's facilities fill a huge void in downtown TO with kids pool with waterslide, safe play and art room for younger kids, and video game/pool table lounge for teens. There just isn't any other hotel downtown with this....The rooms are ok typical Marriot fair, although the we were in the green tower and found these rooms slighty tired compared to the other towers. We always get a fantastic rate via priceline and the kids always love it. If it is a parental trip then we stay elsewhere. We did have maintenance in the hall right outside our door at 4 am banging, cutting and drilling water pipes which was impossible to sleep through but the hotel waved our parking fee's after a phone call to the desk so that was ok with us. The staff are always very friendly, overall a good hotel to serve a purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Such an off putting experience. Don't leave anything remotely valuable in your room”
Reviews.Author: DRZL-Enterprises
Reviews.Content: I found it odd that this was the only hotel accepting reservations on New years Eve. But I thought I would give it a chance since me an other exectutives haved stated at just abut every hotel in the city and got decent feedback about this one. So we stayed in this hotel on the 8th floor on new year seve Dec. 31, 2011, checked out on Jan. 1st around noon. I was spending a romantic evening with my fiancee. Shortly after checking out and getting back home, I realized I left an special important item with sentimental value and a special card in the room. I know for a fact it fell behind specifiic location. After calling I was not allowed to return to get it after checkout + after repeated calls (6 to be exact) to hotel staff + housekeeping + 1 manager I have since been told the room was inspected and nothing was found even after I advised where to look. In other words my item had been most likely stolen by the grimy housekeeping staff and I was also told it took nearly 4 days to clean the rooms, another lie. These items could have easily been retrieved after I mad several calls, with the first call being made 2-3 hrs after checkout when the room had not been cleaned. I would not expect this from my own city. If someone stiole it, just admit, it don't lie to me. Additionally the TV in the room was outdated, and the room layout is in need of a makeover, our room had a musty smell. If you're thinking about booking here proceed with extreme caution, and god forbid you leave anything of value behind, you most likely will never see it again. This experience is enough to ensure me and ANYONE WE WORK WITH will NEVER EVER BOOK or stay at this hotel again. I tried to leave feedback on the site but its unclear who I need to contact regarding negative client experiences. Looking forward to seeing how the Hotel Management can deal with this and explain this one.

Reviews.Title: “Hideous Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Gail S
Reviews.Content: On 12/29/2011, in order to be in close proximity to family members staying at the Delta Chelsea, I opted to stay at Delta Chelsea on Gerrard. My son and I, as well as my sister-in-law and her infant parked in your underground lot, and stood at their parking lot elevator for a few minutes waiting for its arrival in order to access the lobby.
