It didnâ€™t come, and one of your staff passing by asked me and a group of their guests waiting with me, if we had pressed the button which calls the elevator. We certainly had. He re-pressed the button, which oddly enough, the people behind me didnâ€™t appreciate as the â€œsuggested solutionâ€�. He said weâ€™d have to wait. Another employee walked by a few minutes later and said it must be broken. We asked how to get up with a baby-stroller which cannot be collapsed easily, and he pointed and said to me only to make a right and then follow the road up. Then he left. My sister-in-law and I directed their other guests on how to access your facility. We pushed luggage and a baby-stroller up their automotive exit ramp, where their parking attendant advised us that we should be taking the elevator. However, upon our explanation, he agreed to open the parking gate for us so we could get up to the main entrance. Then after waiting about fifteen minutes in queue to check-in, I asked for a room close to my family members who had checked in the day earlier, I was advised by the desk clerk that I couldnâ€™t get a room without two pieces of photo ID. I had only my Drivers License as photo ID. I advised that I didnâ€™t bring my passport with me as their website doesnâ€™t mention requirement of two pieces of photo ID. I asked why the clerk couldnâ€™t take any one of my four credit cards, birth certificate, SIN, Health Card, Drivers License, and various (including police security check for working with school-children) association cards. The Desk Clerk told me aloud (loud enough for other guests to hear) that there was so much fraud going on that they donâ€™t take anything other than two pieces of ID in case this credit cards had been stolen. This isnâ€™t verbatim, but itâ€™s pretty close. Iâ€™m sure you can see here where it goes downhill. Iâ€™ll point out right now that Iâ€™m a local business owner who has provided services within Delta Chelsea's facility several times. Often recommending my clients use the Delta Chelsea as their event venue of choice. I can tell you that I bend over backwards to make sure I treat my customers with respect due, and to avoid using words or actions that would ever insult them. Following what felt like a suggestion that perhaps Iâ€™m one of the vagrants who uses stolen credit cards and stolen drivers licenses, I asked to speak to the registration manager on duty. Their clerk advised me that the manager was busy. There was no pause, no looking around, not even looking at the clerk next to her for backup. She simply advised me that â€œsheâ€™s busyâ€�. When I said that Iâ€™d need to speak to her manager, even if she is busy, the registrations clerk offered that I could go â€œover thereâ€� pointing behind me and book myself in online and then I wouldnâ€™t need the two pieces of ID, I could get back in queue and come back to an attendant with a confirmation number provided online. At this time, my family members whom the clerk knew (as per my advise) were already booked-in, had come down to your lobby to pick up my son, but my sister in law and her infant remained with me at the front desk. I believe my sister-in-law was stunned and wanted to see what would occur, if Iâ€™d be denied lodging. I advised their clerk that I wasnâ€™t going to get back out of line after having invested the time and experienced what Iâ€™d had; that Iâ€™d like to speak to her superior. She went away, came back with a manager, who advised her to process the request and provide us with a full-price room. The manager advised verbally that sheâ€™d process my room request, and sheâ€™d be putting damage insurance on my credit card due to my inability to produce a second piece of photo ID. Their attendant took my Driverâ€™s License in order to make a copy of it. Came back to me, and gave me a key to room 2331. Told us to use the blue elevators to the 23rd floor, and to have a nice stay. Now: room 2331. On what was clearly not a busy day for the 23rd floor, when this hotel clearly is not full, and my family members, also on the 23rd floor have large rooms, with identical â€œtwo doublesâ€� requirements, Iâ€™m interested in why I received a corner room facing the brick wall, with not enough room to bring our baby-stroller into the room and get past the foyer while we dressed to go out for dinner. We had to put the stroller in the hallway, come in with it behind us, and then send the stroller out into the hallway again in order to leave the room. Delta Chelsea has a remarkably uncomfortably sized rooms. I just canâ€™t tell you how very unimpressed we were with the customer service and the room provided to us. I was embarrassed and affronted by their staff members, and have had my feelings justified by my witness who agreed she also felt their registrations attendant went out of her way to attempt to embarrass us. I sent an email asking to be refunded for my lodging costs as compensation for this experience, and suggested they revisit customer service requirements with their attendant so that no other customers feel insulted. I escalated when I hadn't heard back in a week. I haven't heard from their Director of Guest Services to date. On a positive note, we felt your attendants who open doors on the 29th and 30th were very quick and polite, and made up for some of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worst internet connection ever”
Reviews.Author: JM01234
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced such a horrible internet connection in my entire life. I am traveling with a group and we stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 3 weeks. My entire group had problems with the internet (severe problems) and had to call Tech Support multiple times per day to get it started again. The internet connection seemed to get worse as the floors went up. I was on the top floor, so my internet connection was intolerable. The hotel knew about the problem and did not fix it in the 3 weeks we were there. There were a few employees who were very nice and offered to let me use the internet in the business center after hours. But I still would not stay there again because of the internet. I also did not have working heat in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Handy, reasonably family hotel”
Reviews.Author: m0nal1sa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times, and have had a different experience every time. The best thing about this hotel is the location, the price, and the activities. Okay, that's 3 things, but they are all about the same. This property is huge. There are few different wings, and some rooms are definitely better than others. Try to get a room attached to the main building, and away from the pool. For being in Toronto, the hotel was fairly well priced, for what you get. There are food locations everywhere. I liked the separate pool for adults, but it's weird when nobody is swimming, and are just sitting in chairs watching you swim. The kids pool and activities are a lot of fun too. Playrooms, and internet access are a bonus. The conference amenities are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Wonderful loyalty program”
Reviews.Author: Richard1958_08
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this location for the past 6 years for business. The Delta Priviledge loyalty program is one of the best programs. I especially appreciate the free breakfast buffet. As a priviledge member, I am almost always booked into a Signature Club room which is very comfortable. I have also stayed in some of the Queen rooms when a signature room is not available and some of them are looking a bit tired. I am told that all of the rooms are scheduled for upgrades which will bring all rooms up to a standard expected of the Delta hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: moz30
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel several times, great location only a few minutes walk from downtown Toronto. Great sports shops close by, can walk to Sky dome for Blue Jays games in Summer (baseball) ice hockey in Winter. Fantastic hotel, lovely spacious rooms. Why stay anwywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Bussines and Family!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysonRush
Reviews.Content: I have been at Delta Chelsea for more than 13 years. It's a great hotel with all the necessary amenities for business as well as in special for families. The majority of the rooms are large and they all have balcony which is great for fresh air. There is a large kids area in the hotel with the convenience of a staff babysitter. The staff is always very friendly and I suggest that you apply for their frequent guest program which provides you free internet and a dedicated check in. At this time for the New Year Eve, we were upgraded for a corner deluxe room very well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: festaa
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea was booked for us through an agent, and what a great choice she made. We had a fantastic week in Toronto. The hotel was clean, spacious and easy to find. The location was fantastic and within walking distance to all the places we wanted to see. We ate our breakfast outside with the squirells. Staff were friendly and helpful and provided great service when we locked ourselves out of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe room = ordinary”
Reviews.Author: DandD142
Reviews.Content: I read some of the other reviews and am surprised by how good people are rating this hotel. We were using a voucher that included a one-night stay in a King Deluxe room that also included $20 at the Market Garden restaurant (on site). The room was clean and comfortable, but nothing exciting at all. No bar fridge and no free internet (this is 2012 people c'mon!). The food at the self-serve restaurant was quite mediocre and the $20 did not cover the cost of a basic breakfast (probably because you have to spend $6+ for the Starbucks coffee). Staff were friendly. When you factor in extra costs such as parking, taxes, food, these vouchers are not the best value. Posted rate on the door indicated the room was worth $500-$600 a night - you've got to be kidding. Bathroom wallpaper was peeling and there were rust stains on the ceiling fan. I would still probably stay again, but only on a super-saver rate and when I want to be in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown T.O.”
Reviews.Author: jagmor
Reviews.Content: We decided to do a weekend stay in Toronto for Christmas shopping and The Toronto Blues Society Christmas bash as a belated Anniversary present to ourselves. I really liked this hotel - great customer service for one. The main floor lobby was very busy but they have a very efficient and friendly front desk. They gave us a room upgrade and presented us with a welcome package of gifts. Later that evening, they presented us with a bottle of bubbly and some decadent chocolate cake and strawberries - very nice touch. Although the hotel itself is a bit dated, our room was VERY clean and comfortable with good quality bedding. The Delta Chelsea is located right in the middle of great shopping and we did that ALL DAY. So many good stores within walking distance. AND THE RESTAURANTS, good Lord, so many choices. We ate at The 3 Brewers for lunch on Yonge Street and it was very good. In the evening we went to the Monarch's Pub in the Delta Chelsea and did we ever have a great night of fantastic Blues by Ms. Robin Banks and her band. The dance floor was packed all evening. If you are looking for a nice weekend away in the big city, a stay at the Delta Chelsea is worth it. We flew via Porter Airlines (excellent service) to Toronto Island on a 2 for 1 deal and it was worth every penny. You take a quick ferry ride from the island and then board a shuttle to the downtown Royal York (free). The Delta Chelsea was a quick cab ride away. If it wasn't so cold we could have easily walked it. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debby059
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta in November and the hotel is not very easy to find or to get parking . We were advise how to get to the underground parking by staff but it was not correct, so it started there and did not improve throughout the night. We had reservations at the restaurant and we were seated in a timely fashion although the hostess should be someone who is friendly and talkative ect. this lady was none of above. In fact we felt like we were putting her out . Oh well that was her job. Our waitress came and again , not all that friendly with us , we had a question about the menu and she had to go to the manager for advise on how to handle things. I was given a coupon for the restauant when we checked in (we are priveledge members) this waitress did not want to honor the coupon so we did not argue just decided to enjoy the meal , Well i guess she was not so forgiving , it seemed we had set ourselves up for a long night of cold shoulder by the staff. Next time i stay there and i will as i like the hotel and the sleeping accomodations , but i will take a walk and spend my money else where for my meals. (the name of the restaurant is know as Bb33)

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Excellence!!”
Reviews.Author: kathy z
Reviews.Content: Due to health issues our visits to Toronto can be somewhat stressful. Therefore, we know when we stay at the Delta, any unexpected circumstance will be accommodated. Our last stay did have just that. But, not to worry. When we spoke to the staff at customer service, our minds were immediately put at ease. Staff reassured us not to worry and to let them know if we needed anything else. The staff and the hotel understood the importance of taking care of our needs. The customer service from all levels at this hotel is most definitely superior. A morning smile or an evening goodnight goes along way when you are not at home. Our room was perfect and the hotel is clean and well maintained. We wish to thank all at the Delta for making us feel at home, putting our minds at ease and for your sincere kindness! p.s. Thank you to the lady who made me warm milk every night!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like my second home!”
Reviews.Author: kbrants
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my go-to! Everyone I encounter here is so courteous. I got a free room upgrade because they weren't too busy, I got extended checkout until 6pm, and early check-in at 3pm. The hotel rooms are beautiful, and the bedding is so comfortable!! I've been here over 4 times in the past few months and their service is consistent!! Amazing customer service and the staff is so helpful! Only complaint: wifi should be free or cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay! Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Tismom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely - every staff I met was exceptional, very friendly and helpful. They met all of my needs. The front lobby was beautifully set up for the holiday time, extremely clean. The room was nice and comfortable! Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - no problems”
Reviews.Author: Kristy31
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Delta Chelsea. Good location for downtown business travel. Room was updated and very clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. Parking onsite was no issue with allowance to drive in and out during the day. Small complaint - room service breakfast - food was medocre or at least didn't meet my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: I keep returning because of the excellent value - great room and service at a great price. Excellent location for downtown TO.

Reviews.Title: “A night on the town in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Skiforfun-7
Reviews.Content: We did have a wonerful time in Toronto December 10/2011 visiting a few places of interest. We were very happy with the service and freindly advice we received from the Delta Chelsea staff. Checking in and out was a breeze and we loved the underground parking included with our Jaunt deal not to mention the wonderful meal we had in Bb33 Bistro. We are from Kingston and had freinds with us from Syracuse and they were equally impressed with the Delta Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Qwertymnbvc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great! It has everything you would want and the location is amazing. The housekeeping was excellent and the place seemed friendly and warm throughout the stay. It's safe for kids and they loved the games room, and the pool and spa was brilliant for the whole family. We loved the on site bar/club which has great live music nights. I can't praise this hotel highly enough for the price and would definately book again.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: rowdygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea on Sunday, December 11, 2011 on a Groupon deal. The hotel is conveniently located 2 blocks north of the Eaton Centre. The room was comfortable and clean but for what the hotel normally charges, nothing special. I was not impressed at the $13.95 daily charge for Wifi. There is no need for that in this day and age. There are so many other hotels in downtown Toronto that do not charge nearly as much and offer free Wifi. I doubt I'd stay at the Delta Chelsea again unless it is a deeply discounted deal.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Playaneuron
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Chelsea Delta is an OK business hotel convenient to the medical center and with a block of good restaurants across the street. The room was small but comfortable. The wifi ($15.00) was flaky, becoming inaccessible at one point. The breakfast was abysmal - they had a cafeteria style breakfast with different stations serving mostly pre-prepared food, coldish home fries, abysmal pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mjhoc
Reviews.Content: We use this hotel a lot for business and personal trips. It is dated in some of the regular rooms, but if you get can get a great deal for the signature club rooms it is definately worth it. The breakfast room is great and has a great view. And the rooms are up to date and comfortable. Monarch's Pub is also a great place to have a drink, listen to some bands, and meet new people. We had one Bartender there named Sharon and she was very friendly and had lots of information and helped make our night more enjoyable! I would definatly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy beds, a bit dated but fine.”
Reviews.Author: Jooolz1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night Dec 12th/2011. The location of the hotel is perfect. Walking distance to Yonge and Dundas Square, Eaton Centre, College Park, etc! Can't get a better location than that! There was some mix ups at check in. I was supposed to get a King bed deluxe room but they told me there weren't any left so I was given a standard Queen bedded room which I was fine with - only there for 1 night . I went into the room and it was a complete mess and at 8:00 PM!! They did apologize quickly and got me a upgrade deluxe Queen bed room with no balcony. The room was fine, nothing fancy or spectacular. Spacious, especially the bathroom (no tub though),clean and pretty quiet. The best feature of this room /hotel is the bed. SO COMFORTABLE. The pillows were amazing too- like I was sleeping on marshmallows! I'll stay here again because of the location and convenience - and the beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Downtown Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Norcat61
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Delta Chelsea Toronto for the last 32 years. I have seen many changes and they are always for the better. What I really ejnoy about the hotel is that many of the employees have been there a very long time, and know me by name. It adds a great personal touch for myself. Also Gary Myers, the manager has been there for the same length of time that I have been staying there, and we have got know each on a first name basis. Anytime there is something I would need or inquire about, the staff is always right there to help me with it. Never have to wait. Their rewards program is the greatest too! Lots of great deals when you join that. And it is also free!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: PrefferedEscapes
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful time for my birthday at the delta! great location, close to lots of food and only a short walk from the eaton center! The people were great and even sent me a cake for my birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Grandchildren love it”
Reviews.Author: faarttour
Reviews.Content: We have been taking grandchildren here 2 different weekends in December every year for 10 years. The youngest are now 10 and 7 and have been going since they were babies. They love the water slide and childrens play centre. There is a great Santa Claus in the Lobby and they do a nice picture asking for a donation to Sick Childrens hospital. You are close to Eaton CENTRE for shopping and there are hundreds of restaurants in the area in every price range. We have always had nice clean rooms. It is a large hotel but has different banks of elevators for different floors so we have never had a long wait. The biggest problem is getting to the parking levels as there are only 2 small elevators and getting out of the underground parking can be a chore. We find it great value an dwill continue until the grandchildren are too old

Reviews.Title: “Good option in the heart of downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and found that the location is awesome. Centrally located, only 2 blocks away from Dundas Square and Eaton Centre, a very large shopping mall in downtown Toronto. I get strayed all the time when I am at Eaton Centre! It is also nearby Toronto coach terminal if you are catching a coach to another city in Canada. And there is a direct airport shuttle stop outside the hotel. So it is basically very handy to move around downtown if you stay here. Room is considerably large for two persons staying in. A nice bed and comfortable quilt. However room can be quite cold at times especially during my stay (winter), I can feel the cold air flowing in from the window at the balcony although it is completely locked. Bathroom is small, not so comfortable but it has a full set of amenities. Elevators are very slooooow. Definitely slow. It takes forever to get to the 26th where the gym and pool are located. Don't bother getting a room in a higher floor. Get a room as low as possible. It saves your time. This hotel is a good option for those looking to stay in the heart of downtown Toronto. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Touch”
Reviews.Author: thestampdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to do some Christmas Shopping. Very professional front desk and no waiting when we arrived. Asked what the occassion was and I mentioned it was my wife's birthday. About an hour later there was a knock at our door from room service. Much to my wife's delight the hotel provided a complimentary bottle of wine and a few chocolate dipped strawberries. This gesture made my wife's weekend. Great central location very close to the Eaton's Centre and shopping. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MaggieSunrise
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least 12 times. I have never had a problem that wasn't solved immediately. And the problems were very minimal. Everyone is super nice and welcoming. The location is great, tons of restaurants within walking distance. Feels safe to walk down to Dundas Square and the Eaton Centre even at night. There are also several hospitals nearby so its a great place to stay and just walk to the hospital instead of having to park over there. There is also an adult pool and hot tub on the top floor - open 'til midnight, love that!

Reviews.Title: “Old and dirty, you can find better in the area!”
Reviews.Author: Diazote
Reviews.Content: I stay one night in November for work and it is one of the worse hotel in Toronto. It is not at par with other Hotels in the area. The rooms are old and require a new coat of paint. Some furnitures are new but you still feel like if you were in the 80's. Hotel was dirty, food trays were lying around even at check-in time. Hotel has no wi-fi connection in rooms, which is unacceptable in my opinion. Check-in was long an service was average. Only positive thing is the location. If you can, go somewhere else, you will have more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “You Could do Better”
Reviews.Author: Andy R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from October 4-7, 2011. No question, the location was great. 2 blocks from Dundas Square! However, the room looked tired and needed a re-fit. If you are a smoker, you will like the balconies. Maybe it can't be helped, but the location is noisy. We read reviews and made sure our room was not on the north side facing the construction across Gerrard Street. Didn't matter. There was construction of a new wing for the Hospital for Sick Children a block away from our south side room. Our room rate was partially subsidized with reward points. If it hadn't been, our room would have been way overpriced at $250 per night before taxes. This was our 4th choice. Our first 3 were all booked up. If you already booked and are reading this review, don't worry, it's not horrible. It's just not that great. The pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Regular Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Rileynico711
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Delta Chelsea 3-4 times a year on business and usually find it to be a great hotel located in the heart of downtown Toronto. My husband and 13 yr. old daughter joined me on this trip and while we enjoyed our stay, we found the room to be a bit shabby - wallpaper in the bathroom torn in areas and carpet in the room looking very worn. I am a Gold Delta Privilege member and asked on two occasions for a bathrobe which is usually in the room upon arrival however never received it which was dissapointing and not consistent with previous service experienced at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Marie P
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the heart of downtown Toronto. It is located a few blocks away from the Eaton's Centre and within easy walking distance to the theatre district. There are lots of great restaurants in the area and the reastaurants on site are also excellent. I highly recommend Delta's Delta Privilege Program. Without a doubt, it is the best program of any hotel chain. Check it out either on your next visit or on line.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good,neat but bit old”
Reviews.Author: chcui
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two nights, good location, very close to Yonge street. But like many business hotels, no internet, no breakfast. But the airport shuttle has a stop here so quite convinient. It is a old hotel but quite clean, but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very good as always”
Reviews.Author: british-canadian-60
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 2 nights during the week. We checked in early and was told the rooms that were ready were overlooking construction or we could wait. We took the room knowing about the construction which was no problem whatsoever. The room was well stocked and clean. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. Adult pool clean and quiet. Lobby bar a little rowdy with some guests sitting at the bar but service good. The hotel is in a good location, walking distance to most areas.

Reviews.Title: “My trip to Toronto - staying at Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Guy S
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed our stay at Delta Chelsea in Toronto this past November 2011, the staff was great and very helpful and the restaurants were adequate and really good food for a fair price. Thanks Delta Chelsea for making us feel like home sincerely, Guy

Reviews.Title: “Not for me! Will not return !”
Reviews.Author: Alain d
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've been to ! First, I got a 237$ rate for one night. At that price, I said to myself I would get a great room downtown Toronto. The week before, I got a much better room in Vancouver at the Days Inn for 89$ ! Go figure ! The rooms have been somewhat renovated but the first room I got was stinky with cigar. They gave me another room. There was no fridge and no minibar in the room ! The bathroom was just very plain and ok. Rusty water was coming out of the faucet and the same from the shower head. The room was not really soundproof. I went to the Market Place restaurent in the lobby. This is a cafeteria where you order your stuff and dine there. The kitchen was old and outdated, the cooking area was dirty and the cook himslef did not look clean. The dining room is lighted like an hospital room and the chairs are uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you plan to get a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: SLWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Toronto last week for a long weekedn holiday. We booked the hotel through West Jet Vacations and got a great deal. For a Delta hotel I must say that I was dissapointed. Despite the great location, the hotel was not the best expeience. The rooms were extremely small and although modern stye, very run down. The bathroom floor was covered with hair and the bathtub did not drain when you had a shower. The worst part about this hotel was the noise level. They put us in a room that faced directly onto construction - the construction went late and it started at 7am including the weekends. As well, the room next door to us (which we are sure was vacant) had a radio alarm clock that would sound at 6:30 am and stay on until 7:30 am and the volume was on full blast so we could hear it through the walls. When I called to complain about it, the front desk did absolutely nothing about it. I even called back to give them reminders and they completely ignored my complaint. A fight on the balcony above us broke out between a couple and they continued to scream and slam the balcony doors - it was brutal. This hotel needss to really consider hiring more staff to monitor the halls and rooms for noise levels. I lost so much sleep and came away from a relaxing weekend with a serious loss of sleep. The business centre is very expensive - internet is charged per 15 minutes and it is very expensive. As well, the charges for making local calls is $2 per call for less than one minute - rip off!! The front desk did little to be accomodating - in additon to not responding to noise complaints, they were not the most accomodationg people. We had a friend call the front desk to speak with us and the front desk staff brushed them off saying that we had already checked out and we hadn't. The few good things about this hotel include: shuttle service to and from the airport, the very sweet pool boy, and the location. I would not recommend this hotel and I will not plan to stay here again while visiting Toronto. I true test of what this hotel is like will be based on my response from them to this post.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for building work opposite”
Reviews.Author: ian_ok
Reviews.Content: Delta Chelsea is in a good mid-town location, easy walk to Yonge St and Queen St for night life/bars restaurants. It is a huge hotel with different groups of lifts taking guests to various floors. Hotel seemed busy so could wait a while for the lift. Note there is an 80 floor block under construction in front of the hotel on Gerrard Street so to avoid noise during working hours ask for a room on the other side. The building work will last for several years at least. Our room was spacious, could have been more modern but comfortable bed. Bathroom was fine too. Top floor of hotel has indoor heated pool with Jacuzzi and gym all of which looked good.

Reviews.Title: “I will return”
Reviews.Author: drakeNiagara
Reviews.Content: I love the Delta Chelsea in Toronto. Everything is so close to even walk to. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The pool/hot tub in for adults only as there is another one for children. Change room is clean and has a sauna. Two places to eat in the lobby including a nice bar. We will sure return and we are planning for a get away soon.

Reviews.Title: “great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: RanleighReview
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Delta to celebrate our anniversary and while my husband unexpectedly ended up in the ER that day - we still made the most of it and the Delta was really accommodating. We received a room with a king bed and kitchen that we enjoyed. Bathroom was small but for one - we didn't care. Everything was clean and comfortable. Updated movies were available to rent which we enjoyed. We had a reservation at Bistro 33 and after our day - we didn't feel like eating out - they were very nice and sent our prix fixe dinner to our room for in room dining. All staff were very nice and polite. Our rate included parking which is great for downtown Toronto. We definitely go back and hopefully make a true celebration of the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay but I expected more”
Reviews.Author: countygirl74
Reviews.Content: I purchased a night's stay here with a Wagjag voucher which included free parking and free fixed price dinner so it was a good value. The hotel itself was nice (decorated for Christmas) but the room was smallish and I didn't feel like there were any extras in the room. We were supposed to receive an updated room- the furniture and bedding appeared new but the room was just average. The dinner included was a disappointment so we ended up "upgrading" to the Asian buffet for a nominal charge (I would never pay the $29.95 charge that it normally costs). Dinner was okay. We ate at the breakfast buffet the next morning and did enjoy this quite a bit. This was my first visit to this hotel and I was really excited to try it but left feeling underwhelmed. The room was clean, the staff were pleasant, nothing really bad to say but no rave reviews either.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Accommodations and Service”
Reviews.Author: Kaacky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to travel to Toronto for medial reasons in 2007. The Delta Chelsea and it's fabulous staff were most accommodating. With our extended stay, we began to call this our home, and were proud to do so! We were given a kitchenette room for a fabulous rate and our three month stay turned out to be most comfortable. Since 2007, we have returned to the Delta Chelsea on 5 separate occasions, for medical and pleasure ... all with the same great service, attention to detail, and affordable rates. Our room was kept exceptionally clean and well stocked with complimentary water and utensils. On top of that, becoming a Delta member had a number of fantastic perks including complimentary breakfast, free room upgrades, complimentary internet, etc ... the list goes on! We would recommend the Delta Chelsea for business, pleasure or medial reasons ... location is great as it is quite close to all of the hospitals in the area as well as major attractions (i.e. CN Tower) and shopping!! Just a fabulous location!!

Reviews.Title: “Worked out perfect. Discounted rate, still a good room.”
Reviews.Author: Bex_smiles
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy, very nice staff at the front desk. We used the hotel parking for convenience as we heard it was to rain all the day the next day. I didn't want to walk to my car in the rain just to find cheaper parkingâ€¦.but I am sure it can be found. Parking will run you $28 for one nightâ€¦ The room â€“ Nice and clean, no stains, the bedding was crisp and clean. Bathroom was big. Very clean. Shampoo and conditioner, body lotion, facial bar and a show mitt are provided. We had a king size bed, and there was room to move around. Channel changer didnâ€™t looked very â€œsanitizedâ€�â€¦I wrapped it in the sheet to use itâ€¦.yuck. Also there was no working AC so we watched tv with the window open when we got back from being out...the room was stuffy without it. We also had a balcony room. The sounds of the city can definitely be heard! I was awoken at 5am to the sounds of sirens and a fire alarm sound in another building. I thought it was ours and panicked a bit. Not the hotels fault but I would say the windows and sliding door should be a bit more sound proof at some point in the renovation process...whenever that may be. We were there for one quick night. It was only a place to sleep for us as we were out and about that night. I have nothing to really complain about as I wasnâ€™t staying there for leisure. We got the room at a discounted rate and it lived up to the price. I donâ€™t think anyone should ever pay over $120 for a room here though. Itâ€™s definitely not worth anything over that. Good location though, I will say that.

Reviews.Title: “great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: love2gotravel
Reviews.Content: I just spent two consecutive weekends at this hotel which I purchased for a great price from TravelZoo. The room was not large but very comfortable and clean. I had great experiences with all of the staff from check in to the service in the bar. Everyone I dealt with was friendly and helpful. The hotel is located right in the downtown core so everything including great restaurants, theatre and shopping is within walking distance. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Race Ready”
Reviews.Author: canjim
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and up to date. The everthing was ready and you know there were an top of ther game with so may runners all stressed in the early morning. Food was good and they had some light lunches. As I didn't have a car it was walking distance to all race sights. (start, finish and expo). If I do the Waterfront Toronto Marathon again I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Usually pretty reliable”
Reviews.Author: Glen A
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel a few times a year. Usually the place is clean and comfortable. Rooms can be small in some areas but overall are not bad. Beds are amazingly comfortable. Construction noise can be an issue with the new condos being built north and west of the property. I would recommend people join the Privilege program for the check-in speed and the free internet. My last stay this past Friday was okay except for the hairy sink!! I stay more often here than most other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: andrew b
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful elegant hotel in the heart of Toronto. The rooms are spotless and luxurious. The beds are fantastic, not to mention the giant bathroom! The service at this hotel is second to none. The staff is cheerful, polite and beyond helpful. I stay at this hotel every time I am in Toronto, sometimes we go to Toronto just so we can stay at the Delta.

Reviews.Title: “A few nights on business.”
Reviews.Author: kmsultan
Reviews.Content: I spent a few nights at the Delta Chelsea in Toronto. The hotel is one (if not the) biggest hotel in Canada. It felt like a zoo sometimes, but I didn't mind that. The hotel is a bit old, which is evident by the worn out furniture in the room. The location of the hotel is excellent, being a three minute walk from Dundas Square/Eaton Centre. The room doesn't have wifi, but does have an Ethernet Internet connection. It comes with the room, as you'd have to pay a daily fee for it (unless you're a Delta Privileged member).

Reviews.Title: “Discounted Rate at the Delta Chelsea means inferior Room”
Reviews.Author: Joanne13
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a discounted rate for a room at the Delta Chelsea in Downtown Toronto. Lots of companies do this, mine was from Travelocity. My complaint is that they shud tell you that you are not getting a deal, which is how they portray this, you are just paying less for an inferior room. Once I complained I was told that we could pay extra for the renovated more modern redecorated room. The room had stains on the sofa chair. All the furniture was scratched or gouged, carpet was dirty. Bathroom faucets did not work. Bathtub drain was broken and dirty. I am ok with getting what you pay for but that should be my choice not false advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: YarGuy
Reviews.Content: Do not under any circumstances accept a room that faces Gerrard. Construction starts across the street at 7:00 am sharp! Hotel is too big for it's own good and too dated to be of value. Rooms are relatively small. There is no wi-fi in most rooms and where there is it costs $14 every day - as does the hard-wired internet access. Market Garden has lots of choice - of very ordinary and expensive food. Only benefit is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Very thoughtful stay at the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: digerati
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Chelsea two to three times per year for 3-10 days at a time. We're always impressed by the speed of check-in as a Privilege Club member and with the overall level of service. Our most recent stay was especially memorable as they were thoughtful enough to send us a nice package of snacks and a bottle of wine after the Internet connection had been down for a little over an hour. My fiance and I are impressed with their thoughtfulness along with the speed at which they corrected the issue (an hour to replace or re-flash a router and propagate changes is good for any business!). Thanks especially to Bryn Hendricks for following up. We'll be back to the Chelsea in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: GudrunBrynja
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean and we had a very good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Eva L
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean. The bed was very comfortable. I stayed there for two nights and I truly enjoyed my stay there. Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire for 86$. The location of the hotel is excellent, for those in town for a taste of the big TO. Plenty of restaurants around (Big Slice is a fave, just 1 minute walk). The lobby looks like a mix of a 1970s shopping mall, with weird elevator configuration (actually, a nice touch given you get to your floor faster by skipping floors), but check in was courteous and my room was ready for early check in. Got a room with 2 queens, a bit cramped, especially the bathroom, good toiletries, old CRT TV, smallish work station, pay wired wifi (14$) but free wifi in lobby. The view was a bit dismal given they are building the tallest condo tower in TO there (soon to be no view). There is a small balcony for those who want fresh air. The pool and gym area are quite nice, good size pool, good selection of gym equipment, with a nice view of the city (this area is on the top floor). As for breakfast, they have 3 restaurants on premise, including a cafeteria style one (a tad pricey), and lots of dining options in walking distance. If I get this hotel again at a good price, I will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price...”
Reviews.Author: Pread
Reviews.Content: I stayed there this week and wasn't impressed! The lobby looked great........and thats where it ended. Im sure that the sheer amount of rooms makes it difficult to have outstanding service but the Delta in Ottawa manages excellent service with extra points for George who works in the lobby. The rooms (even though recently renovated) was one problem after another. We had no hot water, the towel rack fell off and the balcony overlooked a constuction site and was caked in pigeon poop. They only have wireless internet in the lobby as well. We paid too much for that!

Reviews.Title: “A little tired but good location”
Reviews.Author: Katrinsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on a girls shopping weekend. Great location, walking distance to the Eaton's Centre, lots of great shopping nearby. The underground garage is a little daunting, very steep with narrow spaces. The hotel certainly shows some wear and tear but nothing too major. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “At all costs find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in really bad shape. Way past its good days. Halls are dingy. Rooms are in pretty bad shape. You can see that they have done a couple of cosmetic things like adding a new shower curtain and new bedding but everything else is very old and basically in a state of disrepair. Some examples - every surface of every piece of furniture in my room was so scratched it looked like someone had been through the room with a Brillo pad and removed all the finish on the furniture. - the bathroom was pretty old and there was silicone tape visibly wrapped around the shower head to prevent it from leaking - phone is broken, none of the speed dial buttons work. Press the button for the front desk and nothing happens instead I had to go searching for the five digit code that connects me. The biggest thing was that I'm sitting in my room (it's November) freezing my butt off. So I play with the heat and realize that there is no heat. I call downstairs and they inform me that they are actually not going to be turning the heat on for the whole hotel because it "has been nice outside". Ummm....what??? I'm a paying guest at a hotel in Toronto in November and your telling me that you are not turning on the heat? They offer me a space heater and I say really I would prefer not to have one because they are a fire hazard. Anyway, two calls and various claims that they have spoken to the manager and they call me back to inform me that they will be turning on the heat at 10 pm. Huh? I've been cold for an hour and now you are telling me that I have to be cold for another hour and a half before I get heat. Unacceptable.Â  The best thing that I can say about this hotel is that the bed and towels seem to be clean and free of bedbugs. Other than that....if you are a student or on a really limited budget stay here. If not stay far far away.

Reviews.Title: “Good for its class”
Reviews.Author: grenba
Reviews.Content: I give this a four out of five stars. It wasn't a spectacular hotel, but it was good for its class. The location was wonderful, right downtown, very conveniently located near many tourist destinations, and the room was quite affordable. (I booked through Priceline.) There was definitely some wear and tear on the walls and carpets, but the gym upstairs was very, very nice, and there was a paper outside of my room in the morning. The main reason I didn't give it five stars, however, is that they charge $13.95 for WiFi, which, in this day and age, is a bit ridiculous. I would probably stay there again, however.

Reviews.Title: “great location, especially if like spa too”
Reviews.Author: 4rkidz
Reviews.Content: enjoyed a week for business, especially enjoyed the spa next door Elmwood Spa - they give a discount if show your room key.. the curry's at lunch time in the bistro are great as is the affordable food in the cafe part. Pub i didn't like too much .. but the restaurant is excellent.. business services are really good - make sure you get an upgraded room and that been renovated as some are looking rather tired.. great staff, very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: anmejoshme
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekend. The place was packed. This is downtown Toronto and you will get street noise here. Across the street a huge construction site is going up and during the day, you get some noise from there as well. This is the downside. Everything else was terrific. The rooms were spacious and clean. Everything was working and in good repair. The TV was oldstyle which was surprising but worked well. The bathroom is spotless though quite small. Underground parking with in and out priviledges for guests. We drove in, parked our car and then walked everywhere we wanted to go for the rest of the weekend. What an advantage in Toronto.The staff was terrific from the concierge, front desk, doormen, all were helpful, polite and very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Diappointed”
Reviews.Author: disapp0inted123
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed for two nights to attend a wedding.I was travelling with my son, daughter-inlaw, their 24mth old and my own daughter. We had ajoining rooms. The carpet in the rooms were so dirty that I didn't put my feet on the floor without slippers on them, and couldn't let my granddaughter down to play on them without shoes. The tub was so dirty and stained that I woulld't use it, We stayed on the 10th floor and only 1 elevator worked out of 3 the whole time I was there, We informed the front desk but was told they didn't know anything about it.(after 2 days I am sure someone must of brought it to their attention. We went to the pool area with my granddaughter, again it was dirty, the change room had area that was private for changing. There was a breakfast tray left outside in the hall beside my room when I checked in Friday afternoon and was still there when I checked out on Sunday morning. Sunday I waited 40mins for an elevator to get down to check out. The food in both the Garden Market and Bb33 bisto was appauling. The eggs were dripping with somekind of I don't know what and the girl at the caskier made a huge deal because my granddaughter(23mths) went to the table before I paid for the food. She needed to see her and I had to give my hotel room number so that I could prove she was under 12, even though she saw her beside me. I will never stay in this Delta Hotel or recommend it to anyone. The service was unacceptable from the time I arrived until I left. I even sent for my valet parking when leaving the hotel and i had to wait 15mins. because they forgot to tell anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Awakening”
Reviews.Author: SeymoreTalkless
Reviews.Content: There is currently major construction underway right beside the hotel. And it starts at the crack of dawn. This hotel is fine if you are a super-early riser, but should be avoided by those who desire a full night's sleep. On the bright side it's clean enough and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient place to be while in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: rash_India
Reviews.Content: My second visit to Delta Chelsea and as good as the first was. Perfect location, great hotel, fabulous restaurants , what else would you want! The fact that this is one of the few hotels that the Airport Coach stops at is the icing on the cake. I am surprised pleasantly that the largest hotel in Canada can be so well run even on full days.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, unpersonal, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: GypsyKingBrussels
Reviews.Content: I've seen some pretty big hotels, but this one is really huge, and it doesn't make any effort not to feel impersonal. Unfortunately that impersonal feeling is exacerbated by the fact that most the place, except maybe the lobby, is in need of refurbishment. I'd say it's a good option if you managed to secure a heavily discounted rate, but still... it's too big for a romantic getaway, and not efficient enough for business travel. The hotel's location is good though, half way in between the business district and Yorkville.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: StefanLisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on business in Toronto. We were there for a two week stint during the first part of November with a weekend back home in between. The two rooms we had were very different but one thing that was the same in both room... they were very, very warm. The heating/cooling system had been flipped over to heat, and it was still rather mild in Toronto so even with the air exchange system completely off, we had to ask for a fan for our room both weeks (we were put on a waiting list for those fans, so what does that tell you). We kept the patio door open pretty much the entire time to keep the temperature in the room at a comfortable level, so that made the room much louder due to street noise while trying to watch TV and sleep. The first week we were on an upper floor, and the room was much nicer. It was a larger room, had a better layout and a few other things in it that the room we had on the second week did not. The rooms and furniture seemed older and a few items were in need of repair or replacement. The second week, we were in a room on a mid-level floor and it was very noisy. We had to pay a little more for the room, at it was not as nice. The wall paper on the walls had large bubbles in it (one was the size of a dinner plate), The water pressure was hit and miss as when I was taking a shower one day, the water completely stopped for a good 30 seconds mid-shower before regaining enough pressure so I could complete my shower. Unfortunately, this is one of the preferred hotels by the company one of us works for, and is rather close to the office we have to go to when we are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Enormous Mammouth Big Good”
Reviews.Author: VikeSavoth
Reviews.Content: I'd just flew in from Iceland and before that, in from Copenhagen and I'd found the DC looking for the one hotel in town not booked for TIFF. As it turns out, this was the most amazing location I could have hoped for. Clean, well run, fantastic location. When in the history of the world, is there such a situation? Alright - quite often but do yourself a favor - come for the amentities, stay for the indoor waterslide. Plus, downstairs, the buffet eatery is literally staffed by not simply men in large white conical hats - but men that are actually chefs! I've never had such a five-star breakfast. Whether you're a TIFF'r or otherwise, you have to try this place. Plus for we American folk, Torontonians are fantastic - although I speak some other languages, the Canadian connection in vibe, feel and language makes any stay in this city a friendly delight. Go. Delta Chelsea - a heartbeat away from Toronto's Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and expensive, weird service issues”
Reviews.Author: Squindy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Overall the hotel is serviceable at best. Clean but shabby; we had a somewhat updated room but the furniture was scratched and beaten up. No in-room amenities but it did have a flat panel tv. The decor is dingy...80's fabulous-brass-meets-mid-90s-halfhearted-upgrade. Elevator buttons in the hallway didn't work. Both nights when we attempted to go to the gift shop to pick up some bottled water, we found that it had closed earlier than the posted hours. (We complained to a bellman who had good intentions, he ran into the back to grab us a couple of warm bottles of water for free, which was nice, but we would have happily paid for cold ones.) During the keynote speech at our conference, attended by about 200 people, the event was disrupted by someone in the kitchen literally SCREAMING at his staff for several minutes. I nearly got up and went back there, but the screamer came out of the kitchen, screamed through the hall, and was eventually gone. Conference food was ok, no more no less. The "special" conference rate for a basic room came out to nearly USD$450 for two nights including parking (in a sickeningly stink-filled garage). I would have been better off getting a rate through the internet or staying someplace nicer and cabbing/walking to the conference. Location seems ok...touristy and dingy area but convenient to a lot of shops, bars and restaurants, all of which provided surprisingly warm and friendly service, food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was still being renovated and updated”
Reviews.Author: renik20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea last fall, and read some of the reviews. I think some people are giving bad reviews because they had 'old' rooms, but the hotel was still in the process of being renovated (probably still is!) when we stayed. We were actually asked if we were prefer one of the renovated rooms on a lower floor versus one of the older rooms on an upper floor. We opted for renovated after viewing one of the un-renovated rooms, which was indeed outdated with filthy windows and balcony. That said, the newer room was comfortable, and was still quiet even though it was on a lower floor (I think it was the fifth floor?) In terms of location, you can't beat this place - right downtown Toronto, but not so crazy that it's manic on the streets. We were able to walk around downtown feeling (relatively) safe, but there weren't very many restaurants in the immediate area - we had to stroll a bit. I think the DC's rep as a 'business trip' hotel should probably stick - it wasn't really a romantic place, but definitely convenient for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: ladytraveler1973
Reviews.Content: They are very child friendly and being close to the mall in cold weather was nice too

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: kay082011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend of November 4-6. Got a last minute deal and was happy with the location. There is some construction nearby so be warned of the noise in the early morning. Close to all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “a fun buzz”
Reviews.Author: GMKOttawa_Ontario
Reviews.Content: I was just having an overnight stay between meetings but found the buzz of this hotel much to my likling. The lobby has as much traffic as a bus station but it has very welcome feel to it. Located in the middle of the entertainment district there are folks and families headeing in every direction. There is a variety of restaurant and pub offerings including wisely, a cafeteria style market place, Excellenty for families and people that want to get on with the visit. My room was clean and comfortable. A great place for family and others who would rather not be in the library.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Venture Out & Bring Your Own Food!”
Reviews.Author: trees6
Reviews.Content: We were transported via van from the airport in the pouring rain. The covered area was filled with parked vehicles so our van was parked in the rain. Our driver tried several times to have baggage handlers come out & unload luggage for over a dozen people on the van. The driver ended up unloading the luggage. All the passengers in the van had to disembark the van and bring ALL their luggage in a heavy rain into the covered area. Needless to say, we were all soaked. The hotel is in a neighborhood with littered streets & buildings and many street people. When the rain stopped, we went out to look for a place to eat and were accosted by a street person who grabbed my husband's arm. He had to forcibly push the man away. We went back to the hotel to eat in the hotel restaurant and my husband unfortunately had fish and was sick all night. Nothing about this hotel would ever make us ever want to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Kids everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: CareerEnder
Reviews.Content: It's OK. If you have kids I'm sure it's fine but really far from the four seasons or anything remotely considered "high end". Waaaaay too many kids running around during the day. The day time restaurant is more like a cafeteria ... check that overpriced cafeteria. On the plus side, the fitness facility and pool are pretty nice. I really like the top floor facility. Staff everywhere are good but there's never enough of them around if you really need something.

Reviews.Title: “average conference hotel, some ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: LLPCanada
Reviews.Content: Two conference attendees shared a standard 2-double bed room - it was pretty small - no room to do yoga! No in room safe or fridge. Linens were a bit shabby, but the beds were comfortable. Conference spaces were good, although we were hurried out of rooms after events so that they could be changed - have not encountered that before, and have attended 30+ conferences. Lots of dining options. Room service breakfast, ordered the night before, was 25 minutes late. The food was good, and portions were generous - too bad we had to eat it too quickly. The lobby is spacious, but confusing - there are entrances from 4 streets - if meeting someone "at the entrance", be sure to specify which entrance, as they are not all visible from any one spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price in downtown Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffbb
Reviews.Content: I booked the Delta Chelsea for a two night stay this past weekend. I booked through priceline at $81 a night. I was a little apprehensive after reading some negative reviews on this website, especially considering I booked using priceline (which unfortunately in the past I've found can change the level of service you receive, especially at the front desk at check-in), but fortunately we had an excellent stay. I wish I could remember the name of the girl at the front desk who checked us in because she was extremely helpful and curtious; she suggested I upgrade our room to a "deluxe" room, which I did, for $15.00 a night (down from $20). The room was clean, had a flat screen TV, and was on the 22nd floor, with a great view of the downtown. The hotel is central to the downtown area and has easy access to the subway and other means of public transit. I have absolutely no complaints about the Delta Chelsea, especially for $96 a night ($81 plus the $15 room upgrade) and I will certainly look at it again, especially if it's the same price, for my next trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “got woken up by construction”
Reviews.Author: NickyandMichael
Reviews.Content: We would have appreciated if we stayed on the side of the hotel where there were no constructions happening. Got woken up really early just from construction noise. It would have been nice if we were given a warning because we would have requested for a different room. We went to the hotel just to get away and relax, and waking up to construction noise just ruined it. There was no sense of requesting a new room at 8 am when were checking out at 11am. PRO: great location and clean; recommend to sign up for delta priviledge for free internet CONS: our tv was old but the tv screen accommodates to the new flat screens so we were missing half of the shows.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmed staff but very good otherwise.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDudeMan
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of the no tax offer currently available. The good: - Fantastic location, right next to everything you'd want to be around in downtown Toronto. Short walk to Eaton Center, short walk to everything really, and on the subway line. - Very comfortable bed, great view from the upper floors if you get unobstructed - Clean spacious room - A balcony! A rarity it seems for most hotels today. - Good shower with strong water pressure and adjustable nozzle - Did I mention the bed? - The price - with our package was very reasonable for a hotel in this location, and included all taxes plus parking. The bad: - Odd TV placement to the side of the bed rather than at the foot made it difficult for 2 to watch - The $25 credit in the package we ordered was for food/drink only and did not include gratuity or taxes. I'm sure there's a reason for this, but it's not clearly defined when you book, and only explained on check in. - Limited parking means they can't guarantee you'll have a space if you leave on a weekend evening and come back late, which makes absolutely zero sense! - Extremely overwhelmed with the volume of people - 4 check in agents for a line of 20 isn't optimal,and 1 concierge attendant for a lineup of 10 makes for long waits. - Not very prompt with requests - took 45 minutes for a sewing kit and another half hour for a corkscrew to open a bottle of wine. Overall I'd recommend for the right price as the location is pretty hard to beat. It's not luxury, but it's not downmarket. Just right for us. They need to invest in more customer service staff however.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for one night because of meetings for work. The hotel is in a good location, just off Yonge with many restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is big ... very big, and busy with many people running around. Check in was quick and easy, though I recommend to sign up for Delta Rewards if you have not done so already. The elevators are in different locations and are color coded which helps but seemed to be very slow ... waited quite awhile for the red elevator. The room was average; looks like it needed some updating as the carpet was worn, wall paper was pealing, etc. I did not find the bed all that comfortable and woke up quite sore the next morning. The bathroom though was nice; very inconsistent water pressure for the shower. I did see a few places on site to eat (though I did not try them). As well, there is a full pool area with water slide. The hotel was average; rate for the night was $139. I do not think I would stay here again unless for meetings as I prefer the other chain hotels closer to the water that I have stayed at in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KavemanKarg
Reviews.Content: Dated but comfortable rooms, like many down town hotels all services and in hotel food and such is very overpriced, such as parking, buffet items, even a large back of Doritos was 6 bucks in the lobby store. From the 23rd floor the street noise was still excessive, even with windows fully closed. Adult only pool and whirlpool, nice but crowded just as an FYI. Very popular spot. Overall, service was excellent except for one rude bell captain. If you need a location in downtown Toronto, it is a reasonable choice, but I am going to seek something else next time for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nomadio
Reviews.Content: Superb location in the middle of the action in downtown Tranna. A massive hotel which I understand is the biggest in Canada. Even so, things run smoothly. 4 banks of elevators so you never have to wait. Checked out the fitness/pool area which was very nice. Also scouted out the kiddie area for a future trip - good pool with a waterslide, games room and a daycare. My room was fine. Comfy bed and a clean bathroom. Housekeeping staff did a good job. Didn't try the restaurants but they looked to be busy. Had a problem my first night. Woke up at about 1 a.m. and couldn't get back to sleep. Realized this was because I was roasting, so I checked out the thermostat on the wall. Had to turn it on, then I lowered it from 22 to 17 celsius and pushed the button to activate the fan. Nothing happened so I called the hotel operator, who asked if my thermostat was off. Told her that I tried to activate the air conditioning without success. She advised that that was because "we're on heat". I guess that meant the a/c had been turned off for the winter. She said nothing could be done but sent the maintenance man up promptly. He told me the same thing re the a/c and suggested I open the balcony door wide for a few minutes. I ended up leaving it open a few inches all night. Not real impressed but whatever. The next day when I came back to my room at about 5:30 p.m. the a/c was blowing hard and the room was nice and cool. Not sure how that happened based on what I'd been told the previous night but hey, all's well that ends well. Didn't realize I had that kind of influence!! :-) So, I'd stay here again for sure. Only real complaint is the exorbitant and silly charge for in room internet. There is free wifi in the main floor lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: clarelovestravel
Reviews.Content: We booked to come to Toronto and our travel agent suggested the Delta Chelsea. After booking i was a little aprehensive after reading some negative reviews. The only negative I really have to say is that there could be more people on check-in, and it being more organised. One morning I had a 'chat' with some ignorant oink who thought he was within his rights to push to the front. After him pretending not to speak english he refused to move - this is where hotel staff should have been more aware of situations going on. the hotel is in a really great location - 5 minutes walk to transportation so was excellent and there were lots of great places to eat nearby which made life easier, plus places on site to eat. We very kindly got upgraded to a room with a kitchen which was really really handy and had a balcony with a view of a building site - not a problem for me as I work in construction in the UK so was paying close attention to the Health and Safety on site! All the staff in the main we encountered were lovely, and more than helpful - the only person who seemed disinterested was the lady on the concierge desk - but that was probably because she seemed to be on her own! Our room was clean and the towels fresh and plentiful and we had lots of space to store our stuff. our floor (23 on the blue elevator) was really quiet - although the people in the room next door did seem to stand on their balcony smoking pot - which was kind of annoying as we then had to shut the door! The beds were amazingly comfortable - and the pillows - i slept right through until morning - something i never do at home!! All in all a good stay. I probably would look to stay somewhere a bit smaller and personal next time - but it is a GREAT place for kids and families as lots for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “A big barn”
Reviews.Author: KeepSmilingUK
Reviews.Content: First of all, a big tip for anyone planning to stay at any Delta Hotel: before you go, become a Delta Privilege member â€“ itâ€™s free and simple to join online. It gives you speedy check-in - usually at a separate desk, and late check-out without extra charge. The biggest thing for us was free wired Internet access in our room (a great saving â€“ it could cost up to C$14 a day at most Delta hotels, and much more convenient than having to find a chair in the crowded lobby or restaurant, where WiFi was free of charge). Our experience of the regular check-in at this hotel was poor â€“ the desk clerks were off-hand and lacked the ability to smile. In comparison, the Privilege desk was courteous, cheerful, and a lot less stressed. We spent two nights at the Delta Chelsea before an organised tour of Ontario and Quebec and a further night at the end of our holiday. We also spent nights at Delta hotels in Montreal, Quebec City and Ottawa - see separate reviews. Despite its convenient downtown location, we disliked the Delta Chelsea most of all. Itâ€™s big, big, big â€“ too big! Itâ€™s a utilitarian barn with 1,590 rooms! There were hoards of people everywhere â€“ including lots of groups, lots of families, and the whole place seemed disorganised beyond belief. In particular, breakfast in the immense restaurant was noisy and chaotic, with self-serve areas being cleared at a ridiculously early time and long lines then forming at the various cooking and serving stations. The cash desk was hidden somewhere in the middle of the pandemonium and I reckon anyone could have come in off the street for breakfast without being noticed and without being asked to pay! Not all floors are served by all lifts â€“ so you have to join a line to board a lift in the correct place to be sure of getting to the floor on which your room is located (theyâ€™re colour coded, which I guess says it all). Once on your floor, you then follow signs to your room, reached by long, nondescript corridors. This reminded me of stark, characterless Intourist hotels in Russia, but with the space used there for old babushkas to sit guarding the keys on each floor being occupied by the ice and vending machines here. Our room was small â€“ we couldnâ€™t pass each other at the foot of the beds, and the bathroom was, ummm, cosy. The decor was plain and the lighting was appalling â€“ as seems to be the norm in most hotel rooms these days. The two Queen-sized beds were comfortable and the air-conditioning was efficient but a bit noisy. The cleanliness of the room could only be ranked as average â€“ the carpet had probably not seen a vacuum cleaner for some while, although the bathroom was okay. Would I stay here again? What do you think?!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy lobby”
Reviews.Author: Norrlandska
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and again, I was astonished by the noise in the lobby area. Many groups gathered, people all over, very noisy. The breakfast area have it all, but oh boy, so noisy and so many people all over. Quite expensive- but, generally a good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Top location. Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: breakfastfor2
Reviews.Content: Not worth the full price, dated hotel. Unless you find a great rate (under $100 for a regular room). We stayed at Intercontinental for less... and better overall not to mention! Great location on Yonge, convenient to downtown shopping, Eaton Centre, subway line, Church St., etc. Clean, OK room. Upper floor indoor pool is pretty nice, but has limited hours.

Reviews.Title: “DELTA CHELSEA Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: maiyoo3017
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at the Delta for three days while my condominium downtown was being re painted. I stayed at the Holiday Inn one night and decided to switch because it was quite expensive. I thought the Delta would be affordable but for 169 per night (excluding taxes) there was no breakfast, no internet, tired and old decor and a strange musky smell in the room. View was not that great either. Bathrooms were mediocre. Towels were slightly stained, but smelt clean. Standard amenities. Hotel had some great attractions like an indoor pool slide, an adult's pool and a buffet overlooking the downtown streets. Room service was not that great and quite pricey. They need to re vamp the space, make it more modern and keep up with the ever changing urban times of the city. Location is KILLER, right on Yonge with Bloor, Dundas, Malls, Cinemas, Restaurants within walking distance. Mattress was superb so I slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “enthusiastic cleaning staff!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret C
Reviews.Content: the hotel was beautifully clean. The room was of the same standard of cleanliness but the decor very 70's and outdated. The facilities were excellent for business trips and families alike, the dining good.The staff were helpful and the location excellent. The only criticism is that the domestic staff were a bit over enthusiastic, knocking at around 8 am to clean the room! Using the do not disturb sign only delayed this by about an hour. Not good when on vacation. But I would have no hesitation staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea is merely adequate.”
Reviews.Author: Roscoecat27
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Delta Chelsea was fairly disappointing. The desk staff were pleasant and helpful but that's about it. Our room, and in fact, the hallway leading up to it had a faint (but definite) skunky smell. When I called down to tell housekeeping about it they offered to "spray." I guess we could have changed rooms but we were tired and just wanted to sleep . The room was also very hot, even with the heat turned off. The AC did not work and the sliding door to the small terrace did not open. Again we called housekeeping and they said they would bring up a fan, but they never did. Our room and bathroom seemed old and in need of some updating. I will say that the room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the towels were good.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, tired and needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: lemorley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea for business. If I had made the reservations and was able to change hotel I would have moved. First then positive : the location is excellent, you are very close to shopping, Yonge street and numerous good restaurants and attractions. The beds are comfortable, the staff helpful and pleasant. For the price and the fact that you are downtown Toronto the deal is ok BUT The rooms are tired, the carpet looks faded and and in some areas needs to be replaced. They charge $13 for using the in room Internet for 24 hours. The latch on my window was broken and would need to be replaced to be fixed. The TV is not a flat screen and is quite small. The elevators are always jammed full of people and seem to have mechanical problems where the doors are opening between floors. The market garden restaurant for lunch - the BBQ chicken was so dry that you could only swallow with a glass of water and French Fries were the dregs of the bag.

Reviews.Title: “Night and Day”
Reviews.Author: librachick23
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, The guy at the front desk Jonathan was so helpful. He made us feel very welcome and helped us with all of our requests. Our room was nice no complaints there. The t.v was from the 90's but considering the fact that you're at a hotel in downtown Toronto the t.v was at the bottom of the priority list, so again no complaints. Late at night I called down to the front desk and asked them to reccommend a pizza for delivery. When the delivery guy arrived the ladies at the front desk, Gordana and Farhana refused to escort the delivery guy up, and told me that i HAD to come down. I ended up asking the girls for change for my pizza so I wasnt forced to tip the delivery guy $17 on a $23 pizza but they told me no. When the night manager, Andy, finally came out and gave me change I mentioned to him that I felt that it was unacceptable for his staff to act so rudely to their guests he rudely told me that that was my problem and he didnt care. When I asked him for a comment form for the hotel he said they didnt have one. He must have been clearly aware that his behaviour was unacceptable. I want to say thank you to the rest of the staff however because of these 3 employees I will never stay at the Delta Chelsea again. The night staff appear to be MISERABLE and it really affected my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: tmoney_mississauga
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is nice. The lobby and the facilities and restaurant are all very nice. However, the room was a huge disappointment. My wife and I went here for her birthday weekend and we splurged going to the delta expecting a great room. Going into the room we found the air horribly dry and stale, and the decor very dated. The tv was so small. It actually was the smallest TV I have ever seen in a hotel room, maybe it was 18-20 inches. The bed was nice, and the bathroom was ok. I was really surprised that a hotel of this caliber would be so dated, considering the competition around them. Next time, i will go to the Sheraton downtown. A much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great package deal”
Reviews.Author: ladyrose1
Reviews.Content: I took the No Tax package deal which offered - no tax on the hotel bill, free parking and $25.00 toward meals at any of their hotel restaurants or bars. Plus the restaurant also offered a 20% discount as well. The service was very good - it was noisy but this was because of the downtown area. The food at the Bistro was excellent. I would go back there. It is very central and close to good restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: James K
Reviews.Content: Our stay from October 20th thru the 23rd was an enjoyable experience. My family was happy with the level of service we received and how we were always treated with respect. Everything we asked for from the continuous request for towels to a battery jump on our day of departure was handled immediately and with care. I hope the same level of service will be applied to us when we return to Toronto in the future.
