Also, a special thank you goes to the valet service for retrieving items from my vehicle that were either left by myself or by one of my three children. The thought that things were just done was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lindseybee
Reviews.Content: Downtown, so close to shopping and all the main club areas, if not a 5-10 dollar cab to the Old Port, clubs and main attractions. The front desk was super nice, helped me out with all the little things I forgot, toothbrush/paste etc. The only thing I'll say is the walls are a little thin seeing as I could hear the baby next door crying at night. BUT! Still a steal and would definitely go back. Very pretty hotel, art work is up everywhere. The restaurant downstairs had delicious food and was so comfortable. Try it! Not expensive and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes your stay”
Reviews.Author: timmer101
Reviews.Content: I am a regular customer at the delta Chelsea. Whenever possible I stay here when I am in Toronto. No I am not staying for the large beautiful rooms, don't kid yourself. They are not large but not cramped either. They are clean and in the heart of downtown Toronto. I do stay here because the staff is exceptional. I am always treated like I am the only guest in the hotel. This Weekends all stars are...Alistar, Kevin and his partner at the Privilege desk (I am sorry I can't remeber your name). And of course the most wonderful switchboard operater known to mankind. Always helpful always happy. Our housekeeping staff were curtious and efficient our rooms (yes rooms) were clean and the staff showed genuin concern that we were happy. A little glitch with the water this morning but the maintenance staff was in our room in record time. Once again a terrific stay at the Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: SMatth
Reviews.Content: Big but surprisingly nice once you figure out the restaurant/breakfast system. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet despite the location in midtown which was good for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Huge & impersonal - too big for me.”
Reviews.Author: BigJohnShropshire
Reviews.Content: Canada's largest hotel with 33 floors and almost 1600 rooms, the hotel takes up the best parft of a city block and has 4 entrances - Elm, University, Gerrard and Bay Street. Quite confusing at first, especially as far as central lifts are concerned. The huge central lobby is very impressive but service seems somewhat distant as you join queues and have to wait your turn for attention. Location is good and is in easy walking of local pubs, restaurants and malls, especially the neighbouring Eaton Centre: Downtown is nearby, as is Queens Park, though some way from Chinatown, the CN Tower and the Harbour Front The city reminded me of a scaled down version of New York - noisy, bustling, full of skyscrapers and working cranes but, as with all the Canadian towns & cities we visited, incredibly free from litter and graffiti. Masses of building projects, vehicles and malls but some pleasant leafy streets and residential areas, with expensive condominiums springing up all over the city. Our bedroom suite was on the 19th floor - a near two minute walk from the nearest lift. Corridors seemed endless and the large bedroom & twin 5' beds contrasted with the small en-suite bathroom. The room was clean and quiet,hanging space was fine but the furniture was dated & worn: the washbasin was cracked, there was no fridge and we were unable to open the window onto the tiny balcony. Perhaps the worst complaint was having to face a vast billboard picture of Simon Cowell smirking across the neighbouring building site! I found the swimming pool & sauna, the exercise rooms and the swimming pools very impressive and busy, while the restaurants looked inviting - though we deliberately ate out.The top floor restaurant was closed during our 3 night stay which came as a disappointment as the views from there are meant to be spectacular. An impressive hotel - but not my style or size.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: marianacci3
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff. Coffee place right next door is excellent. Close to everything so you can walk to a lot of attractions. Parking garage is a tight squeeze so if you have anything bigger than a small car make sure to look elsewhere for parking. Make sure to ask for a room away from the construction if you want to sleep past 7am.

Reviews.Title: “Does need renovations”
Reviews.Author: johnydip
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Delta Chelsea, had a room on the 16th floor and was very disappointed. These rooms are just like reviews are saying, old looking, very dated bathrooms in bad need of paint (specially above the tub), tiles were chipped and stained, corners needs cleaning and scrubbing. We had 2 double beds, old box TV. Hallway carpets need to be changed, it's like a different hotel once you leave the spacious lobby and go up to your room. Go there if you want to be close to the Eaton Centre but INSIST for a renovated room and be careful NOT to be book on the construction side of the hotel since they start with jack hammers at 7:00 am, VERY noisy. Definitely not the Deltas I am used to.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Craig
Reviews.Content: I booked and got a king room with a balcony for my Fiance's birthday through Priceline. Got the room for $90 US. I would suggest using something else as their website seems to charge amounts for the conversion that aren't even close to actual rates for the Canadian dollar. The hotel likes to post their "USUAL" pricing on the back of your room door. Seems funny, seeing as how hotels really never have a set, standard price for anything. They like to claim that their usual rate is something between 5 and $600 for one person in their king suite. Delta Chelsea can always be found on Travelzoo, or some other savings site. The hotel was great and I didn't encounter any of the problems that I read in other reviews. The main lobby and reception area is beautiful. The man that received me during check in was very helpful and friendly. I liked that the main corridors to the rooms were actually clean, bright, and temperature was well controlled. Nothing I hate more than going to a "nicer" hotel and seeing the same old dark, dingy, stuffy corridors. They were none of those things at this hotel. The balcony was a very nice feature, I just wish the weather had been a little better during our visit. The rooms was very nice and clean. Only noticed one old stain (which may have been blood), but it was very faded. Hey, some stains are bound to be found on the floor of a hotel that probably hundreds of thousands of guests stay at. Bathroom was very clean. Especially when considering the tub surround is still tile and grout. No mould or anything along the grout lines. Elevators were very fast, which is good, considering there are 26 floors. The finess facility is amazing. I have been in some gyms that aren't as well furnished. The pool and hot tub were so clean and refreshing. They were each the perfect temperature (for me anyway), and the view from the pool/fitness area is amazing. You get a great city view and a clear shot of the CN Tower. We were able to walk all over the place or even quickly get to the subway system if need be. We spent the afternoon at the CN Tower and walked all the way down there. Maybe 30 minute walk at most. So many restaurants of every variety close by. I would recommend Little India on Queen st. Great little place. The Eatons Centre is right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanViking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located. Right in the heart of Toronto. Do not let its size scare you off. Staff is great and restaurants are very good. Some of the rooms could be updated. The fans in the bathroom and the air conditioning was kind of noisy, because of age mainly but everything else was great. Comfortable beds and easy check in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but room was small!”
Reviews.Author: Satella
Reviews.Content: Checking in this hotel was disappointing!! Expect long line ups!! Upon check in they most likely have 2 double beds and no 1 king beds. This was fine as 2 beds is what i like to book most. The lobby was bustling busy but very tourist attractive. Stayed on the 16 Floor which was very MUSTY!! The interior design and wallpaper was not attractive at all. Upon entering the room i felt so clustered as it was small compared to other 3 star hotels i stayed at. No access to balcony as it was locked! the washroom was small and the shower was not good at pressure at all. The Queen Double beds were a joke they are more like Twin beds with extra pillows! Not Happy. Beds were comfortable and we did sleep soundly thru the night. The Pool was very nice and the sundeck was very nice during the hot summer months. Good views of the city as well. I would think twice before booking this hotel again but at the price and service it was meh to me!

Reviews.Title: “Disbelief over brand affiliation and 3-star rating!”
Reviews.Author: eightfoldpath
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Delta Chelsea for a business meeting on-site. First time guest at this location but many experiences with the hotel brand elsewhere in the GTA and beyond. Property shows 3-star rating consistent with what I have come to expect as a business traveller when staying at Delta or other major hotel chains. Upon arrival the exterior was quite impressive and lobby area bustling with activity. Check in was friendly and efficient. When I got to my room I was shocked by what awaited me behind the deceptive veneer of my preliminary experience. In a word, the place is a dive. Peeling wallpaper, a wall-mounted heating/cooling unit that doesn't work, a television that may have come from my grandparent's yard sale, yellow bathtub (that dripped so loudly I had to place a face cloth under the spigot to quiet it down), dingy tile, a shower that intermittently scalded and froze me, and furnishings that were reminiscent of my dormitory days. The room was small, closet small and amenities like wireless internet were not available - even if one was willng to pay. At one point I was actually tempted to go outside and confirm that a Delta brand logo was adorning this one-star accommodation. I was starving when I arrived, and although I usually order room service, the conditions created the 'perfect storm' for enticement to leave the room and dwell as long as possible in the deceptive veneer of the public areas. I chose the Marketplace for my meal as it offered a cafeteria style variety of options for me to build my dinner from. I cannot explain what compelled me to buy the sushi; it seems an obviously bad decision in retrospect. The label stated: "My sushi is guaranteed fresh", which for the record was true about the fish, it is too bad the guarantee did not extend to the avacado - which was rancid. Everything I put together from the salad bar was either tasteless and dry or sour and off; with the exception of the pickles which quickly became the highlight of my repast. To be fair I must include the fact that the bed was quite qood and provided a comfortable night's sleep. There was also a lovely terry robe provided in the room which seemed an out-of-place luxury in such shabby surroundings. At least it gave me something to cling to as I lived with the regret of not having booked my usual room at the Marriott. In my effort to avoid the inconvenience of walking a few blocks, I sacrificed all the style and comfort that I had come to take for granted. I know better now. My advice to you, for whatever it may be worth, is to stay away from the Delta Chelsea because the only thing it succeeds at is proving the old adage true: "You can't judge a book by its cover". The Management should focus more attention on what their guest rooms have to offer, because after all, customers are not paying to spend the night in your lobby. Never, ever going back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday in Canada”
Reviews.Author: rallydriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 2 nights. Hotel was situated in Downtown Toronto. Room was nice and clean, bed was massive!!. Staff really friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Partyer”
Reviews.Author: Nancy R
Reviews.Content: It was a long weekend, Saturday night. I called at 2:30 to complain about the noise. We are staying at a room perpendicular to the building where the party was happening. I talked to the front desk and requested if they can do something about the noise but nothing was done. It was 4:30 and the noise was even worse, beedless to say I did not sleep that night. Aside form this incident, we had a pleasant stay. If you intend to stay there, please request a room away from the condominium. Do not expect the staff to do something with your complain.

Reviews.Title: “unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: TOCDNTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: The room was small and definitely in need of a makeover. The bathroom was very small and very much in need of a makeover. I am sure both were clean, but they did not seem to be clean because they are so dingy. At $300 for one night, I was grossly over charged.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: rrmambo
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews and I was a bit worried about the hotel. My wife and I stayed 2 nights on October 8th and 9th of 2011 for a friends wedding. We flew in on Porter Airlines from Newark and that was excellent. The Delta Chelsea is a short 10-15 minute cab ride and we paid CA$13.00 for the fare. The Delta Chelsea is very centrally located and as others have written the lobby is very impressive. The staff was super friendly on check in and helpful. Our room was on the 7th floor and was clean, pleasant and modern. It had definitely been updated recently. The bathroom had newer tile floors and bath surround with granite counter tops. The beds were comfortable and clean with great pillows. The rugs were clean and the room had more then adequate space. Everyone in the wedding party was really happy with the hotel. We goat a great rate also of approximately $120.00 USD per night. The hotel is huge and they have different elevators for different floors. They have a nice pool on the top floor with a roof deck. There are some great views of the city from there. There is a super high rise condo going up next door so there could be some construction noise during the day if your facing that side of the building. We were there on a weekend so that was not a factor. There are tons of restaurants, shops, sights within walking distance. It was a pleasant stay and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Traveler20090810
Reviews.Content: Delta Chelsea met my early check in and late check out requests. Love the Chelsea!!!!!!! Friendly helpful staff. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicola B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 10 days and found the whole experience enjoyable. Staff were extremely helpful - be it asking for directions or something for your room. The cleaning staff are excellent and so smiley and friendly. My room was a large room on the 4th floor with 2 double beds, desk, decent sized flat-screen TV with lots of channels available, balcony and decent sized bathroom. Everything was spotless and the beds were so comfortable. The hotel is in a fantastic central location and also really close to a subway station if you needed it. I would definitely recommend this hotel based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Both staff and hotel need a renovation”
Reviews.Author: mistylime
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with a friend over Thanksgiving weekend. The front desk lady was very unfriendly. Rooms were ok., but on a noisy floor with screaming children running down the hall. Internet service is plug in only and you have to pay for it. In this day and age wireless should be the norm, especially if you are being charged $14 plus tax for it!! And it didn't work at first I had to call twice to see why, just got a message saying to try again later. That is very inconvenient when you want to find a place for dinner or need directions in a rush. The hotel is in a busy location and it is big and bustling but overall it needs some freshening up and the front desk staff could be a little more friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating!!”
Reviews.Author: Alice S
Reviews.Content: We chose the Delta Chelsea for it's reputation for being an upscale hotel. This was a family vacation with young children, and we decided to splurge and stay some place a bit fancier for this vacation. The hotel, while beautiful in the lobby, was sorely in need of renovations in our room. We paid a lot of money for a 1 bedroom suite, which had a pull-out sofa for our children to sleep on. The kitchen looked like something out of the 1970s, complete with an old yellow stove, and cupboards that had been painted over to appear newer. The carpets were badly stained, and there were other people's food wrappers under our bed. The balcony did not appear safe for us or our children to sit out on. Both pool areas were very clean and well maintained, and our children really enjoyed the kids activity room. Staff in both of these areas were friendly and helpful. Overall, we felt that this was incredibly overpriced in comparison to other newer hotels we have stayed at with the same type of room. We also booked online, and the photos of the same type of room we booked looked nothing like the room we were in. There are clearly some rooms that have been renovated for photo ops, but ours was clearly not one of them!! My husband is not picky when it comes to hotels, but even he was surprised by how dirty the carpet in the room was, and how outdated all of the furnishings were. We will look at staying at a newer chain-type hotel for our next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: Amanda L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in April 2011 while visiting Toronto. The hotel is nice, with a great location close to the subway system and lots of restaurants. The staff was friendly, although the lobby was a bit confusing at first due to the different elevators for different floors. Lobby always seemed very crowded. Our room was decent but on the small side. It had a small patio that was disgustingly dirty with cigarette butts and chewed gum all over it, so we didn't use it. The pool area is nice, as is the fitness area. Our major complaint is on our first morning waking up in the hotel, we were woken up by fire alarms blaring for 1/2 an hour before someone finally came on the announcement system and said which floor the problem was on and they needed to evacuate (it wasn't our floor so we stayed put as told) and the alarms continued to go on for the better part of an hour. Rather annoying at 7 am, especially considering there was no fire. All in all it was a decent place to stay, and we would stay here again, but mostly for the convenience of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Badly needs a renovation”
Reviews.Author: servicecomesfirst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea for two nights over the Thanksgiving long weekend. We picked the Delta because it is one of the few hotels to allow pets. While the place is enormous and very busy, our check-in was quite speedy. The rooms, however, are tired looking and have a musty smell. Our room had a small balcony but it was filthy with penguin droppings. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and our daughter really enjoyed the pool. The large self-serve restaurant is great for breakfast. One problem is that dogs have absolutely nowhere to "do their business" -- we had stayed at the Delta a couple of years ago and there used to be a dog park across the street which is now the site of a new condo tower. Suggestion: why not build a small park on the hotel site?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs some T.L.C.”
Reviews.Author: dustylin
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9 p.m. after travelling all day .The girl on reception could not find us a room but following a conversation with a colleague we were allocated a refurbished room on an upper floor at the rear of the hotel. On arrival at the hotel we thought it was old and shabby and the corridors and lifts up to our room were drab. However our room was basic but clean and comfortable with the usual amenities and we slept well in it.We used the restaurant on the first night. The food was average and the staff helpful and friendly. The cafe which is open from 6.a.m to 11 p.m. was good value for breakfast and late evening snacks. The pool looked inviting but we had no time to use it.This hotel is in a good location within walking distance to shopping centres and activities. The concierge staff were helpful with advice and arranging transport.Perhaps we were lucky getting a refurbished room but we spent very little time in the room anyway . Our stay was o.k. but I think I'll wait until its completely refurbished before I would consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki S
Reviews.Content: We had a family room booked, you know the old one room with two queen beds trick. Why the kids don't get singles always surprises me. The kids are teenagers, so not small kids and we had been travelling for three weeks, so we had a suitcase each plus hand luggage. The room we were given did have two queen beds but the room was so small, you could barely walk around the beds. We couldnt even store our suitcases. How they think a travelling family can fit in a room this size is beyond me. So we had to upgrade ourselves to a bigger room. Yes it was bigger with with a foldout sofa bed for the kids. Everyone knows they are not comfortable, however we did have enough room for the bags. Just be careful when booking that you know exactly what the room is like. It was clean however the "white" sheer curtains were yellow and quite disgusting and half a bottle of mouthwash had been left from someone else - Yuk! It really does need a little upgrade. The foyer and entrance are beautiful but the rooms are tired. The staff were helpful and the Market Garden was a great place for breakfast and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be renovated!”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: Great location but the rooms need major updating. My room had an old small tube tv, no AC, curtains that didn't fully cover the windows, a blinking phone that was ancient, and the doorbell to the outer door of the room was wired to the wrong room.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Grantown on Spey, null, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Scottish visitors”
Reviews.Author: Anne G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 10 nights and loved every minute of it , the bedroom was nice and clean and we found the staff really nice and helpful. We booked all out tours through the hotel and i would recommend Kens tours he was an excellent guide .All in all we had an excellent time in Toronto We were only about 5minutes away from the Eaton centre and we went for a walk every night and felt very safe If we go back to Toronto we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: curioustraveler28
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin....I booked two rooms in this hotel through priceline for my birthday. I then upgraded the rooms to Signature Club rooms and signed up for the Delta Privilege program believing this would ensure that I received the best customer service possible. Unfortunately, I was completely WRONG in believing that! I called the hotel approximately an hour and a half prior to check in as the privilege program has a feature where you can call on your way and check in at that time to expedite the check in process. I believed I was checked in. Again, wrong. When I got there at 3:00pm (the hotels check in time!!) I was informed that the room I had requested was still occupied and the only room available was beside the elevator AND there was only one room available at that time. I asked Dawood, the front desk agent, where my friends were supposed to stay and he informed us that their room might be available by 7:00pm, but maybe not. After arguing for about 20 minutes about only one room being available and it being right next to the elevator I became tired and simply accepted that he was not going to do anything at all to help out in our situation. I agreed to take the room by the elevator and then wait until "sometime later" for the other room to become available. Stupid me for thinking this was the end of it. Dawood then informed me that the room by the elevator was now taken and there were no rooms available at all....at 3:30pm, half an hour past check in. At this point I became irate. I turned TO MY FRIEND and said "this is (expletive - tripadvisor wont let me put *'s) ridiculous." Here's where this hotel really blew me out of the water....Dawood turned to his associate and said "can you call security?" Excuse me???? I am a young professional woman and by using profanity I deserved to have security called on me? What type of customer service is this??? I wouldve left right on the spot had I not already paid for the rooms. I asked him why he was acting like this and he actually said to me in an extremely rude tone, "I'm talking to you like this because of the way you're talking!" What happened to the customer being right?? Apparently they arent in this hotel! After this stay I'm so incredibly shocked at the complete lack of customer service I experienced...I will never even consider setting foot inside this hotel again. Other things to note: If you book through a third party site (priceline, travelocity, etc.) expect to be told at every chance that you have no rights as a guest and any "extras" offered to guests that booked through the delta site will NOT be offered to you. Do NOT spend the extra money for the signature club floor, the lounge is not worth it. The rooms are old and worn in. Everything is outdated, I dont quite understand where the "renovated rooms and corridors" are. The valet took AT LEAST 30 minutes to take our keys and to bring our car up in the morning - and then took the key to our car and put it in his pocket and left! If you want anything brought up to your room from guest services be prepared to wait about 3 hours and make at least 3 phone calls to them. There is no express check out, be prepared to wait in line for at least 20 minutes to check out. There are no guaranteed rooms, even if you are a privilege member. In all, this hotel is absolutely horrible. Take your money and stay somewhere else...this hotel is maybe a 3 star hotel with 1 star customer service. DO NOT STAY HERE! It is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, period. (I have emailed Delta Hotels regarding this stay but shockingly they have not responded!)

Reviews.Title: “Busy, bustling place”
Reviews.Author: CanberraSteve38
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was fortunate that we arrived for check-in just after midnight. Service was rapid: we were soon in our room with kitchen. This is a huge hotel and the next morning we saw just how busy a hotel lobby could be. That's not a criticism: I felt that the place had a real buzz and, when it came time for check-out and storing baggage, we were impressed with just how well things operated. The room wasn't the most modern but it was spacious, comfortable and served our purposes well. The kitchen, while quite small, was in a separate room which meant that cooking smells were kept out of the main room and was well equipped. The downtown location was just what we were looking for: check out the good views of Toronto from the outdoor terrace close to the fitness centre/pool. Transit connections (subway and streetcar) were close. It was disappointing, given the price of the room and what you'd expect from business-oriented hotels of this class, that free wifi was not available in the bedrooms (it was, however, available in the lobby). Perhaps this will be addressed in the hotel's renovation program.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Mayleekerr
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute room here for Nuit Blanche 2011. The location couldn't have been better. When I arrived to check in I noticed that the lobby was quite busy. Thankfully I am a Delta Priveledges member so check-in for me was a breeze, but I could see this being frustrating for the average traveler. My room was clean and the bed was really comfortable. The only issue I had was that the heat didn't turn on till morning, so all night it was really cold. They also offered me a 6pm checkout, which was nice considering Nuit Blanche runs all night long. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for your stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but not Cheap”
Reviews.Author: msawyer_11373
Reviews.Content: The 4-night stay at Delta Chelsea in downtown Toronto was quite unnerving and left a bad taste in my mouth due to an incident that happened at 1:35 early morning of 9/24/11. We were awaken by the fire alarm system that went blaring and the p.a. instructed us to evacuate the building which we did. Nervously, we walked all the way from the 10th flr to the ground, fire trucks came but it turned out it was a false alarm but nobody explained to us why it happened! I hope the hotel has a better maintance system, I wouldn't want to experience the same thing again and left us wondering.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday :(”
Reviews.Author: cat198
Reviews.Content: I visited TO for my birthday. The Delta Chelsea prestige clerk didnt have any interest in doing something special for my birthday (Montreal Delta Centerville are more then happy to give wonderful experience for celebrations!) Even though it was written on my reservation I was there for my bday; I had to verbally remind them and they didnt seem too interested. Got a few balloons and 2 chocolate strawberries. Woohoo! In the morning I finally got them to give me free breakfast. Rm was clean and for most part comfortable

Reviews.Title: “good at right price”
Reviews.Author: Aspi123
Reviews.Content: right in downtown toronto. nice clean rooms with facilities. gr8 gym and pool at rooftop. internet very pricey. but no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ianrenwick
Reviews.Content: Others have pointed out the chaotic nature of the lobby (and odd elevator setup) as well as the dire need of renovations, but this hotel is in a good location of downtown Toronto (5 minutes walk to the Toronto Eaton Centre) and the restaurants in hotel are pretty good. The rooms themselves are comfortable enough, but lack a minibar and anywhere to put your bag. The in-room amenities are pretty average, but sufficient and the showers need a big upgrade. The aircon is pretty noisy too. You can't hear any outside noise, but in certain rooms, you can clearly hear the elevator cables, and others have reported hearing weights being dropped on the floor as they are staying in a room under the gym. Overall, a good location, but an otherwise average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at All Costs”
Reviews.Author: Bigwens
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the misfortune to stay here for two nights en-route to the USA and in order to visit Niagara Falls. What a mistake. This has to be the worst hotel I've ever had the misfortune to stay at. The entire experience from check-in to check-out was a disaster. Not only was the foyer an absolute zoo when we came to check-in but it resembled a beach resort during spring break. Loud, noisy teenagers everywhere, yelling and screaming through the foyer and total chaos all round. There was a lengthy queue in order to check-in - not simething I would expect in a four star hotel. But this was only the beginning. On opening the door to our room were met with what can only be described as third world. amenities. Our room (1130) hadn't seen any maintenance for decades, it was dirty with yellowing paint and chipped furniture/bathroom fittings, the bathroom was so small the entry door hit the shower rail over the bath, the grouting was stained and dirty, the filthy balcony looked like it was from some back block tenement building, the TV and telephone came over with Noah on the Ark, there was no fridge or minibar, and the lamp was broken. , This would be what I would expect to pay $50 a night for, if that. The only saving grace was that the bed linen was at least clean. To add insult to injury there were screaming. shrieking teenagers running through the halls at all hours of the night. A complaint to the main desk saw a security guard despatched to wander the corridors but as soon as he/she had left the noise resumed at higher decibels than before. There were youngsters banging on doors which were then opened and banged constantly while the occupants of the room screamed "OMG" for about the thousandth time. Overall the atmosphere was one of a youth hostel after a bachelor party. Again not what I would expect from a 4 star hotel.Essentially the hotel was so poor that I would never set foot in it again. It was in a dingy, depressed area and neither my husband nor I felt entirely safe wandering around the streets in the immediate vicinity. And as for the dining options. We made the mistake of dining in Bistro 33. We chose the option of the Asian buffet. Any passing resemblence to Asian cuisine was cursory. The few dishes which bore any resemblence to Asian were being kept warm in bain-maries and in general those items that should have been warm weren't, and those that should not have been, were. There was a lack of serving utensils meaning cross contamination between seafood, meats and cheeses, there were no basic condiments such as soy sauce, the stir-fry station was un-manned for almost the entire time we were there and there was only one poor chef whose responsibility was to staff the entire buffet area. Most items were not labelled so you had no idea what each food item was and where there were labels they were incorrect or the food was missing entirely. Disgusting! And the taste of those items that were on the buffet left a lot to be desired. I certainly expected a great deal more and as a minimum would have expected good food hygiene. It was not to be, We informed the check-out staff that this was the worst hotel experience we had ever had in our exstensive travelling history. While apologetic he really was unable to offer much in the way of excuses. On challenging the hotel management upon our return to New Zealand we were advised that parts of the hotel have undergone renovation and upgrading but unfortunately not the levels we were placed on. Hardly a comfort knowing that we paid the same as those experiencing the upgraded rooms. The staff we dealt with were nice enough but nothing could make up for a poorly run and managed hotel with major renovation requirements and a lack of understanding of what the travelling middle-age couple want from a hotel stay.I for one will never set foot in this hotel again. On our travels over six weeks throughout Canada, Alaska and the States we stayed at other Delta hotels and had nothing lthat even came close to this experience. This proves it was endemic to this hotel only. Wake up your ideas guys and look after those of your customers who pay the bulk of your income. Or change your focus to the youth market and charge accordingly.....you'll have less desatisfied customers all round.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service but needs renovations”
Reviews.Author: tshep42
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very helpful, depsite the hotel being very busy when I was there. I needed luggage stored before I could check in, and after I had checked out, and the staff were efficient. The check in was quick. They were also helpful arranging for a cab to the airport. The room was clean but obviously run down. Delta needs to do some renovations and updates to this hotel. The fire alarm went off at 1:30 a.m. and kept going of for 20 minutes. They gave regular announcements for the 20 minutes, but it was terribly disruptive.

Reviews.Title: “bistro brasserie restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ladywithceliacs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge with every amenity. The decor is old and tired but the restaurant gave such excellent service, I felt obliged to write this review. I have Celiacs and must eat glutenfree. When the hostess Edna found out, she sent out the souschef who planned my meal with me. Well what a culinary treat. Absolutely delicious and he came out during the meal to make sure I was enjoying everything. Our waiter Raymond also gave superlative service. We were all most impresses by their kindness. Thank you to this souschef whose name I unfortunately can't recall. The location of this hotel was great and had anything you could need which made up for the somewhat rundown condition of the room. My only real complaint was that there was no minifridge in the room. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Service Staff”
Reviews.Author: skydancer_2003
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservation on 8/18 over the phone, the reservation agent was very helpful in guiding us to become a Signature Club member and booked us the Tax free package. We couldn't book the same style room for all three nights so we were in room 1750 with a kitchenette on 8/18 and had to check-out on 8/19 and re-check back in for the club room reserved for 8/19 and 8/20. I believe the young man who helped us at the front desk for Signature Privilege members was Kelwin. He was very considerate and made sure we didn't have to wait until 3:00 pm to get checked back in. We were able to get into room 2580 right away and get on with our vacation. Jeanette was our server at Bb33 Brassiere for lunch on 8/19/11. We requested some changes to the Smoked Chicken Pesto Pasta dish. I wanted a fried egg cooked medium on the top of his dish and my wife preferred regular vs. smoked chicken. Jeanette and the chef were very accommodating and the food was fabulous. We mentioned we wanted to see The Whistleblower movie at the theatre on Bloor Street and while we were eating Jeanette went and found out the movie times for us without our asking her to. She was very personable and didn't even flinch when we made special requests. We've stayed at alot of hotels where you got what they made and no changes were allowed. We stopped by the restaurant on 8/21 too late for breakfast but saw Jeanette and she asked us how my birthday (8/20) was and if we liked the movie. It meant alot that she remembered us. Special thanks go to Jeanette because she really "owns" that restaurant and made it a delightful experience. The attendant at the adult pool was very nice and made sure we got the tour of the rooftop patio. We think the hotel should open up that restaurant again - it is a special place. All of these Delta employees are outstanding workers and made our stay very enjoyable. We definitely felt at home and can't wait to come back to Toronto and know we have a hotel that we like to stay at. The hotel is in a great location and we were able to walk to just about every place we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Solid and friendly hotel for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: TiredCanadian
Reviews.Content: I recently went to the Delta Chelsea on business. I usually go with my family, but this was a different experience. I definitely recommend the Delta Privilege (membership) as the Privilege check-in is very quick. I got a nice quiet room with a very comfortable bed and was able to work in peace. My only pet peeve is that they charge for internet/computer access in the Business Centre. I guess with most people carrying their laptops or Smart phones, it is not a big deal, but sometimes you need a real computer with a printer connection. Very friendly and efficient staff -- I really needed a lot of help from valet parking/bellman and they were exceptionally helpful. This is a solid efficient clean hotel. If you are looking for elegant, upscale or ritzy in Toronto, there are better choices. One point, the Delta has several discount plans with various groups and it is worth asking whether your professional group or company has a rate agreement with the Delta.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting....and horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Carole T
Reviews.Content: We spent last night at the Delta Chelsea as a get-away for our anniversary. We checked in around 5:30pm, went up to the room, changed and headed out for the evening. We arrived back close to midnight and when we pulled back the duvet to get into bed, the white sheet had a large blood stain on it. Repulsed, I called the front desk, who sent someone up with clean sheets, and offered us the opportunity to switch rooms. Since I would know that the new sheets would not have been previously slept on (as the other CLEARLY had been) I decided to stay where we were. A male employee arrived at our door and HANDED me the sheets - we had to change the bedding ourselves - and then had the nerve to stand there as if waiting for a tip! At 7 a.m we were up and out of there - I couldn't spend another second in bed. So much for sleeping in on a rare morning without children waking us. I showed the girl at the checkout desk the picture of the bedding and told her we had to take care of the bedding ourselves and she offered us a free breakfast, which we declined. Then she asked if we wanted to speak to the manager, which I do not know why she just did not automatically get a manager - if that was my business I would want to know that stuff like that was happening. We declined talking to the manager at the time because by this time I was angry and grossed out again and just wanted to leave. Am regretting it now because I am sure it won't even be addressed. We will not return and I am extremely disappointed that I need to wait another year for a chance to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Last_travel_bug
Reviews.Content: Although it is a big hotel with numerous rooms and adequate facilties, it is showing its age. Stayed for 4 nights during the Toronto Film Festival. The rooms lower floors were supposed to be renovated but the only telling sign was the carpet in the rooms and some wall papers. The TV, and interior was still dated. The corridor carpet, elevators and interior need a good cleaning. The bathrooms were cleaned but the floors were not vacuum daily (pieces of paper was the evidence). The service was good and courteous. The restaurant BB33 was good in food menu and service. Eat 3 nights, lounge was good too. The breakfast garden restaurant was good in selection but pricey. Reputation from previous about it being in not a desirable location and questionable use of rooms were not every evident as it is definately a very busy hotel. For $136 per night (corporate rate) seems a very reasonable bargain for a hotel in the downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “love delta chelsea”
Reviews.Author: zzy60974
Reviews.Content: everyone is always helpful. when I lost batteries to my headset, the attendant at the fitness/pool gave me 2 NEW batteries! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTownMiss
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last October and I thought to write a review about it now as I was looking to book again for this coming October. We stay there so we can be downtown for Halloween. We always go to a big Halloween party in the city and like to be down there early to enjoy the whole day. Last October our stay fell in the middle of the strike they were having and we didn't find it terribly difficult to get in or out even though there were picketers blocking the entrances. They were quite mild compared to some strikes I've seen. The staff appologized for any inconveniences and we were offered a voucher for a few free drinks at the bar for the troubles. We really didn't notice anything else effected by the strike. Our room was quite small which I'm assuming most are like in this massive hotel, but very nice and clean. They have an adult pool as well as a kids pool that arent even on the same floor as each other. The hottub was broken when we went in the adults pool but everything else was fine. The change rooms have a nice steamy sauna as well as a little frige with cold wet towels inside for when you came out. I loved that. Overall a very pleasant stay and I'm looking forward to going back next month.

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: AddickMark
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in this hotel. It is a typical big city hotel with a round the clock busy reception area surrounded by a bar, a sports pub and restaurant. There are also two or three very good pub/restaurants across the street. Rooms are clean and the beds (pillows) very comfortable. Good location five minutes from Dundas Square and main shopping. Itâ€™s half an hour down to the Lakeside area/Rodgers Centre/CN Tower, but the subway is near at hand. All round a good place to stay for a three or four day visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “If you are light sleeper, avoid!”
Reviews.Author: AnonymusLondon
Reviews.Content: I am quite surprised about some of the really positive reviews on this hotel, as I'm struggling to find anything nice to say about the place. I was booked here by my company due to a conference, so not my choice. I was given a renovated room, or that is what the receptionist said, but apart from a cosmetic make-over, I couldn't see any major improvements. There was no double glazing, the balcony door was nailed shut so not accessible, no safe or minibar in the room, and I am pretty sure the bathrooms haven't been changed in decades. I was on a low floor facing the construction site. The current windows are absolutely useless and offer no noise-reduction whatsoever. I understand that construction noise cannot be blamed on the hotel, but not having decent windows and double glazing can. I had to endure the traffic noise on top of the construction site noise, which on my first night started at 4.30am and on the second night at 5am! I hardly slept, between trucks, cars, drilling, etc etc. The walls are as flimsy as the windows, so you can hear your neighbours too, if they are on the loud side. Internet connection in the room did not work on 2 out of 3 days, which was handled by shrugging and being told to simply sit in the lobby which had wireless (at 11.30pm at night?..). It's a huge, impersonal, loud hotel, which personally I hope I do not have to experience again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherAlan
Reviews.Content: conveniently located, the Delta Chelsea was buzzing with people when we arrived. We didn't know it was TIFF at the time of our trip so we didn't book in advance. The price we paid was a little rich for the features and ammenities but next time we will know! Definitely cannot fault the hotel at ALL in any way. The on site restaurants were great.. the staff were friendly and the adults only pool made sure that we could relax without the hassle of kids splashing about! Next time would book well in advance and make sure not to travel at a peak tourist time.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Staff, and great location”
Reviews.Author: SprBaje
Reviews.Content: As a returning Delta privilege member at this location, I have witnessed consistently amazing service from the Staff, in all departments of this convenient location. From the moment you check in, even on points, you become the center of the Staff's total positive guest experience. On this trip the housekeeping Staff went as far as oragnizing my toiletires on a clean face cloth- dimly amazing to me. The rooms are always clean, and comfortable, as well a paper greets you in the morning, while you enjoy the in room coffee. My only regret is the lack of up to date equipment in the fitness room, which caused me to seek out a local gym. I did receive a follow up letter regarding my concern, which again speaks to the quality of Hotel follow up. This Hotel is a great value, had a wide variety of in house food choices, and is close to all major tourist locations. Well done, Delta!

Reviews.Title: “CONFERENCE”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl F
Reviews.Content: The hotel hosted a PH (Pulmonary Hypertension) Conference this past weekend. We arrived on Friday and left on Sunday. I wish to compliment the hotel and also organizers for their choice. We checked in and out with ease, enjoyed the Elm Street Buffet, the waiters in the dining hall were unbelievable, the food delicious and the rooms were clean and certainly adequate. Thank you for a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, consistently good experiences”
Reviews.Author: suzanne_baal
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Delta all of the time and always have a good experience. The customer service is good (tip: sign up for the delta priviledge program to avoid the line ups to check in and have even better customer experience - it's free and starts being worth it right from the first moment). The rooms are always clean, they have glass glasses, and just good quality everything, all around. Oh, and it's right downtown and walking distance to everything. Perfect location, good value (not too expensive), and excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Hotel in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: andreaadams
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for families. I stayed with my husband and two year old and when he left for his course my daughter and I played in the playroom which had toys, art supplies, and and indoor slide. There is also a pool with a water slide that would be exciting for older children. The cafeteria style restaurant meant no long waits for food and made eating with a toddler a breeze. My daughter received a children's package with games and colouring during check in. Rooms are spacious and air conditioned, staff is available to answer any questions, and there are many restaurants to choose from. We wills stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: AaronVancouver
Reviews.Content: Overall, hotel is dated. Some elements to our "deluxe" had been upgraded carpet, bed, vanity, however, the clock radio did not work; the bathtub and tile surround were ancient; and overall level of cleanliness was poor. Hotel staff were pleasant and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: smellrose
Reviews.Content: We needed to book a room pretty last minute and it happened to be right in the middle of the Toronto Film Festival. We found a room at the Delta Chlesea at a decent price. I was a little worried after reading the reviews of the un-renovated rooms, figuring that's what we would most likely get, which we did. It was nothing like the reviewers said. Sure, the decor was a little faded and the TV was an old SD model, but it was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff was friendly and pleasant, though we didn't have a need to use many of the services. The location was great and my husband got a chance to enjoy the pool as well. As for the construction noise, that is certainly not the fault of the hotel and is pretty abundant in downtown Toronto this time of year. Would definitely recommend to my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: scadventurer12
Reviews.Content: It's the most important thing about real estate: location. The Delta Chelsea has it. It is so central to everything, you really can explore the city from it's doors. You can walk to the Eaton Center, St. Lawrence Market, Kensington Market, Art Gallery of Toronto, etc... Parking: It will cost you $28 Canadian a day plus tax. It averaged out to be $33 American/day. We had a rental car, so we liked the in/out privileges that many other parking garages don't allow. Room: Ours was on a lower floor in the tower away from all the construction. It was renovated, smaller, but perfect for what I needed. Perks: The daily newspaper was nice. The restaurants in the lobby were nice to have if desired. The staff was extremely helpful. They answered all questions I had and accommodated every request I had. Just ask them... and they'll make it happen! Don't be fooled: It's not the Four Seasons. The clientele seems to be mixed, so don't expect everyone to be posh or anything like that. Overall, I'd book the hotel again in a heartbeat if I had the same type of room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: gm69
Reviews.Content: My only complaint would be the scam they pulled with the Facebook promo. When booking online, after seeing the posted rate (and booking) a promo advised that you were get an addition $25 off if you "liked" their Facebook page. Upon checkout they tell you that it is applicable on your next stay. Otherwise, clean, safe, well priced, great location. Didn't go to the restaurants but had a drink in the bar and used the fitness facilities. Definitely would go back if staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Always Great”
Reviews.Author: raymondoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Chelsea 50-60 times over the years, and enjoy the excellent staff and location of this hotel. We have never had a problem and will not hesitate to go back. Ray and Alice Welland On

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: evilstepmom
Reviews.Content: Was here in January for a conference, stayed in a deluxe upgraded room, with a balcony. Had an opportunity to see the non-renovated rooms, and there is a fairly significant difference - such upgraded bedding - for the price, so I would recommend the upgrade. The conference itself was very well managed by the banquet facilities and the area was perfect to walk the neighborhood to get a bite to eat, with many dining choices. The only negative I can recall was the self serve breakfast/lunch cafeteria was very expensive - you would be better off to go down the street and find something to eat. Room service was very good though and quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel... but do your homework”
Reviews.Author: Kalajo
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Delta Chelsea in Toronto for 2 days. When booking the room, we tried to use a coupon for the $25 off (posted on Facebook) but we were told we couldn't because we were staying 2 nights (not just one). No one could give me a reasonable answer for this, however, when we checked in, they offered us parking for half price which made up for it (since parking is $30 a day!!). We were also told at check-in (not at booking) that it was Carribana weekend and they in order to gain access to the hotel, we would need to wear wristbands because they lock and secure all hotel entrances. A minor inconvenience, but still something we would have liked to know when booking. When we got to our first room, it smelled of smoke and there were cigarette butts on the balcony. We complained to the front desk and they quickly upgraded us to another room. We have 2 kids, 10 & 12 and they loved the water slide!! The pool on the other hand was small, cold and crowded. The hot tub is not the best either. Over all, this is a nice hotel and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. Where it does lack is in some of the "extras" that I would expect from a Delta hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most expersive, disgusting and not clean rooms, with horrible and unorganized customer service.”
Reviews.Author: TPPKnockers
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worest hotel I've ever stayed in and paid an arm and a leg for. Crap. Spider webs hanging from the ceiling, wallpaper hanging off the walls, no air and I've got pictures

Reviews.Title: “Good place in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SadSadGolfer
Reviews.Content: We used to live in Toronto, so we're no strangers to this area. We spent 2 nights at the Delta Chelsea (the Sheraton was booked!!) but due to the nature of our trip, we didn't use any of the hotel's amenities. However, our room was clean and comfortable, and quiet (12th floor). We found the hotel to be generally clean and well-kept, but a bit of a zoo... lots happening, people coming and going everywhere. No problem for us, it was peak tourist time anyways. Staff was friendly and professional, check-in was easy. Lots to see and do in this area of Toronto, an easy walk to many attractions, and the subway is close-by. We didn't bring our kids on this trip, but this hotel is very kid-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTater
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta Chelsea about 5 or 6 times and the hotel has always suited my needs. The hotel staff has always been very courteous. The hotel is a bit outdated and not perfect in some rooms, but with my experience the hotel rooms have never been dirty. The beds and linens have always been comfortable. This hotel has 2 pools: A adult only pool, with a great view and a pool with a water slide. The location is great! Easy access to Younge street, which has plenty of fast eateries. My only complaint is my room didn't have a view or a balcony. (First time in 6 visits) But none the less, I will definitely be back to this hotel, as the staff is always friendly and inviting, the location is great, the pools are fabulous, and the room rates are decent. Thanks Delta Chelsea, for giving me a place to stay, while I enjoy the beautiful city of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Construction”
Reviews.Author: Jess S
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "Construction". Be aware that there is construction happening accross the street and it is LOUD. They started at 7am. I know this is not the hotels fault, but wanted to make other readers aware. Ask to be on the oposite side of the hotel if at all possible. The beds are extrodinarily comfotable and the room was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “No Fringe Benifits & Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: Laurie M
Reviews.Content: We were so excited about our recent family vacation to Toronto. We arrived at the Delta Chelsea after several long hours of driving time from NY and we were expecting a nice "deluxe double" room- the room was so small, it had no microwave, fridge, continential breakfast, etc. Be prepared to have a thick wallet also--coffee is $5. The throw pillows on the beds were so dirty that I put them in the closet! Dirty furniture & carpet as well. No fringe benefits here! For the price, I was just expecting something so much more. Sadly, we won't be returning to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of Toronto's Best”
Reviews.Author: Sandra1968_11
Reviews.Content: The Delta is in one of the best locations going. Within walking distance to the subway, theatre district, China Town, Eaton's Ctr and more. The hotel has a great relaxed atmosphere, which is felt as soon as you walk through their doors. Staff is great and ready to assist you, if needed. Try it you will like it, and I really think you will return on your next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “definately overrated”
Reviews.Author: monty031
Reviews.Content: I paid the extra $30 for the "deluxe room" that they assured me was updated and larger than the standard room, i was very dissapointed. The room was small and the furniture was chipped and cracked, and the carpet was in need of a vacuum. The balcony was covered in cigarette butts (so much for smoke free). I complained to the front desk and was given the chance to have another deluxe room, it was exactly the same. I went back a second time and talked to a different staff member, he was very helpful. He offered me a standard room but on a corner, it was much larger than the more expensive rooms and cleaner. I have stayed at this hotel before and was not impressed but booked it because my children were excited about the water slide. I should have listened to my first instinct. Jonathon at the front desk was great, helpful and friendly. He was the standout of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: KTownTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a prime downtown location with easy access to public transportation and shopping which is why I'm giving it an average rating. The lobby was packed when we arrived (in my opinion, not very well laid out) and we had to wait quite some time for check in. There was Privilege guest check in but unless you came in through the front door, it was not easy to see. Our room with two double beds felt crowded with the desk, dresser/tv stand and an extra chair poorly placed that made it difficult to walk around the beds. The bathroom was not up to my standards of cleanliness but adequate for our purposes. We had lunch in the Market Garden restaurant. The food was good but in typical Toronto fashion, quite overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NimsM
Reviews.Content: The location is hard to beat if you're looking to do touristy stuff downtown Toronto. But wow, the hotel lobby is like a train station! It's too small for the volume that this hotel handles. All credit to the counter staff for dealing quickly and efficiently with the influx of humanity! The rooms are nothing to write home about - a bit poky and not exactly super clean, especially the bathroom. We weren't here long enough to try out the amenities, but one that we did try was the water slide - that was thoroughly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Second time was the charm: Renovations made a difference!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisC1
Reviews.Content: When I originally stayed at the Delta Chelsea back in November of 2009, my review was rather scathing. When I voiced my concerns to (then) General Manager Kathy Rutledge, I was assured that massive renovations were underway to transform tired and dated rooms, like the one I stayed in. Kathy asked me to contact her if I was going to be in Toronto again, assuring me that my next stay would be worlds different. Planning a get-together in Toronto with friends in June, I took the opportunity to write Kathy and I was answered by Jonathan Holliwell, Director of Rooms. Jonathan explained that, indeed, extensive renovations had taken place at the hotel. He went on to say that floors 4-9, the oldest rooms at the hotel, had been demolished starting in December of 2009. My wife and I were truly the last guests to stay in dingy 725, days before a $5 million dollar project saw floors 4-9 completely renovated. Upon returning to the Delta Chelsea, I found the same excellent and friendly customer service waiting at the front desk. Check-in was expedient and personable and, despite a hectic and busy lobby, the front desk clerk was not rushed and frazzled. She took the time to ask how my day was and whether I needed any information on area attractions. The accommodations this time around were significantly improved. While this property sees an incredible amount of traffic, the room was fresh, inviting and clean. The lackluster small CRT television (with no VOLUME CONTROL) that we had in our room back in 2009 had been replaced with a large LCD television. Gone as well was the tired and worn furniture and carpet, replaced instead with comfortable and well-maintained furnishings and decor. Despite an early (1AM) fire alarm that went on for over half an hour, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. This time around, my experience was much more in line with the Delta Chelsea's reputation as a first-rate hotel in downtown Toronto. A huge thank you to Jonathan Holliwell for going out of his way to proactively address my concerns and in making sure me and my friends enjoyed a comfortable and issue-free stay at the Delta Chelsea!

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant, we would be back. 6 boys + Mom Dad=2 rooms great $"”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseCookes
Reviews.Content: My boys and I really enjoyed our stay. We were there to visit Toronto for a night with our French student. The 2 rooms had an outside door which could be left closed while the inner doors to the 2 rooms were just left propped open with our bag. There was a small square foyer between those rooms. So we had one room with 2 double beds window and balcony with door and the second room was 1 queen bed in a large room which I loved. We had the floor attendant bring 2 twin foldout cots, which were very very comfortable for my 11 and 10 year olds to use. We had the older boys use the room with double beds. That way they could watch TV without disturbing M & D and the younger brothers! (2 of the 6 boys were same age cousins) The pool with slide was a great perk. Good to burn up some energy and cool enough even for the big boys!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: MzMel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Club room for our anniversary. It was a very nice room, clean and nicely decorated. The little chocolates on the pillow were a cute touch...breakfast was included, but was not very impressive. There was some variety of muffins, croissants, bagels, and yogurt, but no hot items. The club lounge was very nice, though. The staff was very friendly and courteous. Overall a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “My best business hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: JCPY
Reviews.Content: 'm very pleased to have chosen to stay at Delta Chelsea and these are my reasons: 1. Helpful, efficient and friendly staff- the check in personnel (Ferdinand); operator who arranged a technician to check on my room's power failure within minutes; room service (dining) 2. Fully-equipped gym, locker room, pool, a separate weights room and jacuzzi. I'm particularly impressed with the swimsuit water extraction (or drying) machine. 3. Convenient location- drug store, grocery store, shops and restaurants are within walking distance. The best deal is the airport express bus that stops right at the hotel doorsteps. 4. Being a Delta Hotel Privilege Club member- free local calls (using a calling card); late check out till 6pm, free internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Issues”
Reviews.Author: jess224
Reviews.Content: I was pretty dissatisfied with my stay at the Delta Chelsea this past weekend. The location of the hotel was great however, which made it easy to spend time outside of our room. It is located close to Younge and Dundas square which was a big bonus. The one restaurant that was open when we were looking to eat was so pricey that we found it cheaper to order to our room, and the service from the Room Service staff was great. However, I paid the extra 25 dollars a night for the upgraded room and wish I wouldn't have. I read the reviews prior to going and saw the the rooms that had not been renovated yet, were not worth staying in. So after forking over an extra 50 dollars for this upgraded "DELUXE" room, we found a filthy washroom with another guest's used, hair covered bar of soap. After calling and complaining and asking to have it removed, we were assured that they would have housekeeping remove it. After my two day stay, the bar of soap was never removed. It is probably still in that shower. The bath was dirty, the paint in the bath was peeling, probably because of the lack of exhaust fan. The drain was broken and came right out of the shower, with a nice hair ball at the bottom of it. Also, we had some nice large holes in our sheets, if that's not a deluxe room, I'm not sure what is.... On the morning of checkout we had to leave very early, as I'm sure most people do when they have a flight, meeting, or event to attend, and when I complained about the unsatisfactory stay I had, I was offered breakfast on the house (beware, if you want to pay for breakfast at this hotel it will run you at least 20dollars a person, which is why we took a quick walk down the street and found many great, cheap, breakfast locations, just steps away) . If I am checking out of the hotel at 6 am because I have somewhere to be, how could I stay for this complimentary breakfast? I did not find this a suitable compensation for our poor stay, as we could not even enjoy it. I will not return to the Delta Chelsea, there are MANY other hotels that are located in this location, and as that was the best feature in my opinion, I will look at other options the next time I visit downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy. Dull. Dated.”
Reviews.Author: Gemma R
Reviews.Content: My family and I Arrived from UK to the Delta Chelsea Hotel after a long day and flight so was in need of a good nights sleep. This did not not happen, we were woken up nearly every hour by noisy guests coming in from their night of partying, lots of shouting, doors slamming and noise outside the hotel too. Don't stay here on a weekend as you will not sleep well!! The rooms are very small unless you upgrade. Decor in rooms is extremely dreary and seems like it needs a good makeover. Bathroom needs good clean to. Location is good for Eaton centre, St, Lawrence Market. and Its around a 25 minute walk to the CN tower and Rogers Centre. The food Market area was the better part, still dated decor but food was fresh and good. Cereal does cost a fortune though! Parking is expensive and they charge CA$14.00 for Wi-fi, i think this should be free to hotel guests as the rate for hotel room is a lot for what you get! From staying at this Delta Chelsea and a few others on my Holiday I would not book to stay again or recommend the Delta Chain.

Reviews.Title: “Pool and Location make this a good choice”
Reviews.Author: JimmyCricket1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed as family of four in one room- a bit of a squeeze (2 queen doubles) but comfortable enough. I chose this hotel based on 2 key factors- swimming pool for the kids and downtown location. On those measures alone we were happy with the choice. It is a 20-30 minute walk to the bay/CN Tower, shorter if you just want shops and restaurants. It is a large somewhat impersonal hotel- used to handling big tour groups. Maybe its a UK thing but I had expected the room rate to include breakfast, this was not the case so we paid about $25 each morning for the 4 of us. Also in hindsight I wish I had haggled over room rate- I booked months before travelling and did it all online- c $170 per night for family room for 4 -I bet I could have negotiated a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here this month and cant wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: meaganWB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge. Its in a great location..close to fast food, restaurants, TTC and attractions. Hotel offers its own restaurant and Pubs. It has stuff for children and adults. Our room has been clean both times without any problems. Staff are willing to help you and are very polite. The only thing I say is expensive is parking. Its 28 each night for under ground and 30 for valet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But A Bit Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bebehi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is LARGE, the lobby is nice, and the rooms size is average. Our floor was a non-smoking floor, however, our room reeked of the smell of cigarette. We brought the problem the Concierge and she immediately had the room sprayed. There was construction right across the street which woke us early Saturday morning. Our balcony was covered with soot which discouraged us from going out there. I think concierges are part of the front line of a hotel. Our experiences with their concierge varied. The first one was excellent; the second gentlemen was informative, but not friendly; the third gentlemen was rude and snappy. I hope the hotel knows this. We booked our hotel through Expedia. This disqualified us for the free Continental breakfast. So those of you who book through discounters should know this. Hotel parking is $28 CAD if self parked and I think about $30 if turned in to the valet. There are two metro station on streets above and below the hotel which made it so convenient to get to the convention center. The trolleys were also above and below which made it convenient to get to Chinatown where we had the BEST seafood. A note to those who ride the trolleys: we headed back to our hotel at 9:30. We had to wait 30 minutes before the next trolley arrived. So be aware that the frequency of the trolleys drop at a certain time. One last thing. They advertise free wifi, but that is only in the hotel lobby area. If you need to use the internet in the room, you need to pay about $13/day.

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of a makeover”
Reviews.Author: VACanuck
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this property based on a Priceline bid. I have stayed here many times over the past several years. The hotel has had little if any renovation in that time, and continues to look run down. It's always crowded and feels like a cattle yard in the lobby. The bed was comfortable (I had to insist on a king or queen as I was offered two doubles...). Duvet had been washed so many times that the 'fluff' was all bunched up in the top and bottom of the duvet and no filling in the middle. I'm not sure why hotels put these things on beds; it just causes guests to put the A/C on higher and run up their energy bills! I was originally told that they were 'sold out' of the king or queen rooms, but the desk clerk eventually found a king bed. He warned me that it overlooked a construction site and was I ok with that? I said as long as there was no construction during the night; no problem. The entire North side of the building faces this massive condo project that will tower over the Delta once completed. Construction started at 7:00 a.m. on the button, but we were up and ready to check out by then. Furnishings were worn. The tub was awful; some paint job to hide its age was wearing off and left it looking completely uninviting. The bathroom was very small; only one person could be in there at a time; no fan. Location is ideal if you are going to any of the hospitals in the area (which I was). Plenty of restaurants in the area. Shopping is close by as well. Parking: $28 plus applicable taxes to $31 and change for underground parking. Valet is over $35 plus taxes.... About average for the area, so no big deal

Reviews.Title: “standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandie1277
Reviews.Content: Standard downtown hotel. Clean rooms, couldn't use balcony? Ok check in. Halllways smelled of curry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Pakmoi
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is a HUGE hotel. Many tour groups and flight crews seem to stay there. The best things about this hotel is the location and the staff. The Delta Chelsea is walking distance to many shopping areas, the Canon Theater and a large assortment of restaurants. In fact every evening my husband and I, would leave from a different exit, the hotel sits on four city blocks, and in a few minutes find a new and interesting restaurant to try! The staff at the Delta Chelsea is AMAZING!!!! Everyone was friendly and very helpful. The front desk made sure we had maps of the area and would write directions on it to the places we wanted to see. The concierge had good advice on restaurants and even called a few restaurants to see if they would be open when the play we were seeing was done. The only downside of the Delta Chelsea is it is run down. Many of the seats in the lobby were thread bare and worn. In our hotel room, the bathroom walls had been patched but the paint did not match the rest of the wall the same with the bathroom door. But the room and bath were clean and the bed very comfortable. There's so much to do in Toronto, you're not going to spend that much time in your room! We would stay at the Delta Chelsea again the next time we're in Toronto!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for downtown Toronto, parking price is meh.”
Reviews.Author: FBST
Reviews.Content: I booked this place on priceline, which to be honest, I wouldn't have stayed at this hotel if it wasn't for the website. You gotta know that in Toronto, EVERYTHING is expensive. I actually got the room for $75/night. I read a lot of reviews before I came, so when I got there I asked for a room facing away from the construction. Unfortunately, they didn't have 2 double beds facing away from the construction, so I upgraded to a deluxe room just for $15 more. $90 a night here isn't so bad. The deluxe room though, looked like the size of a regular 2 double bed room, so I was actually wondering how small their regular rooms are. I got into the room and it actually wasn't completely cleaned, but it wasn't disgustingly messy, called the front desk and they had it fixed right away. Got chocolates and bottles of water out it so that was good. There are a lot of small souvenir shops around the hotel, so get your stuff there since the big tourist shops are usually more expensive. There's also this great bar next to the hotel that the concierge recommended called the "Crystal Elephant". Great food, drinks, and service. If you're form America, where bars usually close at 2a.m, you have to remember that in this city, everything closes at 1a.m. This place is really busy, with a lot of conventions, and family trips, so I'm not sure how this would go for couples looking for a romantic trip. You can definitely hear people who are rowdy in the hallways, but I couldn't hear the people in the rooms next to us, so, it's not completely bad. The gym is also really nice. I didn't go to the pool, but the gym and the pool are right next to each other, so that looked really nice too. This place doesn't offer free internet like other places, but that's fine if you're willing to go to the lobby which has free internet. I went to the 2nd floor like a lot of reviewers have suggested, and it's really nice to go there, since there are not a lot of people there. I did go when there was this banquet, but it wasn't that big of a deal. They also have a grand piano on the 2nd floor that you can play with.

Reviews.Title: “Consider the The Club and 26th floor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelbear007
Reviews.Content: We were just there and had a great time. Find Kerwin at Delta members service desk ,what a doll! We are Delta members and you should join. You are treated much better this way with reservations and service. The 26th flor has better rooms and Wi-fi availablity. You get a continenat breakfast daily in a separte room on the 25 th floor as well as daily appetizers which will help control your dinner costs. All museums and shows involve getting tickets at their web sites before you go. Doing this will get you a Delta discount. Please don't wait until you get there. Order your show tickets online before you go or call the box office locally when you arrive to avoid a ten dollar service fee. There is also a TKTS discount place across thre street from EATON CENTER MALL but you have to hope the show you want has availbility.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best...”
Reviews.Author: Luke911
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the past week end at the Chelsea. Location: VERY central, meaning you must expect traffic jams, construction detours and STREET NOISE parking: Horrible, expensive and no guarantee you'll find a spot. Check-in: What a joke, I've seen airport counters less busy than this. Kudos to the front desk staff though they are VERY patient courteous and helpful 9 Jonathon and Allister). They messed up our reservation and we had to travel 3 times backs with suitcases and stroller to the front desk before we got the proper room, the complimentary parking was highly appreciated as a compensation...
