Elevators : you'd better pick your color otherwise you're up for a fun time (not) Rooms: small, outdated, urgent need of update in terms of painting, carpet , TV...bathroom was clean and spacious enough We did enjoy the family corner with the pool and the play room for our toddler to run around after the rabbits and play with toys All in all, if you have a GREAT deal online it might be worth it but if you have to pay full price you can find better somewhere else. We know we won't repeat because the wrongs still outdid the rights and our stay was average at best

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: loospoos
Reviews.Content: Location, price, amenities - you get the full package with this one. Delta has a great chain of hotels and this one is no exception. It is close to everything, has all that is needed - whether travelling for business or with family. Most rooms have a small balcony with a full size patio door.

Reviews.Title: “Old, small room, busy and dangerously low carpark”
Reviews.Author: em_be53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, being a family of 4 in a double double bedroom. The room was tiny, despite being told we could fit a rollaway bed upon booking, the hotel did manage to squeeze one in, but we barely had room to open our suitcases.the bathroom was minuscule. The beds are very small and uncomfortable. The hotel is very large and busy and difficult to speak o a concierge. We had a look at some of the renovated floors and it seems that if you're lucky enough to score a room on one of these, your stay will be better. The kids facilities seemed fantastic, but our 12 year old daughter was sick the day after she swam in the kids pool and whilst we can't say for rue it was the pool, the water looked cloudy. We had breakfast in the cafeteria style restaurant. It was expensive and poor quality, with the cappuccino that we paid a lot for, being undrinkable. The car ark is very very low, with tight turns and not really suited for SUVs. The rented Dodge Durango scraped its roof. The location was ok, in walking distance to th main shopping areas and we walked to Chinatown, Kensington markets, the waterfront. It's near stations and restaurants. Personally, I'd rather pay a bit more and stay somewhere nicer, larger and with better kept rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired and dated but mostly clean and adequate”
Reviews.Author: holidayjulie19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 24 years ago on my honeymoon and our travel agent recommended we stay here when planning this trip to Canada. When we were diven our rooms (651 and 653) we walked in and found that the bathroom to 653 had no door on it and was nowhere in the room. I was astonished that this had not been reported. As our teenage son and daughter were to share the room this was not suitable. We were readily accommodated in different rooms so that was no problem. Room was a bit tired and dated but there seems to be a renevation project going on so it can't happen over night. The room was clean though. We found it annoying that the health club only lets in 19 and over. My son wanted to train as he rows to a high standard but even explaining this they would not let us and they felt really too old for the children's pool so i think there should be some flexibility there. The hallway carpet wasn't cleaned properly in our 4 nights there as there was rubbish on the corridor at the edges that was there all the time. I caught a cleaning supervisor on the last morning and she was horrified by it. Replenishing the tea. I left my empty t bag wrapper out each morning but had to phone down on the 3rd day to get the teabag replaced (I borrowed my childrens the 2nd day) I feel if wifi can be free in the hallway it should be free throughout the hotel and can't understand why we would have to pay for it. Overall it is a good hotel but a bit shabby. hopefully in a few years time all the rooms will have been done up. I would be interested to find out what happended to the door in 653 though.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: simply9
Reviews.Content: This hotel, as others have written, is placed so close to all the amenities that it makes getting about so easy. It is a big hotel and the reception area is constantly buzzing with people coming and going. However, a very slick process ensures that there is very little waiting either on checking in or leaving. The room was clean, well decorated and comfortable. The Bar and Market garden are reasonably priced and the food is actually not that bad. There are many varied eateries very close by , if the thought takes you. Shopping in Toronto is great, and of course, there are the many sites to visit as well. We would stay at this hotel again and I would love to revisit Toronto, if only to see a Blue Jays game live....

Reviews.Title: “I will NEVER come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa f
Reviews.Content: I will never return to the Delt Chelsea. Hotwire said it was comparable to the Hilton and this was false. Our room was very small and two people could not fit in the bathroom, the room was not very clean at all. There was pigon crap all over the balcony window to the point of hazardous to your health. We were woken every morning(about 5am) by the two pigons that lived on our balcony. The tv had very poor reception and the tv appeared to be over 10yrs old. The hotel is very noisy and overpriced. There was a room in the hotel sealed with police tape (24th Fl). The hotel could not accomodate parking for our truck so we had to park in another lot off the hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “Fire alarm at 4:30AM ruined our stay.”
Reviews.Author: hrmelness
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Friday night in early March, in room 1220. It was a rainy night when we checked in. The lobby is confusing and not very welcoming because there are multiple entrances and no real focal point when you walk in. I came in from Elm St. and the front desk is hidden around the corner from the restaurant. Wifi internet access is free in the lobby only. My boyfriend found the front desk staff on the pushy side when they attempted to upsell. The elevators to the underground parking structure show their age and reminded me of dingy apartments. Going up to our floor I found the hallways dark and the interior needing a refresh. While turning a corner, we noticed broken glassware on the floor. It was noticed and promptly cleaned up by staff in the time in took for us to drop off our bags and head back out for dinner. It's a large hotel and there were many people checked in that night, particularly tour groups or sport teams, I couldn't tell exactly, perhaps both. We could hear others in the corridor from our room. Overall the room was standard and comfortable. The bathroom had a heated lamp which I'm sure comes in handy on cold early mornings and late nights. The room had a dingy concrete balcony which is accessible by glass sliding doors. When shut you could feel drafts coming from them. On the plus side, the pool and fitness centre at the Delta has natural light. It's nice to work out and not be enclosed by four walls. We tried out the cardio machines and the hot tub. The weights area is small and a bit cramped but is well equipped. This would have been an average stay if it were not for the fire alarm that went off at 4:30 AM. The loud, intrusive alarm went off and then clumsy announcements for evacuation by security. We heard a few folks leave their rooms in the hallway and then the fire trucks arrived but no security came around to ensure that we had evacuated (we didn't). I forgot my swimsuit in the bathroom and was able to retrieve it the next day from housekeeping with a claim number. I would return but I definitely wouldn't pay the listed/rack rate for a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but badly in need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: Neuch_11
Reviews.Content: well centered Staff : very nice Porters Valet-parking (paying) Room : the room was big but badly in need of a renovation... Stained wallpaper and couch Bad smell of sheets and bedding Mould in the bathroom... Hair dryer in the bathroom Iron + ironing board Coffee No fridge No safe Breakfast : great Wifi : only in the lobby Swimming pool : ok Room with Wii, Playstation, etc. for kids and teens (separate!)

Reviews.Title: “Good for being in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: LondonStagman
Reviews.Content: Good experience as soon as you walk through the door and very central for everything. Great staff and service Food was ok but a bit canteen style for the buying - ie per item on the tray. Lots of local choice and the Thai next door was very good! Get your CN Tower tickets at the concierge desk and short cut the queue! It was like a fast pass!

Reviews.Title: “Best week of my life!”
Reviews.Author: Kalitaholly147
Reviews.Content: Everytime I'm in Toronto my family and I always stay at the delta and no wonder why. It's amazing there. I enjoy every moment I can. This week especially. I can't wait to enjoy my 21st birthday at the delta :)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: Cindy R
Reviews.Content: Warm and pleasant greeting, helpful and courteous staff. Fabulous food for all tastes with a variety of restaurants to meet your budget. Decorative and comfortable rooms. Recommend becoming a Delta Privilege Member for bonus extra services. Definitely a place to stay upon return trips!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sean s
Reviews.Content: I would like to express my sincere disappointment with my recent stay at the Delta Chelsea Hotel in Toronto on August 13th. To begin with, there was no convenient location provided to allow check in, and when I stopped in what appeared to be the only access point for the lobby the concierge threatened to have my car towed. When I finally did make it to the reception, I learned that the parking garage was full, and we were on our own to find parking in one of the busiest areas of downtown Toronto. The biggest disappointment was the quality of our room; with an awkward layout, peeling and dated wallpaper and a sliding door that didnâ€™t fully close or latch to act as our bathroom. These are hardly the quality standards I expect from a first rate accommodation, or from the rates I paid for the night. To top it off I was charged $13 for the use of the wired internet, which is ridiculous considering wireless internet is typically provided throughout the building, free of charge, in the majority of establishments that charge even half of what I paid for my stay at the Delta. Overall I was very dissatisfied with a stay that I was looking forward to giving the standards I expected of a Delta hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities and location at it's price point”
Reviews.Author: Charles R
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is no Ritz Carlton. However, for the price you pay, you are getting a great hotel in the ideal location. Where else can you find a hotel that size, with separate adult and child pools, your own private balcony and services right on Yonge Street in the heart of the downtown core for under $140 a night? I'm a repeat customer of the Delta Chelsea, but with children and without. The place is clean, staff friendly and helpful, great services, amazing place for children. They have a separate family pool area on the second floor with a waterslide, so you have no worries of annoying older couples with loud, playful children. Adjacent to the family pool is the Camp Chelsea children's activities area, which even has child care services if the parents want a night out. For those without children, the adult only fitness and pool area on the 27th floor is very relaxing. My only negative is the layout of the main lobby area. Masses of people come from every which way, in a very crowded, tight and poorly laid out reception/concierge/bell desk/elevator lobby/lounge area. At $28 a night, on site parking is on the pricy side, but reasonable for downtown Toronto. They also give unlimited in/out priveledges, something very few garages in downtown Toronto provide. I will return again and again to Delta Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “All-in-one Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ErineL
Reviews.Content: if you're looking for all in one hotel in Toronto, this must be the place. free wifi on the lobby, located in downtown, very close to Bus station-only 2 blocks away. nearby, you can find many selections of food places, shopping mall, subway and streetcar station, coffee shop and the most crowded entertainment and art district in the town. for breakfast, you can choose either buffet or a-la carte on the coffee shop (price is not bad at all). cleanliness is very good. ask the concierge for tour, or some good place to visit, because sometimes, we can get discount by showing our room key! the pool and fitness center is okay. not bog but good enough to use up the rest of your energy at night

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, Great Location, Safe”
Reviews.Author: cliff w
Reviews.Content: Almost didn't stay there when the first time I phoned the Delta booking line, the woman on the phone said that we had to get valet parking because our vehicle was over 5 ft 6 inches at $35+ a day, above our budget threshold. When I phoned the line again to cancel our reservations because of that, the man on the phone explained that if the vehicle was over the height, then valet parking would be the same as the regular parking, and that these instructions were written on their internal information system. I was happy I didn't have to cancel the reservation. The hotel was in a great location. The staff were all enthusiastic and friendly. It is very well staffed. Although the main foyer is chaotic with hundreds of people, it is an organized chaos, and it took very little time to get checked in. The Marketplace restaurant was Disney-like in how it was organized in sections. With two efficient cashiers, there were no delays in getting through cash. The food was a little pricey, but in College Park Mall 3 minutes from the hotel, there are a number of places to eat very cheaply. The subways are very close, no more than 4 or 5 minutes away. We always felt safe at night going to and coming from the hotel from the subways along Young Street. The nearly 3 story waterslide in the kids pool was excellent and the kids burned off whatever energy they had left every night there. The pool lifeguard staff were there during the operation of the waterslide until 10 pm. Our room did not come with a fridge, but I saw some being moved into rooms, so they are obviously available. It was very good value for money, especially factoring in the waterslide/pool area/games room for kids, the safety of the area and hotel, the proximity to everything, and the comfort of the rooms. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: boardinbob
Reviews.Content: The hotel's benefits are the central location (I was at a conference at UofT, and it was 15 or 20 minutes on foot), and the staff was very friendly. If you can find a good deal to stay here, it is definitely a great choice. I didn't like the fact that I couldn't open the balcony door more than 4 inches, although the views aren't great even from the 18th floor, regardless. Inside, the room was nice, clean, and the beds were quite comfortable. I would stay again, particularly for $100 or less.

Reviews.Title: “Not the fanciest, but clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: FromThe361
Reviews.Content: Check in was courteous and prompt. The room (standard) shows some wear but otherwise was very clean. Beddings were very good. Housekeeping did a good job maintaining the room during my stay. Taxis were always readily available, and the Dundas Square subway stop is only two blocks south. Better enforcement of pool area rules (attire) was needed. Use the second-floor lobby for free wi-fi access to avoid crowds on the first floor. Free Globe & Mail newspapers each morning. The hotel tended toward a young adult and family crowd over the weekend, but noise was not a problem, at least in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service on phone. Not helpful at all.”
Reviews.Author: Scarlette K
Reviews.Content: Called at 5:30 Aug 12, 2011 to ask if a friend has checked in yet and if so, to connect me- gave them last name of my friend and first name. Customer service staff on the phone said there were many of the same last name and none with the initial of the first name I gave him. Several seconds of silence as if he was waiting for me to think of a solution. I told him that my friend and a few other people would be checking in today as a crew of flight attendants from the same company. He said to call back later because maybe my friend didn't check in yet. I asked, or rather, wanted to confirm that he would know whether or not a group of people who works for a big travel company Cathay Pacific has booked several rooms for a specific time range. He said he wouldn't know. Did not even take the initiative to help me out or suggest solutions. Full of attitude - expect me to provide customer service to myself. Lazy. Not willing to help clueless visitors. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Gladdes
Reviews.Content: Big thanks for the Concierge at the Delta Chelsea who gave us step by step instructions on how to make our way to the zoo. There was a small hic-up on the return trip, but nothing that wasn't easily fixed. We were made to feel completely taken care of, even out and beyond the walls of our hotel. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Walking distances to everything downtown!”
Reviews.Author: isaruya05
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in august. We have visited Toronto many times but always been accommodated in hotels outside of the downtown core. The lobby is quite busy but the checking in process was fast and courteous. The Delta has 27 floors and there's different elevator for each quarter of floors. Parking is about 30$ a night, which is within the average price range. There is ongoing condominium construction facing the hotel on Gerrard St. It claims to be the tallest residential project in Canada. So noise nuisance will be present at least until the end of the year. It usually starts early in the morning, 6:30am. But if you are assign a room facing the construction work, you do get a balcony. The double bed standard room lacks practical space and so does the bathroom. But we didn't care much. The furniture is clean but in need of fresh paint and a may be a flat screen tv monitor. We chose this particular hotel for its geographical advantage. Its about a 30 minutes walk to the waterfront, 5 minutes to the Eaton Center and 20 minutes to Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “A Girls Whirlwind Weekend”
Reviews.Author: denimead
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the Delta Chelsea in Toronto since I was a young 18 year old. I have grown up with Delta Chelsea and now I have my kids growing up in the Delta Chelsea family. Of all the visits we have made, we have never had one bad experience. The staff know us. They welcome us with open arms. And they even welcome our teacup Yorkie named Bearly. It's truly our home away from home. The accomodations are perfect. The food is awesome. The location...we can't say enough about. Its centrally located. There are little restaurants and lounges surrounding the hotel if you're looking to get out of the hotel. Shops are a plenty and most importantly, the Delta is steps from the subway. Cleanliness and client satisfaction is their #1 priority and it shows. I would highly recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “It was a great place for parents and children!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel029
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea with my husband and three daugthers (13 & 7) and we loved it. They have two pools, one for the whole family and one on the top level of the hotel which is exclusive to adults. They have an arcade for the teenagers and a play room for kids. Three restaurants on site, one of which is affordable. They only thing that i had an issue with was that we are a family of 5 and you are only allowed to have 4 people in the room. We just requested a cot from them. great stay and would go back 100%.

Reviews.Title: “large older hotel, small rooms, good location but bathrooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: ParizadM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July 2011 for 5 nights: 1 room for myself and another for my parents. Both rooms (queen beds) were smaller than I thought they would be - I believe this is an older hotel/building. It is a large hotel with over 1000 rooms and was very busy when we were there. Location is great if you want to stay in downtown - close to shops, restaurants and subway. My parents rooms had a stale smell when we checked in on the first day but that dissipated after we aired it and had the AC on. Otherwise the rooms and bathrooms were clean but I definitely think they need to be updated - even for the price we paid through priceline. We used the spa across the street - Elmswood - which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “great location in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: e w
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with all the amenities. Caters to business guests and well as families. Several restuarants in the hotel that caters to all guests. Market Garden very affordable with a great menu selection. This hotel is one block from subway station, and just one block north of Dundas Square on Yonge street. Lots to see and do within walking distance. Rooms are very clean and staff are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: BlondeCricket
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea for a family trip to see the sights of Toronto. The lobby was beautiful and the hotel seemed to have all the things a family could want. Most of the people working there were helpful. The bell hop captain was quite rude to me when I asked him for a cart to get our luggage. The room we had overlooked Gerrard and had a balcony. Unfortunately, there is contruction right across the street with workers starting at 6:30 in the morning. The room was clean, but a bit run down, with peeling paint and wallpaper in the bathroom , outdated TV and furniture. It was an excellent location with easy access to subway, and within walking distance to many stores and restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Small but fun family pool. Good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWithFour
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night to get a break from camping. We were also traveling with a dog. The water slide at the family pool was fast and through a DARK tunnel. They had plenty of lifeguards for such a small pool which got very crowded at night. They should open up the "adult" pool for older kids to relieve the crowding. We left my boys (8 & 10) at the child center for two hours and they liked it well enough. The babysitters were good at providing supplies to keep them entertained. But they would have become bored if we had left them any longer. We stayed in the older wing and it was very nice, maybe it had already been renovated?

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels...”
Reviews.Author: askewd
Reviews.Content: I came to Toronto for a combo business and family trip and while my wife conducted her business, I and my son did the family vacation thing. The Camp Chelsea, the swimming pool, the water slide, the variety of restaurants, the geographical location to all things downtown, the helpful conciergeel and all other aspects make this a go-to hotel for families. My wife commented that she felt that we were on a cruise ship. That was a perfect description. Unlike a cruise ship, I was able to get off whenever I desired to see the Toronto sights. Considering we are less than 2 hours away by air, we will be BACK!!

Reviews.Title: “Taylor (night manager) is number one!”
Reviews.Author: BevStPierre
Reviews.Content: Fun interesting place in the center of downtown Toronto. You will never be bored inside or outside this hotel. Let me just say two thumbs up for Taylor (night manager) for his upstanding role in customer service, professionalism, knowledge, understanding and for going over and above the call of duty. To find people in the work force who love their job like he does and take so much pride in providing the excellent customer service skills he illuminates is so very hard to find in this day and age. Keep up the great work and positive attitude, you will go far. Representing Delta Chelsea, they should be honoured to have such a dedicated employee. Thank you for your time and understanding.

Reviews.Title: “It had everything required but it was ok!!! I wouldn't go back!”
Reviews.Author: mtraveler93
Reviews.Content: The place was clean, modern and like Mini Vegas! As we met, my kid met DC the Robot who was interactive and she loved it. He is there only on the weekends. So if you are going don't miss that. The room was great and the staff were really friendly. However, I stayed there primarily because it said it had facilities like child minders for kids, etc. The child minder at the Kid's Center was very nice and polite, but after having stayed around the world with several hotels who had child minding services: the child minders at the Delta Chelsea just did not have what it takes to entertain a child. And their hearts were not in it. In fact when I was there with my kid, a parent left a child in the room, he was like 7 or 8, but the minder just walked out with no one there. He was watching a movie, and she was out just for 5 mins, but still, that's not why parents leave them in their care. Anything can happen. Plus when they ask the kids if they want to do craft work, it is asked in a friendly manner but half-heartedly....so thus a fruitless attempt. Children pick the vibes. So this is unfortunate. Sure stay at Delta Chelsea for partying and if you are single or couples for sure. It has great adult services: super gym, super swimming pool, super business center. And it is great for bigger kids. But definitely not for families with kids younger than 6 years. OH AND IT HAS NO WIFI in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good service”
Reviews.Author: Nikitty
Reviews.Content: We booked the Delta Chelsea in June 2011 through Hotwire. We arrived about 2 hours before check-in, but the hotel staff was nice enough to let us go up to our room early. The concierge was very helpful in booking transportation to the airport for us and the rest of the lobby staff seemed to be courteous. The lobby was gorgeous and offered quite a few things to us such as free wi-fi, a bar, a restaurant, etc. The room was older, but it was very clean and we had a nice view of Yonge St. from our room. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to a traveler on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good New Wing - Tired Old Wing”
Reviews.Author: cartist
Reviews.Content: We booked a deal online for 7 nights and got a room that smelled of cigarettes in the old wing. The staff were very amenable and gave us a second room, also in the old wing, which smelled this time of cigars. Again, agreeably, they put us in an 'upgraded' room which they said normally cost more, this time in the new wing. It was lovely and pleasant and we had a very good stay. I would suggest that one ask to be put in the new wing when getting a room. Also, not a northern exposure as a massive tower is being constructed on that side. Other than that, a good rooftop exercise room and pool and a good restaurant for breakfast make this a good (and well-situated) hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but building works are not good when you are traveling with a baby!”
Reviews.Author: SineadC
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel but were dumbfounded to find we were in room 818 (eye level with building works) which mean't a superb view of the building works taking place across the street. The works started at 6.30am (not 7am as promised) and mean't it was impossible to get our baby to nap during the day. The second night we were treated to a very loud party and early morning building works. We were moved but to a much older (albeit quieter) room which felt sort of dusty and dirty. 2 nights out of 4 were really ruined for us (we had 4 rooms in the party in total) On the plus side though, it offers great facilities for kids and we might even come back next time. From the playcentre to the pool to the good choice of family friendly restaurants The concierge happily recommended two excellent local restaurants too! Stay ... but insist on a semi-quiet room! We had asked for 2 interconnecting rooms when we booked and sadly this wasn't possible either.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: CaryAllison
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice over the past couple of years--the first time was arranged by my hosts--a conference I was attending which was held at the hotel-- the second time was my call, which should tell you something. I have no real complaints about this property and feel very solid about staying there. It's in a good central location, near some good bars, good food, and good museums. The rooms are spacious and comfortable by big city standards. Like a lot of large "corporate chain" hotels, the main challenge for the Delta Chelsea is traffic. A zillion people pass through this place and so the issue is will they be able to keep it from getting too beat up. So far, so good--but not with a lot of room to spare. It's huge--and busy. If you are looking for intimate ambiance, you are in the wrong place. There is a large food place on the ground floor, which is convenient, a decent bar (though I'd recommend some of the places right around the corner such as Elephant and Castle). Have not used the pool, fitness center (if there is one and of course there must be), etc. Good service--they know what they are doing. Something special? No. Money in the bank for a mid-priced hotel in a good location? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place ,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Roque63
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our family vacation in east Canada. Our last stop was Toronto. We stayed at the Delta Chelsea. I was a liitle bit worried coming into this hotel after reading all the negatives reviews . Nevertheless I made a reservation thru Orbitz and got a excellent price . When I arrived the staff very were friendly and got me and uprade in the Hotel ,nice view ,nice room . Please request higher floors . . Facilities in the hotel are excellent . I have been traveling into major cities and I can assure you cannot get a room and excellent location for under $150.00. Thank you Delta Chelsea for my great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Vegas-size hotel”
Reviews.Author: USARicardo
Reviews.Content: Everything was "adequate" no more, no less . I will say though that the front desk was helpful and friendly . There were not many very good food options either.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts”
Reviews.Author: whyayepet
Reviews.Content: Two nights here which was more than enough in this big city hotel. On the face of it it looks pretty good but the bedroom although spacious needed some TLC with wallpaper peeling off the wall and taps not totally secure in the shower. Eveyone made you feel welcome but kinda hard when the infrastucture not fully up to speed to rate this as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Delta”
Reviews.Author: honesttraveller56
Reviews.Content: My mom and I always stay here with my kids,we love it.Rooms are great.Its also the perfect neighbourhood for shopping as Eaton Center is only 5 min away.Staff is great and it has a playroom for the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: originalcynthia
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through Priceline and received a great price. The hotel is located in a perfect location within walking distance to Yonge Street, Eaton Centre, etc. There was construction going on during our stay, which created a lot of noise starting early in the morning. Also, we did not receive our request for a king size bed and had to make do with two queens. The kids' activity room was perfect for our young son. He loved all the toys. The family pool was nice, but I preferred the adult pool. The kids' water slide was dark and scary even for me as an adult! The hotel is so large there are separate elevators to take based on which floor you're on. This makes it difficult when you're staying with another party that has a room on a different floor, and sometimes it's difficult to navigate your way to common areas using a stroller (i.e. on the way to the family pool from some floors you have no other option than to deal with stairs). Overall, we were very pleased with this stay and will probably return during our next stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGradstudent
Reviews.Content: Great spot in the heart of downtown Toronto. The room was spacious and had a great balcony that overlooked younge street. Saw Billie Elliot at the Canon theatre and it was only a quick walk away. Close to shopping, restaurant, and other attractions. Large hotel with overpriced parking (typical) but which also had a great indoor heated pool and jacuzzi and a spacious outdoor rooftop patio with scenic views of downtown and the CN tower. Bonus: SUPER comfy bed and pretty nice linens. Overall, a good value and I'd return and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service and dirty hotel. We will not be back!”
Reviews.Author: craig8929
Reviews.Content: Came here with my family for a 4 day vacation. Hotel put us in the wrong room. No apologies for their error. Room was dirty and run down. The room had an adjoining room and the tenants of that room just walked into ours!! The doors were not even locked!! Guest Services did not seem too concerned. They just sent someone up to lock the door. Acted as if it happens all the time. This hotel is simply worn out. It needs a major face lift. Games room has dated games and pool needs major updating. The only thing going for it is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels in Toronto for the same price”
Reviews.Author: devotchka83
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night and chose the DC for the airport express bus stop right outside the door, and its downtown location. It has nothing else going for it in my view. For the same price it's possible to stay somewhere else much nicer downtown with more personal service. It's so busy, it's like a conveyor belt of people checking in and out at all hours. My room was clean enough, but really dated (particularly the carpet, which was very timeworn). You can get a reasonably-priced hot breakfast in the Market cafe, but it's also rather soulless.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like A Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynMusician
Reviews.Content: This hotel is HUGE (there are multiple elevator banks that aren't even enar each other...) and not as fab as it appears online. The rooms are kind of old-feeling (but clean) except for those on the upper floors which have clearly been renovated recently. Oh, and speaking of the upper floors, you have to take the elevator down and back up (depending on where your room is in this monolith) and then walk up a flight of stairs to access the adults-only pool and the gym. The food court type eatery downstairs is expensive and set up poorly from a traffic-flow perspective, but the Bistro is quite good. Overall it is a fine hotel for pleasure, not so much for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot if Visiting Hospitals”
Reviews.Author: kellylm21
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here while my mother was in a nearby hospital and this hotel was perfect. Not only was it within walking distance of the hospital, but it was clean, quiet and comfortable. The restaurants provided decent value as far as hotel food goes. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Normally my favorite hotel...Complete let down.”
Reviews.Author: TheDaz
Reviews.Content: Normally when I travel for work or for personal vacations for the last 10 years I have always tried to stay at a Delta hotel. In fact in 2003 I stayed almost 4 months of the year in a Delta hotel. I really like The Delta and in the past I have always been treated well. Recently as mentioned above I took a trip to Toronto and stayed at the Delta Chelsea...Which I have done every year for the last almost 10 years. I have to admit the concirege service at the Delta is second to none...Class act people and attitude...They will do anything to make your say more pleasant. This time my room was located at the end of a long hall on the 8th floor facing another building with absolutely no views...The room was damp and a little musty...Not a room I would classify as a "Deluxe" room. I don't normally have a lot of expectations when travelling...Ussually I don't get much time to sleep so any bed will do. And even though this stay with the Delta ws only for 3 days and two nights...It really left me with a bad feeling for this hotel. When I arrived there was food on the floor of the hallway...like chips and other finger foods....Not on a tray or anything actually on the carpet close to our door. I noticed cleaning staff in the hall and left for the day only to return around midnight with the food still there. The following morning 24hrs later the food was there and a foul smell in the hallway...Again I noticed cleaners going right by only this time rolling over it with there carts. I left for the day (too busy to stop and complain) and once again that evening I returned late to see food on the floor. When I checked out of the hotel on my third day the food was still there and this time I notified the check out clerk thaqt I was disappointed...I do not normally complain but this was not right....Food on the floor over 48hrs in a Luxury Hotel? She really did not seem to care. The following day I also wrote a letter to the Delta and informed them of this issue...Which after expliaining the details and photos that this was the worst experience with Delta and to be honest may be my last....Not sure I will return. I have not had anyone follow-up in over a week and was simply told we will follow up with our cleaning Manager. As someone who paid over $400 for two nights...I feel completely ripped off and let down. This was the only time I had to get away this summer and this is all could think about my entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff makes up for dated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sgkhoo
Reviews.Content: Had a problem with my newly rented apartment on arrival from Dublin and needed to find hotel accommodation quickly. The cab driver took us to the Delta Chelsea. The front lobby facade is impressive, but the lobby was incredibly busy. Free WiFi in the lobby ensures the place is packed full of smart phone and computer users. At the desk, Jonathan helped us book a kitchenette room and has to be commended. He was very friendly and took the time to ensure we were comfortable and sorted with the huge amount of luggage and baby we had with us. He recognised us a few days later as well and inquired about our stay which was a very nice touch. The hotel has exits on each side practically, and is very central. The rooms are very dated, but goodness, the bed was just so so comfortable! The kitchenette was old and not very pleasant to use, but it did the job.The balcony railings were all rusted and the whole place looked like it needed a fresh coat of paint. The adult pool was lovely, and affords a great view of the sunset over Toronto. Very peaceful indeed, and they have a swimsuit dryer in the changing rooms as well. The wonderful staff made up for all the negatives and I would certainly book here again should the need ever arise again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: iceman46
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Delta hotel 3 to 4 nights a month for Business purposses , I have always been very pleased with their accomidation . The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are always clean and quite , and an outstanding hotel shuttle between hotel and airport ,

Reviews.Title: “I shall return!”
Reviews.Author: ferraridin0
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Delta Chelsea is downtown, one half block from Yonge Street. It is the last stop on the Airport Express bus from Pearson Airport and the first stop to Pearson Air-port on the Airport Express bus. Also, the hotel is conveniently located to restaurants, shops, and the bus/subway system. The rooms are modern and clean and the hospitality is excellent. The hotel is popular with families.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel on the Yonge & Dundas Streets”
Reviews.Author: Adnansamir
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location is very good as its literally on the Yonge & Dundas Street. The rooms are good and its one of the largest hotels in Toronto. They liked to be called as Family Hotel as its very famous for families. Wi Fi is free in the lobby area which is really nice. Check in good and the staff are helpful and attentive. The Breakfast is good however the meat in all kept in one shelf which is not good for people who dont like bacon etc. However the spread was very nice and the restaurant staff were also very good. There is very nice Swimming pool with slides for the clients to enjoy which is a bonus. Loads of Indian restaurants around and lot of shopping places around as well as you are on Yonge Street. The only negative is a Strip bar across the hotel called Zanzibar. However its very safe at the hotel and they dont cause any trouble. Overall recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Couples”
Reviews.Author: lockePortRexton
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't for couples but more for families and definately in need of a few upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Room overdue for an upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: honeybee2009
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel. As there is no WiFi in the rooms, the lobby is packed with people and their computers. The wallpaper in our room was peeling at the seams and so yellowed. I want to mention that the maintenance staff and the plumber retrieved my earring from the bathtub drain within an hour of my distress call! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Just didn't do it for us!”
Reviews.Author: Trave-LVN-Bug
Reviews.Content: Positives - Room was decent, nicely decorated, comfortable bed & a large bathroom. The hotel has a very nice work out & pool area. Lots of places to eat in the hotel although we chose to eat elsewhere. Decent location. Free wi-fi in the lobby. Not so positive - The staff we encountered were not helpful or very friendly except for the cleaning lady. We drove & found out that our vehicle was too large to park at the hotel - actually anything other than a car is probably too large. Very low clearance. I told the girl at the front desk & she said we could valet in the oversize parking. Turns out the lot was full & I told the valet "I think she already charged my card" & he said she should have known it was full & that he would tell her. We parked at the lot right next door (This lot is not affilliated with the hotel) that was perfectly fine for the 1st 2 days. The 3rd day a very unfriendly woman was working there & refused to take our US $'s, although everyone else & the 2 previous cashiers did. She refused to let us pay her more because she said she didn't know the exchange rate. We changed US $'s to Canadian at the hotel & went to pay her & she decided it was now $30 & not the $20 she said previously. I checked w/ the hotel to see if the oversize lot had a space & then parked there the last night. Always look at your bill upon checkout bcse I was charged for 3 nights valet parking when we only used 1. I did get it straightened out before I left. Also, there is a building under construction on Gerrard St & they start work loudly at 6:30a M-F. Of course, our room was right across from it. Bottom line - If we wouldn't have had to mess with the parking situation & the mean woman & the construction wasn't going on we would have had a much more pleasant experience. The hotel is not a bad place per se, but unfortuneately our experience with it wasn't that great. I gave the sleep quality a 2 bcse of the noise, not the bed. The bed alone would be a 4.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok but upgrade what you can when you can please”
Reviews.Author: tdizzle_11
Reviews.Content: the corridors were real dark and dingy the rooms were real small and the T.V.s could be upgraded that is just what i think but all in all not bad for downtown T.O.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: nczcmz
Reviews.Content: We checked in quickly at the Delta Privilege desk. Service there was adequate but not especially friendly. I realized later that they didn't even mention the special kid's check-in which I forgot about. We had a kitchenette room which could definitely use some renovation. It was old and small. The bathroom was pretty decent but didn't have a fan. The internet service in the room isn't wireless, but it is fast. The hotel is large and has numerous elevators which do not go to the same place so you have to make sure you are getting on the correct one. I went down to get a pizza for the kids from the Marketplace. The guy making them told me it would be 15-20 min. so I said that was fine and I would be back. My husband went back 20 min. later to pick it up and found that the guy never put it in the oven so he had to stand there and wait for it to cook. I didn't try it but my husband said that it was very salty. The family pool was nice. We were a little confused though why our 10 yr old was asked to do a swim test in order to use the water slide that he had already gone down at least 5 times. We walked to the Rogers Centre from the hotel which was a fairly significant walk with 2 children and a baby. Dundas Square and the Eaton Centre are only a block or two away. The hotel itself is nice for kids, however, the general area it is located in isn't. We were wondering if we were the only people in Toronto with children until we went to the baseball game! Everyone in the area seems young, childless, and smokes.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: mikeri14
Reviews.Content: We have gone to the Delta Chelsea 4 or 5 times now, and it is great. Yeah it is getting old and needs to be updated, but you are close to everthing Toronto has to offer. Plus they have an amazing child playzone area, the kids swimming pool with the waterslide which even I had fun on, they offer babysitting so that you can go out on your own for a bit, which is very nice. The adult pool is very quiet and the fitness area has a great selection. the beds are super comfy and i really need to get one of those pillows. I didn't get his name but the guy in the booth in the parking garage exit is a great guy, we were grumbling about our long drive home and he made us laugh which made our long drive home almost bearable.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice property”
Reviews.Author: Blizzardave
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is a very nice hotel with excellent staff and a fantastic central location. I stay at the hotel several times a year for business purposes. Generally speaking, the hotel is clean and well-maintained. The only drawback I could mention is that the hotel is quite expensive as are the restaurants within it. It's certainly not overpriced for a hotel in its class but it's pretty much out of the range of the unwashed masses. If the company I work for didn't pay my tab, four nights in the hotel would cost me the same as my mortgage costs for a month. Nonetheless, if you're looking for a great get-away in a beautiful hotel that's centrally located, you can't go wrong at the Chelsea. If you think you might be back periodically, sign up for a free Delta Privilege membership that will entitle you to a few freebies from time to time, too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASBrown
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this large downtown hotel twice in 5 months, and will not stay elsewhere. It is handy to everything, you can walk everywhere, from the waterfront, to Chinatown, to the HN Tower.... The hotel staff is efficient and friendly, just ask, they will help. Case in point, one night the room next to us became very loud, it was after midnight, I called the front desk, and within minutes security came and we never heard another peep all night. Check in and out lines are long, however, the desks are staffed properly, and the line goes quickly. Have no fear staying here, you won't be disappointed, the rooms are large and clean, there is a gift shop for snacks and drinks, and a full service restaurant/bar on site. Look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Comfortable, and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BirdcageBohemia
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend has been to the Delta Chelsea for years and it was the first and last place he looked at when booking the night for our trip to Toronto. Our room was nice and clean and pretty sizable too for two people with a lot of items between them. I really enjoyed the coffeemaker and wish they left more packages of the regular brew (not decaf,) it was so good! The location was great- accessible to all the places we wanted to go such as Queen St. West, Kensington Market, and the Waterfront. Check in was super fast and easy. I do want to add these points though, but they didn't detract too much from our experience. I wish they had a mini-fridge because my boyfriend and I are in the habit of carrying around food with us that needs to stay cool. The balcony was a lovely touch but it was unfortunate that it was completely covered in bird poop and had no chairs. Even just one would be nice. All in all, I'd definitely come back here and apparently, we will be next month!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it but would like to come back as visitors.”
Reviews.Author: macsdao
Reviews.Content: We loved our stays at Delta Chelsea. We have only come to stay because of hospital visits. We needed somewhere close to the Princess Margaret Hospital and this was perfect. Everyone at Delta Chelsea is so helpful and accomodating. Really, really impressed with everything and everyone there. Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: baseballmlm
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived at about 10:30 am and checked in to our room without a problem, which was great because we didn't expect to be given our room so early in the day. We had a kind bed room which was small but big enough for the two of us. The room was clean and updated. We even had a small balcony off of our room which was a nice surprise. The bed was very comfortable and there more than enough pillows for us. The single problem we had with the room was that the shower occasionally got cold while using it, but this did not stop us from enjoying the hotel and its ammenities. The facilities the hotel offers are fantastic. They had a family area with a pool, hot tub, and waterslide which is very nice. On the 27th deck there is also a pool and fitness area for adults only. This was very nice and quiet. There is also a small outdoor area on this deck with lounge chairs and amazing views of the city. Not only is the hotel beautiful, but it is in a great location. You can more than easily walk to restaurants, shopping, and multiple subway stops. We only stayed over one night but on our second day we weren't leaving the city until late afternoon so we asked for a late check-out (1pm) and a very nice woman at the front desk said it was not a problem. Check-out was also simple as we just let the people at the front desk we were checking out and it took less than a couple minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone as it fits adults and children greatly. I am looking forward to staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: desandstu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June 2011 for nine nights. We were originally booked into a room on the 5th floor but had a problem with the hot water. We were quickly put in another room and compensated for the inconvenience. We could not fault the staff who were very helpful. There were 3 eating establishments on the premises but also many local restaurants. There was on-site parking which was rather expensive but then this was central Toronto. There was also a nice gym and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: goldielocks79
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights in September 2010, very luxurious hotel with great restaurants, food was a bit on the expensive side but tasted nice bed was very comfortable and shower was great, would definitely recommend staying here when in Toronto as it is perfect for shopping, sight seeing etc

Reviews.Title: “Largest canadian hotel, busy, some noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: GeraldN
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel we were on the 17th floor, express lifts though. We had a deluxe room, which was fine, very large with king sized bed. There is extensive building works, on the block across and we were wakened at 7:00am. Noisy before that with waggons reversing etc, Even on 17th floor! Many hotel rooms on this side. we had learnt of the building works 2 weeks before travelling and had requested a quiet room, but didn't get one. Self sevice at breakfast, but wide range of food cooked while you wait plus continental breakfast as well. Hotel just off Yonge street and downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Overall comfortable and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: drloky
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on a Saturday and the room was a decent size and clean. The room did have a balcony, but it was very small and didn't have any furniture - also wouldn't want to go out on it bare foot. Even though the reception area was very busy when we checked in, the line moved quickly and the staff were friendly and efficient. Internet was not included and it was quite pricey

Reviews.Title: “Good location with nice lobby - but old, dirty room! Not a 3.5 star!”
Reviews.Author: Marigold79
Reviews.Content: Rooms are old and are in need of serious refurbishment!! Lobby is nice, but once we arrived in our room I was extremely disappointed. Our room smelled stale, with a hint of smoke even though they are "smoke free". The bathroom had faded tile, bathtub was old. All furniture was old (not in a nice vintage way), carpet was old, and the patio was dirty with cracked paint. I will not return here...the location was great but there are lots of other hotels within a similar price range in the same area. No mini bar and $14 a day for internet. I wish someone told us all of this before we booked!

Reviews.Title: “Made birthday special”
Reviews.Author: coochoka
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night celebrating my wife's birthday. Staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. We'll stay again if the oppoyunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel, Construction across the road”
Reviews.Author: warwiac
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel room through TravelZoo for a low rate. Was in TO early, called hotel they arranged an early check-in however it was on Gerrard Street size, where a huge condominium construction project is going on. The desk said the site ran from 8 AM to 5 PM, however they start closer to 7:00 am, so try to get the otherside of the hotel if possible. The rooms are clean, good A/C, but they are dated and probably due for a refurb. (TV was a CRT) Kids Pool is small but has a slide, great for small kids (12 and under ) Nice hotel for children, super busy hotel. Used the convenient hotel parking under the building ($28) with unlimited in/out priviliges, so avoided the valet charges. Elevators to access parking garage are small and really busy at check out time, so beware. But all in all exactly what I expected from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: alpinestaRR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 7 days at the end of June 2011. Our room was a corner room at the end of the hall, facing Gerrard Street. Nice big room, no complaints with the amenities really, except a fridge and safe would be nice. Also, if you have the blinds/window open in the morning during the week, you will hear the construction across the street pretty early. If you keep the blinds closed with the air conditioner on, you can't hear it though! As part of the Signature Club, we were greeted with GREAT and FAST check-in/check-out service at the separate check-in counter (did you know it's FREE to sign up for??). Also had complimentary wireless internet which proved to be very valuable during our stay. The concierge was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The market was great for grabbing a quick breakfast before heading out for the day. My girlfriend really enjoyed the gym on the top floor. Overall, we were quite pleased with the Delta Chelsea and would definitely stay again. It is a very busy place, but you can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: NNewJerseyTraveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent and the staff is very friendly and helpful. That's everything good I can say. Now, for the bad. The room was TINY, the decor was totally outdated and it smelled stale. The bed was VERY uncomfortable. The bathroom had too few towels and the water from the shower ran too hot one moment and too cold the next. After our first night there, the housekeeper showed up at nearly 6 p.m., after we'd just returned from a day out. There were pigeon droppings all over the balcony. The food in the Market Garden restaurant was medicore and overpriced. Would we stay here again? Never!

Reviews.Title: “Location of hotel is the big plus”
Reviews.Author: WBarts
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Overall a good stay. Best features of this hotel: central location and nice swimming pool / gym and sauna. The lobby and reception area seems to be very busy and crowded (probably since it's a large hotel). The receptionist upon check-in was not very friendly and gave a keycard that did not work the first time. Check-out was smooth and friendly. Housekeeping staff was very nice did a great job on making our room and brought extra items that we reqeusted right away. Compliments for them! Dislikes about this hotel: wired internet has a charge (about 15 CAD per day). In most hotels in Canada wireless internet seems to be free. Also the rooms could use a bit of renovation / touch up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CardiffLudwig
Reviews.Content: I stayed here fro five nights,it was in a very good location,close to the Eaton Centre and a subway,next to Yonge Street,there was plenty to do in the hotel,I paid for breakfast,not sure if you can include it in the price,friendly staff,decent prices as well,also free access to two swimming pools,a fitness centre and a waterslide!,

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: searst2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Delta many times while traveling with our children. We dropped our children off at the playplace, located beside the pool, in the evening. The children made crafts, watch a movie and play games. The kids enjoy this and it allows my husband and I time to see a show or go out for dinner. There's a water slide that's large enough for older kids but also small enough that younger ones could use it also. There are a few restaurants on the premises including a cafeteria. Meals are relatively expensive here, tip: if your on a budget there is a great breakfast restaurant just south of the hotel which serves large portion breakfasts at half the cost in comparison to the hotel. The hotel is clean, comfortable beds and well maintained. If you have young kids there is a children's checkin area, here they will each receive a free goody bag filled with game and toys.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but definelty not cheerfull and what the hell is the smell??”
Reviews.Author: MickRLondon
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying that the staff at this hotel were helpfull and very friendly under difficult circumstances. The hotel itself though is of the pile it high and wedge in as many people as possible persuasion. The foyer is manic at all hours of the day and night and it quite frankly just makes you want to get out of there as soon as you can. When you do finally fight your way through the hoards of people and screaming kids to get up to your room you are greeted by an unending corridor with what seems like hundreds of rooms.The room itself quite frankly stank of damp and there were odd patches on the wall by the bathroom so I assume it actually was damp. Disgusting! The duvet on the bed had no stuffing left in it whatsoever and also appeared to have the remnants of someones curry dinner on it. We requested another from housekeeping but nothing appeared so we ended up having to go and find the maid ourself!! The room had a balcony but don't get too excited because you can't access it as the hotel have nailed the doors shut. I assume that this was something to do with the huge building site that was just outside the hotel and the dust it was creating. By the way the builders on the site start work between 6.30 & 7.00 am so don't expect to be able to lay in. Oh and one last point incase you are still wondering whether you should or shouldn't stay here, we were kept awake most nights by student types running around the corridors shouting and banging all the doors. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Helpful Staff but Walls as Thin as Toilet Paper”
Reviews.Author: juralov
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at this hotel, there is confusion about where the reception is, but the staff are friendly and kind enough to redirect us. This wouldn't be necessary if signs were more clearly marked, as to where to go. This is the same scenario with the elevators. It seems confusing and we were running around to find the elevators in this maze of a hotel. Our room was clean with older finishings but good enough. The worst part of the whole trip was the paper thin walls in between rooms or lack of sound proofing. The rooms are quite small and that's ok, but you can hear the neighbors conversation, as if they were in the room sittng right beside you. This is fine too if you have quiet neighbors or else don't value sleep too much... On a positive note, the staff are friendly and the in-room dinner was delicious. A finely dressed gentlemen arrived with our dinner, very delightfully presented and delicious as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ADinh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last month for 2 nights and chose it because the hotel was a short walking distance to the main food and shopping area. The first impression of our room was really small compared to other hotels I've been to in Toronto but our bed was comfortable, the room was clean, and the staff was very nice. I left my jacket and flats in the car that was parked underground and the a parking staff was super kind to grab the stuff and deliver it to my room! Good thing we got valet :) Overall the hotel is good and the location is very good! I'm going back this month again because I had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “I CHECK OTHER HOTELS AND FOUND THE DELTA CHELSEY THE BEST FR 2006TO 2011 ECT”
Reviews.Author: BAYBOY_11
Reviews.Content: why we like staying at the Delta Chelsey rather than other hotels 1:Clean and comfortable rooms beds ect 2:Staff are friendly and Respectable, treat you like family always trying to make your stay more enjoyable. 3: Location everything is within walking distance, Hospitals, Restaurants, Shopping., and Entertainment ect. 4: Delta Chelsey a fun place, water slides, swimming pools, spars, hot tubs and .if your into fitness , gym Equipment that will meet all your needs 5:Transportation is not a problem, Bus runs to and from airport, taxi service always available no wait! We have stayed at the Delta Chelsey for several weeks every year since 2006, and will continue to do so in the future we are treated like family and you couldn't ask for anything more, We recommend the Delta Chelsey to all our friends and family Thanks to Everyone at the Delta Chelsey for making our stays so Enjoyable Thomas and Wanda Hoskins ..Newfoundland ca.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcmaple
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not offer much in terms of amenities. The location is not central to downtown toronto. It is located near all the hospitals. The beds were very hard to sleep on. However the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 2360dundas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great location, close to Eaton, Winners, Dundas/College subway staion. Even better if you join the privilage club.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but we had problems.”
Reviews.Author: jen1232
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and overall the hotel was good, but we had a number of problems that I felt they could have dealt with when we asked, but did not. First can I say that we got the very strong inpression that because we were in the cheaper room we were not as important. I thought hotels were meant to treat you all the same. We ordered room service on our first night and left our tray outside (the room service itself was lovely) However at about 2.00am we heard shouting in the hall and people eating off our tray outside. The noise continued for 2 more nights and we asked to be moved. We were told that this was not possible as there were no free rooms - in a hotel that big!!! We said fine we would stay. Two days later after getting back from sight seeing we found ketchup smeared on our door and up the walls. We called to reception and said we wanted to move again and there must be rooms free now. They said no again and said it would get cleaned. It did not - it was wiped a bit, but it was very visable. However the food in the resturant was lovely if not a bit expensive and the pool was great. Overall we wil not be going back on our next trip as we informed the hotel at least 3 times of our problems and they did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Location is all they have going for them”
Reviews.Author: Leanpig
Reviews.Content: We paid extra for a room with more space. The pictures are deceiving. It was small, dark and old. The location cannot be beat so if you could care less and are just going to be sleeping then it isn't bad. It isn't dirty (or we didn't find it to be) but it is cramped for more than two people staying in a room.

Reviews.Title: “average at best”
Reviews.Author: lovepuntacana_9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta about 9 times over the past twelve years on business; each visted lasted more than one night. With an absence of about two years, I recently booked an overnight stay at the Delta and was terribly disappointed. The staff still remain stellar in terms of service and speedy assistance however, the rooms are definitely not worth the money. We paid $176.00 with a promise of a 315 sq foot room and ended up in a 275 sq foot room. I am afraid Delta, guests can tell the difference. The desk chair had a huge chunk out of the arm with gaping foam exposed and another chair in the room had an ugly stain all over the back of it. In fairness, the beds were very comfortable but the comforters were lumpy. I did enjoyed the balcony and location but given the cost of the room and the poor shape of the furnishings, I will not stay here again when there are other motels in the local area which place a higher regard for the room appearances.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, close to everywhere I wanted to go”
Reviews.Author: docklie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 2 nights. I arrived there around 10am, my room was not ready and they had none available at this time of the morning in the same price bracket (quite amazing for a 1500+ room hotel, good on them if they really are that busy). For an extra $20 a night I upgraded to a larger room (which I had to wait a couple of hours for in the very comfortable lobby). I chose a room at the back of the hotel as there is construction work going on at the front which apparently starts at 6am. The room was very large and very comfortable with a nice size balcony. I enjoyed this hotel, the location was good , the staff were friendly and efficient, check out was speedy. There is no wi-fi in the rooms which at something like $14 a day for internet is a bit surprising but it shouldn't spoil anybody's enjoyment of the place. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “My preferred place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Wordfiend
Reviews.Content: Great location (walk to Eaton Centre), great rooms, comfortable beds, and the Elm Street Lounge has the *best* French fries. (Seriously.) I'll be back again. (I wish the Internet were included in the room rate.)

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Night at the Delta.”
Reviews.Author: Caleyjoy
Reviews.Content: Love staying at the Delta when we are in Toronto. Hotel is great and is so central to everything. Also, met a very friendly bartender, Sharon, this time. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great hotel...we'll be back....”
Reviews.Author: DAHutton
Reviews.Content: Since I have trouble sleeping, we requested a quiet room, and the room was the quietest I've stayed in. Also very nicely decorated and comfy. Service was excellent. Check in easy with Privlege Card as was check out. Great location ....near Eaton, China Town, and Yonge St. as well as many great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: em_b90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea hotel for 5 nights and had a great time. The concierge staff were very helpful when we needed advice on which tours to go on etc. We had our breakfast each morning at the Market Garden restaurant, the food was a good price and there was a lot of choice (The muffins were particularly delicious). We visited the pool/sauna upstairs which we really liked, we also went back up to the top floor on our last night to take some pictures of the city as the view was lovely. The location of the hotel was great, it was very close to the Eaton Centre and the underground system. Also the gift shop in the hotel was great for purchasing small souvenirs. We would recommend this hotel to others. .

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs-up!”
Reviews.Author: Souvikcool
Reviews.Content: We (me, my spouse & kid) stayed at the DC Hotel, Toronto from 3rd June to 5th June. We would give it a thumb-up for the experience. DC is the largest hotel in Toronto. The rooms are nice. But to access micro-wave you have to come at the lobby. Also, internet is chargeable...again at the lobby, you can have it free. Kids check-in have a token play kit which excites them. The room doesn't have refridgerator...but upon calling the helpdesk, they can provide one at the room. A funny incident happened - at 3 am in the morning we were awakened by a pager call that there has been a fire-alarm from 22nd floors & few top floors were asked to evacuate. It was a little nervous at that time but soon got sorted out for the better. The swimming pool & kids area are good & recommendable. Baby-sitters are available during normal hours at 10 CAD/ hr rate. Parking was 28 CAD/ day. Overall it was nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: Katie_and_Craig
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard hotel in a good central location. Internet connection was pricey though and restaurant wasn't great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Meets all your needs...business, pleasure and family!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawareliable
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at the Delta Chelsea Toronto while on business and enjoy all of the services (fitness, pool, executive lounge etc...) but was hesitant when I was booking rooms for myself and family for a niece's wedding. What a pleasant surprise it was to see all of the activities and pool and, best of all, water slide for the kids. It put a smile on all of their faces (ages 7-15) as well as myself and my sister's! Since the family zone is separate from the adult pool you can enjoy those amenities while on a personal trip and adult facilities while on business!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly helpful staff made this stay great!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaDM
Reviews.Content: The service here was excellent from start to finish. What really stood out was the checkin process. We had requested an early checkin. Our assigned room wasn't ready and the only rooms which were ready faced construction (a large condo development is going up across the street). Front desk staff gave us a free upgrade so that we could go to our room right away and not face construction - marvelous as we were staying for five nights! The room was lovely and very clean, and we even had a balcony with a very nice view of the city. The hotel's location is excellent - just a block away from College Station on the TTC. I was here for a conference, and the facilities for that were great too. I can't think of anything negative to say... everything worked as it was supposed to. What made it really great, as I said, was the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: ontario64
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in May 2011. I chose the Delta Chelsea based on the location and it turned out to be a wise decision! It's close to many resturants in Dundas Square, as well as the Eaton Centre. The subway station is no more than a 5 minute walk away and it only took about 10-15 minutes to get down to the CN Tower on the subway. We were also able to walk to the ROM, which saved us cab fare! The convenience store across the street was also handy to buy late night snacks! :-) We had a renovated room, which was great! However, my sister recently stayed there as well, but had an unrenovated room and she wasn't that impressed. So if you want a hotel in a great location and with a great room, splurge for the renovated room! Based on my experience, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: COLLEENTIM
Reviews.Content: this is the only place i would stay in toronto ,the staff are great friendly and will do anything to make your stay comfortable,they are the most increditable people here ,helpful and the most awsome food you could think off try the half chicken ,food is always hot and ready ,not once have i had any problems my partner or myself and have been here twice for 4day stay once and a 3 day stay the next time,,they are right downtown and the soaps are so wonderful that they give you ,have a great stay i know we did thank you delta chelsea

Reviews.Title: “So much for being a family friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fevrod
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as they advertise as being the best if travelling with children, our flight from the UK got us to the hotel at 11:30am but we were told even though rooms were available we couldn't book in till 3pm at the earliest, not a major problem as long as we could get out 11month old freshened up. Well firstly 3 out of the 4 enterances have steps only so we struggled to get the push chair in and out and when we asked for the baby changing room (having just got there after 11 hrs of travelling) we were told they dont have any, it's sandard toilets only unless you are booked in with a room then you can use them on floor 2 in the childrens area. Pretty useless for us as they wouldn't book us in. Was a complete joke and had to change her on a sofa which I'm sure if what the other guests want to see!!! The beds are extreemly comfy but you can only fit 1 adult in them so our family holiday was spent in seperate beds which isn't very nice and quite dated with wallpaper peeling off and the carpet under the desk hasn't seen a hover in years. All in all very expensive within the hotel and we wouldn't return here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay at the Delta Chelsea - A true story”
Reviews.Author: its_a_truestory
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Delta Chelsea was terrible! 2 weeks advance notice of our family stay, and still we couldn't get into the room until 8pm! Our idea of having our 4 year old stay in her grandparents room was ruined and we didn't get to have the evening alone that we had planned on having by staying at the Delta Chelsea. Extremely disappointed in the overall organization of the hotel. No communication seemed apparent between the different departments and in the end it was the customer (us) that paid the price. Next time I will have to be begged to stay in the Delta Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: Happymum_11
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Delta Chelsea and found it to be exceptionally good. The rooms were well maintainted the towels and bedding were very clean the beds were the most comfortable I have slept in. The staff were attentive and any query was dealt with promptly and effeicently. I would definaltely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beds and great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris182180
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to Eaton Centre and Bloor Street shopping, Canon Theatre, lots of great restaurants both downtown and in Yorkville, AMC and Varsity theatres, and of course the subway if you need to travel farther (although the new Bixi bike rentals also all around downtown now). Beds super comfy, balconies (seem to be on every room), and nice lobby with lots of friendly, helpful staff. Only drawback is small exercise room and treadmill area very warm. Air conditioning in the room a little noisy and had to turn temperature down quite low to keep room cool but then I like white noise to sleep. Some rooms renovated with flat screen TV's and larger size room but value for rate paid good.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lekkermen
Reviews.Content: Property could do with some refurbishment.... clean an comfortable and staff very friendly, lots of construction noise from apartment tower being constructed right across the hotel (reservations was kind enough to warn us before we did the booking..... ear plugs helped

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location but just OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagotravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This Delta Chelsea has construction going on next door. So when we arrived they pulled the bait and switch on us. They told us our cheap rate were construction side rooms and that for $20 a night more they'd switch us to non-construction rooms. I wouldn't mind if I had known we were getting a cheap rate for the construction (I would have chosen a higher rate for non-construction rooms) but to do this to us at the last minute seemed like a scam. I did write the hotel and they did offer me a voucher for a lower rate if I wanted to stay there again. The problem is that the hotel was also not very clean, there was no help staffing the business center and they charge for the internet (no wifi!). The carpets had not been well vacuumed anywhere and there was makeup on my bathroom counter when I checked in. In addition, despite all the no smoking or pay a dire fine signs, my room had clearly been smoked in. So, despite the granite/marble, fancier interiors and lobby, I chose to stay at the no frills Holiday Inn Yorkville for my next trip. I paid less, the room was cleaner, and there was no bait and switch. Plus, the parking was cheaper and the wifi was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price we got!”
Reviews.Author: evanescencetabby
Reviews.Content: Great location, so close to all sorts of attractions. We actually have stayed here twice, back in February as well. Hotel is clean, very large. The rooms are small but good enough.
