No real complaints. Beds are comfortable. We had a balcony both times, I think everyone does. Check in was quick and easy. Parking costs a lot but in downtown Toronto it does anywhere. We only paid 100 in Feb (off season) and 150 in May. I wouldnt pay more then that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night only in May found hotel very central close to Eton Center room was large very clean My husband had forgotten his razor I rang guest relations to ask for one in a few minutes a knock at the door with everything we could have needed razor , foam ,toothbrushes, toothpaste, combs etc, now that is service . found the staff very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest Hotel I've been to”
Reviews.Author: lamb_26
Reviews.Content: We arrive and there was an open juice bottle and a beer cap on the floor. Some of the lights weren't working and the worst part is the washroom. The towels were dirty, there was yellow stains as well as mascara stains on them and in the shower there was still soap scum. It was just disgusting never going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Planning to return again.”
Reviews.Author: CamilleDNy
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I made this booking based on gut and not advice from friends who are regular travelers to Toronto. I was very happy with my choice. The hotel is centrally located, close to everything and within walking distance to shopping areas. My balcony had a nice view, I was on the 11th floor. The meals that I had at the hotel were pretty good, I was out late one night and came in hungry, it was a pleasure to find that the Market Garden was still open. They make a really great burger! I just have a few complaints. The parking is pretty pricey. I wish that there was a deal on parking and/or internet if you stay more than one night. Parking for 2 nights at the hotel plus internet access for two days added almost another $100 to my final tab. My AC didn't work very well and I asked the housekeeper to see if she could turn it on the next day. She couldn't but that day was rainy so I was fine. She also showed me a plank that was located next to my door to the balcony so that if I wanted to leave my door open at night I could use the plank to prevent the door from opening wider. On the one hand I was glad for that little touch, on the other hand, the idea that even on the 11th floor I might need that extra touch was a bit scary. Housekeeping was great by the way, she came in one morning while I was doing work and was so quick and efficient. She also gave me extra coffee :) It would be nice if the rooms had mini fridges in them so that guests could keep drinks and/or food. The newspaper delivery was a great touch as well. All in all, a really great hotel at a really great price and I will certainly be a repeat customer in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: loveUllapool
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night - but really impressed by this hotel. Lovely staff, incredible location - absolutely no complaints. I booked through priceline and paid a lot less than the published rate!

Reviews.Title: “centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gord_Mtl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property a few times and most recently in May this year. Overall, the hotel is a good moderate hotel which is centrally located right by the Eaton Center with easy access to all the central areas of downtown Toronto. I got a great deal on Priceline for the hotel. The rooms are of a good size with comfy beds. Parking at the hotel I believe was $27 a night with in and out priviledges.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for kids!”
Reviews.Author: Schnekie
Reviews.Content: We come back to the Delta Chelsea several times a year. We have three children ages 8, 9 and 11. The children's centre and Camp Chelsea are fantastic. The staff (which has barely changed in years) treats our kids like royalty. We have spent march break, summer vacations and even Christmas here. The different hotel packages offered are great, especially the family fun package. Other hotels don't even compare. It has a perfect location where you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops and the Eaton's Centre. This is our favourite hotel and we will continue to come back year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest but sufficed.”
Reviews.Author: SLCollins78
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a 5th flight with a tired 1 year old and our room wasn't ready -this was 8pm. After we waited an hour we went to our room. We were given a meal whilst we waited which was good but our baby was so tired. We were at the hotel during spring break and it was bedlam, there were children running round non-stop. We couldn't get near the facilities with our daughter. Our room was fine, not special but comfortable and good value. The location was excellent in downtown Toronto. Service was reasonable but quite slow but I think this was because the hotel was so busy. I would avoid in school breaks for sure!....and I'm a parent!

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire delivered”
Reviews.Author: curiousx
Reviews.Content: We used Hotwire and got a rate of $123CDN including taxes. On check in we were offered (and accepted) a $20 upgrade to a room in the renovated section. Though the hotel was very busy, service was efficient and friendly at the check in, concierge service, and cafeteria. The room was quiet and well equipped. Though not overly large, the room had a step out verandah and a modest view. The beds were very comfortable. The location is good and a short walk from George Brown House and the Textile Museum - both excellent places to visit especially if one has limited time and AGO or ROM would be too much.

Reviews.Title: “Big City Hotel - Small Town Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Steviegate
Reviews.Content: Had travelled to Toronto several times between 1999-2005 for business and stayed at the Delta Chelsea since my first trip. This was my first return visit back to Toronto and the Delta Chelsea since 2005 and I could not have been happier with the hotel and my accomodations. My room was clean, spacious and with a very comfortable bed! The hotel staff was extremely helpful, especially during my check-in. When I needed a taxi to get to the airport, the porter made sure to get me one of the flat rate cars used by the hotel. Grabbed lunch a couple of times at the Market Garden restaurant (excellent egg salad sandwich) - good value for your money. Last but not least, the Delta Chelsea is ideally located for as far as shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: leighyao
Reviews.Content: Purchased a package on travelocity. The room is ok, but it is old. The lobby is quite crowded... One thing I particularly don't like is the noise. The sound proof is poor, in my opinion. Besides, a lot of kids and teenagers were running around.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel in a Big City”
Reviews.Author: Sparky2509
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chelsea for one night in April. A great hotel for a main city, a bit of a Macdonalds for hotels but has a load of extras to enjoy. A great selection of bars and restaurants. Chris the Duty Manager on the desk was great, received an early check-in upon arrival. Parking is a hassel but what major city doesn't have this. If you are after a private personal place to stay in Toronot then dont go here, this is a high volume, fast paced hotel, get in & get out! Overall, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “cozy little room”
Reviews.Author: amdjdk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the delta chelsea for my birthday. The room was not a bad size had a nice balcony which was nice to cool down the room and was nice to stand out on. The bathrooms were incredibly small, you basically have to straddle the toilet to close the bathroom door. I unfortunately never got to the pool which was the main reason why I wanted to go here but I was too tired after a long day in the sun. The beds were soo comfortable, I enjoyed my sleep. My two main concerns: there was not a complimentary breakfast, and the only restaraunt near by was eggsmart which had a line out the door, so we waited to eat. my second concern was the elevator to the North parkling lot, there was only one SMALL elevator which always had a line up, it took forever for the elevator to go down and return to the main floor. There were no direct stairs to the parking garage other than going through the south lot. We did this and got a little lost however finally found our way out. I am not used to having to pay for parking as it is usually included in other hotels, however I didnt mind because it was underground parking!! it was $31.00 for one night. We walked to the CN tower and Rogers centre, it took atleast 20 minutes (longer for me as I was wearing flip flops). I overall had a goood time and I would return there! I couldnt beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Delta Chelsea is my favorite hotel and has been for 25 years.”
Reviews.Author: Mike155012
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea May 23. This is the most recent of dozens of fully satisfying visits over the past 25 years. I have nothing but positive thing to report. All visits have been fully satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: racsan24
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. the food there is all delicious. Great downtown location, but very low noise. Housekeeping forgot to clean our room one day, so we got a free night! Very relaxing, fair prices. Why stay somewhere else?

Reviews.Title: “THE perfect location in downtown Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: BebeCat2010
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is within walking distance of shops, restaurants and nightlife. Hotel personnel are very friendly and service is prompt. Very nice lobby area with a self-serve eatery just a few steps away. Avid walkers can walk to the CN Tower, University of Toronto, and Casa Loma Castle. Hotel has plenty of self-parking.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms - BIG Service”
Reviews.Author: ProdGod
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Delta Chelsea with 87(!!) teenagers and 8 chaperones (band trip). Although the rooms were a bit smaller than I would have liked, and some of the students weren't happy with the lack of internet in the room, I have to say the service was fantastic. I especially have to signal out Andy and Mike (sorry...didn't get last names) who treated us so well. They went above and beyond to make sure our kids had a great experience. Obviously you can't beat the location...it was great taking our students out for a walk at night on Younge Street and getting back to the hotel in time for curfew. A beautiful hotel with a great staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Do it.”
Reviews.Author: tcw0806
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels and nothing comes even remotely close to my experience at the Delta Chelsea. It was perfect for lack of a better term. The room was great, the location is great and the staff are just extremely pleasant. I have absolutely no regrets. Definitely THE BEST stay, by far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Terrible experience all round”
Reviews.Author: MohanKr
Reviews.Content: Terrific downtown location. But right from our check-in to our morning breakfast and front office staff, the experience was uniformly bad. To begin with although we had a pre=paid Full American Breakfast inclusive plan, we were given a limited breakfast voucher that required us to count the number of croissants or the items we were having. When we showed the pre-paid voucher the next morning to the front office staff and requested them to reverse the extra charges billed on breakfast, they expressed surprise that the pre-paid plan included a full American breakfast ( although it stated that clearly on the voucher). They made a point of taking time to make their corrections. Having checked in at midnight, it took us about an hour to locate someone to request for some In Room food. We had to call the front desk and ask them to have someone call us back. The room, admittedly a twin double bed standard one, had been booked well in advance (about 1 month ahead) with a specific request for the best possible views. But we were told when we checked in at midnight that our room had a view of the construction opposite. Naturally we had tp upgrade. The concierge services were useful but not provided warmly--almost as if they were doing us a favour in their busy schedules! Finally when we checked out and they asked us our opinions, we told them ! And guess what--they mumbled an apology !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service - great "home base" for a Toronto wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Kwasind
Reviews.Content: My wedding was in downtown Toronto so the night before the wedding, we needed a place to stay that would accomodate my bridesmaids, my mother and I. The Delta staff went out of their way to make sure we had enough space at a reasonable price (we booked the "business suite" so had plenty of room to get dressed & our makeup artists met us there & there were adjoining rooms so everybody had a place to sleep). Everything went smoothly and we couldn't have been happier!

Reviews.Title: “IN THE HEART OF THE CITY”
Reviews.Author: WillPwr
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this hotel is next to EVERYTHING! If coming to Toronto for leisure, shopping and sightseeing then look no further. Everything and more I needed was next door or a block away. The hotel turns one of the restaurants into a club/lounge on Saturday night; very good music Mr. DJ The hotel rooms could be updated with fresh paint, plasma TVs, etc. but I'm not complaining because the convenience this hotel offered me surpassed any "updates" I refer to "Trip Advisor" often when making travel selections so I appreciated reading all of the reviews from past guest. There reviews helped me so I hope this review helps someone.

Reviews.Title: “Signature Rooms a lovely upgrade”
Reviews.Author: PNGToronto
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for business and stayed at the Delta Chelsea due to its convenient location. The desk clerk upgraded me to a Signature Room. It was one of the most comfortable night's sleep I've had away from home. The room was clean and modern, although the tub/fixtures probably could use a fix/replacement. This is my hotel of choice in Toronto due to its location. A quick walk out the Elm Street exit gets you to a handy convenience store and a plethora of good restaurants at different price points. If you are looking for something cheap and different, consider the Le Commensal, a vegetarian buffet (Elm Street exit, turn right) -- which serves a variety of ethnically-inspired vegetarian/vegan dishes and is very good. Even if you don't use the Delta hotels often, consider joining Delta Rewards as the late check-in (up to 6 pm if available) is a very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are inexpensive using Priceline but no complimentary Internet in the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: pacmanto
Reviews.Content: Bought my room off Priceline, name your own price. Paid $85 USD per room for 5 nights; with taxes came to $495 USD. This was May 2011. Location is fantastic. Within walking distance or a short cab ride of everything in downtown. Unfortunately, you get what you pay for. My computer screen is larger than my Zenith brand TV. I'm not joking when I say it's probably a 15 to 17 inch TV. I've seen better TVs at cheap motels. Currently there is construction outside. Nothing you can do about that except jack hammers start their symphony at 0630h every morning. We ordered room service 3 times during our trip so I'll review the menu. Of course, it's expensive with $4 delivery, 15% tax and 15% gratuity added on. I had the 8 oz Alberta Rib Eye for $28 and my fiancÃ© had the All Day Continental Breakfast for $18. My steak was surprisingly better than I expected, cooked exactly the way I wanted it. Don't get me wrong, the Keg is 10 times better but I can't say I was entirely disappointed. Next night, we had snack of nachos ($9), 10 wings ($12) and three cookies ($5). Big plate of nachos - I'd order this again. The wings weren't good at all. Cookies were soft and yummy. Third night, had the chicken breast sandwich on ciabatta ($10) and a 12" Hawaiian pizza ($14). The sandwich was the best value and similar to pub quality. The pizza was gross --- there was a bitter aftertaste and smelled yeasty. Yucky! Don't order the pizza!! All in all, great value for Toronto. This is my second stay and I'd stay here a third time if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “always clean, always welcoming”
Reviews.Author: eyeguy101
Reviews.Content: love the location, right in the heart of the city. close to great restaurants, theatres and venues. Easy to get too and easy to get out of. Staff is always friendly. Eaton's centre is easy walking distance and access to subway is very close by. Love this place

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by the quality of my hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: sweetkeet
Reviews.Content: I had trepidations about staying at the hotel prior to taking an early-morning train, but my fears of bedbugs, dirt and unsafe rooms in a less-than-ideal part of town -- all fuelled by rumours over the past year -- were quickly brushed aside. I found the hotel to be a bustling centre of activity -- with the facilities and clientele quite pleasing, and not the least bit seedy. I dined at Bb33 Brasserie, and found the food quite good, as well as the service at the establishment. My room was spotless -- I even inspected the mattresses and sheets, and found everything to be just as I wanted. I enjoyed my stay and challenge my fellow travellers to give this central hotel a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea is rated at 3 1/2 stars, but deserves only 2 - 2 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Eric451
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this well-located hotel in downtown Toronto for one night. The hotel has seen better days as our small room had old scarred wooden furniture, a balcony which was rusted and in desperate need of painting and a small old-fashioned TV. The parking fee was high, at $32/day and the garage for self-parking was small and difficult to navigate especially with a larger car. I suspect the garage was originally designed to be for valet parking, when the hotel had seen better days. The public areas were slightly better with updated decor from the 1980â€™s and were less shabby, but this area too, as the parking garage, were divided by walkways and small rooms, which made it seem cramped and also made it difficult to locate the elevator and the small notions shop. I believe outside of its location, the only nice thing about the Delta Chelsea Hotel is what appears to be an attractive cafeteria, which offered food at a very reasonable price point. Next time in Toronto, I will try a different downtown hotel

Reviews.Title: “Well located but uninspired”
Reviews.Author: Runner029
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at Delta Chelsea in April 2011. It is a very large hotel located conveniently for walking into town and getting to and from the airport (it is on an airport express bus route). The hotel is characterless though and the room I stayed in was in need of modernisation especially the bathroom which felt very dated. Breakfast is cafeteria style and uninspiring but functional. I did not get a chance to track down the gym or pool but suspect it would have taken a while to find them such is the size of the hotel. Insulation to the ouside is very good (I was on the 10th floor) but to the corridoor lacked slightly resulting in interuppted sleep on both nights. Practical for a stop over, not a must see on a trip to Toronto though. Explore other options is my advice, this will do, but it is not special.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saphire81
Reviews.Content: Overall I would rate this hotel as average. The best thing it has going on is the location. Walking distance to shopping and great restaurants - so if thats all you're looking for, then this is the hotel for you. Otherwise the hotel is very big, which means very busy at check in/out, and very loud in the hallways. Secondly, while the rooms are nice, they are the smallest hotel rooms I have ever seen in my life. No Wifi in the rooms, not even offered at extra cost. There is also no control over heating/cooling in the rooms. Ok, there is a thermostat, but once speaking to management I realized its just for show. We stayed in April on an unusually warm weekend and our room temp was 81 degrees - way hotter than my comfort for sleeping. I turned on the A/C (which didn't work) and was then told by staff that only the heater is turned on this time of year. June-Sept is when you can actually use the A/C. If temperature control is important for your sleep, do not stay at this hotel. Lastly, parking is $28 a night and online is listed as "unlimited in/out privileges". At check in we were told NO in/out privileges. Good thing we could walk everywhere. As for the good, the hotel is clean, staff are friendly, and prices are reasonable. If you just need a place to rest your head for the night, this place will do.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average experience”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night through Hotwire. Delta Chelsea is a great location, not far from Eaton Ctr. I called ahead to make a bed request and provide my Delta Privilege number. That was one of my better phone experiences when following up a Hotwire booking with a hotel. My check-in at the Privilege desk was only satisfactory. Pool staff were friendlier. I tried using the video check-out; it provided a statement then just hung when I selected checkout. My room overlooked the mega-condo being built to the north, but it was Sat night; no construction noise. Bonus having a small balcony. Noise seem to carry through the air ducts from my neighbours. Room had newer carpet, but otherwise the room was dull and boxy-feeling. Old TV. Furniture was real wood, but beat up. Comfortable bed and white comforter. Coffeemaker, but no fridge. Bathroom is small. White tub yellow with age. Enjoyed the Jane Jacobs toiletries Soft towels in my room and at the pool. I used the adult pool top floor. Hot tub was popular. Change room sauna worked well; smaller than typical. Fitness equipment is in 2 areas. Weights were in a dingy blue room, no windows. Cardio equipment is just past the pool area, but there is no wall between the cardio area and the pool. I didn't have a car or laptop and didn't eat onsite - so can't comment on those. I've enjoyed other Toronto hotels moreso - including Sheraton Ctr and Hilton. As such, I'm unlikely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are attractive, clean and comfortable, and service consistently reliable-home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: envirobag
Reviews.Content: Beds and pillows are the most comfortable I've ever slept on. It's a wonder they don't sell them on the side, as other hotels do. The most central location available, short walking distance to world class theatre, dining and shopping. Staff is warm and accommodating. Delta is as predictable and reliable a hotel experience as MacDonald's is a family dining experience (meant as a compliment). There are enough commonalities across Delta hotels (e.g. beds, decor, bath products, service, hospitality etc)to make each feel familiar, whether or not you've been there before. Delta Chelsea is the flagship of the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean room, efficient service.”
Reviews.Author: Late_Harvest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for two nights. The hotel staff were efficient and friendly. Our basic room was clean and of a decent size. The location was good, within walking distance of the Eaton Centre and a variety of restaurants. One issue was the soundproof-ness of the room/door. While our room was a good 10 - 15 metres or so from the nearest corridoor, we could clearly hear when someone there was having a conversation with a raised voice. Thankfully this did not occur too often, or late at night. I also found parking a bit expensive at $28 a night. I noticed signs for covered parking a block away for $19 per night. Same with another hotel one block away. Check-out was fast and efficient, with no surprises or extra charges on the bill. For the price we paid, good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gatorgirl99
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room with 3 other females and was comfortable. Had a great view. We stayed high enough that we had a great wide view of Lake Ontario. However, the room was warm and no air condtioning system that I'm accustomed to in Florida. (that says a lot that a Floridian wrnt Toronto and felt that the room was too warm)The hotel made provisions to bring in fans for us. Great location to the Eaton Center. We didn't park at the hotel but at a location off of Gerrard and Younge that was connected to a condo that charged much less than the hotel. Overall I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, good position”
Reviews.Author: chubbychops
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this as part of a business trip. Glad I didn't have to pay as the quoted room rates seemed expensive. it is a huge hotel with over 900 rooms. The room we had was nice, although the bathroom was very small. The doors were very noisy at night and first thing in the morning, they closed with a slam! The pool and gym seemed nice, the restaurant BB33 was good and not too expensive, although there are multiple places to eat out nearby. Would recommend if you can get a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Debster_11
Reviews.Content: I had read some not so great reviews of the Delta Chelsea of late so was nervous of what to expect. We requested a room on the opposite side of the construction that is going on nearby and also not near an elevator. (Contruction on Gerrard Street side)The room we got was on 4th floor and facing onto Bay Street & had view of CN Tower! (Room 453) Very spacious room with two large double beds,so comfy. Before arriving i had signed up to the Delta Chelsea privilege card on their website which meant we got free local calls and a very late check-out of 6pm for our red eye flight on way home, perfect!! Also If the reception is busy there is a special area for card holders to check in. So highly recommend signing up for this. The pool & sauna is average but was never very busy especially on weekends which was surprising. Lack of kids was also a plus! (They have there own pool on 2nd floor!) We ate out in local restaurants -Eggspectations on Yonge Street and Sunset Grill are fab for breakfast. Eaton Centre only few mins away.The only downfall of hotel is the amount of entrances the hotel had, got confusing when meeting people etc.. Other than that i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCM2
Reviews.Content: The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful, except for the chefs in the restaurant, otherwise a nice hotel. Swimming area lovely with good views of the CN tower.

Reviews.Title: “Back again to our favorite Toronto destination”
Reviews.Author: JustVisiting49
Reviews.Content: Took the grandkids to the Lion King, Once again the Chelsea was our base for the weekend...So nice to be in the centre of whatever you could want to do in the city...As usual they went out of their way to make our stay the best....

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travelpair55
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a few nights at the Delta Chelsea and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The room, though not large was spotlessly clean, the bed comfortable, and the complimentary newspaper each morning was appreciated. Not sure if all the rooms are the same, but I did find the bathroom smaller than what I'm accustomed to at other hotels. Not a major thing and certainly the bathroom was clean and well stocked which is more important to me than the size. Be forewarned that you are staying in a downtown hotel and traffic noise can be a factor during the night. Food was good and the bars were great for a late night cocktail. If you are looking to dine outside the hotel, be sure to try Donatello Restaurant located on Elm Street, right across from the hotel. It's a great little Italian Restaurant with excellent food!

Reviews.Title: “queen for a day”
Reviews.Author: catherine_armagh
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Delta Chelsea on business and always feel safe. As a Delta Priv member I receive a few nice perks which make me feel that my business is appreciated. As one staff member said "there are hundreds of hotels in the Toronto area that you could have chosen, so thank you for choosing the Delta Chelsea" The sales people have been amazing at attempting to meet my organizations needs for an upcoming conference. I have chosen to use the Delta in London ON, Delta Meadowvale and will be staying at the Delta Ottawa for a conference. I truly trust the Delta. I have worked with Jarett in London and David in Toronto and both have gone above and beyond to make me feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Good convenient hotel in central toronto”
Reviews.Author: IainTipping
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, staff were knowledgeable and helpful, room were large and comfortable, location is convenient for coach station to the falls.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable value and comfort”
Reviews.Author: policywonk48
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels in Toronto and always come back to the Delta. The location is perfect for business or touring, walking distance to the hospitals on University, Queen's park, the Eaton's Centre, etc. The service is always great and I've never had a room less than perfectly clean. The fitness centre is well maintained and the equipment is top notch. It may be one of the last hotels in the downtown to have balconies. Every room had a coffee maker and I love getting up in the morning, collecting my complimentary newspaper outside my door, making coffee and having it on the balcony while I watch Toronto wake up. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful! Excellent Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: CurlGirl76
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as we did a "mommy/daughter birthday getaway". From start to finish, I could not be happier with this hotel and it's staff. As a priviledge Member, our check-in was quick and efficient. Within 5 minutes of being in our room we received a call from the front desk saying that they had mistakenly given us the wrong room and that we were being upgraded to a King room which was much bigger and renovated (our original room was renovated with a Queen bed but a small room). As we hadn't unpacked anything, this was no biggie and we appreciated the extra space in the new room. That evening, before we left for dinner, we received a knock at the door and there was a bell-hop with 6 helium pink and yellow baloons, a gift bag and a delicious slice of chocolate mousse cake. With it was a note saying happy birthday to my daughter and was signed by Kerwin at the Front Desk. My daughter was estatic to receive such special treatment and it was this thoughtfulness and attention to detail that totally won me over with this hotel. We ate lunch and breakfast at the Market Place restaurant and found the food to be exceptional. The restaurant was also very clean, the food very fresh, and most items were reasonably priced. Again, the employees working here were professional and friendly. The waterslide was open at 4pm and while my daughter really enjoyed the slide (pitch black inside the tube!), she was disappointed with the size of the pool as there wasnt alot of room to do anything when there are alot of kids and families in there. We also found it to be perhaps overly chlorinated as my daughters eyes were sore even the next day and our skin was VERY dry after being in the pool and our bathing suits were a bit stiff from the chlorine after they dried. But over all, she was happy with the waterslide, which is what matters most. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. It was clean, the staff accomodating and friendly, our room was great and the bed extremely comfortable. In the evening the maid brought chocolates and water to our door which we also appreciated. The Delta Chelsea has earned a very satisfied customer in me, and I have already raved about your establishment to various friends and co-workers. I look forward to my next stay at this hotel! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: csasani
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had planned a trip to Toronto and my friends dad let us use his corporate voucher as he stays at the hotel twice a month. To make sure we were able to use the voucher he called the hotel and made arrangements as well as faxing in his information as well as credit card information. He also provided information on the voucher. Everything was fine so we thought and after driving 2 hours we arrived at the hotel. We found out we were NOT able to use the voucher. We asked to talk to a Manager and the "manager" came out, he was a younger guy and did not seem to be the manager. He even pulled out the faxes that my friends dad had sent and proceeded to tell us we couldn't use it. The only thing he was able to offer us was a free breakfast which we would of gotten with the voucher anyways! We were basically thrown out into the street, my friends birthday was ruined and we went back home! The ONLY thing they were able to offer was free breakfast?! Ridiculous! I will never recommend this place. My friends dad who is a corporate customer will no longer be staying there either and he is extremely angry! Horrible customer service!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay. Well looked after.”
Reviews.Author: DSW39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week recently & had a great time. They kindly upgraded us as it was my wife's birthday while we were away & we really appreciated this gesture. The staff were all very courteous & helpful, and we had none of the problems other guests have mentioned. Ideally located for the main amenities, and would recommend the hotel to friends visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was definitely memorable, one of my favourite hotels by far!”
Reviews.Author: Malz16
Reviews.Content: Well, I've already said lots but I sure wouldn't mind saying it again! :) The service was for sure the best. There was always an employee there to help and to answer my questions! Especially if your new to downtown Toronto, Delta Chelsea would make reservations for you, give you directions and just anything you need they're there! All the employees I came across were awesome with good attitudes and very polite. I thought to myself, who ever does the hiring is very good! I stayed on the 19th floor and the view was cool, there is also balcony's! The beds were the best because they have almost like duvet's and the pillows are amazing, definitely had a great sleeps that whole week. The sauna up on 27th floor which is for adults, I liked how they had cold fresh rags for you in a fridge for afterwards and a bathing suit rinser as well, very nice! It just goes to show that they think about their customers. I also liked how they had oranges for you by the pool. OH can't forget the awesome view on the 27th floor by the gym part, outside they have a big patio and you can see the CN Tower nicely, it was very nice to get pictures. The hotel itself is beautiful, it felt like I was home away from home :) Delta Chelsea is very welcoming, the moment I got there I knew it was going to be a good stay! I loved how they had fresh coffee made for you in the lobby and more. I personally think they have everything a hotel needs, I suggest to go see for yourself! P.s, the location is perfect. Almost everything you need is walking distance. Can't wait to go back this summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Visits”
Reviews.Author: meholvey
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Delta Chelsea when visiting Toronto. It is close to shopping and entertainment. We have always been treated well by their staff.

Reviews.Title: “just so-so for the money...”
Reviews.Author: mjsmoke
Reviews.Content: We actually booked the day before we arrived thru an online portal and we got an excellent deal. As we were only going to be there for one night, we figured a 3.5 rating should be good. Well, we were a little jaded to find out that there is no wireless internet in the room (free wireless in the lobby, which was ALWAYS filled with kids, and loud teens). The room was pretty much the size of my spare bedroom at home. And we couldn't for the life of us, figure out how to turn on the air conditioning system (if there even was one) since the heat was on and we couldn't really cool the room down even with the window open. We tried calling the front desk but they didn't answer the phone- AT ALL!! So I guess, overall for the less than $100 we paid for the one night wasn't too bad, but compared to the Delta in Montreal where we have stayed before (and is actually a favorite) this Delta paled in comparison. There were two bright spots though, breakfast at the Bistro located in the hotel was FANTASTIC! And, since it was my partner's birthdday, our parking fee was waived!

Reviews.Title: “$200 a night? Not worth it at all”
Reviews.Author: leo1232
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the biggest in Toronto, yet the most unclean. I had the experience of being assigned to a room that was full of black hair (I have short hair), and a shower that was rusty and did not work. I was told that all the "Delta Rooms" were renovated, this did not look like it was at all, it was old, the paper was peeling off the walls. After telling the front desk, I was told that's how our rooms are and I should have inquired about it before I arrived. I then asked to speak to management, and I was assigned another room, however clean it was, the hallway stand. Someone is not doing a good job cleaning at all, neither in the rooms or the hotel. In addition, I came to Toronto for business with Apple and was awakened at 6:00 am by the construction across the street. At night I only slept by 2:00 am, and I was completely "dead" in the morning from getting only 4 hours of sleep. Something must be done about the noise level at night, this is not a club, and neither is it a place for people to party in the hallways, what you don't have security? Is it that hard to contain the noise level that everyone complains about? If it was one person that complained then it might have been just 1 night, but this is every single night, and everyone complains about it! Additionally, you must do something about the cleaning crew, they are not doing their job right. Maybe it time to fire one of your "family members" as you call them, in order to get the job done!

Reviews.Title: “sleep before you get there”
Reviews.Author: lorna29
Reviews.Content: OMG if you are ready to give up a good nights sleep this is the place for you...We arrived friday afternoon to a check in line that went on forever with only 3 people working check, while standing in that line we noticed tons of kids and teens and young adults already creating a BUZZ in the lobby...finally making our way to our room on the hallway floor was a pile of empty alcohol bottles(not a good sign)...the hotel is well located but that's about it the room is small but has all that one needs but the action only begins after 1am through the night all these young adults come back to the hotel screaming and laughing down the halls throughout the night, we were staying two nights and said I'm sure tomorrow would be better well NO it wasn't the second was like the first in fact if you could believe it ...worst, at 3am a young man screamed and yelled so loud I jumped out of bed...needless to say I will never return and NEVER suggest this hotel to anyone...so if your an insomniac and need action during the night this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “A good nights sleep not likely”
Reviews.Author: visitur
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before, years ago, and had a pleasant experience. The locations is great. I was very disappointed this time around due to the fact that I was woken up every 30 minutes or so throughout the night. The room my friend and I were given was beside the floor's ice machine. I went to bed around 10:00 pm, only to be awaken by the noise of ice falling from the machine and the motor turning. It got worse as all sorts of party goers started trekking to it, to gather ice. There was running, yelling, wall banging, all throughout the night. The people had no respect for those choosing to sleep. Finally even the late night party people went down for the night and I drifted off again, only to be awoken by the rooms alarm clock, which neither my friend nor I had set! The final straw was the construction that began at 7:00 am on Saturday morning. One hamer became two, etc. Be warned there is a new building going up right beside the Delta Chelsea! When checking out, my friend and I asked to talk with management about our stay. There were two other sets of guests ahead of us to discuss their dissatisfaction. When discussing the noise from the ice machine, management said that they were fully booked for the night, and so would have been unable to move us if we had asked. The couple in front of us received 50% off their room rate because they had called down in the middle of the night to complain about their problems. Fair? I think not.

Reviews.Title: “Expect lots of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: pcbbsn
Reviews.Content: I stayed the at Delta Chelsea for a conference in Toronto near by after getting a good deal at an online whole sale company. The problem is that NOTHING was included and the hotel makes sure you pay. I paid $16.95 for 48 hours of wireless internet access in my room only to find out that the signal was horrible and it didn't really work. When I called for assistance I was told they don't have wireless internet in the rooms, only hard line, and could not tell me what I had paid for (even though I entered my credit card on a page that said "Delta" and the wifi name was "guest internet.") The staff was very unhelpful and did not resolve this so I paid for but did not have internet. Parking was very pricey at the hotel. $28 per night plus $6 in additional fees per night. I was also charged for a morning paper that I never knew I could ask not to have. The concierge is always busy. Expect to wait in a long line if you have a question. The lobby is always bustling, thankfully there wasn't a lot of sound transferred to my room. My room was in the "old" block and needs an upgrade. The room was fairly small. The bathroom even smaller. But the bed was comfortable. There is a LOT of construction going on outside though and they were kind enough to start at 7am on a Saturday morning as well as week days! The adult pool and exercise area was nice. The location is great. Had I not been fee-d to death I would have been content with my stay but am annoyed at the hidden charges and that the staff was unresponsive to making things right.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: maddy62
Reviews.Content: We had tickets to a show in Toronto and decided to make it a weekend and booked a room at the Delta Chelsea. Everything went well until we had party people staying on the same floor at us. Ten oclock they start banging doors walking up and down halls talking loudly. At some point we fell asleep ;hoping that was it for the evening . They had apparently gone out and returned at 4 oclock in the morning only to wake us again and how do you get back to sleep again? WE are planning another stay in Toronto in May and will probably NOT book another room with you. Disappointed to say the least

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for families!”
Reviews.Author: Dragon013
Reviews.Content: When I was young, my mother used to take my brother and I to the Delta Chelsea. We would tour Toronto and always had so much fun. When I got older I still stayed at the Delta Chelsea on many occasions. Now that I am married and have young children, we all call the Delta Chelsea home when we stay in Toronto. For the past 4 years we have stayed here for March Break. The kids love it! We are central to activites inside and outside the hotel. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Many times they have gone above and beyond what was needed. It is a beautiful, well maintained hotel that never dissapoints.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff. Great room, and location!”
Reviews.Author: Ash19856
Reviews.Content: The room was immaculately clean. The bed was really comfortable. Nice sized room and bathroom. I love how they have an adult swimming area. I don't like to be splashed. haha. Its about a 2 minute walk to the Eaton's Centre. If you take the bus down to the Bay Street Terminal its about a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Its conveniently located, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Both restaurants within are great. The pub restaurant has great pub style food and the bistro's buffet breakfast is great. It comes in at about 18 dollars a person but they have packages that you can get the breakfast added on for a better price. Whenever we go to Toronto we always stay at this hotel. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic bonus Waterpark”
Reviews.Author: CatsLOL
Reviews.Content: During March break 2010 I booked one night at the Delta Chelsea in downtown Toronto. I went to my local CAA store and got a voucher for parking too, which saved me money, but this hotel is great! It has Canada's longest waterslide inside the hotel, AT NO EXTRA COST, the room was comfy and big for a Standard 2 Queens. In the lobby is a cafeteria restaurant where cooks are on hand to make what ever you order, breakfast, lunch or dinner, which I enjoyed immensely with my teenaged son and 2 daughters. There was also drinks and snacks available out of the coolers at any time. The Waterslide made the vacation!!! And the hotel is in a perfect location downtown so that we were able to WALK from there to the CN Tower, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay AND our sightseeing. I would do it again, and the room rate was very affordable for mid-March break. 10/10!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gl0beTr0tter05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the rate was good and we figured it would be okay for just one night. We should've spent an extra $50 and stayed somewhere else. The hotel is huge however, the rooms are tiny. The bathrooms are so small that two people can absolutely not be in there at the same time unless one of them is in the shower. The rooms were clean, but not very well updated. The promised us a rollaway bed, but never brought it. We were charged the $20 fee for the rollaway bed, but did take it off when we told them that it was not delivered. Stay at the Marriott Eaton Center if you can, it's much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “So many things to do !”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJade
Reviews.Content: Will definitely stay here again ! My grandson loved the waterslide,

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in downtown Toronto!!”
Reviews.Author: DLV2011
Reviews.Content: Amazing hospitality, beautiful room, superb service! Thank you Delta Chelsea!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: jacklover
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, I was made to feel that my patronage was important and valuable. The staff was extremely friendly, the facilities were beyond my expectations and well above standard -- very clean, well run and I received very personal service. I have no qualms about recommending this hotel to anyone and will definitely be returning to this hotel upon my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “very nice functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: politepete
Reviews.Content: Good Location ,fast check in ,Rooms a bit tatty ,Food good ,A very busy lively hotel ,in need of a lick of paint maybe ,No complaints with service received ,It does what it says on the tin ,it is in a very convenient location for all amenities /attractions .

Reviews.Title: “Youth hostel meets small town motel”
Reviews.Author: srb270
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend getaway with our baby and preschooler in the 1 bedroom suite. The hotel is in a good location for walking from VIA rail station ( how we arrived) and to sites like the ROM and AGO and we needed the one bedroom for our baby to sleep and nap. So this was fine but other hotels may be a better choice. We had 2 horrible nights that makes me think of staying here again. The first night we were kept up by some 20 something partiers that were visiting outside our room from 2-4am and wafting pot smoke into our room. Also during this time there was a fire alarm, so needless to say, it was a bad night. The next night as very cold in our room but the old heater was too loud it would have woken the baby. Also the combination of a horrible creaking in the floor above from the wind and the uncomfortable sofa bed kept me up most of the night. Added to this: - the crib we requested did not arrive - the tap dripped constantly in the tub - bathroom fan not working - loud consruction across Gerard street easily heard through barely closing old patio doors (rusty old coffers and iron balcony) - old Jerry- rigged looking finishings in bath and kitchen with a grimy appearance of a cheap student rental apartment - the pool and surrounding decor is really dated and cheap looking ***there is a family play/craft room that is surprisingly well equipped though beside the pool I would say this would be an OK budget accommodation but it is really not that cheap. I think the normal studio rooms are nicer, but I would not stay in the 1 bedroom again with my family but probably spend a bit more for a cleaner, newer, upgraded hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CLLAjax
Reviews.Content: Went for one night. Needed a place near the Cannon Theatre. Also wanted a hotel with a bar and a restaurant. There are 2 towers. The old and the newer. We stayed in the old. It looks old but our carpet looked new. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable and there were 2 pillows each. I was asked at check-in if I wanted to upgrade but I had a good deal and was happy with my room and price. The lobby is huge. There are 2 bars and 2 restaraunts. We ate at the Market Garden. It's like a cafateria. Grab a tray and get your food, cutlery,drink, pay the cashier and find a seat. The food was very good. The salad bar was hit and miss. The bar we drank in was the Monarch Pub. Service was good. Drinks not too expensive. We were there on a Saturday night. They had a dj playing old and new dance music. There was a big enough, older crowd. Overall, had a good time and good stay. If you're really picky about your room , you might want to upgrade to the new tower. Underground parking is for cars only (5',6").

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocomama
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Quiet, pools are nice. Hot tub is great. Good restaurant downstairs, but a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Boogalie
Reviews.Content: Likes: 1. location - five minute walk to subway station college and dundas stations. near restaurants along yonge. short walk to Eaton Centre. 2. room - has a balcony. spacious enough. very good size bathroom. comfortable bed. quiet room (mine was at the end of the hall facing yonge st) 3. information - the room comes with tourist magazines and a map and there are more brochures in the lobby 4. shuttle - the hotel does not have its own shuttle but it is a stop for the Airport Express. Dislikes: 1. security - the lobby can get very busy and how does the staff differentiate between a guest and a non-guests. the elevator does not require keys to operate. walking from the subway to hotel from yonge can be sketchy. 2. restaurant - breakfast at the Marketplace is not that great. 3. business centre- there is a cost to use the business center $6 for 15 minutes of internet.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Lynda219
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta Chelsea in Toronto many many times over the past years and have never been disappointed.. The quality of this hotel is second to none and the location is perfect.. close to everything "downtown".. as well as transit .. The rooms are well kept, clean... and the beds are incredibly comfortable.. If I have one negative comment regarding this hotel it would be that the restaurant is very expensive.. I find myself going out to eat meals while staying at the Delta Chelsea.. All in all.. I always enjoy my stay at this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Lollie049
Reviews.Content: If you want to beable to walk to alot of Toronto's attractions this is the place to stay. You are surrounded by restaurants, shopping, Eatons Centre. The subway is close and a taxi to Yorkville Area or the waterfront is under $10.00. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accomodating. They have two pools, one for kids and the adult pool is for 19 yrs and up. Not the greatest for the teenagers 16 and up. I have stayed in fancier hotels but for the price the Chelsea is clean, up to date and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: FLYINNOW
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea Hotel is perfect-- it's near everything! I recently needed a hotel close to the university network of hospitals for treatment and surgery. The Chelsea Delta was within a block of Mt. Sinai ,Princess Margaret and Toronto General, so we could walk there from the hotel. It's one of the most reasonably priced hotels and we found the staff very warm and welcoming. The room (we have stayed 2 times) was very clean and comfortable. They are very accommodating as far as parking goes. We were able to leave our car in their parking garage from early a.m. until evening, when I was finally released from the hospital. An small extended hourly fee was mentioned, and it was cheaper than the hospital's parking fee. But when it came time to leave, the hotel staff, knowing I had just had surgery, very kindly waived the extended fee. It's that kind of generosity one always remembers when considering where to stay the next time. Bravo Delta for being so nice and affordable! Thanks again. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, amazing room, incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rachael_Roc
Reviews.Content: I went from Buffalo, NY to Toronto, ON for a quick overnight shopping trip with a friend. Little did we know it was Canada's "Family Day" so the hotel was packed! Nervous that it was going to be quite hectic, we saw there was plenty of people on staff to keep everyone moving. With the size of the hotel we also thought that we were going to get lost, but the staff showed us where to go & it was very easy! Perfect location for shoppers being only a block from the mall! After a long day of shopping, my friend and I ordered room service and rented a movie on TV that was still in theaters! The food was tasty and it was a great way to relax! Did I mention that this was all at a great price?!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Tiger1957_22
Reviews.Content: I have never posted a review on trip advisor before, but my first-but-not-last stay at the Delta impressed me enough to do so. I was in Toronto with my husband for a non-invasive, but serious, medical procedure done in hospital. I joined the privileges club (free) so we were able to drop our bags off at 9:30 am (early check-in privileges) on the day we arrived, in order to go straight to the hospital. The next day, we set out before dawn for my procedure at the hospital. We were supposed to stay another night; however, threatening storms were causing flight cancellations already. We were able to fly out that night, checking out at about 5 pm (late check-out privileges) so were actually charged for one night over all. Comfort was amazing, as were the much-talked-about pillows. An extra blanket was provided, when requested, as was a mini-fridge. Hard-wired internet was free (if you're a privileges member). Location was quite central. We had a king deluxe room -- reasonable size, extremely quiet, as per our request. Hospital stay rate was offered by staff, upon check-in, after we had already booked. Convenient choice of various eateries in the hotel itself, eliminating the need for trips outside to eat. Service was polite, prompt, courteous and above-and-beyond. Hope to return next time to actually 'see' Toronto as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loriesco
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I decided to go to the big smoke for a getaway! Based on previous trips we've never had any luck finding a half decent place for a good price so we decided to book online to ensure a nice place for a nice price. We thought about going through hotwire and priceline but am not too keen on the fact of not knowing where your staying until after you pay. Lucky for us we went on the Delta website and booked a room through that. We got 1 queen size bed room and when we got in the room it was like a shoebox. Not much room to move or breathe. Upon inspecting the room we noticed that it wasn't as clean as it should have been. So we called housekeeping and they offered to move us rooms. We gladly accepted and were upgraded to a king size suite. This made us very happy as it was twice the size of the original room. They did their best to accomodate us and would happily go back. The indoor slide was great!!!! The hours were crap though. We had enough time to do a couple runs so that was nice as that was the main reason for booking at this hotel. Parking was expensive but if you ask nicely at the front desk they will add extra hours onto your parking pass. This was very nice as they had gave us a late check out for 1pm and we're allowed to stay in the same parking lot until 6. The late chek out was great as well. Overall we were very impressed that this hotel was happy to help us and accommodate us in any way possible. I would definately go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Juvenile Delinquents roaming, not too bad of a stay, not great.”
Reviews.Author: JustinH
Reviews.Content: Bid a 3.5 star property on priceline for $68 and was assigned this room. Total charges with tax came to $89 for the night. We arrived at the hotel, to find that overnight parking was $31 per night including taxes. I have since learned that parking can be had cheaper in the parking lots next to the hotel, or across the street from the hotel. Check it out. Parking in the hotel had no benefits, we were on the 5th underground floor, and had to walk a mile to get to the room anyways. If you are going to pay for parking, you mine as well get Valet service ($5 additional I think).. At check-in, there were 2 people working the front desk. There were about 20-30 guests ahead of us in line. I had printed out a Delta Privilege card on the internet, so I was able to check in at the VIP desk with no wait. The woman running the VIP desk read me the riot act saying that since I booked with priceline, I wouldn't get any perks of the Privilege card (no free WIFI, no room upgrade), but she would "do me a favor" and let me check in with her. That was kind of rude, the woman went back to twiddling her thumbs while mobs of people waited in line after she checked us in. We were assigned a room with two double beds, not exactly romantic for my girlfriend and I. There was no choice in room (we understand this is how priceline works). We were also assigned a very dated room, there are newly remodeled rooms in this hotel and we did not get one of them. Our floor was filled with kids running around the hotel, hanging out in the hallways at all hours and throwing parties. The next morning there were tons of garbage and pizza boxes thrown in the hallways, it was weird to say the least. The plus side is that the room was very clean, yet very no frills for a supposed 3.5 star property. I would consider the accommodations to be no better than many 2.5 or 3 star properties I have stayed in before. Also those 2.5 or 3 star properties will include free breakfast, free parking, and free internet. The delta has none of this. The breakfast, parking, and internet were all overpriced. The huge plus side of the room is that it is walking distance to Younge street. There is a great British restaurant/pub right next to the restaurant on Younge street, we loved it. There are also several decent bars, and lots to see and do within walking distance. There is a very good place for breakfast called Eggspectations that is within walking distance of the room also. Way better than hotel food. The hotel had a very nice Adults only pool and spa. We used the pool, it was very clean. There was also a nice Sauna in the lockerrooms. We didn't use the spa because too many people were in it, but it looked fine. Apparently there is a water slide and a kids pool, but I had no interest in this.

Reviews.Title: “One of the chaviest hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: alexsw1
Reviews.Content: For the location and the overall facilities and look of the place this hotel attracts a lot of chavs. My stay was very mixed. Positives - the gym and pool (quite impressive for a hotel), turndown service (on request but was very good), staff (pleasant enough without being American/OTT). Negatives - my 'non smoking' floor was the smokiest, smelliest non-smoking floor ever. The room was little better. Scratches on furniture, mirror hung crookedly, generally tired looking. See previous comments about chavs - they were roaming the halls and gym with tins of beer, several on my floor were having parties in their rooms late into the night. The next morning the hall way was littered in left over food that was dropped by room service on clearing trays and other debris. Nice. Tips - this hotel does not have enough parking for all the guests. There is a $6 overnight parking next door on Elm Street that I ended up using when the lot was full. Wifi free in reception. If you pay cash like me rather than leave a credit card, they will ask for $250 - pretty high and apparently to ensure there is no smoking in the allegedly non smoking rooms. Delta Chelsea has never been great but it's in a good spot and I suppose all this being said I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, unhygienic, sloppy, rude customer service”
Reviews.Author: eattravellove
Reviews.Content: Here's a summary of what I endured during what will be my last stay at the Delta Chelsea: Short black hairs in my bedsheets and in my folded up towels (I have long blonde hair). A comforter with dried blood stains on it. A modem that did not work properly upon check in, took several hours to replace and still hardly qualified as high-speed internet; I couldn't do my business work with every webpage taking ages to download and thus was not able to meet my deadlines. A clerk who did not take my credit card details upon check in (as they had it on file), called me afterwards to ask me to bring it down at my convenience, and then rang my room at 8 a.m. the next morning, waking me up to ask why I had not brought it down yet. When I remarked to her manager that I was a gold privilege member who has stayed at Delta hotels 15-20 times in the past year alone, she replied, "So what? We have Platinum Plus members who run out on their bills all the time." I encountered the same kinds of flippant answers from other staff I spoke with. In-room dining was a disaster; a fruit plate sent to my room on behalf of a friend consisted of bruised, browning, completely inedible fruit that had to go straight into the garbage. There was no card to identify who it was from, although he had requested one. Best part of my stay was, most appropriately, when I left. The doorman at this hotel is consistently attentive and on top of things, which is more than what I can say for any of the staff I encountered during my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but extra charge on credit card was a surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Kodie123
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night package deal through central reservations which included room and breakfast for two. Room was comfortable and breakfast was good. Upon check-out, received a copy of my room charge which was accurate. A few days after check-out realized that the hotel had hit my credit card with an additional charge of close to $50. I enquired about this charge and was advised that someone at the hotel (not sure if it was the front desk or the billing dept) had added an add'l charge for the breakfast for two, although my reservation was clearly marked as a breakfast package offered by the hotel. The hotel remedied the mistake very quickly, but be careful if you stay at the Delta Chelsea for any errors like this, as the hotel didn't catch this extra charge and it wasn't listed on my check-out confirmation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: tymaca
Reviews.Content: I must say, the entrance and lobby of the hotel is very lively and exciting. I definitely felt like it was a very happening place to be in Toronto. The kids had their own special check-in where they got goodie bags filled with toys. I read other reviews that said to sign-up for their Delta Privilege club (which is FREE!), and had a speedy check-in at the Privilege desk. No line and great service. They gave me a room on a floor that I wanted with a great view. You also get free internet with this membership, but you have to have them remove it from your bill because it automatically charges you when you first go online. Had I not checked over my bill, I would have paid the !13.95 plus taxes for my advertised "free" internet. They were happy to remove when I called. The room was pretty small to get around (2 double beds), but for the price it was worth the tight quarters. My son ordered an extra blanket that they brought up immediately, and then called a bit later to make sure we received it and we were satisfied. So, the customer service was excellent! The kids loved the pool and water slide! We were there on a weekend, and the kids basically had the pool all to themselves, which was awesome. There is a game room and an area for little kids to play. You do have to pay $28 for packing, but that is pretty standard in a big city. Overall, it was a great location to stay with the kids and we would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and relaxing, the best nights sleep I've had in a while.”
Reviews.Author: JustMeHello
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms. Staff is excellent, always give that little extra that makes you want to stay longer then planned. Location, location, location.. unbeatable, so close to everything that is the best of Toronto. Walking or a short taxi ride is all it takes. The staff is so helpful and will let you know what is happening in and around the area so your days and nights can be spent out being entertained or you can just as easily stay in and enjoy the pools, bar, and restaurants. I was very impressed with the beds and the bedding, what can I say! Best nights sleep I have ever had in a hotel. The Delta Chelsea has never let me down when I needed a good nights rest before heading out the next day.

Reviews.Title: “The Delta Chelsea is our home away from home!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlene040
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love the Delta Chelsea! It's where we spent our honeymoon 6 years ago and we faithfully return at least 2 times during the summer for our 'family summer vacation' now that we have a little girl, Carolyn! She asks every spring when we'll be going to our 'cottage', The Delta Chelsea in TO. She says it's better than a cottage because of your amazing water slide that Daddy has to go down at least 2 times just for his little girl! Since we live East of Whitby, my husband & I have stayed at the Delta for a grown up night away and we've had an amazing time seeing the live jazz entertainment at the Monarch's Pub in the Delta. We just have to make sure we DON'T tell our little girl where we are going because we'd never get out of the house without her! :) The Delta is definitely our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the location and spend as little time as you can in your room”
Reviews.Author: Breannlisa
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, Very close to Eton Center and right where the action is. The lobby and common areas seemed very nice and clean. My room was pretty small, seemed outdated and yellow tinged. The balcony was tiny and though a sign stated no smoking, there were cigarette butts all over it. Overall, Staff was grear and I would stay there again for location but if you are looking for top notch accomodations, go to a newer facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AverageTravelGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a Saturday night in January. Parking in the underground lot was easy but cost $30 with in and out privileges. Lots of spots available. Not labled well though - we went in a few circles! An elevator took you from the parking lot directly to the front desk. Check in was nice, easy and fast. Request for late check out of 1PM was granted with no hassle. Rooms were somewhat small. The beds looked massive in the room! Bathroom was small. Had to close the door to get in the shower. But the rooms were CLEAN! Bathroom was also clean. A call to the front desk for 2 robes and shower caps was pleasantly answered, followed by a phone call from guest services to see if we received the robes and if we needed anything else. Hotel was very quiet this night. I wake up over little noises but I had no problems this stay. Different colour elevators made it easy to find our way around the hotel. The bar/lounge downstairs was nice. Good light menu, but somewhat slow service. Overall, a very pleasant stay with no issues!

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed”
Reviews.Author: gortca
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the pool and spa, the Bb33 was a great place to eat as well as the market garden place

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: waterloo65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks and traveled around Toronto i read alot of bad reviews before arriving well i thought this hotel was excellent. The staff were really helpful and polite nothing was too much trouble. Took the advice of a former guest and joined the privalidge club it is free to join and you get a free upgrade, late checkout and seperate checking in desk. Would recommend this hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: retiredinottawa_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before on business and always enjoyed the service. Now retired and looking forward to spending weekends to visit family, and decided to choose same hotel. Location is very convenient. Cleanliness, service, and value are also important and hotel delivers.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the relaxed atomphere and the people are great.”
Reviews.Author: trippedup05
Reviews.Content: The service was great and the staff was very professional and super friendly.The rooms were very clean as they always are when we are staying at The Delta.The beds are super comfortable and that is saying alot as I don't sleep well i hotels but I did at The Delta.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to a holiday”
Reviews.Author: HambletonTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the start of a 17 day tour of Southern Ontario. Great location for sightseeing in the city. Good welcome after a long flight, with a helpful reception and the offer of luggage assistance. It has a very smart feel to the lobby area, with excellent signage for bars, restaurant and the, if somewhat slightly confusing, numerous lifts, some only go to certain floors. Modern feel to the corridors, light and comforting, and the room was excellent. Large bed, really comfortable, with a good blackout so sleeping was good, it would have been excellent except for the sound of the night time building work opposite (but not the hotel's fault). Good shower and refreshingly fluffy and clean towels. The swimming pool was excellent and the roof top view is breathtaking. We didn't eat in the hotel, there are so many diners and restaurants in the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Value In Toronto”
Reviews.Author: GreyCup
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything going for it. location, price, restaurants, quiet and comfort. Great rooftop pool and gym area along with a sun deck for summertime lounging. Being a Delta Privilege member has some great perks such as priority check in counter. I'm back again in a couple of weeks. Only downside is the price for parking. $25.00 a day is 1/4 of the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... value!”
Reviews.Author: travellersnb
Reviews.Content: We love the Delta Chelsea! We stay with them every year as we come to Toronto for our son's check ups at the Hospital for Sick Children. We find the newer rooms are well appointed and renovated. The options for dining are really nice.. the Market Garden is casual and easy for dining with children.. nice salad bar.. made to order meals.. staff at the check out are never very friendly.. but have been there for years! The cooks are great and helpful in making sure kids get what they want! The nicer restaurant on the Gerrard entrance is awesome.. we enjoy the breakfast buffet on the weekends and lovely dinners in a finer dining atmosphere at a reasonable price. Monarchs Pub also nice for a drink or a quick bite even with the kids in the early evening.. or afternoon. The children's center is great, lots of activities to keep kids busy.. you can stay and play with your kids or for a fee leave them their with the staff.. my son enjoys painting and all the arts and crafts.. might be nice if the staff were more involved with the kids and directing them on projects than just sitting holding down the fort.. but still a nice place to spend time with your children. The pool is good, my older son loves the water slide.. but my younger son finds the pool water too cold and hot tub too hot.. so we usually avoid it. Great location.. walking distance to Eaton Center and all kinds of shopping.. as we are here to attend appointments at Sick Kids.. the location couldnt be better.. across a little side street and we are there! I think for the price in a major city.. this hotel offers lots for the money!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: jimjim021
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights on business. After staying at another horible hotel in Kitchener, Ontario this was much better! Hotel had great front desk agents, rooms were clean and quiet. I would stay there again! Great Job & Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: CamilleMcCue
Reviews.Content: When booking a room at a hotel do you consider the following: comfort, family and adult facilities, friendly-helpful staff, cleanliness, great food, nightlife, discount tickets to local theatres and last but not least location, location, location!! If all of these wonderful qualities are what you look for in a hotel, don't delay, book at the Delta Chelsea today!! The Delta Chelsea is truly a home away from home!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beds and pillows”
Reviews.Author: LizWaterloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Friday and Saturday night in January for a Music conference and were very impressed with every aspect of the hotel. The staff are professional, friendly and very helpful. Yes the furniture is dated but the rooms were immaculate and the beds and pillows were the best I've ever slept on. I actually had to find out the supplier of the pillows and they happily provided the company info. The location is close to everything so that you don't need to use your car and they had excellent packages available at booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a prime location!”
Reviews.Author: janne57
Reviews.Content: We love to take the kids to Toronto every Christmas vacation and we always stay at the Delta Chelsea. Once you have parked your car, you won't need it again until you are ready to go home. It is within walking distance of great shopping, theatre, galleries and museums. It is in the heart of downtown Toronto. There are great restaurants close by and also great restaurants in the Delta Chelsea. If you like buffets for brunch or supper, then the restaurant in the Delta Chelsea is the place to be. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is warm and friendly. Truly, can't think of anything we'd change. Oh, also find out about their great package deals too!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! COMFY BEDS, GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: KandBF
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed herq fairly often, we call it our little getaway from home. Its a nice hotel, beautiful loby and amazing look outs on the top floor, where the adult pool is. Amazing view of the CN Tower. The Adult pool is chilly, but the hot tub with the amazing view is perfect! The beds are extremly comfortable and always clean. I hate how people comment on the floor of the rooms, i mean of course there are going to be stains kids stay at this hotel so get over it! The staff are always friendly and always willing to help if you need them. We always get drinks at the elm street bar which is nice and relaxing and the bar tenders are really nice and always give you tasty peanuts haha. The one good thing about the delta chelsea is you are close to basically everything, which is key because who wants to drive in the downtown area its way to busy! Overall we love this hotel and we always go atleast 2-3x/year. We are staying there again in Feb and we can't wait we are so excited!

Reviews.Title: “You'll be going back.”
Reviews.Author: 19Cheri73
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel for families traveling with children. The Activity Centre caters to the kids in the best ways. Their babysitting service caters to the parents. The staff is very friendly, they remembered our kids names each time we went back, they even sent birthday cards during the year! Our kids have been to every province, but all they can talk about is the Delta Chelsea. The folks at the Bell desk are awesome. The hotel is steps away from the Toronto Eaton Centre, the dining selection is excellent and varied. We first stayed there in 2007 and have been back every year since. Heading there again this week! : )

Reviews.Title: “Rowdy on Weekends”
Reviews.Author: Weerobbie
Reviews.Content: I hosted a conference of about 40 people at this hotel over a weekend. While the conference facilities were good and the staff support to the conference very good, the hotel floors were loud and rowdy throughout the friday and saturday nights making it a terrible location for serious work. The conferences rates were very good value and the food served (breakfast and lunch) good and well presented. My bedroom room was small but was connected to a meeting room. Although the furniture in the meeting room was worn and a bit cheap, it was an extremely effective room. My bedroom and bathroom were clean but worn. The bed was too soft and sagged in the middle. The entire hotel was extremely cold (the coldest I have ever stayed in). My collegues and I would have been satisfied with the hotel had it not been for the partying. The Friday night I was woken a number of times by a party on my floor. The Saturday night a number of my collegues couldn't sleep due to a loud party on their floor - slamming doors, loud knocking, loud conversations in the hallway and running in the halls.
