Even though security came up numerous times, it didn't end until 4 AM Sunday. The end result was that I had VERY tired people at my conference. When my Administrative Assistant complained at the Front Desk on Sunday AM, she was told partying on the weekend is normal - a completely unacceptable answer from my perspective. I will not stay at this hotel again as I cannot be assured of a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ethan88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times with family. We love that it is a short walk to the Eaton Center and downtown. The food is very good. The hotel rooms look like they have been renovated recently. The pool has the only water slide in downtown and it is a is a good place to go with younger kids. This is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rochachakelly
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal on priceline (try there first!), the room was very nice, very basic. The lobby is really amazing - we were there near Christmas and everything was lit up and beautiful (there was even a Santa in the lobby!). The location is great. Concierge helped us find a really wonderful Thai restaurant next door (Bangkok Garden - good food and right outside the hotel), and a coffee spot the next morning. Overall, a great spot to stay, would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a good expierence”
Reviews.Author: travelingsteveo
Reviews.Content: I arrived here on a Sunday early around 12pm and i was able to check in early. The room was nice and very clean, housekeeping did a good job. I enjoyed the fitness and pool room on the 27th floor, there are tall glass windows so you can see a cool view of the city such as the cn tower while you are working out. Everyone was very friendy. I had a late flight home so i asked the bellhop if he could store my luggage for several hours, he did an excellent job, then he directed me to a shuttle bus to the airport. I was very pleased with my stay. I

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location is average”
Reviews.Author: Aliceesjan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel. The rooms are ok, service is ok, everything is a little bit average. Not bad, but not special either. I have slept in another hotel in Toronto and would prefer that hotel to stay downtown. Furthermore the hotel is located a little bit on the outskirt of where I spend my time when being there.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel so much to do”
Reviews.Author: chloenerdypie8di
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best hotels i have been to there was alot for the kids to do and for different ages as one is 13 and the other is 9. The pool was open long hours and the staff are amazing. The beds i stayed in were so comerfatable and there was alot on the tv the food was great and the hotel was very clean. there was lots of lifts so you dont have to que and the room was cleaned every day and the hotel was right in the centre of everything

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff - terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: nemo500
Reviews.Content: From other reviews on Trip Advisor, we knew the Delta Chelsea was going to be a busy hotel, but nothing prepared us for the overcrowded lobby, long waits for lifts or complete unfriendliness of the staff! We were in town for a friends wedding, and while the location was great everything else was terrible! The price of our room certainly did not reflect what we got! We reserved a wheelchair accessible room and while the bathroom was functional for that purpose, the room was tiny and cramped by anyones standards! On arrival we were handed our key and not time was given to explain anything about the hotel (eg which lift to take, where certain amenities were etc). Concierge staff were particularly unhelpful and when I asked specifically where I could buy laundry powder I was sent on a wild goose chase which eventually lead back to the concierge desk! When I asked again she said "oh do you mean laundry detergent?". After some further not so helpful directions I ended up at the Kids area where you buy the laundry detergent. There was a frazzled looking staff member with hyped up kids everywhere, chasing a traumatized bunny rabbit around my feet who was able to sell me some detergent! Parking was a whole other nightmare most easily summed up by saying staff had no idea what the procedure was when we got a car on the second day of our stay! I can honestly say that we only came across one staff member that was helpful and friendly in our whole stay. This hotel was utterly disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “terrific location and super friendly staff/great service but tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: solotravelar
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed, flat screen tv, EXCELLENT in room service and super courteous friendly staff. I arrived late and was hungry, asked for a meal to be delivered and was really impressed. First class service, certainly expensive but very convenient specially when it's late and -15 Â°C outside... Negative points : #1 : no free wifi in the rooms. Come on we are in 2010 !!!!! #2 : the room, although updated, was with average/poor quality materials (except for the bed). You do see peeling wallpaper in the walls, sofa had a huge, visible and disgusting stain, but seemed clean. Location, location, location... Bathroom was super clean. I would recommend and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: fluffernuffer
Reviews.Content: We booked adjoining rooms for my wife and I and 3 children (15, 12, and 8). We arrived at 4pm (after a 5 hour car ride) and the rooms weren't cleaned or ready (check-in is at 3). The staff was unapologetic and somewhat rude, telling us it was going to be at least another hour before we could check-in. Fine, we waited in the lobby with our luggage for an hour. After an hour, they told us we could check-in to ONE of the rooms (the other one was to be ready within 30 minutes). We went up to the room and waited for the other to be opened. And we waited... And we waited... Finally, after an hour we called down again to unresponsive staff. It took nearly 3 hours to sort that mess out. To top it off, the rooms were dirty and cramped. Our shower curtain smelled moldy (no fans in the bathrooms) and there was toothpaste splatter on the soap display, mirror and wall. GROSS! I could go on and on. One positive, the beds were comfortable. The place is in serious need of a renovation. Until then, I'll be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vancouversurfergirl
Reviews.Content: I was booked in at another hotel nearby but I have family members that stay regularly at the Delta Chelsea and they convinced me to try it. I should not have listened - this was my first stay at the hotel and my last. My check in experience was disappointing and my room was dirty when I finally made it to the room. It also did not have a bar fridge and when I requested a cot in the room for one night, there was not even room to unfold it. (and I was already paying more for an "upgraded" room). I had emailed ahead with my special request and would have appreciated being told at that time that the room would not fit a cot so I could change my plans. When I reported my concerns to the front desk I was told I would need to pay more and "upgrade" again as a cot would not fit in any of the rooms with a king bed and to get a fridge. There was no apology whatsoever for the massive stain and vegetable parts that were dried on to the drapes in my existing room. We were booked in for three nights and within the first hour of our stay there were regretting making the decision we did. I then waited for 30 minutes for a porter to help me move my items to the room that I now had to pay even more for. A couple of other things happened that made our experience even worse but not enough to get into here. Our new room had a broken lamp in it but otherwise was fine. I don't have much good to say about the Delta itself except the bed was incredibly comfortable. Also, the location was good - can walk to downtown- with a good selection of restaurants nearby and the restaurants in the hotel were not bad for breakfast options too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price/location”
Reviews.Author: kjeanveau
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through priceline for $80 when the posted rate on expedia was $165. Upon check in, we were told that our room was two doubles and that no single queen/king was available in the entire hotel. Having a husband that tosses and turns, both of us sharing a double wasn't in the cards, so we we actually used separate beds! Room seemed a bit older/dated with and old tube tv, but was clean and the bed linens were very soft. Fire alarm went off for about 15 minutes around 10 pm, which was annoying. Room service was expensive - $18 for a glorified continental breakfast, so I recommend passing on that! Parking was also expensive -$28 and we were told that while we had in/out privileges, if we left, we may not find another spot upon our return. It's 3.5* rating is accurate, and while nothing was particularly lacking, it wasn't amazing. I would stay there again if I could pay the discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: time_well_wasted
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the late evening after nearly 12 hours of travel to discover the building under siege due to a labour dispute. The doors were blocked by large groups of pickets.shouting slogans and generally intimidating customers. They also held up customer who were leaving and entering the expensive parking area for a minimum of 5 minutes per car I waited 10 minutes for the privilege of entering. When I booked the room 2 days earlier nothing was said on the website that there was a labor action going on and it wasn't until I had checked in that I was presented with a notice saying most basic services were unavailable due to the strike. despite not getting basic maid service and most restaurants in the complex being shut I tried to be philosophical about it . After returning home I went to Deltalistens website hoping to advise them of my concern about failing to notify customers of the strike only to discover that the site does not allow you to discuss anything with Delta but it is a site using Delta's name to farm personal information for the IPSO Research Agency who I suppose kicks back dollars to Delta for every unwary customer with a legitimate concern..... My recommendation stay away from the Delta Chelsey they have all the morals of a gutter rat. while smiling politely.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel workers on strike do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: navsan
Reviews.Content: The hotel workers walked of the job on the 28th 0ct 2010 I had the misfortune of checking in on the 28th itself. had to check out after two days, lack of service room not cleaned no restaurant open.super 8 motel has better service than this hotel. there is no end to the strike.

Reviews.Title: “Service is still great, as usual, staff is very polite and friendly”
Reviews.Author: rudolf4cancerrun
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is on strike, it is a bit inconvenient because the parking garage is being blocked by the picketers, however, the hotel does comp parking for the wait. We waited for about 5 min to get it, yes it is frustrating, but it is definately not Delta's fault that it is happening. Some of the protesters were chanting "dirty rooms, do not check in" and that is just absurd. We were assured by the front desk staff that rooms are in order as usual and they were, we even got a free upgrade so that we do not hear the protesters as much. I mean how great is this. One restaurant and one bar were closed, and that is the only limit to the the service that has happened, the rest is open and in full operation. If anything the service has improved, because rooms are being cleaned by directors and managers, and the food is being served by the GM and the executive chefs. We were quite impressed by the service. Housekeeping was limited at first, but now that the situation is more under control we were able to get full service, all we had to do was request it, and that is not hard to do because it is one phone call away. The price was a little high for the situation, but we got a free upgrade to a better room and free parking, upon check out we were offered 10% off by the manager of front desk. The hotel is in a great location for everything, basicly 20 min walk from the farthest point. If you are looking to travel for cultural reasons or business definately a good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Staycee80
Reviews.Content: Myself and 6 of my girlfriends travelled to Toronto for the weekend on Oct. 21 to celebrate my birthday and see the musical Wicked. I booked our rooms online through Travelzoo and got a rate of $115/night, which I thought was a great deal. I had done a LOT of research before selecting a hotel as I did not want to stay in a dump for 3 nights, and was a bit wary as the Delta Chelsea had mixed reviews...I'm so glad I decided to try it for myself! I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. The Airport Shuttle drops you off right on the doorstep of the hotel. Upon check in I asked the front desk clerk if I could possibly get free room upgrades, and he was happy to oblige (and made sure we still had adjoining rooms). I also asked to have fans and mini fridges for both rooms and they were brought up within minutes of arriving. One of my girlfriends had called ahead and asked if they could decorate my room for my birthday, so I arrived to a large wall banner and balloons everywhere, plus a complimentary tray was sent up with wine, cheese, crackers, fruit, cookies and milk. The second day they sent up a dessert of chocolates and dipped fruits. Any time we asked any staff member anything they were super nice and helpful, and made you feel right at home. We had 3 and 4 people per room so we went through towels fairly quickly but it was never an issue to get more. The beds were amazingly comfortable, and despite having 4 occupants the room never felt too small. Loved that we could walk out onto a balcony. The adult-only pool and hot tub on the 27th floor are a great feature. Despite reading numerous complaints about the noise, I heard very little from the hallway, other rooms or outdoors. We didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants but we did visit Monarchs Pub a couple of times and enjoyed the atmosphere there. Maybe the biggest selling point of this hotel to me is location. Minutes walk to our theatre, the Eaton Centre and the "Times Square" of Toronto, and with 4 entrances bordering different streets, it took no time to get anywhere, even in heels! The only complaint I have (and this is very minor) is that the rooms didn't have free internet. You could get WiFi in the lobby for free but if you wanted to use it in your room it cost $13.95 per day. This is kinda ridiculous in this day and age where most places have free WiFi, but is certainly not a deal breaker to stay at this hotel. Overall I LOVED it there and can't wait for my next trip to Toronto to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY Businees as usual- not”
Reviews.Author: travellots03
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on strike and when I booked for a four day stay they said that it was business as usual!!!!! There was no service in the hotel room- no clean up in the room- nothing. and they still charge the going rate! full rate for parking even if you had to wait to get in and out and cross the picket lines - Business as usual! - no way

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is on Strike!”
Reviews.Author: Mykil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the hotel on the evening of 29 October for a getaway trip. We called the reservation desk at the hotel directly on Thursday and made our reservation with them. We were not told the hotel workers had gone on strike on Wednesday! We were greeted by polite but noisy hotel workers on strike but had no problem crossing the picket line. Our room was dirty, beds were haphazardly made, bathroom was disgusting with only one bath towel, face cloth and hand towel. No soaps or other vanity items. It appears management is trying to run the over1550 room hotel by themselves. There is no room service, one restaurant is open but it is over priced and the quality of food sub par. Staff are short tempered and no bars are open. Exiting and Entering the hotel means crossing a picket line and that was tough to do morally. Again, the striking workers were most polite and gave us no grief crossing the picket line. The noise was constant sun up to sundown. The atmosphere is tense inside the hotel with all sorts of security guards and cameras videotaping everything. We checked out Saturday evening at midnight and the Front Desk refused to compensate us for the mess we entered. We are in another hotel at a cheaper rate that has real food and now happy. Funny, the striking workers were kinder to us than the inside staff. What a shame, it was once such a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad situation - made worse by the response of Management”
Reviews.Author: BdaVisitor
Reviews.Content: As we were travelling with young children, our family decided to get a one bedroom suite, and a "Family Fun" room, which looked great on the website. On arrival the hotel looks very nice, and the staff were accommodating when we realized that our rooms were further apart than hoped. Unfortunately, it started to go downhill from there. When we got into the one bed suite, it didn't appear to be very clean (to the point where the last guests old lettuce leaves were still on the fridge shelves). This wasn't a huge deal, and as it was we had to move rooms as the door handle was broken. The Family Fun room had stains on the carpet (I realize that accidents happen with kids, but there are ways of cleaning carpeting) and the play area was nothing like that shown on the website. Instead, it was a small childrens table, two stools and a chalkboard. It was a bit disappointing. On the first night we got room service, and although it took a little while to get to the room, it was very nice. As we were watching the news that night, we saw that the hotel workers were going to be going on strike - the next day. At 6am the next morning we woke to construction directly across the road. We weren't warned about this beforehand. At 7am the protesters kicked in, with drums and loudspeakers and whistles. This carried on until about 7- 8pm for the remaining 4 days that we were there. The staff protesting were housekeeping and in-room dining, so that meant that the rooms were not serviced, we were not able to get room service, and 2 of the restaurants were shut during that time. We realize that the situation was unusual, and cleaned our own rooms and ate elsewhere or cooked in-room for ourselves during that time. We did eventually receive notification from Management about the strike, at just before noon on the day it began due to a note slipped under our door. Upon checkout we discussed with the desk attendant the compensation they were offering due to the lack of services available during the strike. They indicated that none were being offered. My husband then bought up that there is a leaflet in each bathroom indicating that, if you are not happy with your stay, they would give you the first night free! She spoke to a manager and it was agreed that of the five nights, one would be free. We were very happy. Later in the day, another Manager called and indicated that the person we spoke to that morning did not have the authority to give us the discount. We mentioned that we were very unhappy, and while we realize it was unusual circumstances the fact of the matter is that we did not receive the services we expected, and compensation should be offered. The manager indicated that they did tell us about the strike - true, but AFTER we found out on the news the night before. We then mentioned the promise to give the first night free if unhappy - apparently this is null and void under strike circumstances (though that small detail wasn't mentioned on the leaflet). After some more back and forth with the Manager, she informed us that we always had the option to stay somewhere else. Next time we will. I do believe that if service was operational as usual, I would have been quite satisfied with the stay. The location was convenient, and kids enjoyed the Family Fun Centre and adjacent pool. And had we been able to order room service again, I have no doubt it would have been good. The rooms left a bit to be desired for a 4-star hotel, and were dated, not as clean as one would expect, and we weren't able to go out on the balconies thanks to the amount of bird poop. Ultimately, thanks to the response of Management, we would not consider staying again, and certainly would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: notpei
Reviews.Content: Am presently staying at the delta with family who are undergoing testing at the hospital. The room upon arrival was a disappointment. It is very small, and not clean. Obsviously it hadn't been thourghly cleaned before our arrival. The support staff went on strike during our stay........need I say more, all the comforts were are being charged for are not being provided, not to mention the noise level at all entrances due to the workers picketing. The bed linens are lumpy beyond statement. Would not stay here again! The only positive thing is the location for our purpose. The food is way overpriced in the hotel resturants, dined out at a resturant nearby after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- If you're college age”
Reviews.Author: ck231
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Super8's which were nicer than this hotel. The hotel staff although friendly enough, were completely inept, with long waits for service and a lack of communication between front-desk managers. Our "modern, renovated room, with a balcony overlooking the city" was run-down with threadbare carpets, a disgusting, mildewy bathroom and a balcony consisting of crumbling concrete with a view facing a wall. Upon arrival, we found the lobby full-of drunken, rowdy twenty-somethings. I would highly recommend paying the extra few dollars to stay at one of the areas nicer hotels and skip this one. This was my first and final stay in a Delta hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrborders
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Delta Chelsea one night and I'm shocked at how loud the construction is next door. They started before 630am and the sounds include jackhammers and someone yelling over a loud speaker. I also felt this hotel is totally old, smells musty, and floored that they charge a $4 delivery fee plus gratuity for room service. Wish they had mentioned that when i ordered a $5 icecream! Thank God I only had to stay one night!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth its price”
Reviews.Author: vincentmontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night for a rate of $160cad that didn't include wireless internet (tough these days you almost never do) I was mostly shocked when I received my bill showing an amount of 2.75 for a call which was to a toll free number.. This is quite a flat fee !! The room itself was handicapped accesible which I was not even made aware of at the time of checking-in.Â  There was hardly any space between the bed and the TV. I have to note that the bed and pillows were quite confortable. I went to the "market style" breakfast place and was charge hefty $23 for an omelette, a yogurt with fruits and a coffee..Â  Other than being conveniently located, I wouldn't recommend it for its price.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cutewife
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Delta Chelsea. There was a problem with our TV - we could not order a movie - and the staff was very responsive. Comfortable beds, clean and spacious rooms - it was perfect. I don't recommend the food however, both the restaurants left much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: arich21
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 10nights and everynight was fantastic, on arriving the staff were very helpful we immediately got upgraded to a larger room in the hotel with a better view of the city. The room was very clean and had been modernized recently. The bed was comfy. We were helped with our enquires to every detail on looking for places to go by the staff. Everything we wanted to do was within walking distance (except the zoo on which the staff told us the subways to take and the bus number aswel). This is a hotel i would definatly use again although walking through the lobby it was always full of people and lots of children we were never disturbed in our room once by the noise in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “more than what i expected for a good price”
Reviews.Author: smcgolrick
Reviews.Content: this hotel had much more to offer than i was expecting for such a low price. We paid approx $150 per night and it was worth it. The room was tight..and the balcony left much to be desired, but it was all we wanted (2 girls on a friend weekend away). Couldn't hear anything in other rooms either, so that's always a bonus! Decent gym as well (lot's of weights and equipment and heaps of treadmills and cross trainers). Pool looked good as well and there was a hot tub. Tools availble to guests. it's right downtown, close to a lot so convenience is definately key. It's a very big hotel, with a restaurant that didn't look that great, but two pubs that had decent pub food. And wireless is free downstairs...that was great!! I would recommend this hotel to friends and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no so great room.”
Reviews.Author: jackc00
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I chose to stay at this hotel for its great location. As good as its location is, we immediately encountered a problem when we were checking in. We spent about 20mins checking in only because they had checked somebody else earlier into our room. They made up by giving us a breakfast voucher and "upgraded" us to a suite with a kitchen. The bads, The room was not very inspring and the room smelled like paint and glue (from recent renovation). The thermostat in our room was NOT always working (which made the paint/glue smell even worse) and the fan kept on spitting out white dust particles (probably from the renovation). The whole situation was extremely irritating to say the very least. The sound proof wasn't anything spectacular either. Anything goes on in the hallway pretty much goes right thru the door. The goods, Provided that our room was a suite with kitchen, Delta was nice enough to complete the suite with all imaginable kitchen necessities (eg, kitchenware [pots, pan], sliver ware and appliance [microwave, frig, coffee machine and stove]). It's very convenient for those who wanna cook (but who would when there are tons of restaurants right around them?!?!?). The mattress was very comfortable. Summing it up... The location is GREAT but I wouldn't stay here (crappy room by my standard) if I had not found a good rate (we paid $79 + TAX/night) thru online deal sites...

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy and Still Here??????”
Reviews.Author: sunshine4evur2010
Reviews.Content: I am here because of a pain clinic I am attending. So it is neither business or leisure. I have had no laundry facilities in the women's change room on 2nd floor to which I have asked something be done( am on 3rd week and in men's change room doing laundry) very humiliating. When speaking with to me the appropriate people I am asked to go to their floor or office they do not come to me. Did I mention I am her for a pain clinic meaning in pain 24/7 and when asked to travel to other floors or other offices when I can hardly move after a vigorous week or day at hospital is ridiculous.even if I wasn't in pain where is the CUSTOMER SERVICE?. I had something delivered to my room by mistake and I called and notified guest services so they could deliver to right room. Last night I spoke to a manager at front desk (OCT 24) about laundry and he said some one would speak to me last night . Still waiting was in room all night. I have 4 weeks left and if possible I will get company to move me pretty sad. That is very inconvenient for me sort of like my whole stay has been. I will say the food and cleaning staff have gone above and beyond to do whatever they can I am not hard to please you can ask them. They have been fantastic from the servers, chefs, and managers all great personalities. My weekly cleaning lady she has tried to make it as easy as possible for me knowing I am away from my family and living out of my element. Cudo's to them. I would love to hearfrom someone with some sort of authority I never have since I have been losing my patience....Communication from each facility is a big thing if something isn't working notify front desk so guests can find out before travelling to area.. Thanks----Cindy .

Reviews.Title: “Great bed”
Reviews.Author: Patsy186605
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here, arriving Friday Oct 15. I booked with Expedia and paid 170 Canadian dollars per night, which I thought a bit dear. I had a room on the fifth floor, accessed by the red elevators. It was quiet though I could very occasionally hear groups of people passing by. The best thing about the room was the beds. Mine was extremely comfortable. I could have done with a (plastic) teaspoon instead of a pair of plastic mini chopsticks. I thought the lobby was like Grand Central Station, and it looked shabby. There were queues for checking in and out but they moved quickly. I could leave my bags the day I checked out and got the coach to the airport just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes your stay excellent”
Reviews.Author: timmer101
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta Chelsea a few times now, as I will be again in a few days. I was surprised to read some of the reviews I just came across. I have had great experiences at the Delta Chelsea. Sure some of the rooms need updating but it is a big spot. What always makes the trip for me is the staff. What a fantastic group of people. This hotel has a great central location, 2 pools, great restaurants in the hotel and nearby, but what really makes it is the outstanding service provided by the staff. They are every willing to help. I thank them and look forward to my upcoming stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadianvacati0n
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location. I knew it was not one of the best hotels but expected to be descent. The room was facing to a busy street, we could hear the noise from the street all night long and noise from neighboring rooms. I did not get a good night sleep. And there is no fridge in the room... I will not return there again nor recommend anyone but maybe teenagers who are there to party to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizanton
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in this hotel in Toronto. Like Toronto itself, the hotel is quite expensive but the double room was lovely with two large double beds, very comfortable. Food was good though expensive. Staff were extremely helpful. Adult only swimming pool is on the top floor of the hotel, alongside the gym and there is a small sun terrace also. (There is a children's pool on the 2nd floor.) If you want to take any trips, e.g. to Niagara Falls, then book in the hotel itself. They couldn't do more to assist and really do know all about what is available and make sure you get booked on the correct trip. Hotel location was convenient for public transport. Toronto public transport is excellent, expecially the subway which links to buses and trams to enable travelling all around Toronto. Hotel staff are knowledgable about transport and the people of Toronto are very helpful. We found that if we asked someone in the street for directions, several people would come forward to help. We had a trip to Niagara and that was wonderful. All in all, our trip to Toronto was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Hair in tub, old small shabby rooms, cheap for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: reflectionofvenus
Reviews.Content: Thought we had hit the jackpot, a sale from travelzoo at 99.00 per night. Delta is usually a luxurious hotel, but very bad experience. Big black stran of hair in the tub, shabby old wallpaper which was peeling, rooms were so small there was no place to put luggage, carpet old and disgusting. Complained to the front desk about cleanliness, was told I would have to pay the difference, which was not my 99.00 bargain. She explained it was the old part of the hotel. Purchased internet, which was slow and didn't work right-don't waste your money.BUYER BEWARE! Go somewhere else! I was a delta privilage member-won't be doing that again.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest hotel in the Commonwealth”
Reviews.Author: ChurchgateDevon
Reviews.Content: The title says it all - it is more like entering a railway concourse when you check-in. This hotel has it all with 5 restaurants and many hundreds of guests so can be very busy at times. Great for tours as it is on the route for all major tour companies. With 5 restaurants there is plenty of choice of menus, but there are also many eating places just around the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel , there are better out there”
Reviews.Author: alanp_117
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a large, complex thst needs updating, rooms were ok, although some of the bthroom fittings looked as if they were about to fall off. The area the hotel is in is slightly seedy and made me feel slightly unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: cultureseeker_10
Reviews.Content: My son and I have just returned from a wonderful stay in the Delta Chelsea. I felt compelled to write a review after reading some of the other less than complimentary reports from others on this site, if only to serve to reassure anyone who has booked this hotel and is now wondering if they've made the right decision! I am left wondering if some of these people actually nitpick for the sake of it - as reading these reviews I struggle to believe we were staying in the same hotel!! We secured a really good deal through laterooms and after requesting the recently refurbished rooms (as advised by another reviewer on this site) we were given a huge room with the most comfortable beds and pristine bedlinen and fantastic views of the CN Tower. Toiletries were replenished daily along with the fluffy white towels. Free newspapers were also delivered to the room on a daily basis. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and we found the breakfasts in the hotel to be reasonably priced with a plentiful selection of fresh food cooked to order. As for the building work - we think it was on Gerrard Street - but were so unaffected by it we simply don't remember! We can't comment on noise levels from the work as our room was lovely and quiet. People should remember they are in a large city and birds, traffic, building and even the occasional down and out are all part of city life. By the way we were also there the night the fire alarm went off, but these things happen and no one panicked and everything was fine after twenty minutes or so so what was the problem?? Thanks Delta Chelsea we had a great stay and would definitely recommend you to others.

Reviews.Title: “I would prefer a quieter location”
Reviews.Author: kangarooboy
Reviews.Content: A little noisy at night.Hotel is close to a semi-seedy area.Business centre lady not helpful. If I had a choice again I would not stay here. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a touch up and a bit more”
Reviews.Author: mike787
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from holiday I thought it best I write straight away. The hotel is in a good location but it is in need of a coat of paint, it looks drab inside. The worst thing is to be prepared for building works on two adjacent roads and these works will be lasting a long time, (looks like construction of two new blocks is taking place and is at an early stage). So at 6.45am you will be awake. The side we were in also suffered with pigeons, the 'balcony' was coated in pigeon faeces and the vermin would start with their noises before the works on some mornings. Staff are very helpful and the restaurant at BB33 is good value, if you want a hearty breakfast it is FAR cheaper than the local breakfast outlets and provides high quality food and as much as you want. Nice pool on the 25th floor. Until the building works are finished I cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: navywrslr
Reviews.Content: Was in Toronto to run the Scotia Bank Toronto Waterfront Marathon,and this hotel was perfect for that. The location was with in walking distance of everthing. The room was large,clean and very comfortable. The service at check in and out,plus the nice size business center made everything very pleasant. I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: katie-mark83
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Delta Chelsea at about midday, knowing that our room would not be available until 3pm (check-in time) however we were able to leave our cases at the hotel whilst we went out to explore Toronto. This was facilitated by the downtown location of the hotel which is in easy walking distance to all attractions. We had a Signature Club Room, which was beautiful with views over most downtown Toronto and Lake Ontario from our balcony! The complimentary breakfast was delicious as were the evening canapÃ©s, which we sampled on our second day. The rooftop pool only 2 floors up, has spectacular views and we would recommend going up to the terrace even if you donâ€™t intend to use the pool. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful at all times, especially those at the front desk. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Delta Chelsea Hotel, and we will definitely to go back there next time we are in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Average in all respects, some things not so good”
Reviews.Author: LolaWantsandGets
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother-in-law and I stayed here for two nights. My mother-in-law called the hotel to book a seniors' rate, and she got one of the recently renovated rooms for $99/night. Our room was bundled with our airfare, and we got an old room (not renovated) that looked like it was straight out of 1990. What was good about this hotel: - excellent downtown Toronto location - our room/floor was quiet and relatively clean - the service at the front desk was good. the bellhops were exceptionally nice and efficient. What was not so good: - everything in our room was old and out-dated. worn-out, ugly furniture and decor, tired and stained carpets, halogen lamps that looked unsafe and rickety, an old Bell telephone whose speed dial buttons (to various areas of the hotel) didn't even work properly anymore and a TV with a clunky system and limited channels. - there were hardly any amenities in the room. we got 2 bottles of water, a coffee/tea maker and that's it. no bar fridge. no wi-fi at all in the room. internet access was available, but it was via ethernet an you had to pay something like $15 per day to use it. If you wanted free wi-fi, you had to go down to the lobby, and try to find a signal that worked. - the heating and cooling system is central and ancient. it was cold at night in Toronto, so we wanted to put on some heat. the thermostat was the old dial kind, and when the heating would not kick in, I called down to the front desk to ask why. I was informed that the hotel was "not on heating yet" -- meaning that the *whole hotel* was either on A/C or heating. The hotel was still using air conditioning, and if you wanted heat in your room, too bad. The closest you can get to heat is to shut off the A/C. - Even the windows in the room were old and seemed totally energy inefficient. Maybe that's why it was so cold in the room. The windows were also completely filthy -- so much so that someone had squeezed through the small window onto the balcony you couldn't use and had written in the dirt on the window. Wonder how long it's been like that? Ever hear of window washers, Delta Chelsea? - The hallways also had old peeling wallpaper, dark and stained carpets, and lots of scuffs and scrapes on the walls. The couches in the hotel lobby were also dirty and had stains on them. Some parts of the hotel just seemed a bit trashy and old. Although my mother-in-law really liked her room (it was basically brand new), she did not like the restaurant downstairs she ate at and said that even the sandwich she ordered was sub-par. I should mention too that on our first night there was a fire alarm at 2:30 am. It was not clear initially that it was a fire alarm -- the sound of it was confusing -- and we had to read the notes on the back of our door to know for sure it was a fire alarm. About 5 minutes after the alarm started, the management made announcements over the loudspeaker and told the majority of the guests to stay in their rooms. These announcements were repeated every 2 minutes or so for the next half hour until the fire department determined it was a false alarm.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: englander1952
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very well located for most tourist attractions. Considering the close proximity to Yonge Street and Dundas Square it was surprisingly quite. The service in the hotel was very efficient as we had to report a problem with the bathroom, which was put right within the hour. The staff are knowledgeable and friendly. We did think the the restaurants were quite expensive. There are two swimming pools, one for families on the 2nd floor, and one for adults on the 27th floor which also includes a fitness area. The next time we visit Toronto we would consider staying at the Delta Chelsea again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Pagora
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very good. I accessed it using the airporter express which dropped me off at one of its many doors. Having joined the privileged member club prior to departure (free) I did not have to join the queue at main reception but was checked in and out in a matter of minutes. The room was high up as requested, large, clean with adequate space for two. The view was onto a construction site unfortunately, as having traveled from Ireland it would have been nice to see something of the city from the balcony. The hairdryer didn't work and wasn't replaced despite being reported twice. College and Dundas subway stations are very close and the area is quite safe for late night walking. Local fast food eateries abound the area and a number of shops, including one 24 hour - staff unfriendly. Whilst there were large crowds in Dundas Square everynight - there was no actual entertainment. I slept well, with little noise from the corridor or from outside and the television, whilst not ultra modern served its purpose with excellent reception.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: Was back in Toronto for 2 nights in Sep 2009 and decided on the Delta Chelsea again, The girl upgraded me for an extra $20 to a balcony room on the 10th floor (Green Section) after advising me the 17th floor room she had in the system would be too noisy as it was near the elevator! How nice of her, I had a renovated room and it was so nice! it had a balcony and all the amenities of a Delta Hotel, The pool was great for a nightly swim (Open till 11pm) and the SUbway is nearby, make sure you catch a Blue Jays game at Skydome (Baseball) if like me you're an international tourist, The atmosphere is great and it's just like you see in the movies, Check Out was smooth although the shuttle bus got caught in a traffic jam and i missed my flight (Not the hotel's fault!) Still a great hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: cliffy1155012
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Delta experience, will definately come back. The retaurant staff were outstanding, epecially the chef on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Schiller04
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 days.. really clean and good service plus a very central location.. good value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Location - quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 3 nights to visit family. Location is excellent --- if you're interested in being in the very centre of downtown Toronto, which was good for us. Very convenient public transit (subway, etc.). This is a large, busy hotel which seems to do a brisk business but appears to be quite capable of handling it all. The room was very comfortable. I could quibble and say the bathroom was a bit small and the TV a bit dated (not flat screen HD), but these weren't prohibitive problems. The one MAJOR complaint I had is no wireless internet. I now travel with an iTouch, so must rely on wireless capability. Delta offered wired connectivity, but this left me essentially without access for 3 days. (There is an expensive business centre downstairs; I would not pay those prices.) This was VERY disappointing. Other than that, a very comfortable stay at a reasonable price. Would likely stay there again if circumstances so warranted.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JAB253
Reviews.Content: We found the Delta Chelsea to be an excellent value with a very professional and courteous staff. Our room was quiet and very clean. We had one complaint, but it was taken care of immediately and to our satisfaction. Location can't be beat. I'd recommend it. -JB, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holeinthehead
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is in a good location in the city however the hotel itself was nothing to write home about. After spending 9 hours on a plane after been delay for 3 hours on top of that (damn ash cloud) we checked into the hotel, half asleep I handed the desk clerk my debit card by mistake who proceeded to announce to the 20 others waiting behind me that my card was declined, simple mistake on both our parts but I dont think the whole hotel had to know about it. The staff in the Monarchs bar were more interested in the stanley cup match than the clients, and while we sat at the bar, cash was demanded each time we ordered a drink despite clients either side of us running tabs. The staff in the other bar, the much quieter elm street lounge were much more attentive, friendly and quite happy to run a tab. Broadband was poor which is a shame for a hotel of its size & location. I would look for a different hotel in Toronto the next time

Reviews.Title: “Pass on the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: rdombkowski
Reviews.Content: I was excited when I booked my reservation at the Delta Chelsea in Toronto. I had fine memories of staying there about 10 years ago and it is in a wonderful location. When I checked-in at about 6 pm, the desk clerk could not find my reservation. I produced a copy of my confirmation number for a two night stay. The desk clerk found my reservation but said that they did not have a room with two double beds for both nights and that I would have to switch rooms for the second night. I said that we were traveling with small children and a lot of stuff and this would be inconvenient. I offered to take a room with one King bed and she said that she did not have a room with a king bed I could stay in two nights!?! I asked why the hotel accepted my reservation for two nights if they could not accommodate me and she said something about "(Our partner site) does this to people all the time..." I asked if the room change could be done automatically, and she said that we would have to check out, come down to the front desk and check-in again. She said that for $15 dollars extra they would "upgrade" us and we could stay in the same room both nights. Out of frustration I agreed. The actions of the hotel feel fraudulent and like a clear bait and switch. I have never heard of having to pay for an upgrade after the hotel and their booking partners cannot communicate effectively about the rooms that are available on a given night. This was not my error and I had to pay for it. The total cost that I paid for a mediocre â€œupgraded" room could have bought me a much more pleasant experience at a number of other hotels within walking distance. I would not suggest staying at the Delta Chelsea in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: parone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta for six nights,the room was great , excellent housekeeping, I did not have breakfast included in my package but a coffee-pot , coffee, teabags and milk was provided. I wish there was a small refrigerator to hold cold drinks or left over food which I had to purchase elsewhere because of cost and a microwave to heat it up. However, it is a nice place away from home and easy access to mostly everything in the Downtown area, I would recommend it to someone wishing to spend a short time in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Worn .... Needs upgrade”
Reviews.Author: petrohead
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this location before with our children when they were young was a great place........ now it shows it age not much money has been spent on upgrades ... hotel looks and feels worn .... can find much better at same rates nearby....

Reviews.Title: “Decent place in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: gbloi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta Chelsea several times over the past 12 years. I stayed in a Club Level room which gave us access to the Club Lounge. Continental breakfast was decent but not much in the way of protein. You had a choice of either hard boiled eggs or cold ham and cheese. It would be good if you are a carb lover. Staff was friendly and housekeeping very helpful. Concierge Desk staff were a little snooty. Great place to stay if you want to wander along Yonge Street. Within easy walking distance to Eaton Center/

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: DavidK12
Reviews.Content: What a awesome place to stay when in Toronto. Restaurants are excellent and room service was top notch. Room was spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: muszekfan
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room via Expedia and was very pleased with the price. When we arrived, however, we were informed that no cots were immediately available. After waiting for 3 plus hours, I groused and we were moved to a room with three beds at no extra cost, which was very impressive service. The hotel is in an excellent location - really ideal for travelers. It is HUGE - the biggest hotel in Canada with nearly 1600 rooms, but you never feel that immense size as there are different elevators for different floors. The kids in our group LOVED the four-story water slide and I loved the adult-only pool and jacuzzi with its outdoor view of the CN Tower from the 27th floor. The hotel's restaurants are a bit pricey but there are plenty of good places to eat nearby that are much less expensive. All in all, a great place to stay!"

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small rooms and only average service”
Reviews.Author: CraftNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Delta Chelsea because it was recommended by friends for part of our vacation to southern Ontario. We spent two nights and had a room with 2 double beds as my young adult children stayed with us. We found the room to be very cramped; had to make our way sideways to get between the dresser and the beds. Internet cost per day was $13.95 and we were promised a fridge to be delivered which did notr happen. The television looked to be from the early 90's; in other words this room appliances/furniture and size wise is in need of an upgrade/refreshment. The location was great as it was downtown and not too costly and cleanliness was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “The Delta Chelsea is my home when in Toronto - I love this place.”
Reviews.Author: DrC33
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Delta Chelsea many times and always find ourselves going back. The last few times we have been in Toronto, it was to take care of my ailing father. The hotel desk staff were incredibly compassionate and found us unbelievable rates for really nice rooms. This past weekend, my father died. The only room available was a kitchenette. There was a warmth and familiarity to the room and hotel which was comforting. I love the room service menu. I also really enjoy the restaurants - though this time we preferred to stay in. The housekeepers are wonderful. The valet parking is the most reasonable of the downtown hotels. Although $32 seems expensive at first, parking downtown is equally expensive. That rate allows you to get your car and valet it as many times as you need to within the 24hours the rate covers. If you have to stay for several days and cost is an issue, I recommend the kitchenette room. There is a 24hour grocery store right across from the hotel with reasonable prices. The room is really like a one bedroom apartment. However, I have stayed in several different rooms and have never been disappointed. My only criticisms are the paucity of valet staff and the lack of wireless internet in the rooms. Regarding the parking, we often find ourselves waiting a long time before someone comes to help us. Were these two issues corrected, the Delta Chelsea would be damn near perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Ute_Ba
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied with our decision to stay in the Chelsea. It is a very big hotel but the room was very quiet and also well equipped but older. Included in our hotel costs was also a breakfast voucher for an continental breakfast (coffee or tee, juice, 2 fresh baked muffin or other baked goods). This was always a nice start in the day. But the best on the hotel is the location. Directly situated in the down-town. Nearby we could find a lot of restaurants, shops, malls. It was only some minutes to the underground or to buses. Very nice was it to relax after a long day in the pool and have a great view to the night skyline. For Toronto we can recommend to have a typical Chinese Dim-sum lunch in the restaurant â€œBright Pearl Seefood Restaurantâ€� - 348 Spadina Ave. We felt as in China. The Dim-sum were delicious and really not expansive. http://www.brightpearlseafood.com/

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but needs renovations!”
Reviews.Author: ethan88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times with family. Its in a great location, right in downtown. I like the restaurants and pool with waterslide, great for kids. I think this hotel needs some renovations. I always stay in a deluxe room and they have been recently been renovated but I am not sure about the other rooms. I would recommened this hotel to families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2trav3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Delta Chelsea twice in recent weeks and loved it. Checked in by Kevin and Ashleigh who made us feel very welcomed. The rooms are clean and the beds are the MOST comfortable we've slept in compared to other more expensive hotels. Our first stay was during a very busy weekend. We were worried that we could not sleep with all the party noises from the other rooms. Surprisingly, we could hardly hear anything. For such a big hotel, the lifts were fast. And our kids love the water slide. There's always lifeguards on duty so we feel very safe at the pool. Best of all is the location of this hotel. It seems to be right in the middle of all the attractions and very close to Life Square (Toronto's Times Square), Eaton Center and lots of restaurants. We walked all over with 3 young kids. The bus station is nearby so we walked there to catch our bus to Niagara Falls. No need for unnecessary taxi fares. There is also an airport shuttle bus which will drop and pick-up from the entrance of the hotel. How convenient is that ...... and oh, kids ride for free! We had a great stay, far exceeded our expectation and we will love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel with a great location...”
Reviews.Author: much2buzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from August 4-8, 2010. Upon entering the hotel, I thought the lobby was absolutely beautiful. Our room was perfect with very comfy beds. House cleaning was top notch. Very nice that it had a pool area for adults. Had a great pool for kids too (on a different level) and the kids were having a blast. Nice to have the daycare option for younger children. Lots of great sights to see within walking distance of the hotel. I would stay at this location again without any hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel...this hotel was a disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: Kevnic14
Reviews.Content: We have "purchased" hotel rooms via Priceline several times and have never been disappointed - in fact our expectations have been more than met and we encourage many of our friends and family to use their services. We have stayed in 2 star to 4 star hotels and have had fabulous experiences. We requested a 3+ star hotel this time around, yet we were immediately disappointed upon walking into our room. The room was very small, yet we have loved some of our smaller rooms, so that was not the biggest concern. The room had a musty smell to it upon entering - the balcony doors were smeared with finger prints and whatever else - the balcony was simply very dirty and really just 'gross'. Upon entering we first noticed the bedding and the extreme lumpiness of it - we discovered that the duvets have their fill in all of the wrong places and there were large two foot sections that did not even have any fill, so essentially we were sleeping with sheets upon us. The washrooms were tiny, and had basic amenities in them. I lost shower pressure during my first use - seeming almost like someone turned on a garden hose or the dishwasher while I was in mid-use. During my third shower, the tub began to fill up. We were so disappointed that there was no mini-fridge in our room and we needed to toss some of the food that we had brought along with us. On our drive home we passed several one to two star hotels, and it was interesting to note that even those advertised fridges being in their rooms! I purchased a pop one evening from their "market" restaurant - I took the pop from one of their coolers, so my assumption was that it would be cold, however it was lukewarm. We met some friends who live in a nearby city and we brought them up to our room briefly before heading out again, and the first thing that they noted was the water stains on the ceiling and the stains on the walls. The public washrooms on the first floor were very dirty, with paper overflowing in the garbages and the sinks were dirty and missing a soap dispenser. We were not offered the assistance of someone to help with our luggage, nor were we aware that there was a concierge available to us. All in all, we payed only $75.00 a night by purchasing this room through Priceline. Because of our wonderful experiences with this company, we are not in a position to blame Priceline, yet feel that the Delta Chelsea has sorely misrepresented themselves. This was not a 3+ star hotel - it felt more like a 2 star hotel however - it may have been grand at one time, however it simply feels like it has not been upgraded in several years. We were terribly disappointed and will not be back to this hotel. Kevnic, Windsor, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “2nd time pleasantly surprised. I would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: CubaFun123
Reviews.Content: Last time I stayed at the chelsea...I had a room with a broken toilet. had to call mainenance 3 times before they would move me. would not flush. I kind of felt that I was given a room on the "old side" as I had booked through priceline. The room had a balcony nailed shut but before they nailed it shut they "forgot" to remove the wine bottle..old newspaper and cigarette butts. I vowed never to stay there again. I just finished staying at the chelsea for my 2nd time (good rate and good location). I was pleasantly surprised. I was a bit scared the first moment as my hallway stank...when I entered my room (2030) It was fresh smelling...so I decided not to bother asking to change rooms. It was a very nice room. The next day the hallway did not smell at all so I guess maybe somebody had smoked there or something. no problem. This time I found the staff from the front desk...to bellmen to what appeared to ber management eagerly asking guests if everything was good...greeting guests... it was a nice experience. The room service menu is varied and INCREDIBLY fair.. I was shocked when I saw that the price for a meal was pretty much the same or lower than what you would pay for the same fare of similar quality in a restaurant. The hotel was packed full when I was there...National wheelchair power hockey or something like that. Even still, there were few line ups at the restaurants...they must have had extra staff on. As there were many kids in the hotel for the hockey event the hotel had a full size "robot" in the lobby talking to people...was very funny to watch. Whoever was the voice of the robot by remote was chatting with people who came near it. Thought this was a nice touch and good plan by the hotel. The location of this hotel is fantastic... step outside one entrance and there is a small market for snacks etc... another door and you are at yonge street... tons of restaurants of all price ranges and great people watching. I would stay at the chelsea again and would recommend it for conventions.... business travel or just visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location and extreamly helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: AndyDragon
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel when it was under siege from the G20 protesters which put the whole area and staff under strain. The hotel was ringed by police, many of whom were staying at the hotel. Our getting to the hotel from the airport had been mucked up by the travel companies local agents who were also supposed to be arranging other things for us â€“ something that after the difficulties of travelling in left us most stressed. The staff member who signed us in had it marked on his badge that he was new staff member and he set the tone for our stay with the hotel. He recognised that we were stressed and asked how he could help, and help he did: he even rang us the following day to see if the fix heâ€™d put in train had achieved a positive result! I have stayed with work in posher hotels whose staff would defiantly not have troubled themselves to ask much less try and help. Despite the first couple of days in Toronto was a bit scary at time thanks to the trouble makers, and worrying due to the inefficiencies of the local agents of the holiday company, the hotel staff made it as positive as they could. We would be more than happy to stay in this hotel should we return to Toronto. We were so happy with the service I made a point of emailing in our thanks to the staff that went the â€œextra mileâ€� to make our stay memorable for the right reasons to the General Manager.

Reviews.Title: “Practical rather than beautiful”
Reviews.Author: james_patching
Reviews.Content: Great location but generally seeming a bit worn down and old. The staff were professional but didnâ€™t really seem to enjoy what they were doing and the bars and restaurants, while practical and useful (they had everything I needed and were open at the right times) werenâ€™t anything special. A place for the businessman not wanting to trek too far out of Toronto rather than a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Bad as all the reviews make it out to be - nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: love2travelww
Reviews.Content: After reading many bad reviews on the Delta Chelsea i was upset that i was staying there before i even arrived. We chose to prepay our room with the cheaper advanced rate available on the hotel's website. We selected a regular Delta room. When we arrived, because of all the bad reviews i asked the front desk if we could at least get checked into a renovated room. Samantha (lady who served us at the front desk) did us one better and talked to her manager and upgraded us to a Deluxe King Room for free! it was great we had a king bed, chair and desk with a nice amount of space. We stayed on the 22 floor. I must say the room did smell like cigarettes when we got in but that's really no fault of the hotel when you have 1500+ rooms but it would have been nice if they could have eliminated the smell for whoever the guest would have been in that room. The smell was gone by the next day after we left the door open to the balcony. Not a bother for us since we got a free upgrade. The gym is really nice, there's plenty of machines to go around and even a pool (i'm not one for pool's but people were always in there every time i went to the gym). Downside is that the machines do not have individual tv's but most people use their ipods anyway. The purpose of our trip was to relax and sightsee and go to Caribana. We stayed for over a week and had a great time. The hotel is in the BEST location because it is centered around the main part of downtown so its just a 5 or 10 min walk depending on how far you want to go but there's street shopping, the mall (Eaton Centre) and movie theatre all within 5 mins from the hotel. There's a great tatoo place as well (Ultimate Tattoo). There are always taxis available at the hotel which was a great thing (even when we weren't at the hotel there was always a taxi around at any point to hop into to go to the next place). Ladies there are PLENTY of mani/pedi places, even one right outside the hotel of the Younge Street exit which i went to and enjoyed. During Caribana they had a pizza station in the lobby $5 (not bad at 4 or 5am) which came in handy after late nights of partying. There's enough Bar's to have a drink and the market place is available all day for food if you don't feel like going outside. Yes the elevator wait did get crazy at times because of the amount of people there but that's really not a problem once you get used to it. The conceirge is helpful but there's also a touch screen monitor that allows you to search for things like shopping, dining, music etc which was great when the conceirge was busy. Thanks so much to the reservations lady Samantha who upgraded us to a King Deluxe room without any fuss. We greatly appreciate it and we will definitley be back again same time next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst smelling hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: DXB_Maple
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto in July 2010. We have previously lived in Toronto and knew that the location of the Delta Chelsea would be perfect for our planned activities during our trip. The Delta Chelsea was not cheap but as we could remember would be our best option. The Delta Chelsea is in an excellent location. The rooms are clean but are in deperate need of updating if they would like to keep up with the rest of the Toronto hotels. The beds are comfortable. We stayed on the 10th floor during our trip and over the course of 3 days there seemed to be an aweful smell on the floor. Further investigation found that there was some kind of problem and the hotel was renovating a few rooms. The smell was overwhelming in the hallway. I don't even want to guess what the problem was. The location of this hotel is excellent but there are other good hotels in the area that are of much greater value for the dollar. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly place”
Reviews.Author: abncparties
Reviews.Content: We chose the Delta Chelsea on the recommendations of two friends. They had both stayed at the Delta Chelsea many years ago. The Delta Chelsea definitely is showing signs of age and in desperate need or remodeling. I know they are doing some remodeling, but we were not fortunate enough to stay in the remodeled section. We stayed in an old room with no refrigerator or working internet (although they kept promising to fix the modem, but were unable to). The toilet leaked the last day we were there, but since we were leaving we did not make a big deal of it. The staff was wonderful and extremely helpful. The Delta Chelsea is right in the heart of downtown and it is not necessary to have a car if you stay there. The subway is within walking distance and all the sights are within the subway/bus system. There are many restaurants to choose from and all type of cuisine or you can dine at one of several restaurants at the Delta Chelsea. If you are into ice cream, as I am, there is an ice cream shop right around the corner from the Delta Chelsea that was absolutely incredible. They mix your choice of ice cream and toppings on a marble slab and serve it in a waffle cone. Yum...Yum...Yum..... The hotel has a several story slide for the kids that looked like great fun and a wonderful pool for the adults as well as a separate work out and weight room. There is also a spa for that massage after a long day of shopping!!!! I would recommend the Delta Chelsea, especially after it is remodeled. We got a wonderful price and it was well worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pahotel01
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel.Booked a king room through a third party (and heard the reviews) but it was great!!!! Room was big and a comfy bed, clean, had a baloney, really cudnt ask for more. Stayed 3 nights, got room service twice and was hot and delived within a half hour both times!!! only one thing, i asked 4 a fridge and was told at check-in that i was put on a waiting list and it would be brought up later - it never was!no major problem though. Staff were great. Shop in hotel for water etc. Would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: disgruntled919
Reviews.Content: Surly staff, borderline accomodations - deluxe room yet|! Don't patronize this dump. stayed at the the King Eddie for cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fareed_dossary_2255
Reviews.Content: The excellent location of Delta Chelsea hotel makes it the most attractive hotel in the area . It is located at heart of downtown where you can shop, eat, entertain and visit most attractive tourist locations in few minutes by walking. The hotel staffs were happy to help at any time. It has huge lobby where you can see many people from different countries. The most disadvantages of this hotel is that the room is small, no refrigerator at the room and no free wireless internet at the room. All other services are great and I strongly recommend this hotel for others and for my self.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: lizzylibrarian
Reviews.Content: We bid $90/ni on Priceline and the Delta Chelsea accepted our offer. With a toddler I feel lucky we got a hotel that is so family friendly. Upon check in our son was given a gift of a board book and small stuffed animal. We loved the family pool on the second floor. The play room looked nice too but since it was so stinking hot while we were there we only had eyes (and time) for the pool. I explored to see the adult-only pool on the top floor. It is small but nice and the attached patio has great views of the city. They also had a family movie going on at least one night we were there. Again, we didn't take advantage of it, but it was nice to see. Our room had 1 Queen bed that was very nicely furnished and had really no view to speak of. Since we booked through Priceline I wasn't expecting much and we were very happy with the room. There was no dresser but a very large closet in the room. We really enjoyed the location near Yonge St. After long HOT days of sightseeing it was nice to have a variety of casual and relatively cheap places to eat. Most mornings we had breakfast in the Market restaurant. Of course it's a bit overpriced but worth the convenience for us. I really enjoyed their Med. omelette. We also took advantage of the free wi-fi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RandomCanada
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times, and it's got pretty much all the standard conveniences (pool, laundry, business centre, restaurant, cafe, lounge, kids' centre, pool, workout room) and the location can't be beat. My least favourite thing about this hotel is that the workout room is on the top floor (26?) and is encased in glass, and can get very stifling during Toronto's famous muggy summer heat. A couple of times I've given up on trying to work out because of the oppressive heat in there. The open doors and fans don't make much difference when the air outside is heavy and humid. My favourite thing about this hotel is the Market Garden cafe/restaurant - the food is great, the staff is friendly, the selection is awesome, and the dining room area is huge so that there's always a table, and it doesn't seem crowded any time of day, even though it's busy most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: RDSX28
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past weekend to attend a game at the Rogers Centre. The hotel was fine it could use some sprucing up as far as decor. The TV reception is also not the greatest. The Market restaurant offers little variety and the prices were rather high in my opinion. The restaurant at the corrner of the street Elephant and Castle is a better choice for dinner. Yummy food and reasonably priced. There are a number of kid friendly activities. The pool area for families is quite small. The "waterpark" is one large slide. I took my 10 year old to swim and after an hour she wanted to leave as it was so crowded it was actually u nsafe. teenagers, moms with babies, and adults that really should have used the other pool. I heard the adult pool was quite nice. They really need to have a larger swim area for families.the hotel is within walking distance to many things but is quite a distance to the waterfront. There is also a ton of construction going on around the hotel and so the view is horrible. I would have to say it is an average hotel nothing special at all. FYI parking at the hotel is also 12.00/day plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: writergeek313
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Delta Chelsea for three nights at the beginning of June. It was our first time visiting Toronto, and we liked how centrally located the hotel was, both to the subway and to local attractions. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. Despite being on the eighteenth floor there was quite a bit of noise from the street and construction across the street. It was never a problem for us, but it could have been for some people, I'm sure. The hotel has quite a few different restaurants. Though we never chose to eat at the hotel, we certainly had many options if we had wanted to. At one point the concierge told us to use a subway station that was partially closed because of construction. That sent us out of our way quite a bit, since we had to walk to another station. I also really wish someone would have told us there was free wifi. We didn't discover that until the last day of our trip, after we'd been hunting down hotspots for two days because we couldn't use our cell phones otherwise. All in all, the Delta Chelsea was a good value in a great location. I'd more than likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldent Stay There AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Browneyegirl86
Reviews.Content: We Stayed In Toronto...The Room was Nice and Clean and Very Comfertable Beds!!!! On the other Hand House Keeping Was Terrible Super Slow waited like 4hrs to get things and get a knock at my door at 2am for the things i had asked for 4hrs Away...They dont have a Fridge seeing for people with kids alot of Perishiable Foods Go to waste EASY!!!!! I find they Took forever just to get us a Fridge Last day they came with one!! Duh Too Late!! For people who like To bring a laptop and Want Free WIRELESS You would have to go Downstairs in the Lobby..Other Wise They WANT you to connect the internet in the Room For 13$ a Day!!! NO THANKS!! We pay enuff for the room i think the wireless should be all over the Hotel No matter What!!!! I think those things 2 things should be automatic when u get a room Free Wireless and a Fridge !! OH the water slide is a other thing thats Ok but my children where upset seeing they cant swim that good have at least me or my husband there to catch them when they come down from the slide they dident want that and i find it dumb it ruined the fun for my children they where looking forward to the slide!!! **So if u have children its a "MUST" They have to know how to swim or they cant do down the slide which its really STUPID! But For sure not staying there Again!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, great location, good view”
Reviews.Author: whirledwanderer
Reviews.Content: we stayed here after we fled another hostelry. Had a room service meal on a night when we were really tired and it was excellent quality and value. beds were comfortable and while there was noise from the street it was quite entertaining. we enjoyed the balcony and the view of the Canada Day fireworks [rooms could be improved with the addition of refrigerators]

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBRochester
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in May and had a great stay. Adult pool on top floor is great with a great outdoor view. Every single staff member was above and beyond helpful and nice. The service level and friedliness of the staff outshine any imperfections the hotel may have and there are some but it appears they are working on them. We were given an early check in and were allowed to park until well into the afternoon on the day we left which was very convienent to do more sightseeing. The room we were given was quite large and very clean, very old, very small tv though. Would definetly reccomend this hotel and will be staying again for two nights July 27th.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good except parking”
Reviews.Author: cpagia
Reviews.Content: I was a bit dubious about this hotel after reading the ratings. The rooms are a little tired, but you would have to be fairly picky to be worried by it. Location is very good, although a bit of a hike to the waterfront, it is very close to Torontos answer to Times Square. There are lots of good cheap restaurants nearby, especially Japanese. There are also various eating options onsite. Rooms only have wired internet access, wireless in lobby. Internet is free in room if you sign up to the free hotel club. Parking is stupidly expensive. Instead, park in a little underground parking garage just over the over side of Younge on Gerrard St east (turn up a little laneway next to a small block of flats). Here the parking is $10 per 24 hours and is "pay and display" voucher based, so you can go in and out as much as you like. But don't tell anyone or it will fill up ;-) There was plenty of room down there during our visit. You will probably need a car as I found Toronto pretty spread out and hard to get around compared to most large cities. If you can get a good deal and "join the club" its a pretty decent option fairly well situated in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “City Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rich16
