Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel! center of everything, CN Tower is nearby, Canada's Wonderland, a few subway stops and a bus stop away, Niagara Falls, a train ride away from Union Station, the slide was fantastic, i know its for kids, but adults do enjoy it too,

Reviews.Title: “The biggest Hotel of Canada”
Reviews.Author: Fruehlingsgold13
Reviews.Content: That is what they say! It is huge thow, as it is big, they do have trouble making it somehow nice. The best thing, you can open your windows in the room and it gets you out to a small balcony for fresh air, well as far as the fresh air from the Lake reaches you. Hotel Room was clean. Do not get messed up with all the different Elevators for the different floors. They provide you with fitness room, a small swimming pool and a small sauna in the 27th floor. Was almost empty the times i went there. Do not take breakfast at the Market Garden as it has no flair at all, i did not went to the Bb33 Brasserie, but it seems to be more cosy. Elephant & Castle just around the corner is a Restaurant and Pub with Sports TVÂ´s. Do not miss the Pub at Corner of Yonge St. and Dandonald St., they provide you with a range of local Beer Brewery CompanyÂ´s on old wooden tables insite and nice Terrasse as well, if you stand the Noises from the street. If you have time to relax, just take the Ferry to the Toronto Island Park, do not miss the nice old houses of Algonquin Island.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to be all things to everyone....and does it pretty well”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is first and foremost big. It's got 1,500+ rooms, an indoor waterpark, multiple restaurants, color-coded elevators for different towers.....you get the picture. So if you're looking for an intimate, service-oriented hotel experience, do not pass go, do not collect $200. But for being such a big, chaotically busy place, the Delta Chelsea functions remarkably well. The British Pub-themed lobby is big and very busy at all times. Color-coded elevator banks (blue, green, red, gold) lead to different sets of rooms, improving efficiency, but elevators can still be a bit slow at times. Typically for such a big place, the Delta Chelsea has a labrynthine, confusing room floor layout. Expect to get turned around at least a couple of times trying to locate your room. My room, a standard Delta queen room, was compact, but very comfortable and well equipped. It was clean, with nice modern furnishings, and a big, plush, super comfortable bed and a large TV. The small bathroom and dated shower were the biggest room disappointments. I didn't eat in hotel restaurants but there are plenty of them, including a popular buffet-type restaurant in the lobby. Check in/out was surprisingly fast for such a big hotel. The hotel is right in the middle of the downtown Toronto action, right off the sleaze/cheese of Yonge Street, and a few blocks from the massive Eaton Centre shopping mall. It's a long block to the College subway station, but you can cut through the College Park shopping complex on really hot or cold days. Toronto is a multicultural wonderland, with endless things to see, do, eat and enjoy. The Delta Chelsea is a fine, centrally located place to stay, as long as you don't mind big hotels and lots of company.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MRSAS
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed in this hotel for May Half Term with my family the hotel is in a great location. A few minute walk to the Eaton Centre excellent for shopping. If I came again I would stay at this hotel for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hectic, but great amenities”
Reviews.Author: megse
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through Hotwire and followed the recommendations of fellow travelers â€“ upgrade your room, create a Delta Privilege account and watch out for the crowd. First off, parking is really hectic at the hotel. It is really narrow and difficult to maneuver, so I would watch out if you have a large vehicle. We traveled with a station wagon and found it difficult to navigate the twist and turns. As a privileged member, you are eligible for a speedy check in. I was REALLY impressed by the organization of the front desk itself (I work as a front desk agent at a hotel). Just to demonstrate why Delta Privilege is helpful, the line up for non-members was really, really long. However, you bypass that as a Privilege member. The staff members are multilingual, so you will not have any problems if you speak a different language or dialect. We had an upgraded room on the crown floor â€“ which was GREAT because it includes continental breakfast in the morning and the added perk of access to the Club Room. The service at breakfast was friendly and inviting for morning travelers. Our room was newly renovated and furnished, but we did have a few problems. The internet is not wireless except in the lobby. I have a macbook so for some reason the DSL line was not recognizing my computer, which was kind of problematic. However, for the bigger issue â€“ the noise level is really bad. The walls are paper thin (we had the embarrassing issue of hearing a couple fornicating next door!). The next evening we heard them having a party at 2:00am. When we called to report the noise, the issue wasnâ€™t resolved very promptly. In fact, we had to call twice as the issue only got worse. So yes, the noise is bad, but it really didnâ€™t ruin our stay. It was just more embarrassing if anything. I "might" stay here again (hotwire will decide that). While it does have its charm â€“ the breakfast room â€“ we kind of just got lucky with our upgrade. I donâ€™t think I would have recommended this location had I stayed in a standard room because even with the privilege points, the rooms are still small. The lobby traffic and sheer size of the hotel actually detracts from its positives. You kind of feel lost in the shuffle. If you want a great downtown hotel â€“ stay at the Cambridge Suites. Itâ€™s just as close to all the amenities, but you feel less like herded sheep.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: Naillic
Reviews.Content: I booked my 10 night trip to Toronto on Priceline. I got the Delta Chelsea Hotel for $60 + tax. I joined the Delta Priviledge Programme (free) to avail of complimentary in-room internet access,free local calls and a guaranteed late check-out. I then upgraded my room to a "Kitchenette" room for an extra $40 + tax per night. The room was wonderful. Not the Ritz and needing some basic repair work on the bathroom tiles etc. but having a full kitchen complete with utensils was fabulous. The room was spotless, furniture and toiletries basic but for what I paid, extremely good value. The hotel lobby is like Grand Central Station during rush hour! This is the biggest hotel in Toronto, so expect a busy enviroment. However the staff were superb. Polite, courteous and at all times willing to give of their time. An extremely pleasant Jennifer checked me in and after a transatlantic flight this was effortless and appreciated. At night, for the whole duration of my stay I did not hear a single sound. However the location of the hotel is it's biggest asset. College subway station is a 3 minute walk away. Dundas Square is 5 minutes in the opposite direction. The hop-on, hop-off tour bus stops right outside the door. As does the excellent Airport Express service to Pearson. $32 return and it only takes about 50 mins depending on traffic. Would I recommend the hotel, definitely for the price, room type, location and service. If I got all this again I would go back in a flash. Well done Delta.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs CPR”
Reviews.Author: Travellingnurse50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night while on business. The hotel was booked for me because of its location to where I had my meeting. This hotel is in serious need of a massive overhaul. Everything is shabby and tired - from hallway carpets to the bathrooms. My room was tiny and the lack of wireless internet in rooms continues to infuriate me (come on major hotels! Wireless please!). Wireless access for free in lobby however. Phew. The lobby is chaotic with many group tours and running children. Next time will insist that I stay at a Starwood or Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Good food, needs work otherwise though”
Reviews.Author: darkeyes456
Reviews.Content: We just came back last Thursday, the 10th of June, 2010, and our room wasn't expensive as we booked through Via Rail....much cheaper that way, if you are train travelling. We were just there a night and it rained, so we ate in the B&B Restaurant downstairs and it was superb food! I was amazed, truly amazed! The hotel is close to the Eaton Centre, within 2 blocks, so that is a bonus, but the rooms are very far from the elevators, and like someone said, very confusing, as to colour coded elevators and such. Our room was 'okay', but the hotel does need some upgrading, and what's with the no-smoking on the "balcony"??? That seems ludicrous, and I don't smoke! Other than that, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: capertraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Delta Chelsea. Good hotel. Close to Subways and easy to get there on the airporter. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Canada's biggest hotel is big on service”
Reviews.Author: billyphatu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 10 days at the Delta Chelsea, which is Canada's biggest hotel in room numbers (Note: check your reputable secret-discount-hotel websites as the DC is almost always on there, what with the number of rooms it's got). We were surprised at how personable and helpful the service was, at what is otherwise a giant souless corporate hotel. Everything we requested (fridge, robes, crockery etc) were delivered without fuss. And upon revealing our recent engagement, we were provided with free Internet, wine & strawberries! Yes it is in need of an update - the room decor was slightly 80s/90s - but everything was clean, working and, most importantly, comfortable. The only downer on the room was lack of ventilation; we only had a small, fiddly window and a balcony that we couldn't access. Also they seem to be selective about when they turn the A/C on (only the temperature is controllable in-room). The large pool, gym and sauna area on the top floor is great, especially as it is adults only. They have a kids pool /games room downstairs. The good thing about the Delta is that it is surprisingly quiet, once you've escaped the chaos of the lobby, which has a good choice of albeit-expensive eateries. Their lounge-bar is a bit shabby though. Overall we had a comfortable, easy and affordable stay at the Delta Chelsea, and would reccommend it to anyone who wants a good base for their stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel in desparate need of updating”
Reviews.Author: Bubbalink
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very big, which is a good reason as to why it is a little outdated.. The lobby where you enter looks big, but with a place as big as it is, the lobby gets very crowded. Rooms are very large. A lot of them have balconies.. The pool and fitness area on the roof is very nice.. good view of the ciy centerally located in Downtown Toronto, close to everything. Not bad value for the $$, but if you can find something a little newer in downtown Toronto for the same price, take it..

Reviews.Title: “Just another place to spend the night.”
Reviews.Author: raneflight
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Delta Chelsea on a thursday afternoon around 4. The lobby of this place looks much like a small train station, it was really busy with lots of people running around and a dark lighting or the area (and nowhere to sit down). The check-in staff were reasonably good and upgraded us to a nicer room on a higher floor (15th floor). The hotel is gigantic with something like 3 or 4 sets of elevators, so finding our room was a bit of a challenge. When we got to our room however, the cleaning staff was still in the process of cleaning. We went downstairs to see if we can get a difference room. The front desk was good at correcting their mistake and gave us another room on the 12th floor (after spending 15mins on the computer and phone) but to make up for the poor planning on their part we got 2 days of complimentary parking (which is $29 a day...) The room itself is just so-so, the carpet is old and the washroom is small (but relatively clean). The beds were comfortable, however, it was very weird walking into the room and the first thing you see is little lumps on your bed...(the lumps were just from the comforter, which was naturally shaped that way...weird) We did have a gigantic 43" LG flat screen tv in the room, but unfortunately, there is no wireless internet in the rooms and wired is something like $14 a day. I was told that there is free wifi in the lobby, but never got a chance to use it. Overall, the Delta Chelsea is just another hotel where you can spend the night, but it is located in a really busy and active location in Toronto (on Gerrard just off or Yonge) although at night, it was still very quiet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good even though it's big!”
Reviews.Author: andyjansy
Reviews.Content: What a big hotel! â€“ one of the largest we have been to with entrances on all four corners of the block. The coach shuttle from the airport (C$60 for two) goes every 20 minutes and takes about 40 minutes if the roads are not too busy. Our room was quite spacious but did not have a wonderful outlook over the rooftops; it was however very clean and comfortable and very quiet. Food and drink is rather expensive, even for a hotel - $6.60 for a small beer! There are plenty of good eating places on Yonge Street and around and the Frascati on Elm Street is very good indeed. Another time in Toronto I think I would probably choose somewhere slightly nearer downtown but this hotel is perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: meschwar
Reviews.Content: I got this place on Priceline for an insanely good price. I had red some reviews here and on Yelp that made me nervous, but I was super happy once I got there. I'll quickly run through the few negatives just to get them out of the way. Other people have touched on these. * Parking is an additional $27/day. I thought that was insane, but then I looked at prices for other lots, and that's basically what overnight parking in Toronto costs, so you can't really complain. * Internet access is $14/day. Annoying, but that's just what big fancy hotels do. * We did have one or two really long elevator waits. Other times weren't bad at all. Now, onto the good stuff. I found our room to be immaculate, spacious, and full of the plushy goodness fancy hotels offer. (I rarely stay in fancy hotels, so maybe I'm too easily impressed by things like bathrobes. I dunno.) I've gathered via TripAdvisor that some rooms have been renovated and others haven't. Maybe they stick Priceline people in the unrenovated rooms when they are otherwise booked up, but we got a recently renovated room. At check-in, the asked if we wanted two double beds (the Priceline standard, I guess,) and I said, "One bigger bed would be better than two smaller beds, but we'll be fine with whatever." The clerk checked and told me that she had a room with a queen bed, but it was a wheelchair accessible room, which meant a shower stall instead of a bathtub. No problem, I said, and took the room. Maybe the room I would have gotten otherwise wouldn't have been so nice. I don't know. This is actually my new standard for Priceline/hotwire hotel booking. Make some random request about your room (bigger bed, higher floor, near/far from the elevator, facing the whatever) just so I don't get the worst room in the place. But I digress. I checked out the pool and exercise room, which seemed really nice. I didn't try room service or the restaurants, because this is one of the world's great eating cities; why on earth would anyone eat at the hotel? I really just couldn't have been happier with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service in Delta”
Reviews.Author: parfum2010
Reviews.Content: I didn't pay $267.00 for such terrible service. I didn't expect a brilliant suite on this price, as long as the room is tidy and clean. But, later on the TV got fire itself, and the smoke was all around the room. I called the front desk, but I didn't expect they sent someone to fix the TV. At least someone in charge should come up to see whether we are ok. I called the front desk again asking for room changing, since we cant go trough the nite in the room full of smoking. I talked the guy in the back office, and he promised me to change the room for us, and let me go to the front desk. However, when I got there, the front desk guy refused to change the room, and told me the rooms are all sold out and they can do nothing. I couldn't believe this, I insist on changing the room. Then , he offered me another room with a sofa bed. I couldn't believe it, I didnt pay for $ 267.00 for a sofa bed! And how two adults could stuck into a sofa bed! I was so mad, I asked the manager. The guy told me to wait at the back, I refused, I insisted to talk to the manager rite away. So, he went back to talk to the manager. And something weired happend, he came back and offered me another upgrade room. So, they lied to me about all the rooms were sold out. But, I said nothing, but took the room, I was so tired about negotiation. They ruined my nite and my vocation, too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional staff, exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Cincycaddy
Reviews.Content: We purchased our room for the Delta Chelsea via Priceline name your own price and ended up getting our room for $75 for three nights over Memorial Day weekend. After reading various reviews we were a bit skeptical of this place but after our stay we have nothing but praise for the place. Once tip: Join the Delta privilege program. Free to join and as a member you are able to check in at the Delta Privilege check-in bypassing the chaos at the main desk (this place is a mad house on the weekend) Additionally free internet and local cars are part of being a member. We requested a remodeled room (thanks Tripadvisor for the heads up) and were updraded to a "Deluxe" room. In all honesty I think the deluxe rooms (~$15 more on their website) are merely the remodeled rooms. In any case they were nice, clean with a fair amount of space. One issue we had was that due to the remodeling of the Hotel there were no operational ice machines on our floor or any of the other easily accessed floors. I discussed this with the front desk and they promptly offered to send up a mini fridge (score one for Customer Service) We did pay for the $27 parking ($30 with tax) for the first night but we ended up parking at the building across from the hotel on the South-West corner of Gerrard and Bay. $5/ night on weekends and holidays and $15 flat rate during the week. There is no in-out privileges but we use Toronto's awesome public transit system so it is not an issue. Overall this is a great hotel. I've stayed at more posh places, but the location of the hotel (right in the mix of things) and the exceptional staff make this a winner in my book. Do some planning, request a remodeled room, join the Delta Privilege club and park elsewhere (cheaper) and you have a formula for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: crewboi
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on Priceline. The room was very nice size with two beds, a couch, and an armchair. The bathroom was nice and the air conditioning worked great. This hotel has a beautiful view of the skyline from the roof. There is on-site parking for an additional charge, but you can take your car in and out as you please. This was a great hotel and I hope I get the chance to stay there again next time I go to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: londonwesty
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here because of location, price and name. We have stayed at Delta in Mississauga before. Upon arrival it was busy and I managed to skirt the regular check in line by asking for directions of how to park by the upscale desk. They offered to check me in. That was a bonus. Parking was good, easy access and nice to have as part of stay. Rooms were small and beds small as well, comfortable but not what we expected. Hotel was very busy as it was the start of spring break but noise from hallway was too loud and lots of activity, shouting, etc. just kept waking us up. There should be something done to the doors to keep noise out. 2nd level family pool was very busy, noisy and not very clean. As with other reviews you could see it in the water colour, kind of milky. Went down slide anyway, and wouldn't you know it, got a cold the next day. Adult pool up top of the hotel was very nice, quiet and clean. Would not stay at this hotel again. Was not that impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, anonymous in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: 05252010bv
Reviews.Content: By that I mean that you could be anywhere, and it was clean, private, comfortable and well situated within the city. Perfect for some alone time with your partner, without fear of interruption. You are close to everything in Toronto, and it is everything a downtown hotel should be in terms of convenience and service. Be Warned: It isnÂ´t swimming in character, or charming unique details of decor. If you are looking to ooh and ah over little objets dÂ´ art, or remark on colonial era crown moulding, go elsewhere. Come here for the convenience, anonymous comfort and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably the closest to Dundas Square, I didn't see any other hotels on the 5 minute walk to the Eaton Centre! It's a huge hotel, but they take really good care of you. There are 2 swimming pools one of them is on the top floor (only for adults) with AWESOME views of the city and the C.N tower. Nice Jacuzzi and exercise rooms. Our room had a balcony as well, which is cool. The beds are like heaven. Overall Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Service Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HazelN
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta Chelsea at least 10 times in the past 12 months and am currently a guest as I write this review. I travel from Largo, Florida and often arrive late at night to check in. No matter how late the hour the front desk staff are as friendly and upbeat as if it were the start of their day and their cheerful and helpful manner always gives me a lift after a long day flying. The rooms which I have been given have differed (according to availability and what I paid) but in all instances they have been very clean. The bedding in the Delta is superb and I really would like to find out where they buy the incredibly comfortable pillows. As a non smoker I appreciate the fact that all entrances to the balconies in the rooms are clearly marked as non smoking so that I have never checked into a room with the tell tale odour of guests past. The multiple dining options have something for any budget and the BB3 is exquisite. Over the past year I have stayed in many other hotels in other cities in North America and the Delta Chelsea has in my opinion the best staff to client ratio as well as the most superbly trained staff I have ever encountered. I recommend the Delta Chelsea to all my business associates and friends with confidence and always look forward to my next stay at my "Toronto Home". Hazel N.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable Hotel - would go again”
Reviews.Author: totty01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Thomson workdwide, having booked flights with them as well. The first room we were offered we refused as it was next to the lift shafts and lifts were in use 24 hours a day but it was no problem to change rooms. we had pre - booked the buffet breakfasts during our 10 day visit, the choice of food and quality was good.Plenty of whatever you wanted, Eggs were scrambled every day which I didn't mind but my husband was miffed that he could not get a fried egg. The adult pool and spa were very nice, and quiet during the daytimes too. For what we paid for our stay we thought it was very good value and were pleased with the choice. It is centrally located and there were plenty of staff on duty at all times.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special. The pool was a bellyflop.”
Reviews.Author: MarieMom25
Reviews.Content: We specifically chose the Delta Chelsea in Toronto because it was billed as the best family hotel. The hotel pool was no bigger than any other average hotel pool, and the water slide was much smaller than I imagined from the descriptions. Plus, my three-year-old was unable to go on it, even when accompanied by an adult. Condition of the whole pool area was less-than-pristine. The rooms were acceptably clean, but very well-worn. The big stuff was clean enough, but fine details like grubby light switches were missed. Hotel staff was friendly and very helpful, although that is generally true of most Torontonians, in my experience. Bed was squeaked, room was small. For the price we paid (even in a Downtown) I would have expected something that was at least on par with a Hampton Inn, but instead got a Comfort Inn. I've paid less for nicer rooms in Manhattan. If this was the last available hotel in Toronto, I wouldn't be too upset about returning, but since there are usually plenty of options, we probably won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our Toronto home from home”
Reviews.Author: Indy11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Chelsea to many times to count right now. The rooms we have used are functional but comfortable. It has a good location which makes most things within reasonable walking distance. The staff have always been most welcoming and helpful. If your stay sees you there on a Sunday you should try the brunch in the Bb33 Bistro and Brasserie. The Elm Street Lounge makes an ideal location for a night cap. Can't real comment on the Monarch, but it always appeared busy. The Market Garden gives a good choice for breakfast at a reasonable price. We have never used it at any other time.

Reviews.Title: “In the right place, but on the old and small side”
Reviews.Author: ConVivo
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of the action, the Delta Chelsa is the hotel for you. It's a few minutes walk to Eaton Center and a few more to the Royal Ontario Museum. All in all the hotel is okay, not dirty, shall we say - well used. Rooms are small, furniture is old and the 19" TV is a total joke - hadn't seen one of those since college.. Parking is $30 a night - ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent hotel in Toronto Centre”
Reviews.Author: psmith45
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel. I only stayed here a night and got a bit of a discount on the room. It's a decent room, the staff was pretty friendly, no complaints. It's close to the Eaton Centre, a few blocks walk to City Hall; basically a little bit north of the downtown financial district. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: PD0609
Reviews.Content: We pricelined this hotel and got it for $55 a night. I would never pay more than that for that hotel. We arrived at 9 pm and they told us they didnt have a room for us ready and they wanted us to wait around until one becomes available. At 9 pm to say that a room is not ready doesn't make sense so we demanded that they find us one. The front desk girl went in the back and 5 min later she came back saying that she found one...so I guess there was a room but they just didnt want to give it to us... weird. This is a huge hotel so be prepare to wait long for elevators especially if you're in the blue tower. The green one seemed to be quicker. The rooms are just ok. Not clean enough to our standard and they need some major renovations everywhere. The hallways looked old, ripped carpet that was taped back together... didnt look very nice. We usually stay at the marriotts and this time we decided to use priceline and see what we could get at a cheap price... For the price that we paid we were pleased, but we would never stay there again, unless we priceline it and get it for the same price. If all you care is the location, then this is a good choice but other than that there is no reason to stay at this hotel, unless you get it for really cheap.

Reviews.Title: “The price you pay...”
Reviews.Author: wombat23
Reviews.Content: We went to Toronto for a weekend to see Tut at the AGO and enjoy the city. We booked a deluxe package through the Delta Chelsea. The first thing is that the room was fine but certainly not deluxe (not large, no separation of sleeping areas, crt TV, no fridge or microwave, for examples). On top of this, EVERYTHING costs money. Such deals as "kids eat free" are slippery things and I still cannot figure out how the exact same breakfast was discounted one morning ($22) and cost over $40 the next. Beware the traps: a plate of watermelon innocently sitting out to be put on one's tray will cost $4.50, and if you take the wrong juice it may void your package. These depressing cons aside, things were okay ... except where they were not. We had the impression that this hotel was "family friendly" because of its pool and recreation facilities. The latter are quite run down and both are under too much pressure. There are so many people in the pool that they have to add so much chlorine that if a milliliter gets in your eyes they will be bloodshot. There must have been 20 people of all ages in the hot (actually merely warm) tub, which made it feel quite disgusting. I assume they have coliform counts under control, but it was not a nice experience. This weekend followed upon another in Ottawa, where we had met up with friends staying at the Delta, and many of the same impressions apply. Our first night was marked by a stag party apparently happening in rooms on both sides of us and across the hall. They woke the entire family with obscenities and noise that went on for hours after midnight. Having your 4 year old ask you what a [--] sucker is at 3AM after phoning in multiple complaints and learning that many others had been made was a low point in my parenting life. Staff were timid and ineffectual in dealing with the problem. They also displayed absolute ineptitude (tho pleasant manners) in actually giving us our AGO passes. All around, this is a hotel we will not revisit. The reasons we went in the first place -- the kid friendly stuff and the AGO package were both disappointments. Our room was okay, except the hotel staff did not exercise control over a major disturbance. We had to move to a floor that was under construction and smelled like cigarette smoke. We also di dnot like being nickeled and dimed: 14$ for a movie, cheesey policy on kids meals, expensive parking, internet another 14$ or something. This is low class stuff. All of this might have been quite different if the hotel was lower on bookings, we had not had a floor full of partying dorks, and so on. The staff were nice, even if incompetent, and the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, family suite a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: EMUP
Reviews.Content: We went to Toronto looking to have a children's holiday over Easter, we wanted a hotel that they would like and to do the things they wanted to do. The Delta Chelsea and the family suite fit perfectly for what we were looking for. The location of the hotel was great, the Market Place restaurant was perfect if you have small children. Staff were mostly very lovely and very nice to the children. I was a little surprised that while we were in the kids club the staff member didn't acknowledge the children or even smile at them. While I understand they are not there to babysit and we were there to play with them, I would have thought that she would have welcomed them and maybe asked their names and shown then where things were kept. We picked the family suite as it offered two bedrooms which we prefer so that everyone can get a good nights sleep. The room size was perfect and it felt clean but it is in MAJOR need of refurbishment with peeling wall paper, chipped tiles, stains, uncomfortable sitting room furniture (probably the most uncomfortable sofa I have ever sat on) and the balcony was shocking. I understand that the hotel is currently working on renovations and knew this prior to going there so I was aware that we may get a room that was old and shabby so I wasn't disappointed. Knowledge is power. Room service staff were quick and very nice. Front Desk and bar staff were really friendly. I seemed to know more about what a family could do in Toronto than the Conceirge did from my trip planning. The kids loved it and the Easter bunny found them so we accomplished what we set out to do. I would stay again but maybe wait until all the rooms have been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Best FAMILY FRIENDLY Hotel in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: mismasters
Reviews.Content: I was nervous with some of the reviews on here about what we were getting, especially for the price I was paying. This hotel was A+mazing! We payed $99 CAD a night and had two double beds that were so....comfy. The coffee maker in my room did not work, so a small note to the room attendant was left and she replaced it with a new one. Every staff person I spoke too was super friendly. Free wifi is in the lobby and can also be received on the 2nd floor pool area. My son loved the family pool and waterslide. They also have a family play center with toys and a pet bunny rabbit named Brownie. Our balcony door would not open enough for someone to fit out, which I believe is done for childrens rooms and rightfully so....I didn't want my son to be on a balcony 10 stories up while I was in the bathroom! You cannot ask for a better location. You can catch the TTC at College or Dundas stations with Eaton center and Dundas Square within 5 minutes walk from the hotel. A shoppers drug mart is just across the street for extra needs until midnight with a 24 shoopers at College and Yonge. Tip 1: This is a HUGE hotel with over 1,000 rooms. This means there will always be a lot of people around (people who need something, checking in/out, directions, etc). Be smart about timing with check out/ check in, etc. Tip 2: There is a Toronto City Guide in the lobby, GET ONE! This has a map of the city, attractions and more importantly a map of the TTC lines. Tip 3: Use the lobby touchscreen monitor that has a connection to Yelp for local attractions, dining, etc. It has the reviews for each and shows you the location on a map. Tip 4: READ the instructions for towel service, located over the toittie :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but some staff could be more helpful..."”
Reviews.Author: FussyMidAgedWithKids
Reviews.Content: Location good for access to Downtown, however this end of Yonge St a bit seedy. There is no info in the rooms about the hotel facilities, so had to search for pools and kids rooms etc. Also was not told at check in or when we paid for our first meal that kids under 12 pay 1/2 for meals so missed out and the cashier would not refund! Poor! Also the meal offers vary, so the key is to ask first! On the plus it is very child friendly with kids playroom, kids pool with shute, teenage den with computers, xbox & ping pong. Internet access free in lobby and the Market Garden Restuarant so a fav with my iphone obessed kids. Little chef in Market Garden very grumpy! There is a adults only gym and pool which was good for an escape. Lifts too our room on 23rd floor tedious as often waited several minutes (no kidding) for them to arrive - we then found a back route to use the other set of lifts to floor 25 (pool deck) and walk down two flights - great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Silverain54
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night (3/27/10). Got a great deal off discount booking site. Upon arrival was given a room with 2 double beds, upgraded to "King deluxe" for $15 extra. This was worth it in our opinion. Up on the 23rd floor we had a nice view of Yonge St. and a balcony. Can't say TOO much about the room as we only stayed one night but it was clean, the bed/bedding was comfortable, and the decor was modern. Self-parking at the hotel was $27 for a 24 hour period with in and out priveleges. We took advantage off the breakfast buffet offered as we wanted to eat quickly and head out. It was $18.99 pp and we thought it was a bit steep for the selection of what was offered (typical buffet stuff). However the food was tasty and beverages are included in the price. All staff we dealt with were polite and helpful! All in all we had a great stay and would look forward to staying at this property again. The location was within walking distance to the Eaton Centre and other shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to take a Swim in Winter”
Reviews.Author: sail2peace
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just wonderful. The staff friendly and helpful at every turn. Very close to Eaton Center Mall. The pool and fitness facilities on the top floor we amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel for business and pleasure. Close to nightlife, shopping, & sports. The restaurants of Toronto are going to be a good reason for me to return. The only minus that I want go into to much about is that I would not book via Expedia again. I know that Tripadvisor and Expedia are the same company but Expedia will not be doing anymore bookings for me.

Reviews.Title: “the rudest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: strawblonde48
Reviews.Content: this hotel has rooms that are absolutely disgusting. mouldy, old, vinly/polyester "bed spreads". not anything like the pictures. beware if you book thru a 3rd party they will ONLY give you these gross rooms first. I couldn't breathe within in 10 minutes of being in the room because of the mould. they refused to give me another room unless I paid lots extra. it's listed as a 3 1/2 star at every website, but the manager says they are not that they are only a 2 1/2 star, his words. if I book a 3 1/2 star room i want one and do not expect mould in my room. they do have nicer rooms but you won't ever get one if booked thru a 3rd party, also the managers words. i will NEVER stay there or recommend this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Back as a fovorite”
Reviews.Author: JPC1628
Reviews.Content: We knew the Delta Chelsea in the seventies, when it was a favorite kid-friendly destination of families. Since then, it has had its up and downs and we have not patronized it in the last few years. Perhaps it was fine, we just did not go. This time, the Tut exhibition drew us to Toronto. The Chelsea is once again the busy, popular, ideally situated, big and somewhat "assembly-line" hotel. But the superbly trained staff are quick, efficient and cheery (an extra ticket for the exhibition was delivered to our room within the hour). We found the Chelsea in the middle of a profound renovation (not the first since we were there) ,which did not intrude into the life of the already renovated parts. The latter are just fine; the standard rooms are just as standard as they were (on the small side, no fridge), but the furniture and bedding are totally up to date (workable desk and chair, wide screen TV) comfortable and clean. The renovation has been successful, and the halls and rooms are on the cheery side. But for those of us with nostalgia, there are still traces of the 1970's Chelsea, such as the black on aluminum raised numbers for the floors at the elevator doors, and they have kept those improbable balconies which open onto dismal views, and which we thought to be a menace when we had small children. The restaurants (a cafÃ©, a lounge and a "brasserie") are unremarkable, but the Market Garden is a buffet-like place where you coould actually compose your own meal and take it back to your room (self room service, so to speak). So the Chelsea should be once more the prime family destination in Toronto. For us, the $200 (all in) tab for one night, parking and two adult tickets to the King Tut exhibit was great value.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend at the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Tikkles62
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent rate at one of the discount websites then upgraded our room on arrival. The hotel was super busy due to spring break, but the service was excellent and friendly. The staff is well-trained. Everyone we encountered was helpful and pleasant with a great attitude. We ate dinner one night at one of the hotel restaurants, and we were very pleasantly surprised with the exceptional food quality. There are 2 pools. One is adults only which is nice. The underground parking leaves something to be desired especially at $27 per night ($32 valet), but that's metro Toronto. Excellent location right off Yonge. We will definitely consider this hotel on future trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: supermom46
Reviews.Content: Checking in was a zoo.We requested early checkin, but were even lucky to get our room by regular check in time. The service was mediocre at best. A few staff were excellent, Maxine at Front Desk, but the rest could care less about providing any kind of service let alone quality service. The room was small, required maintenance and repair, and quite disappointing. After removing a tack from my foot, I needed to push the carpet at the entryway to the washroom back down under the threshold so it would not be a tripping hazard. The windows in the room were in such disrepair they were fogged which was very unattractive and we couldn't even see out of them. The room was stuffy and the fan/airconditioning came with no instruction regarding the operation of it.The childrens playroom was great, except for the sweltering temperatures we expereinced within the playroom. Staff member Meagan was FANTASTIC. Meagan was enthusiastic, professional, and knowledgable.Unfortunately these traits were not shared by all we encountered in this area.The buffet breakfast was terrible. The bacon was tasteless, poor quality of food, and limited selection. The decor in the Market Garden was terribly outdated, and tired. The March Break program was about the only good thing we expereinced while staying there. Thank goodness we only stayed one night. I would have quickly cacelled and moved to another hotel had we had to stay a second night.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Trekman20
Reviews.Content: The construction across the street starts at 7am although we were told at check-in that it did not start until 8 am. If you need quiet in the morning go to another hotel. It would have been very useful had they informed me about the construction when I called the hotel to book my room. The hotel is located conveniently to everything in town. The lobby is alive with activity. This could be a great place but I can't give it a good review at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: Hollymoon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta Chelsea three times. Each time I have been impressed with the welcoming and accommodating staff. Everyone that I have come into contact with has been lovely and very efficient. The central location is also great. This year I stayed during March break, it was really busy, lots of kids. I was with work, not children, but they all looked like they were having a great time, lots of activities going on. The free popcorn and talking robot in the lobby seemed to go down well with all the children. It looked like a good place for a family break. When i have stayed during the school term, it has been much quieter. The adult swimming pool on the top floor is fine. It is quite small relative to the number of rooms, however, it has always been quiet when I have been for a swim. The view is great. The only problem I had was building work going on outside. It was so noisy. The work started really early in the morning and did wake me up. Check that you can have a room away from the building work if you book. I would recommend this hotel for it's great location and lovely welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: shauny2k3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after going on priceline.com and offering $35 a night on the name your price option they're famous for. Pro's: - Excellent location - Good food service area - Nice clean swimming pool and jacuzzi - Helpful staff - Clean Con's: - a little old - long wait time to check in - always busy Certainly not the blitziest place in the world, but well worth the money and very clean with an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “"Vacation almost ruined by surprising deposit policy"”
Reviews.Author: NeverAgainKanata
Reviews.Content: Our Family booked 3 nights during March Break...we had carefully planned our budget according to the cost of hotel and other items on our list of things to do. We booked 2 adjoining rooms to provide a little more comfort for ourselves and 3 growing boys! On our first dinner out we were embarrassed by a declined Visa...we immediately thought our card had been compromised so upon getting back to the hotel we called our Visa company and were shocked to be informed of $1937 charged to our Visa by the Delta Hotel. We called the front desk about this and were THEN informed of their "security deposit policy" of which we were never told about when reserving the rooms over the phone or at check-in. The total charge for the 2 rooms over 3 nights was $1164 so they billed over $800 extra as a security deposit that we were NEVER informed about. We never received an apology or any compensation for this very inconvenient problem for our family vacation. We were not able to use our Visa for the rest of our vacation because the Delta Hotel had tied up any remaining room on the card. Free internet or free parking was never offered as customer care. We felt humiliated that our carefully planned budget had been ruined by a policy that was never disclosed. We will never stay at the Delta Chelsea ever again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed. The rooms were small and felt crowded. The hotel is old. I was sold this hotel by family who were quite impressed with it. I went in with high expectations and was let down. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea ~ Always a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: JennyP_7943
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Delta Chelsea ~ it has become somewhat of a second home in the last few months, (which is likely not all that cost-effective; thankfully I don't foot the entire bill :) First and foremost, the front desk staff are wonderful; I am especially fond of the people working at the Delta Privilege Desk. They know me by name, they're fun to talk to, and they always do their best to accommodate me. I am often put in a position where my stay has to be extended day-by-day due to my uncertain, sometimes erratic work obligations plus I have a lot of friends in the city and am easily-swayed to stay a bit longer for non-work related fun. The staff is so patient with me; despite the fact that I know I must be a pain in their necks at times. The location is fantastic - my favourite neighbourhood in Toronto - In-fact I used to live a block-away. Lively Yonge Street with the diversity of people, shops, restaurants, and food. The Toronto Eaton Centre (huge mall) is a quick walk away. A car is not necessary and their is life buzzing around the streets 24-7. The Entertainment, business, and film districts are all very close-by. The hotel lobby is huge; always bustling with people. It has a nice, cozy type of feel with plenty of seating. In-terms of dining - I haven't actually dined in the more upscale of the two restaurants but have ordered room service from them numerous times and I am always pleased. Perhaps a few items are a tad over-priced - but room service always is pricey. The more family-style restaurant is great. Huge selection, great salad bar, fresh pizza, made-to order food from the grill. It's cafeteria style, laid-back, and you can request take out if you prefer the serenity of your room. I have been in the pub and received great service from one of the bartenders (although it was a while back and I forget his name). Seeing as it is a huge hotel, there are three blocks of elevators that are separated by colour. The "blue" elevators tend to be the busiest and there is sometimes a bit of a wait - but that's nothing that would upset me. The hallways are a bit dated but clean. Depending on where your room is located, it can be a bit of a trek from the elevator. In terms of the rooms - I have been in a wide-range of the hotel's rooms. I will agree that the unrenovated guest rooms are sub-par with very dated furnishings, silly little tvs and they show wear and tear. It has however been noted several times here (and to me personally by the front desk staff), that these older rooms are under-going renovation. The upgraded rooms are very nice, with flatscreen tvs and modern furnishings. Sometimes I will get a room with small imperfections here and there - the odd scuff on the bathroom tiles or a too-loud fan in the bathroom, but never anything that would negatively affect my enjoyment. I really dislike the alarm clocks in the upgraded rooms though. Maid service is good - the cleaning staff is always friendly and accommodating. My only complaint is that despite always requesting a 6pm check-out, there have been a few occasions where the maid has walked in before my scheduled check-out time. Again - very minor complaint and infrequent considering how many times I have stayed at this hotel. The internet is free of charge for Delta Privilege Members, ( a great rewards program for frequent visitors. The perks I receive thanks to being a member have earned them my loyalty). They have a nice fitness centre and adult pool. For those with families - I hear they have great kids-programs. There's a cute little reception desk just for kids; nice touch. Simply-put - the Delta Chelsea is in a fantastic location, has a wonderful roster of employees, nice rooms, good food, good value, and my thumbs-up :)

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise & poorly appointed room”
Reviews.Author: dnbma
Reviews.Content: The construction across the street starts around 7am. If you need quiet in the morning, you must request a room away from the construction before you arrive. The Delta Chelsea is a very busy hotel and once you check-in, it is very difficult (if not impossible as in my case) to move to another room. The Chelsea can't control this so make sure you do. My room also had peeling wallpaper, frayed carpet that was pulling away from the wall and a musty smelling bathroom. Again, ask for a renovated room before you arrive as it will be difficult to move once your checking in. The hotel staff tried their best to help but they were unable to do anything. The hotel is located conveniently to everything in town. The lobby is alive with activity. This could be a great place but I can't give it a good review at this time.

Reviews.Title: “A positive weekend at the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: anem65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Chelsea Delta in Toronto. We purchased a package that included an overnight stay at the Chelsea, two tickets for the King Tut Exhibition, free parking, and a $25 food voucher. ....all of t his for $169. ..and, excellent value for our money. The hotel was extremely busy as it was Valentines/Family Day weekdend, Nevertheless, we got excellent service. Regardless of the lineups, checkin in and out was quick and seamless. Our hotel room was smaller than what we are used to, but quaint, and romantic, and set the mood for Valentines Day. Our food voucher covered a breakfast brunch in the morning. We felt we spent a very positive weekend at the Delta Chelsea. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean Festival”
Reviews.Author: DorothyR1
Reviews.Content: I consider this my home when in Toronto. It's in the center of all the activity, a few steps from shopping, and entertainment. Park the car, and leave it.Trolley, Subway, Buses, and Taxi's to get you where you want to go. Better yet? Walk!! I always take the train up to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Stella_6874
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is located right in downtown Toronto, which meant we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. I think that is the only reason it is so popular. It offers a few onsite restaurants and a pub, so the lobby is always mobbed with people. It's a nice looking lobby, but it was always crowded and noisy. We used Hotwire and got nearly $30 less per night than their advertised AAA special price, so I'm guessing they stuck us in one of the older rooms, as it was a bit run-down. The floors had scuffs and stains, and the moulding and furniture had chips in it. Our room had a small balcony, but it was grimy looking and the railings were rusty. At one point we called the front desk to ask if they would send up a corkscrew. We waited nearly 45 minutes, and finally called again, after which they came up with it in 5 minutes. (The staff was always friendly though) We visited the adult pool area which was nice and not too crowded, although we went at an off time. The main appeal of this hotel is the location. It would be good for families traveling on a budget, and people who plan on a lot of sightseeing and not much time spent in the room. We were basically only using it to sleep and shower in, so I suppose for the price I paid, the room quality was ok... I think next time I'll spring for something a little nicer though.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected and disappointing customer service by Some of hotel check-in staff, manager, and General Manager.”
Reviews.Author: Meeleursh
Reviews.Content: We are a family with one son who uses a walker and a wheelchair, so we need a fair bit of room for those things and our luggage. When booking our room, there were no accessible rooms, so we booked the deluxe room which had more space than the regular delta room. While at check-in, the lady serving us seemed uncertain as to what she was seeing on her computer. So she called a fellow employee over to help. I asked if there was a problem and he said no. I confirmed with them that we had reserved by phone a deluxe room, high up with a balcony. Again, "no problem". We were standing there with our son with all of our "things"...should be obvious...but no, we got to our room and it was the small delta room. I went downstairs to find out what had happened. The staff who had helped us were not there, so Ashleigh, a very accomodating and nice young lady helped me. She said they down graded us to a delta room (at the $99 rate) because there were no deluxe rooms cleaned/ready. She said if we hadn't had dinner yet, we could bring our things down and go for dinner and whe would get one ready. When we returned there was still not one available, so she talked with her manager, who never came out themselves to help with accomodations or apologize for the other staff. We did end up in a deluxe room on the 7th floor but felt very disppointed with the service and how it was handled. The other disappointment was the pool. We were so looking forward to it, since it bosted being so great and had a slide but we found it very small and dirty. Of course, there was a lot of chlorine to accomodate but, we felt it was cloudy and dirty looking! And my son did end up with a cold the day we returned home. I did an online survey at www.deltalistens.com but feel there response did not give me any desire to ever use Delta hotels again. The entry way to the hotel was warm and welcoming and when we finally got to a deluxe room, it was modern and tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “huge but convenient”
Reviews.Author: ansobol
Reviews.Content: It is a huge hotel (Canada's largest, if I'm not mistaken). As such, it does not have much "character," but is a very convenient place to stay in Toronto. One minor glitch is that newspaper delivery is non-free and provided on the opt-out basis, which I only learned at checkout. Free WiFi is only available at the main lobby and one level above it, in the ballroom lobby, but it is always easy to find a (comfortable) chair or couch to check email and surf the web.

Reviews.Title: “deal”
Reviews.Author: caseylouis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea on Gerard st. Toronto last Thursday, Feb 11 2010. The room was nice and the facilities great. we were wondering about the great discount on rental though and arrived to find that there was construction going on next door. I commented that our rooms would be on that side of the building, and they were. Other than that the hotel was great, but it was a long walk from the train station and Convention centre. We went to the Auto Show Media day.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Northerntraveller10
Reviews.Content: I was here once about 10 years ago, and while some things have changed, it is still a good full service hotel. One thing I found though, is that there are the better parts of the hotel and the older parts. I booked my room thru Priceline, and seemed to get a discount rooms too. It was still clean and the room was up to date but not like I thought it would be. Good for business as it had a big desk, but outlets in this room were a rarity. The service was excellent from staff and as it is a full service hotel, they have concierge to help with directions, and a bell hop to store my luggage upon checkout as I was going to a meeting the morning of checkout and did not want to bring it with me. They also have great lounge areas and a variety of restaurants including a garden bistro, upscale restaurant, more family style restaurant, a pub and a bar. The garden restaurant was great for breakfast - highly recommend it and the prices for lunch were good too. I could see parking may be a challenge there like anywhere in downtown Toronto, so a took a cab from the airport to the hotel and used the subways to get around - works well although crowded in the rush hours - College station is right there. After I found out they have a GO Transit Bus (highway style) make regular runs from the airport to downtown for about $20 - will try that next time and stops right at the front door of the hotel. If only someone could get moving and get a direct highspeed link from the airport, it would make my life and millions of others alot better. My only one complaint was that I was put in a room that was opposite a condo under construction across the street and there was lots of noise during the day, but was confined from 8am to 6pm. No construction noise at night. But if you are trying to prepare for a meeting during the day, ask upon booking for a room away from the condo project across the street. Also the balcony was discusting. No I don't use the balcony, although if someone smoked, I guess it would be good to have, but it was completely covered in bird poop and the railing was really rust covered. I don't know what they could do about that unless screens were put up though. Anyway, for a room downtown that will not break the bank and has good service, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you book through Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: RM_1509
Reviews.Content: The Delta is great if you want to be in the heart of where the action is. The Lobby is very massive and the Resteraunts are very nice with good food. The rooms are tired and old and could use updating. I have stayed her quite a few times and each time the rooms have just been ok. If you book on Hotwire or Priceline at $50-75 night its worth it but I would not pay the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: love_to_travel1188
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in the hotel. We went there for the location and the family fun zone located on the 2nd floor. The kids loved it, and my husband was able to enjoy the adult swimming pool and rec centre on the 27th floor. We were upgraded to a bigger suite which was very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: angel_ritchie
Reviews.Content: I got there and room was dirty but looked good enough that we would stay there for the next 4 nights. The second night we went back at 8 and the room was still not made up from that morning so we went and told and front desk who said they would have it done right away so my family and I went to see a movie. We went back at 10 and it had still not been made up so we sat in the lobby for another hour (until almost 11) when it had finally been done. On the third night when i was going to sleep i noticed that my pillow was yellow which i could barley see through the pillow case so i took the pillow case off to further invistigate and the pillow had garbage written on and this was the third night i would have been sleeping on this pillow so very angry I went down and talked to the front desk about how horrified i was and they upgraded the room right away to a far nicer and much more modern room. Even the little things about our old room were horrible like for example that the alarm clock must have been from the 80's and the one in our new room was brand new and even had an ipod plug in. Please DO NOT go for the cheap rooms they are horrible and you will regret it, if you go for the deluxe room like the one that we were upgraded to you will be a great deal happier. However i will never return to them they made my trip nothing but a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but stay away from the bargain rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelingFelix
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate of under $100 through expedia on our room. The hotel is large, centrally located, lots of amenities, staff is friendly. Our room was OK (clean), but tired with cracked bathroom tiles, ripped wallpaper, no safe, no minibar, a long way from the elevators. Now we know why it was such a good rate.. Chelsea is a good place to stay, but you will get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nomvula_za
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea for one night, and it was everything I needed - efficient, clean, and a great downtown location. LIKES: Check-in was fast and the front desk staff were friendly and happily accommodated my request for a later check-out time. The room was on the smaller side, but I didn't mind since I didn't spend much time in the room other than to sleep! I did use the pool & hot tub, which were nice. Bed was very comfortable! Shower had decent pressure and lots of hot water. I like the June Jacobs green tea & cucumber bath products too. DISLIKES: There is no free internet in the rooms, which these days I feel is a necessity that many other hotels offer as a complimentary service to their guests. Although the front desk staff had given me a later check-out time, one of the housekeepers barged into my room at 10:30am - even before the normal check-out time of 11am! I'm not sure what she was doing; there was no need to come into my room to make up beds as I was going to be leaving later that day. Coffee supplied in the rooms was TERRIBLE, and I expected it to be bad but it was not even drinkable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: world_in_my_eyes
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two nights at the Delta Chelsea. I booked the room through Priceline so the price was great - almost 50% of the hotel website price. The room was a double on the 16th floor facing north. The room was average size and not bad for an older hotel in a city. The room was clean. Some stains on the bathroom tile appeared to be dirt but they were definitely permanent. The towels were nice, beds were comfortable with ok linens, plenty of hot water. The TV was very small but I wasn't there to watch TV so whatever. The location was excellent and I was able to walk everywhere I needed to go. There were only a few small problems, and not necessarily the fault of the hotel but I think they are worth mentioning. First of all, the clearance for the hotel self-park garage was 5'6" clearance so I was unable to park my taller vehicle. However, the front desk was very helpful & valet parked the car for the self-park rate. The hotel might want to consider mentioning this on the website as a lot of people drive larger vehicles these days. The second problem was with internet access. My computer automatically looks for wi-fi networks. In the room, I was taken to a login site that looks like it's for the hotel but really it's not. The name of the network was Hotel Guest Access. It asks for your credit card info but it's not legit. Do not enter your information!! I did, and it's a scam!! Had to cancel my credit card while traveling. Total pain. It seems like someone in near by building is phishing. They should really provide more clear directions for how to get on the internet from your room. The directions in the book were vague. All you have to do is plug in the modem to your computer and they automatically charge it to your room. They do have free wi-fi in the lobby. Also, if you use more than one computer in the room, they bill you $13.95 per day per computer which is BS. We couldn't both work at the same time because of no wifi in room. I complained and they waived the fee for the second computer. The third issue, and not any fault of the hotel, is very noisy construction taking place directly across from the north side of the hotel. If you want to sleep past 7am without hearing banging & booming you will be better off requesting a room NOT facing north. It looks like they are putting up a tall building so it could be ongoing for quite some time. Overall, the Delta Chelsea was a good hotel for my purposes. The staff was very helpful, friendly & responsive. I heard the desk staff saying that most of the rooms have been renovated recently. I signed up for the free membership on the website as soon as I made my reservation. I'm not sure but it might make a difference for the type of room you are assigned at check in.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: rhenastormy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel Jan 16th-Jan17th. The room was very small. When we went down to hand in the keys we made a remark of how small the room was and then we were informed it was because we paid for it with air miles. What a thing to say. Do they not know how much you spend to get those air miles. Never again and I will make sure to let friends and family know the unpleasant stay we had.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: ellierobertsathome
Reviews.Content: a group of 5 of us stayed at the Chelsea for the first time and i must say we will be back whenever we find outselves in the area again for business or for pleasure that is for sure checkin was smooth and easy, the food at the restaurant was good, the rooms were superb and clean and all of the staff were lovely

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Until 4:00 AM!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michieme34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Year's Eve, our room was fine, staff was friendly at check in, alot of noisey kids staying in the hotel, drinking etc.., but that was expected for New Year's Eve, so that didn't bother us, plus at check-in we had to sign a noise waiver!!!Went out for the night, came back at 2:00am and fell asleep around 3am, at 4am we get awakened by the fire alarm!!!!!!! It must have went off for about 10 minutes or longer, so loud, it was pulled by some kids and we were told on the loud speaker to evacuate!!!!!! We had a feeling it was a false alarm, then around 5am, back to sleep, well tried to sleep! then not sure exactly what time it was, the fire alarm went off again!!!, but we didnt have to evacuate since we were on the 22nd floor, false alarm again!!!!!!! So we didnt get any sleep the rest of the night/morning, I called down at around 9:30am and asked for a later check out and was told ok for 12pm, but me and my husband were so pissed off and exhausted we just checked out at 11am. I know this is not the hotel's fault that the alarm was pulled in the middle of the night twice, but we were looking forward to a relaxing evening away from our kids, since our youngest wakes up quite a bit through the night, we thought we would get a decent sleep, that didn't happen!!! I would appreciate a FREE night. We tried to speak to someone before we were leaving the hotel, but were told to wait on the check out line, which would have taken a couple hours, because the line up was huge, glad we checked out through the tv. I hope a manager from the hotel reads this and gets back to me soon!!!!!! When I call the hotel, I get put on hold and then hung up on!! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good price, Terrible Customer Care.”
Reviews.Author: nightsky_0009
Reviews.Content: 1.Reqired to wear an ugly wristband during my stay at the hotel, which I couldnâ€™t remove and replace for my other activities outside of the hotel. 2. Very rude security when re-entering hotel at night. Very unwelcoming personals at the door, felt like I shouldnâ€™t be allowed back to a building that I PAID to stay at. 3. I only had a little more than 3 hours sleep because the floor I was staying on had kids running around drinking until 4:30 am, which I called front desk to see if they can control the situation. The only response I got was â€œ yes the hotel is aware of the noiseâ€�. I did not get any sense of customer care from the operator.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, family friendly, but shabby”
Reviews.Author: Europamonkey
Reviews.Content: Have now stayed twice at the Delta Chelsea. The hotel is huge, with four separate entrances into the lobby from Gerrard, Bay, Yonge and Elm Sts. Check-in and check -out were efficient on both occasions, though occasionally had to queue for a while at reception on other occasions. The rooms on both occasions were spacious and comfortable. All rooms have balconies. Housekeeping has generally been OK, although there was an overflowing ashtray left on the balcony on the first occasion, and disgusting yellow stains on the toilet flush handle on my second stay. This wiped off easily enough, and should have been spotted by housekeeping. The decor is worn around the edges in both the rooms and the hallways. I found the kingsize beds very comfortable but might be rather firm for some. There is free wi-fi in the lobby and bars on the ground floor; a $30 daily charge applies to have access in the room. The hotel seems very family friendly. Lots of excitable kids in the lobby around Father Christmas. The amenities on the 26th floor are adult only (pool and gym). The Market Garden restaurant was fine for a tired solo traveller. Good local options include the Queen and Beaver pub on Elm St, Pickle Barrel on Yonge St, and plenty of other reasonable places within easy walking distance. Had a couple of breakfasts at Eggsmart on the corner of Elm and Bay. All in all, a comfortable stay on both occasions. This is a very large hotel, and service is somewhat impersonal. Good position and an easy walk to the Eaton Centre. Room cleaning needs some real improvement, and renovation is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, awesome location, upgrade your room”
Reviews.Author: Merriam123
Reviews.Content: Can't beat location and value for experiencing downtown TO. Front desk, housekeeping and Concierge staff are fantastic. Would not recommend anything below a deluxe room, shop the internet for discount codes. Wouldn't pay rack rate to stay here. Business services helps you print off boarding passes for free.

Reviews.Title: “Their Suites are not Sweet !”
Reviews.Author: davecason
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone, I usually stay at the Delta Chelsea but not anymore. I joined their Privilege plan here about 3 years ago. It was and is free and it does have some nice perks in the program but forget it if you canâ€™t get your room on those floors booked if they are full. Go find another hotel. PERIOD I asked to check in on Nov 23 on Monday and I was checking out on Friday. (4 days) I was told at the time I canâ€™t get my Signature room because they were full so I asked to be upgraded to a Suite. They said no problem and that was $218/night instead of my usual $179/night. I said well thatâ€™s fine just move me in to the club rooms the day after. I got there no problem on Monday and got a key for a Suite that uses the green elevators (big warning - you want to be in the blue elevator wing) I got up there and opened the door to my suite. I actually took about 55 photos to show people but I donâ€™t know if I can load them up here. It was just sad, the entire room was a hole. I have pictures of the gross rusted and moldy air vents that feed the room, the air system didnâ€™t run at all, the peeling and creased wallpaper and the naps and hacks in the rug, the chipped and hacked furniture and walls, and then spitballs I found on the framed print in the bedroom just before I was going to go to bed. I just hung a towel over the print and left a note for housekeeping. It has a kitchen which I didnâ€™t ask for but it was there â€“ rudimentary fridge and stove but again over all I wouldnâ€™t even live in a house like that mush less a Suite Iâ€™m paying a premium for. It was just disappointing over all so I went back downstairs and asked them to find me another room or better yet my usual club room, they said they will but itâ€™ll be another night. I said OK move me on Tuesday night but right now find me a better suite then, or Iâ€™m going to another hotel. So I got moved to a two room (connecting door) set of rooms off the blue elevators and in 1980 and 1982. It was a better room(s) one regular suite with a king and much nicer look and feel over all and a connected hospitality suite next door. I never did get moved in to the club room I asked for. OK, fine Iâ€™m here, one morning I went up to get my morning coffee in the lounge upstairs. Again Iâ€™ve been in there 10+ times, I walk in and show the guy my room key and he asks what room Iâ€™m in I tell him and he says you canâ€™t come in. I was a bit shocked and asked why, he said well youâ€™re not staying in one of the Signature rooms and said yes, thatâ€™s true Iâ€™ve been waiting to get moved in to one of them. His answer was well Iâ€™m sorry you canâ€™t come in. I then explained to him how I have my Platinum Privilege membership and why I continue to come to the Delta to stay there. Itâ€™s a loyalty program. I asked if the manager was aware of this and he then relented and said I could come in, I then declined and went to my work site and bought coffee. I guess if you have the membership it does not matter and your willingness to continue to use the Delta Hotel chain goes out the window if you donâ€™t stay in a Signature room and instead pay MORE for a suite. Now that makes sense. Then of course upon check out I got my bill and of course it was $160 more because I couldnâ€™t get my Signature room that I asked for from the start so I paid more for the suites but then I found out that I still have to pay for my internet access again for an additional $60 dollars and its again because I didnâ€™t stay in that $179/night room but instead paid $218.00/night â€¦. I must admit I am confused and Yoko at the desk didnâ€™t seem to care. She did give me the name of the hotels manager when I asked so thatâ€™s something I guess. So I paid up and checked out, I am on an expense account but its just point of Delta creating a customer rewards program that only applies when they like it. Should I have to pay an additional $220.00 dollars even though I am a member of their program because they canâ€™t give me the room I want and then I upgrade my room at my cost and the rest of the program does not apply to me as well. I must admit I am confused. So can I suggest the Delta â€¦. No probably not anymore and there is a Marriot 2 blocks away. Cheersâ€™ Dave Cason

Reviews.Title: “clean the bathrooms... PLEASE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: angeric
Reviews.Content: This hotel has rooms with absolutely disgusting bathrooms. Very poorly cleaned with black colored mold around the toilet handle, base of toilet, and back wall... and this has always been consistent (stayed here on 3 separate occasions through Priceline). The bad thing is, that the mold (and not to mention the hairs that were also left behind) on the toilet can be wiped off (as I did the third time around as I was so disgusted and didn't want to look at it any longer); however, the hotel cleaning staff do not bother to do this. The carpets in the rooms are also terribly worn and dirty looking (including in the halls). I wish there was a way to specify on Priceline that I ONLY want a 3 or 4 star (but not a 3.5) so as to not risk getting the 3.5 star Delta (a joke). From here on out, I will no longer risk this and will likely book through another service. The Delta rooms need a serious upgrade... and some SERIOUS cleaning. I bid for a 3 1/2 star hotel, not a hostel room equivalent (which, by the way, are typically much cleaner). A 1 to 2* hotel would be an upgrade to this and would likely be MUCH cleaner. Otherwise, the location is great but the disgusting room always seems to nullify this benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant weekend seeing the Dead Sea Scrolls”
Reviews.Author: jeanlf
Reviews.Content: Good all around. Pool very enjoyable, sauna, hot tub all good. Breakfast/food somewhat expensive. Adjoining rooms provided as promised.

Reviews.Title: “Five star location, two star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisC1
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea has the distinct reputation of being a first-class property located in the heart of downtown Toronto. Unfortunately, based on our experience, the reputation seems to have been earned years ago and the hotel is coasting along on this past reputation alone. We checked in late at night (around 10:30-11:00) and the front-desk staff was welcoming and very friendly. The gentleman offered us advice on area attractions and shopping and was very outgoing. We checked in expediently and made our way up to our room on the 7th floor (725). The room itself left a lot to be desired. While the hotel is completely non-smoking now, our room had a distinct musky smell to it, like an old dried up air freshener. The single queen bed was hard enough to double as an ironing board and the stained carpet told the tale of many, many, many guests who had enjoyed the room before us. When I closed my eyes, I thought I could actually hear them in the room still.. and then I realized it was just people walking in the hallway outside the very poorly sound-insulated room. We turned on the small CRT television, that was perched on a pitiful little cart, to find that the default volume was AT ABSOLUTE FULL BLAST WHEN YOU TURNED IT ON. I have never stayed in a hotel before that felt so 'used'. While the room was not a complete dump, it was dingy and felt very 'tired'. As previously mentioned, the walls were paper thin and you could distinctly hear noises from adjoining rooms and clear conversations in the hallway. I'm sure they, in turn, loved it when we TURNED ON THE TELEVISION IN THE MORNING. I don't know what I'm more disappointed in.. the fact that I actually held the Delta Chelsea itself in high-esteem before staying here, or simply how poor our accommodations were.
