If all its rooms are like the one we stayed in, it won't be long until it's reputation is marred by many ominous black stains, just like our white shower curtain. Would I stay here again? Absolutely not. The location is A+ but, based on our experience, the hotel is a D-.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3.5 star at all.”
Reviews.Author: julz_000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via priceline.com which rates it as a 3.5 star. It cost 70 CAD which I thought was very fair given the pictures on the website. However, the pictures on the website are NOTHING like the room we actually got when we arrived. Beware when booking on priceline, as the rooms you get are the crappy extremely outdated musty rooms. The furniture was old and falling apart, the carpet stained and disgusting. The bathroom was old and tiles were broken. The room smelled like a cheap motel. Given that we were not impressed, we went to the front desk to ask for an upgrade. We had to pay $40.00 for a renovated room and told by front desk that it would have a flat panel television, duvet covers (vs the nasty old flowery bedsheets in the first room we checked into) and a renovated washroom. Once we arrived at the room we were disappointed to see that the flat panel tv was not at all that - it was one of those old boxed tvs. NOT really a big deal given that we would spend limited time in a room but since we paid for an upgrade we expected the room to be as he promised. At least this room was cleaner and the bathroom more acceptable. Normally I would not be so picky, but I didn't think the hotel was worth what we paid. Rooms at the Hilton Garden Inn were going for 140 including fees for a room w/ a jacuzzi. Now that's good value for what you pay! I would not recommend booking here, unless if you really do not care about your accomodations and are looking for something cheap. It's not fair to rate this hotel as a 3.5 star, when half the rooms are dingy and old, and the other half renovated. Make sure you know what you will get stuck with. The parking is a huge rip off - 25 or 30 bucks, and the parking lot always full. Park at the lot across the street, it is $6.00 per day, ($12 for overnight). This hotel is convenient - walking distance to all the shops on yonge street, as well as eaton centre. Great places to eat in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - A little exagerated”
Reviews.Author: oneburr
Reviews.Content: just got back from a weekend in Toronto staying at the Delta Chelsea. The hotel is very large. The parking was tight - leave your large car at home. They charge for everything - parking, internet service etc. The teen club / video game room is 2 computers, ping pong table, radio that only gets one station, an X-Box with 2 or 3 games and a tv. The adult pool, work out room and bar/lounge - there was no bar/lounge. The walls are THIN - you can hear people using the bathroom in the next room clearly. Other than that, the staff was very polite and helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JPDucks
Reviews.Content: My wifeâ€™s and my stay at the Delta Chelsea Hotel started out rather nondescript. The check-in process was easy and our room was a nice size, plus it had a balcony. By the end of our stay in the hotel I became a big fan. On our way back from Niagara Falls we stopped off at a little shop and while inside someone hit our rental car, and did not leave a note. So after informing the insurance company I was e-mailed paperwork which needed to be completed. When we got back to the hotel I sought out the business center. Originally it was closed but a kind gentleman opened it up for me after I explained what happened. Then to top it off, he did not charge me the $6 to use internet or the $0.75 per page to print out the forms. If that wasnâ€™t enough when we awoke the next morning there was a little note left under our door which included an apology note from the hotel for what happened to our car and a complimentary breakfast for two at their buffet, which was really good, and way above and beyond what other hotels would do. Lastly the hotel even waived one night of parking. I canâ€™t thank the Delta Chelsea Hotel enough for what they did. They turned an event that could have left a sour taste on our honeymoon into an opportunity for the hotel to shine. If I make it back to Toronto one day the only hotel Iâ€™m staying at is this one.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...this place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: FCP09
Reviews.Content: Clearly anyone who rates this anything above a 2 star rating has very very low standards...that or is accustomed to trailer parks. The only thing this place has going fo rit is the location - period. NOTHING else. It's one notch above a motel. Don't let the pictures or bright lights as you drive in fool you. D-U-M-P. Best way to describe it. Old furniture, dirty rugs and counches...and I won't even get into the bathroom details. I took the fastest shower. If cardboard towels, smelly carpet and disgustingly dated and chipped furnatire is your thing...then this place is for you. ALL OTHERS Stay away. My company was paying for this dump, but I would never ever come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Got a good bargain + upgrade and loved the central location.”
Reviews.Author: Travelfunsies
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade even though we booked with Hotwire, so instead of a regular room for 2 we got a bigger room with a kitchen. The king size bed was comfy and very big. There was also a couch, table and a chair in the room. We would have needed two chairs though, but I guess you can't really complain given the deal that we got... The cleaning staff missed us once (we left at 3pm), but otherwise they did a good job. They even washed our dishes! The Bistro + Brasserie restaurants downstairs serve good food. The cafeteria on the other hand is hideous and the smell from their fried food isn't very pleasant since it can also be smelt in the lobby all the time. We also liked the free wi-fi in the lobby and an opportunity to wash laundry. The washing machines are in the women's and men's locker rooms though, so it was a little hard doing laundry in the same place where people are changing clothes etc. (there is limited space). Our room was facing Gerrard street on the 6th floor. At first it wasn't easy getting used to the noise from the traffic (e.g. ambulance sirens since the hospital is in the same block), but we got used to it eventually. After we turned the heater on the noise that thing made was way louder than the traffic - so in a way got them sounds blocked pretty well. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: AngelaG2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located, room and common areas were very clean, excellent service, and decent food. Well priced (fall special).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hounddog224
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at the Delta Chelsea. I stayed there from the 22nd to the 27th October. Having read some of the reviews before i left i was a little worried. When i arrived at the hotel check in was swift and Maria was very helpful giving us information on the hotel. I had a room on the 14th floor and i must be honest the room was lovely. The corridor to the room was nice and clean. There were three of us sharing a room and it was big enough for us. As we had just arrived we went in to the Market Garden restaurant in the hotel for some food. There was enough choice and it was made fresh while you waited. I found the food to be good value for money. The hotel was in a central position for the Eaton Centre and many of the other shops. Places like Chinatown and the CN Tower could be reached by foot.. During my stay the only complaint i had was the pillows in the room. They were far too soft but you could make do. I found the hotel was spotless and the staff were very friendly nothing was too much trouble. If i was to visit Toronto again i would stay at the Delta Chelsea again.

Reviews.Title: “A satisfied customer!”
Reviews.Author: AG111
Reviews.Content: I recently had a last minute requirement to come to Toronto for business purposes, and when trying to find accommodation, the Hotel Delta Chelsea was my only option. I am a firm believer in reading reviews before booking, and in reviewing those for this property, I have to admit I was very skeptical before arriving. While there seem to be a number of poor comments regarding the quality of rooms at this hotel (which I admit were accurate to a certain extent), I came to my first-ever realization that those writing these reviews rarely factor in the level of service they experience during their stay. To myself, someone who travels to the extent that I do, I believe greater emphasis should be placed on the quality of service a hotel's employees offer its guests - this is what will bring people back. During my stay I had the pleasure of meeting a few staff members here. Please think of them when you make your future arrangements with this hotel. Leon at the belldesk who always was more than willing to help me out and remembered my name throughout my stay. Kate at the front desk who is a gem to the organization - her presence, smile and professionalism are something I wish one found more often. Casey in the Business Lounge, offered his assistance with my work instead of just showing me the way. Thanks to these employees, I will absolutely be returning to the Delta!!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Toronto? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Gamxiated
Reviews.Content: My first time in Toronto and what a magical city! I love how friend everyone is, so clean, so green, and walkable anywhere! The best part is that the Delta Chelsea was right in the middle of it all between Bloor in the North, Front St. in the South, University Ave in the West and Yonge St. in the East. The Delta Chelsea is a huge hotel with a large lobby with a friend staff and readable signs to find out the street you can exit or enter from. The Airport Express stops right infront of the hotel, which takes travelers from YYZ Pearson to hotels in downtown Toronto. The best airport transportation service that provides free WiFi and electrical outlet! It also gives you a preview of the city when dropping other passengers off at other hotels in Toronto. Rooms at the Delta Chelsea is so comfortable, especially the beds. The views in either direction are wonderful. We had our room onthe 20th floor facing Yonge St. so you can see the people walking up and down Younge, Eaton Center, the Bay at Atrium, and Ryerson University. The bathroom was big, clean, and provides complimentary toiletries. There is Internet access in the room, but recommend to go to the lobby and use their free WiFi. There are many sitting areas in the lobby and everyone is down there to use the WiFi. There are 4 eateries in the lobby, but more choices just outside on Yonge St. and at Eaton Center. We ate the Market Place in the lobby and the food is edible, but could have found a cheaper place to eat outside of the hotel. The breakfast buffet at Bistro 33 was acceptable, but the price was high. Go to a Tim Horton's for cheaper breakfast or enjoy one at the Eaton Center at Eggceptional. At night I would reccommend to try WOO at Dundas Square for a high end Asian Fusion buffet. We did order room service and the food was acceptable, but had better room service at other hotels. The Delta Chelsea is located near the two major subway lines in Toronto. College St. Station is located nearest to the hotel and the other one is Dundas Square on the Yonge Line. Queen's Park station is the closes one on the University Line. However, walking is a good option for visitors since the city takes pride on being "green" with many residence riding bikes and using public transportation. Taxis can be used, but scarecely used them. We were able to walk to the ROM, Bloor, Yorkville, The Annex, Chinatown, Kensington, and Eaton Center. I highly recommend the Delta Chelsea for a great central location when visiting Toronto. The staff are nice and very kid friendly. There are two pools, one on th2e 27th floor with a lounge and on the second floor with the big waterslide. However, being so center in the city all of the attactions are walkable, except the ones near Front St. But it doesn't matter on the distance to the CN Tower or Harbourfront since subways stations are nearby. Toronto is so magical, clean, and friendly that you can truly miss once departuring back home. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: meCanada1
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. It is simply an average hotel, do not expect to be pampered at this hotel. Check in was fast and easy. The room was fairly clean but worn and in need of updating. The room had a coffee maker which was nice but overall the room was very small. The gym is located in the pool area which made it very hot while working out so dress appropriately. The location however is great - close to shopping, restaurants etc. This is by far the best aspect of the Delta. Parking and high speed internet was very expensive. To sum up my experience at the Delta, it was simply okay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, comfy beds, not the greatest service...”
Reviews.Author: yukondoit
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a great stay here. The beds especially are fantastic if you like soft, cushy beds that feel like clouds. The spreads are very nice, the decor isn't bad. The rooms are relatively spacious. Front desk is nice, the lobby is nice, there are quite a lot of amenities in the lobby, and clearly this place handles high volume and higher income customers. The location is pretty nice, right in the downtown "Times Square" section of Toronto on Yonge street. The elevators and parking garage is a bit confusing, but overall I had a nice time and would come back. The only thing that didn't work out so well for me was their internet service. We received a corporate rate for the rooms, but still paid for internet access (which is a bit backwater these days) -- they have individual DSL modems in each room, and mine crapped out. It was replaced about an hour after I called the front desk, still didn't work, the maintenance guy said "I'll call someone". Never heard another thing. Not sure why they use this service anyway -- they should be providing free WiFi like everyone else. They certainly have the money to do so. Otherwise, nice stay, nice accommodations, June Jacobs line in the bathroom was a nice plus (actual quality soap, shampoo, conditioner). I'd go back if I could get as good of a rate as we received this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable as always”
Reviews.Author: happywandererEssex
Reviews.Content: My second visit to the Delta Chelsea. Used the Dowtown Express Bus from airport. This service is very efficient and will help you to get your bearings as it drops off at other hotels. The hotel isn't pretty but is ok inside. I would like to see more sofas or lounge areas in the lobby area. You will see a few adult shops and cinemas on Yonge St. Don't be put off by these as they keep themselves to themselves. I would advise to stick to main streets and keep to busy areas. Generally area feels safe but it pays to be aware of your surroundings and be sensible. Upon arrival my check in was with no waiting and was processed very quickly. I was offered an upgrade but chose not to pay the extra 30 dollars per night. My room 1138 was over looking Gerrard St. I would say it was one of the older rooms and was in need of updating but was clean and had everything that you could need. Very good storage and shower was powerful. I was irritated by a constant drone of some generator noise outside. This went all day and night and if you tuned into it would drive you a bit potty. I wasn't in the room too much so wasn't so bad. Is really near the elevators and ice machine room. The staff were very friendly and passed a conversation or two which was nice. Ate mainly in the market garden restaurant. I felt food was expensive and you would get more choice elsewhere and probably better value. However, I suppose you pay for the convenience. If you try Atrium on Bay shopping mall, in the basement I found a great mini supermarket that sold hot soups, salad bars, fresh fruit and veg etc and at good prices. This mall had a good food court too. As my main purpose was to indulge in retail therapy, this hotel is ideally situated for the Eaton Centre and for the subway (Dundas) which can take you all over the city but again if shopping is your thing head up to Yorkdale Mall. Was a bit disapointed at lack of free wifi access. I was hoping.... I would return but maybe in a few years as I have exhausted Toronto's shops for now

Reviews.Title: “3 Stars and Not 1 More”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea 4 nights over thanksgiving weekend. The location is midtown - blocks from Eaton Centre, on Young, subway on next block, airport shuttle 20 minute intervals. Not a bad location, but NOT near the main business district, fashion district (Bloor) or entertainment district or near the Ontario Art Gallery or Museum. If looking for those you can find a better located hotel. This is a large hotel (think Las Vegas Flamingo Casino and Hotel size) without the casino but with the other amenities, There are a variety of rooms, and I booked a standard room. I am a Delta Privilege member so expect an upgrade if available - that is the standard practice. I received one without asking ( I should not have had to) to a room on the 17th floor - a pretty plain room imo - so I can not imagine what the upgrade was. I looked straight into the windows of other high-rises so it was not that. I had booked a king, but the upgrade was 2 double beds for me alone. No seating area. Nothing in the room had been upgraded in 20 years, the TV was the old clunky box style, the one chair was old and dated from the 70's. While the room was acceptable it was nothing like any other Delta I have stayed at before - much inferior. Front Desk efficient but impersonal, Bar Staff: ditto, Bell Desk: ditto. 27th Floor Pool area was OK but lounge up there locked tight - even to be able to sit and read. Actually no place to sit and read or a quiet area. The lounge had blaring music (live) when I checked in at the Privilege Desk (right outside the door to the lounge) and the music and noise permeates through the lobby and is ridiculously loud. The hotel is chock full of airline staff, and tourists on charter flights or bus trips. I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricelined at $60, otherwise overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LennoxW
Reviews.Content: William Shatner got us a room for $60, which is great value considering the location and the tolerable room quality. But the back of the room door said $569/night is the regular rate, and if that's the case, this place is big-time overpriced. Too many neighbours are noisy drunkards returning from bad Leafs games; the heating and air con didn't work; the roof was leaking in the pool area; and often there was no one at the front desk. On the plus side there's a nice-looking pool, decent little workout rooms, and of course you're a couple minutes from all the excitement. Nighty night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you can get it through a discount site.”
Reviews.Author: nickers82
Reviews.Content: Check-in was really quick and we were able to get our room before 12 noon. Front desk was able to upgrade our original room for a fee, worth it! The room was a standard with queen size. It had a sitting area with a couch and chair, changing area, and the bathroom was small, but adequate. The location was pretty good, being in the heart of downtown Toronto and all. Very easy to walk to prime locations or hop on subway to get around. We did not use it, but there is an indoor swimming pool We got this room for $70 a night through Hotwire. For the price, it was fantastic. If I paid regular price, no way. Pros - Great location, clean, quick service, fancy bathroom shampoo/soaps. Cons - can be overpriced, a huge place so it can be confusing to get around, parking was $27 a day, a bit of a chore to get to if you are driving in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use the word renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: April1071
Reviews.Content: Spent one night just recently with the ROM Dead Sea Scrolls deal and the check in took 15 minutes. The furniture was updated, the flat screen tv was not an LCD or plasma but an actual old model tv with a flat screen (front desk said they have not upgraded yet). The bathroom sink had a crack right though the centre, the shower had a big rust scan beside the drain, and paint was coming off the ceiling in the shower/tub. Towels, housecoat, and soaps etc enough for one guest only, although the room was booked for 2 and it has 2 beds in it. The one lock inside the door is old fashion and the crpet was not updated. We had upgraded originally and we could not understand where the renovating money went. The patio doors needed cleaning, the wall separating each room had paint coming off in major strips. We moved to another room, which too another 15 minutes in line at 11pm, we over heard a open at the counter saying she book a room in advance but the hotel only now had a room with a couch available. The new floor and room was identical except facing Yonge St now, the screen door had a hole in the bottom, the wall paper was coming off the edge inside the door and the edging under the door was loose. The bathroom was better except the tub had no mat and no handles on the walls so if you fell you had nothing to grip on. We complained on leaving the next morning, check out took 25 minutes, and received apology and room updated coupon for next time. It will be a long time before we use it

Reviews.Title: “Never again, too impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Unhappyhampshire
Reviews.Content: We asked to have breakfast served to us, Waiters/waitresses, didn't have a clue,they served over us and when we had finished with one plate, it was left on the table. We had so much piled up we had to ask them to take it away. The Brasserie restaurant was better the food was good the service was good but it was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: msphawkeye
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights (Monday to Wednesday), it is perfectly located for exploring Toronto. Not too close to the waterfront for the other attractions to be too far away but not too far out to hit the waterfront. For the price we paid we were satisfied. Our first room had an awful smell and we were quickly relocated. I thought the employees were helpful. There is only free wifi in the lobby. The adult pool and workout facility were nice. I would think if you had kids you would love the kids pool and activity center. It looked like a full daycare. This hotel is huge and super busy. We did not use any of the restaurants or bars. Too many others in the area to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “4 star location”
Reviews.Author: Con26935
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here early August. Booked it through hotwire so I paid less for 2 nights than what the actual cost for 1 is. Had I paid full price I would knock a star off . We had a typical hotel room, nothing special. If you dislike smoking or have allergies you should know that the rooms do have that faint odor to them....like all places that used to allow smoking but do not anymore. We went for a Jays game and we were able to walk to the dome from the hotel although it is a longer walk. Eaton center is a block away as well as other shopping and restaurants. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment but I will say that if you plan to...bring extra cash. Two eggs was 10$. Just for eggs...no toast or anything lol. Around the corner was Eggsmart though, an all day breakfast place with much better prices. The biggest problem was coming home. We had an evening flight (8pm) and would have enjoyed a late checkout so we didnt have to rush in the morning. A late checkout was half the regular rate for the first few hours....Full Night rate after that. I have never paid for a late checkout and I found it very strange. I would stay here again, especially for a girls trip because it is so close to all the things we would look for. If I was going for a baseball or basketball game (especially in winter) I would look for something closer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location, Small Rooms, Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: AmirMohsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Delta Chelsea Hotel in Downtown Toronto for two weeks. I was with my wife and our 10 year old daughter who enjoyed the in-house pool and slide very much. I would say the variety of restaurants and pubs and the location make it a good family hotel, particularly if you wish to use the metro+bus to go to most tourist attractions. However, I believe that the size of the room is quite average and a bit cramped given the fact that two weeks is a long time for staying in such a small room. Another point is the size of the hotel which has more than 1,500 rooms. One could see that the hotel needs more staff to cater for such a large guest base. A safe in the rooms is also an important feature for me which Delta Chelsea could not provide. There was only a safe in the lobby. However, I still recommend this hotel if you are traveling with your family.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive for a crappy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chickflix
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference. The building needs a revamp, the room was small, the elevators took forever to arrive and there wasn't enough of them. Service was non-existent. I don't know how much I paid for the room since I was part of a group, but I've heard it's expensive. I've stayed in Holiday Inns that were better. The only good thing I can say about it is that it's right down the street from the Eaton Center.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but not a 'Delta' Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Chili-Bite
Reviews.Content: Great location to catch the subway to work or pleasure events. Toronto nightlight is nearby. The room had a moldy odour and the carpets need a good steam clean. Fortunately, I was not in the room for more than sleeping. Internet costs extra, but I notice the hotel never charged me. It is a very busy hotel, lots of teams, conferences, and things going on. The live music in the bar is great. The hotel seems on the edge of some not to pleasant streets where people are homeless or moving drugs. It is close to good and reasonable price restaurants. The fitness centre is awesome and located at the top with a great view. I used the hotel for price and location - would not select this hotel for a vacation or get away experience.

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: flowerchildone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea two nights last spring...I developed a terrible and painful rash. When I returned home I went to the emergency department where the doctor told me I had got it from the hotel. I did tell the hotel and they denied it then they said sorry too bad for you...never staying there again...no thanks...Apparently you can get these nasty rashes from the over chemicalled hot tub. It was their reaction that really dissapointed me. Also I have spied rats on more than one ocassion outside this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel, Bad Price”
Reviews.Author: grayrockravens
Reviews.Content: Price: Booked only a week prior so had to overpay at $259 CAD a night. Location: The hotel is right off the vibrant Yonge St, and in the heart of where the TIFF (Toronto International Film Festival) was held. Nice central location with plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance, though this did lead to the typical city noise at night. I was on the 14th floor and the sirens were still quite loud. Rooms: Small but clean and included a small balcony. Bathroom was small enough that you would have to close the door to use the toilet. Counter space was ample and the shower was OK. Two free bottles of water were waiting for me when I got in. Service: Guest Services kindly provided complimentary toothpaste. Did not have to wait long to check in/out. Overall: A decent hotel with plenty to do nearby, but will be booking other hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: fiveofusToronto
Reviews.Content: Delta Chelsea has a good family centre, but little else. We had reserved a cot when booking directly with the hotel, requested it on check in at 12.00, then again when forced to wait for a later check in at 3.00, by phone at 4pm and again at 10pm. Each time, until 10pm, we were told it was on it's way. Not sure one would have fit in the very cramped room anyway! We were then told there were no more available.We then had to make 2 requests for extra blankets and one family member was forced to sleep on the floor for $250! This hotel was extremely busy and seemed to be very understaffed. Check in (times 2), took over half an hour each time!! Our other issues of inconsistent answers, and being sent on foot into an inappropriate neighbourhood for dinner for a young family, ruining our one evening in Toronto were not addressed. These issues result in us having no intention of returning to this hotel, or any other delta property. We were extremely surprised and disappointed that they did not offer any kind of compensation, especially since their own staff informed us that we had paid "over the odds"! They compounded the problem by not being more understanding and apologetic. In our response to their online survey they said we may be interested in their future renovations, and thanked us for our loyalty to the chain. That signing off is extremely patronizing considering our experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: userScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Delta for one night on the 29th June. Got this room from hotwire for a great rate. Although we were only there for the night i could not fault the hotel on anything. When checking in the hotel staff were quick and very informative telling us about all the services available within the hotel and where they were located, something that none of the other hotels we stayed in whilst in Toronto did. The room was very clean and spacious and we liked the balconey which you could go out onto and watch the city go by you below. The bathroom was of average size, compared with the other hotels we stayed at in Toronto and i loved the powerful shower. Check out was also speedy again with happy and helpful staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ak1999
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Delta Chelsea. It was a very convenient downtown location, close to everything including the subway. The hotel is family-oriented, with a kids pool and a tot play area that is open super late on weekends -- that was great for our kid who was on West Coast time the entire trip. The rooms were clean, very spacious and comfortable. The staff were friendly and efficient. I was pleasantly surprised, and couldn't ask for anything more from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eropagnis
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and baby and stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 2 nights. Even though some people have complained about the hotel, I think that the hotel is a decent accommodation in the middle of downtown Toronto. The location itself already is a big plus - you are within walking distance to most major attractions. Although the hotel is a little old, but it is only to be expected of an establishment in a city like Toronto. That being said, the room was adequate for my family's needs. It was clean and the bed was comfortable, albeit a little tight. But hey, we're not in Toronto to be cooped up in the room. The hotel front desk staff were friendly and even offered my baby a little toy upon check-in, which made her a happy camper. Another big plus is that the hotel is extremely kid-friendly, with an indoor pool and children's centre with loads of toys and even a bunny, which entertained my kid. My only complain would be that the parking facility is extremely hot and dark.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: scapaflow40
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea was my hotel of choice in Toronto for many years due to its good location and good value. I was a young business traveler on a budget in those days and the Chelsea made sense. I hadn't done much business travel to T.O. in the past ten years and went back to the Chelsea in April. Frankly it hasn't changed much. It is packed with families, the lobby area is full to capacity with guests, the Market Garden is like a University cafeteria and the front desk staff is efficient but not too friendly. The rooms are pretty much the same, kind of cramped and with no character. For a week-end budget getaway for a family with younger kids this place is fine, for a business traveler look elsewhere, it is simply too crowded, the rooms too stale, the restaurants uninteresting. I won't be staying there any more but appreciate it's place in the hotel food chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: TakeOffEh2
Reviews.Content: I agree entirely with the 'Family Friendly Hotel in Downtown Toronto' review. I just stayed there for two nights this past weekend and was impressed. It's a great hotel for kids, and I ended up getting a good rate, so it was perfect.. Parking was expensive, but I actually used another lot a block away that was very cheap (on the weekends). The hotel can show it's age though, but if you get a good rate, you can't beat the value..

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bahamabride101107
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and in a great location. Central to everything in downtown Toronto. Found the room to be spacious and very clean. The bed was not comfortable (hard), but they provided extra pillows and blankets which I found to be a nice touch. Breakfast buffet at the hotel is ok-pretty pricey for what they offer. Had we not been in a hurry to start the day, we could have found a more inexpensive breakfast elsewhere. We would return to the Delta Chelsea even though paying to park (and getting a stupid parking ticket!) is a bit ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Canada's biggest hotel and in the centre of the action”
Reviews.Author: saskatoonguy
Reviews.Content: This is the largest hotel in Canada, and it shows in the lobby which is incredibly busy and hectic, even compared with other large urban hotels. There are usually lines for check-in and bell services, and heaven help you if you want to check in at the same time that several tour groups arrive. There is an 11:00am checkout rule that is rigidly enforced, perhaps understandable in such a large hotel. The hotel is very popular with families and tour groups, and isn't a good choice if you're not in one of those categories. Customers will enjoy the two indoor pools (one with water slide), and there is a cafeteria-style restaurant that's ideal for families. The location is superb. Although the hotel technically doesn't have a frontage on Yonge Street (Toronto's main street), it's only about 50 feet away. Judging from the reviews, some rooms have been redecorated and others have not, and differing price levels reflect this. I paid $204 (August 2009) and had a nicely redecorated room with a magnificent view, and a sliding glass door that opened onto a tiny balcony (not true of all rooms). Nonetheless, the age of the hotel (1975) is apparent, especially in places like bathtub grouting where a building's age is hard to hide. There are a number of nickel-and-diming practices that I find very irritating. I had an "environmental charge" of $1.03 on my bill -- what the heck is that? This hotel, like others in Toronto, will charge a "destination marketing feeâ€� (DMF) of 3%. If you ask, they'll tell you it's a tax, but it isn't -- the money goes to a tourism marketing association, not to any government agency. To add insult to injury, they charge sales tax on that fee. These are small amounts, but still they are an irritant. Also, I had been quoted a rate lower than the $204 I was charged, but it was a last-minute reservation made by phone, and when I checked in, I had no documentation to prove the rate the reservationist quoted me. If you're headed to the airport, bellstaff will try to put you in a non-metered taxi. As one employee said to me on a previous visit to this hotel, "Let me put you in a [non-metered] taxi where I trust the driver," and then later I had a dispute over the fare with the driver. If you're going to the airport, insist on a metered taxi, and then negotiate an off-the-meter fare with the driver before getting in the taxi. I know this sounds third-worldish and complicated, but that's how it works in this city. (In mid-2009, a negotiated flat rate to the airport of $55 would be fair, and indeed on the generous side -- no extra tip.) There is a privately operated bus from the hotel to the airport which is much cheaper, but the last time I rode it, it took 1-1/2 hours to get to the airport because of pick-ups at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: s-mallonee
Reviews.Content: I read reviews before travelling on this site and was honestly a bit worried before staying here. I got the hotel on Hotwire for cheap, and assumed that I would be placed in an outdated room as was described in several other reviews. To my surprise (and without any room upgrade), I was placed in a standard room that was what I would expect from a 4-star hotel (even though Hotwire rated it as 3.5). Though the room was small (as can be expected in any large city), the bed was awesome, with a modern bedding and a plush down comforter, the bathroom was clean and included nice toiletries, and the service was outstanding. The guy that checked me in was overly accommodating, and made me feel very welcome in this hotel. The selection of restaurants is amazing within the hotel, and you have plenty more options within just a few blocks. Dundas Square (Toronto's version of Times Square) is just a couple blocks away. To dispel a few rumors tossed around on this site, the bedding was nice and modern - not 80s-era as I have read. The balcony was a nice addition - no rust as described...clean and not a thing wrong with it. The bathroom was not updated - no granite countertops and a somewhat dated bathtub/shower. But, the water pressure was awesome in the shower and the bathroom toiletries are what you would expect from a 4-star hotel. The TV was not a new flat-screen, but it functioned completely fine. No complaints whatsoever. I have stayed in Toronto 3 times in the past three months - once at the Sheraton Centre, once at the Intercontinental Yorkville, and once here. By far, this has been my favorite stay - both for the location and for the hotel itself. Two thumbs up for the Delta Chelsea. I don't know what some of these other travelers are talking about. Unless not having granite countertops in the bathroom ruins your visit, you will be pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: easterndixie
Reviews.Content: If you want screaming kids running up and down the hall in wet bathing suits (this is on the executive club floor!), university freshmen trying to sneak alcohol in the club lounge honors bar (which is not an honors per se bar, but a "charge it to my room " bar for even a soft drink) and crying babies in the club lounge during the hors d'ouvres hours late afternoons,then this is the place for you. Evidently, Delta Chelsea has a new "anti-descrimination policy" that prohibits discriminating against families with small children from staying on the club floor or allowing them access to the club lounge. I paid extra for a business environment and get THIS!? First experience with Delta Chelsea and will be my last!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: TravellinwithFamily
Reviews.Content: I often have troubles in hotels and therefore tend to judge hotels by how they respond to problems. I could not judge the Delta Chelsea in this manner because there were no problems during my stay, not even a little one! A refreshing change to say the least. I booked this hotel using Hotwire. Sometimes Hotwire guests are treated as second class citizens at some hotels, but I certainly wasn't. At check-in, I received a free room upgrade as a Delta Privilege Member (membership is free). I got a very nice room with two double beds which was more than enough as I was travelling alone. What impressed me was all the fine amenities of this hotel -- a great family pool with a four storey waterslide, children's area and program, teen area, and a separate adults-only pool/hot tub and extensive fitness area that would rival some gyms. The meeting rooms looked great and the hotel itself was clean and well maintained throughout. There is free wireless in the lobby and business centre, but internet is a bit costly at $10/half hour. There is an internet cafe very nearby with presumably lower prices. The staff are second to none and I was given a friendly greeting by pretty well every staff member I passed from housekeeping, maintenance, front desk, and management. What was particularly helpful to me is the business centre which I used with a colleague six to eight hours a day during my four day stay. It has meeting tables and comfortable chairs, someone there to help you at all times, free coffee/tea/hot chocolate, phone service, internet service ($10/half hour) and free wireless. That alone made this hotel well worth it. The location of the hotel is excellent in the heart of downtown Toronto on Yonge Street, about a two minute walk from the Eaton Centre and the subway within a few minute walk. Other than The Market in the hotel, the hotel restaurants were pricey and likely out of many people's price ranges, particularly those travelling with family. However, there are many nearby restaurants and I would particularly recommend the many good restaurants (don't miss the second floor ones) in College Park directly across from the Gerrard Street Entrance. There is a particularly good pasta place there that cooks the meals in front of you as you wait. All this went into my best hotel stay ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: patmoncon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. Room was a little small but clean. Unfortunately, one of the beds had a broken leg and we were told we could not move until the next day because the hotel was sold out for the night. This was a little disappointing and we were not offered any compensation for our trouble! The next day when we moved rooms, we had to be escorted to our new room because key cards were not working and had to wait quite a while for security to get us there. They offered us no compensation again for our trouble until my husband complained, then we were sent a tiny cheese plate with a few grapes and 1 strawberry, there were 4 of us! This disappointed me. Kids enjoyed the pool with the waterslide and the Market Place restaurant in the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea: High Class Facade with Low Class Rooms...”
Reviews.Author: artbrutnewyork
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a major disappointment. First, upon entering the hotel it is a dark and dingy with somber lighting. I should have known that after the front desk clerk asked me if I wanted "upgrade" my room to a newly renovated room, that I was in for trouble. I was hoping that the room would make up for this initial impressions. Pros: Central Location located near Yonge Street and Queens Street and rooms have a Balcony with view of the city C Lications: The room: Musty smellling Flooring: soiled, water stained old carpet Furniture: Dated, scratched wood dressers tables Bedding: Old, threadbare sheets Bathroom/Shower: old with "old-fashioned" tub/sink dirty stoppers attatched to rusted chains Chairs: ripped and stained fabric Balcony: peeling and rusted paint...so disgusting didn't want to sit and enjoy the view Poor Maid Service Overall, the room was a bit of disappointment and instead of an upscale hotel felt more like a budget 2-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was good for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: coyote_beach
Reviews.Content: Delta Chelsea August 17-21 2009 I took my husband to Toronto for his birthday present and to see the Blue Jays play. Checked in at 11 am. I had signed up for the delta privileges card ( thanks to the people on TA for suggesting it) so our check in was super fast. Our room wasnâ€™t cleaned yet so the clerk gave us an upgrade to a premier room for free. The room was very small but was clean and had a very comfy bed. We didnâ€™t have a balcony but we werenâ€™t in the room that much. When we did get the room cleaned the maid did a decent job. Like I said the room was small but it worked for us, the service was very good, when we asked at the bellmanâ€™s counter for directions they were very helpful and courteous. We had breakfast once in the hotel at the market restaurant. Terrible food, terrible service, the lady at the egg station just kept yelling at the people to go to another line and the food was awful. I felt like I was in a Seinfeld episode. Overall I would use this hotel again if I got the same deal through hotwire as this time ($62/Night). It is close to everything you need downtown. We walked almost everywhere we needed to go and when we didnâ€™t the subway was right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay there”
Reviews.Author: H_MISTRALI
Reviews.Content: I visited Toronto end of May and stayed in this hotel with a colleague. The hotel is situated in the city centre of Toronto. The rooms in the hotel were cleaned and spacious. The bedding was very nice; the bathroom was modern with marble unit top and the toiletries were of good quality. The corridor had also an ice machine which I thought was very good idea, for those who like their cold water any time of the day. The breakfast in the hotel was also good, with a good choice of food. Newspapers were delivered to you in the morning and the staffs were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel also had a bar with a dancing floor and this was quite handy for us as we could drink and dance in. I will go there again if I ever go to Toronto and will definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: happiestauntie
Reviews.Content: The pool was fun, but crowded. We had to schedule our pool times in advance. There was a room with video games, but the same kids seemed to hog them, and unless you knew the unwritten rules or booked way in advance, your kids had little chance of getting to them. It was a bit annoying that while this hotel does cater to families, there was a lot of crowding and waiting and having to book things in advance. The service in the restaurants was adequate, except in one case at the Monarch restaurant, the waiter went out of his way to be rude to us. We had to change rooms as the one we were in was flooded. Once we alerted the staff, they were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK decor but great location!”
Reviews.Author: Herbiegoesbananas
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through priceline therefore for $65 per night. I wouldn't want to pay anymore!The hotel needs a refurbishment as the decor is outdated and the carpets aren't the cleanest. The rooms do have balconies but they are too dirty to sit out on and the room I was in had empty beer cans from previous visits in the corner! However the bathroom was clean and the shower was excellent. On the positive this hotel is in the centre of everything and is within walking distance to the Eaton Center and the square. However the traffic noise outside was really loud. I've been to New York and stayed in Time Square and I thought that it was 10 times worse in Toronto. There is a hospital just down from the hotel and the ambulances are going in and out throughout the night with their sirens on. Great is you are going out! I think the key is to only pay the hotwire rate after all you pay for what you get. The pool is OK. They also have a kids pool with a water slide which is good fun however the stairs to the slide were so dirty that I wouldn't want my child to be walking up it in bare feet! Check out the next morning could have been better as there were only 2 staff on the desk despite it being peak time and there being a large queue. I think that they could have it better organised and staffed!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Delta Chelsea - the kids had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: ginkybiloba
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Delta Chelsea in August 2009. We did the "Family Fun" package which included parking (a $26 value), plus a $25/day food voucher for the hotel restaurants. It also included 2 hours of supervised childcare at Camp Chelsea. We arrived very early (noon) and much to my surprise, were allowed to check in right away. This was a nice surprise - the kids got to go for a swim and were happy as clams. We were also given an upgraded room on the Bay Street side (much quieter than the rooms facing Yonge Street, as I have learned from past experiences). The room was small, but clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic - we left the car in the garage during our entire stay and just walked everywhere or took public transit. The staff at the Delta were so pleasant and accommodating - they gave excellent directions to any attraction we wanted to see, and were able to give us good information about the attractions as well. The pool was showing its age, but the water slide was fantastic and once my 6 year old got over her initial fear, we couldn't get her off it. Children must be at least 44" tall and pass a swim test (2 lengths of the pool with no assistance) in order to use the slide. The slide is huge - 4 stories tall, and it actually passes outside the building for part of the ride. Very cool. The children's activity room, located next to the pool, was incredible. There were 3 different video game consoles (including a Wii) with tons of games, a well-stocked craft area, ride on toys, a small climbing structure, lego, etc. Our children adored it, and wanted to spend all their time there. There were also family activities every evening, including Bingo, family Fear Factor etc. as well as a nightly movie with free popcorn. The hotel really caters to families, and does it well. We only ate at the Market Garden, which was not as good as I remembered. The food was quite expensive, and there are much better options just a stone's throw from the hotel. Kids 6 and under do eat for free (with the purchase of an adult meal costing at least $10) so that helps a bit. I found the restaurant a bit dirty and really crowded with bus tours. All in all, we had an excellent time and would definitely recommend this hotel. In terms of pricing, I think you are better booking the room on its own, and then adding parking. The $25 food voucher doesn't get you far, and there is better food value to be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Built in 1975 and it shows”
Reviews.Author: DCSteveTraveler
Reviews.Content: Best selling point for this hotel is it's near College and Dundas subway, Eaton Centre, and more downtown. Upgrade to Deluxe or Club Level Room (renovatated in last 10 years, very Westin-esquq.) All that said, got the basic room for $75 USD on Priceline and with the $75 upgrade to Club Level, ended up with an average/acceptable room. I wouldn't pay full price for any room in this hotel. Many other better options nearby so keep shopping if you can. No matter what they try to do to fix up this hotel, unfortunately, it's a victim of the time period it was built, 1975, and it looks like a huge dormitory. The entire building, not just Deluxe or Club rooms, need complete renovation from top to bottom. Probably cheaper to emplode it and start over.

Reviews.Title: “All the charm of old with everything up to date in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: PgnG
Reviews.Content: Lovely large hotel with plenty of restaurants and amenities conveniently located in the heart of Toronto! Had a great walk to many places adding to the invigorating stay. Nice window views. Easy to like visit to the Delta Chelsea and city of Toronto. Our room was slightly small end of the bed to TV area but relative's across the hall was larger. However, both were quite adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Upper Managment a Dream Team Upgrade worth its value”
Reviews.Author: drhope_9
Reviews.Content: Upon enterance I was wiery of the crowd. I was taken aside by the upper manamgement and my needs were taken seriously. I found them to be of extra special talents and grade them as outstanding at what they do. The upgraded room is as nice as any american 4 star accomidation is comfortable. The business center needs attention as three times I was unable to work because of the service being less then professional. Otherwise the food I had was great. There is an Indian buffet at noon thru the week and at night at the Elm Lunge the cheif has a special flare for preparing very good meals. I would suggest this to a travler on business and If you find yourself ever having difficulty in this property ask for Bud or Gary and mention tripadviosr, they will give you 100% service. Torontos center attraction the Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “not good enough”
Reviews.Author: magdalena847
Reviews.Content: The location is great but the rooms are NOT. There were many stains on the carpet and a hole in the bathroom wall. I made coffee in the ancient coffee maker and it wasn't even drinkable. There are 2 bars and 2 restaurants in the lobby (which is nothing like the rooms). We tried both bars and the service was terrible. There was one waiter at the 'louder' bar and only one waitress at the other bar. The first night we were there one of the bars didn't even open. It took 15 minutes to get the waiter over and another 15 to get a drink. I have stayed at the Marriot for about the same price and that was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, city prices”
Reviews.Author: billhig15
Reviews.Content: Busy hotel, lower rates by comparison to others in Toronto. "Upgraded rooms" are an extra $20, didn't see a room that wasn't upgraded so can't comment on that but upgraded room was nice enough, nothing extravagent. Parking lot in cellar very convenient (for a fee, no in/out charges). Didn't use resturants in hotel-3 to choose from. Travelling with two boys so pool and game room were nice amenities. Overall pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Full Service Hotel with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: beak49
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotwire and got a great rate, although the hefty parking fees ($26/day) were tacked on to the stay. The hotel is nice and clean, has all amenities normal for a hotel of this size and class. We found all the staff very nice and helpful. It's a bit of a walk to the CN tower/Rogers center, but it takes you right through the shopping area. Its in a bustling downtown area, full of shops, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value”
Reviews.Author: Santadiva
Reviews.Content: Got a last minute deal at Hotwire for $75 per night. When I arrived, check-in was exceptionally fast. The young lady at the reception desk was so friendly and efficient. She upgraded me to a deluxe room and was extremely helpful and informative. The room was spacious, clean, and more than I was expecting. The hotel is situated away from the harbor area, but very close to pubic transport, so getting around was not an issue. I never needed to use the car. There was ample parking and the area around the hotel was active, but safe. Overall, it was a fantastic find. The parking fee was reasonable considering that the private lots in the area were only a couple of dollars cheaper, outdoors, and did not provide 24 hour attendants. Check-out was as easy as check-in. Again, friendly and efficient staff. I would highly recommend the Delta Chelsea

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for Toronto Pride”
Reviews.Author: TheJohnStar
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends decided to go together for Toronto Pride 2009. This is my fourth year going and second year staying the weekend. Last year we also stayed at the Delta Chelsea. We booked plenty early and were able to book two Premier rooms for $199 each plus tax, then switch them down to $149 per room before tax when the hotel put them on sale. An excellent deal seeing as we paid the $199 the previous year and found it not an unreasonable price. This year I signed up for Delta Privilege which certainly came in handy! Its free to sign up and I encourage that you do if you travel often to Delta hotels. The staff at the Delta Privilege desk were VERY helpful and were the best of the best at the hotel. Martina in particular was a pleasure to have taking care of us, she was very friendly and went out of her way to ensure we were happy right through our stay. We were happy to find at check in that our request for connecting rooms had been honored and that we were upgraded to Deluxe rooms. These rooms are slightly larger and with much nicer furnishings than the Premier rooms. The iPod connectable clock was very handy for getting some music going! The free bottles of water also helped for what was a rather warm weekend. As always the beds were some of the best that we've had in our travels and provided a great nights sleep. The balcony was a very nice touch and is rare in Toronto. Overall no complaints at all about the rooms. We will always go for the Deluxe room from now on! A side note about rooms: the Delta rooms are certainly considered a 3 star at best, but Premier, Deluxe and Signature rooms are certainly of a 4 star standard. Remember when booking a basic Delta room that you get what you pay for! You have no right to complain if you aren't willing to pay the $20 for an updated room. Trust me: well worth it. You won't find me in a Delta room again. The other amenities at the hotel are great for leisure travelers. One of our favourite things is the adults only pool on the top floor. Its great to have the kids and families down in a separate pool and make it a much more exclusive feeling. The staff in the Deck 27 pool were great! Workout area is well equipped and wasn't crowded. The sun deck was a great touch that we had missed last time. Tanning up there felt like your own personal penthouse! Room service was pricey but that was expected. Downstairs the breakfast at The Marketplace was reasonable for the convenience of having it on-site. I would prefer if wi-fi was included, and not a $12 charge. Location was fabulous! A block from the Eaton Centre and minutes from the Church Wellesley Village. It doesn't get much better! Since this stay I've stayed one more time and have two more stays booked so I certainly recommend this. Just remember: don't get the "Delta" room, upgrade to Premier or Deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Your Typical Large Hotel”
Reviews.Author: etravelhome
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about the hotel. It's HUGE. It's the kind of hotel where you expect tour buses to be stopped outside, and 50 people unloading from it. Typical tourist class hotel. Rooms (bed and bathroom) were fine for the night we stayed, but it's nothing to write home about. Location is convenient; only a few blocks from a busy shopping center. The children's pool area seemed a bit run down. Avoid breakfast at the Marketplace (the cafeteria style) restaurant; food was very mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ksl64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our 10 yr. old son stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 4 nights to see the sites and take in a couple of Jays games. We found our stay very nice. Prior to going, I joined the Delta's advantage, upon our arrival we had priority check-in and were given a complimentary upgrade. The room was on the small side but adequate for our families needs. My son enjoyed the family pool with it's 150 ft. water slide and he utilized the game room with it. We ate breakfast at the market restaurant in the hotel, though very good, it was a bit on the expensive side. We found a Golden Griddle restaurant just around the corner, on Carlton St., across from the old Maple Leaf Gardens, that gave you a good meal at a good price. The hotels location was ideal, close to alot of restaurants, with easy access to the subway. All in all a great stay in a fun city.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: djl1724
Reviews.Content: I have been up twice this month for different occasions. Both times were great. got a room with a package deal that included parking and food credit. they upgraded my room both times. rooms were large enough, bathrooms nice, great views. they accidentally put parking charges on room but when i said something they took away the charge and paid for my valet charges, food at restaurants is adequate for quick bite. Location is amazing. so much going on near by every weekend, as well as close to subway. adult pool is nice touch. keeps kids away.

Reviews.Title: “overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: bro12345
Reviews.Content: after hearing some negative reviews from some people booking through certain website which we did i was a bit skeptical. when we arrived out at the hotel our room wasnt ready so the apparently upgraded us to a better room which possibly made our stay alot better. the room was kinda small but was very good, clean and acceptable. we only stayed one night but we had no problems besides a false fire alarm that occured in the evening and the beeping in our room for 20 minutes was kinda annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OttawaSenshotelier
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Delta Chelsea during the Toronto Indy. We were assigned a corner room on a high floor and could see the tip of the CN Tower. There was definitely a 'buzz' around the hotel lobby but things were moving along well. Great location, near the Eaton Centre and Canon Theatre. Will return to this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great City”
Reviews.Author: Copo1966
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 6 nights, when we arrived the person on the desk upgraded our room, when we reached the 12 floor and opened the door my first impression was that it was a small room and it seemed a bit dull, this was due to us coming from a massive room at Niagara, as soon as we drew the cutains and let some light in and settled in, we were more than happy with the room and the facilities within. The Delta Chelsea is in an ideal location, is surrounded by eateries and the Eaton Centre is a five minute walk away, this is a brilliant hotel for those who are staying downtown. We drank at the bars before our meals or after coming back from a visit to a local eaterie, plus there was a bonus of them showing English Foorball, also at lunchtimes there was a curry to be had, but we were too busy to partake. The breakfast and lunches were good at the Market Garden, and the staff were informative and friendly, booking buses for the departure to the airport was no problem at all and the same for cashing travellers cheques, getting back onto the food, the food at the bistro was superb, we ate there twice, and the meals were spot on and served on very hot plates, I had the capon and the girlfriend the rib-eye steak, and I couldn't resist the chocolate tower for afters, and again the staff were very friendly. On the 27th floor was a gym with a swimming pool and jacuzzi, from there you could step out onto a viewing platford and look over Toronto onto Dundas Square, it was superb during the day and even better at night, One thing that will live with me is swimming in the pool on the 27th floor whilst watching the sun going down over Toronto, as Arnie say.....I will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant 4star hotel within Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: liseybear22
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, couldn't fault it. The location is perfect, 15 minute walk to the waterfront, 20 minute walk to the CN Tower/Rogers centre, 5 minute walk to the Eaton centre, 4 minute walk to Hard rock cafe and other local bars/restaurants. Quiet town over Easter, everything (yes everything!) was shut on Easter Sunday which left us at a bit of a loose end. But apart from that the city break rocked! The hotel reception staff were very friendly, they upgraded our rooms on arrival, without request, to rooms on the 21st floor that had recently been refurbished. The hotel room, was modern, clean and spaceous for a 4 night getaway! Much bigger than a usual city break hotel room (i.e New York). We had breakfast every morning in the Garden Market buffet restaurant, which was resonibly priced and you only pay for what you have, which counts! The food was typical Canadian/American fast food nature, but thats what you expect when you cross the Atlantic. The hotel bars have a great atmosphere and friendly staff, how are most accomodating. Only fault was the TV internet we purchased at $13 per hour, inorder for us to check in for our flight the night before. Don't bother with it, as the system sucks and doesn't work properly for seat selection, and the lobby staff can check in for you (over the phone, if you dont want to leave your room too!) Overall, the hotel was brilliant, a very well deserved 4 star hotel! Could even pass for a 4* plus!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tayva
Reviews.Content: Once again I was impressed with the Delta. The annual gathering of friends from across North America was made even better due to the fact that everyone was upgraded at check-in. It pays to be a Delta Privledge member for sure! Rooms were clean and spacious, room service excellent. Check in couldn't have taken more than two minutes. Restaurants, theatres, shopping all within easy walking distance. We all were extremely pleased with the hotel and will stay there again next year. Thank you Delta!

Reviews.Title: “Great view!! Standard room.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGremlin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here with couple of friends at the beginning of July. On arrival the building and reception looked quite impressive. The staff on that particular day -although courteous - looked bored out of their mind. The room was fairly spacious with two massive double beds and a balcony from which we had an amazing view from the 23rd floor. I later found out that my friend had been able to gain access to my room to find a pair of straighteners just by asking Reception to be let in, which was a little disconcerting. Not a HUGE deal as it was just my friend, but was left very irritated that this was allowed to happen without any permission. I work in a hotel ,which is perhaps not as upmarket as the Delta, and felt disappointed by their lack of security on this occassion. Taps/Shower were a little confusing to work & a wee hair round the plug but nothing too horrendous. The bathroom itself was roomy and we were provided with lots of bathing products & plenty of fresh towels. We didn't eat in the hotel but the Menu did look fantastic & the bar area downstairs was very well maintained. We used the inhouse shop a couple of times, but unfortunately didn't have time to make use of the fitness room or the pool (with outdoor slide). All in all the hotel is in a perfect location for Downtown Toronto, it IS a beautiful building even if rooms need a little TLC & there are facilities galore available to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel frequently over the past 8 months - each time for business reasons. I'd suggest that anyone staying at a Delta Hotel join the Privileges Club (easily done on their website). Right from the start you get benefits such as separate check in and check out (at least at the Chelsea) and the ability to check in earlier and check out later. Frequent guest then have their status upgraded as their stays accumulate. I have never had an issue checking in or out. The staff are very attentive and helpful. The rooms are generally very crisp and clean. I frequently upgrade to the Signature Club level. The rooms are larger, there is turn down service and you have access to the lounge where you can get a coffee, tea or water any time and they also put on a great breakfast. The work out facility here is one of the best I've seen in a hotel. There are plenty of aerobic machines, there is a weight circuit and a room with free weights and benches. There is also a pool for laps associated with the gym. The location couldn't be more convenient to the downtown sights. You are in easy walking distance of the Art Gallery of Ontario, The Royal Ontario Museum, Yonge-Dundas Square, city hall, Bloor Street shopping (expensive mind you) and you are right next to a series of great restaurants on Elm Street. If you want to grab some quick groceries for your room the mall in College Park (one block north on Yonge) has a grocery store in the basement. I haven't gone here with my kids but there is lots for them to do here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: ywtchr
Reviews.Content: I was initially concerned when I booked through Hotwire because I'd heard/read some negative reviews of the level of rooms Hotwire gets from hotels, but I decided to get amembership to the Delta Privilege program, which allows for upgrades. I was pleasantly surprised to find that my check-in process was 5 minutes or less, that my room had a great view of Yonge Street/College Park and that the pool/fitness area was immaculate! I've longed to be able to afford a downtown hotel with an indoor pool (i hate natural water and public pool here is...interesting). The bathroom is small and floor tile had obviously been worked on recently, but I loved it...there were days when i didn't want to do anything but lay in bed all day. Their biggest downside - FREE wifi is only available in the lobby, which is ALWAYS FULL (no seats). plus, i'm a nightime internet person so I didn't wanna be in the lobby with my pj's on. So, I had to suffer through $12/dayCDN. I have videos on youtube (delta chelsea suite 2312)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: millhann
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through Hotwire and were a bit put off by some of theTA reviews. Based upon what we had read, we requested an room upgrade. The room we had was large, quite and clean. The hotel service was first rate. We really enjoyed the pool, whirlpool and fitness area on the 27th floor, which also has a large deck overlooking the city. For anyone traveling with children, this hotel is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jen1955
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire, so maybe we got a "hotwire" room. The rate was great for downtown Toronto and we loved the location. The lobby area is very well done and the staff is nice. Our room was a disgrace. I'm glad we didn't spend much time in it. The carpet between the room and the bathroom was pulled up. Unfortunately I dropped something under the bed, uggh, it was dirty, dirty, dirty under there. The carpet had stains, the sink was yellow and the tank cover on the flush did not fit it. I felt like I was in a motel from 1960. I would still recommend the hotel as it's a great location but I was disappointed with the condition of our room. Not a 4 star room, barely a 2.

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: familymanNewLiskeard
Reviews.Content: stayed there during our holidays last summer. this hotel is in a excellent location to everything, such as shopping and dining and seems very family friendly. my daughter loved the family pool and play area with waterslide. i checked out the adult pool area with a gym, its up on the top part of the hotel and has fantastic views. this hotel had a great idea by splitting up the two pools areas, with one for families and one for couples or business travellers. the buffet style restaurant was very good and the prices for toronto were very reasonable. i thought our room was very nice and clean and not a bad size for toronto hotels. we had a very nice stay and i would recommend this hotel to both families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sailor181
Reviews.Content: It has been about 7 years since I stayed here last, but it felt great to return. Check-in was quick and easy (we arrived to check in around 6 pm). It is a noisy, busy lobby, but being such a big hotel, that is expected. I asked for a room on a higher floor with balcony access, and for an extra charge of $25 a night, that is what I got. We were located in the newer part of the hotel with king room and could glimpse a view of the CN tower to the direct left of our balcony. That worked out very well as we had gotten a very low rate ($55) on (the site where you bid for a hotel room), so it turned out to be a great deal. The hotel is older, and is a bit dated; we were in a renovated room, but still it was not immaculate by any stretch of the imagination - there were scratches, nicks, wear and tear still visible in the room. But clean and comfortable with all the necessities. We knew it was not rated a 4 star to begin with, so our expectations were not high. This hotel is wonderful because it is a short walk to so many amenities. We enjoyed the Eatons Center, a nice meal Baton Rouge, and we saw Riverdance at the Canon Theater. We will definetly be returning to the Delta Chelsea again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: oribie
Reviews.Content: It took us only a 20 minute taxi ride to get from the airport to the hotel. The lobby is grand and busy with several bars, restaurants and shops. The guy at check-in was more interested in getting us to upgrade our room than welcoming us. Unlike the lobby, our room was pretty old and tired. It was spotless but the aircon kept blowing dust into the room and we spent 2 days sneezing. Having now visited Toronto, I would choose another hotel closer to the center than the Delta Chelsea. I really wasnâ€™t impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Vastly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DLTravelingMan
Reviews.Content: We booked this property from Hotwire, which had it listed as a four star hotel. That was entirely too generous on their part, as the Delta Chelsea is at best two stars. I stayed there about 10 years ago and it was quite nice. It became clear as we entered the hotel that it had not been painted, updated or deep cleaned since that time. Our rate apparently only guaranteed a bed - everything else was subject to an upgrade fee. You'd like light and clean sheets? 20 extra bucks a night, please. Just awful, we were nickeled and dimed for everything. I'll never, EVER go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden charges!”
Reviews.Author: clester
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just OK. A huge highrise. Room was maybe a 2 star no more. I was charged for parking($24), internet for both laptops (11.95 each), and found an additional charge on my credit card that I'm not sure what it was for. The positive was location ( near U. of Toronto). I got the room for $76 I think through hotwire and thats about all it was worth. Poor value and extra charges add up to my recommendation to stay clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire beware! NOT A 4 STAR hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Brookke
Reviews.Content: I travel to many different cities, Toronto is one of our favorite places to travel since my husband is from here. We always use Hotwire with great success, except this time!! When I saw that we were staying at the Delta Chelsea I knew first hand it was NOT a 4 stat hotel... Im not quite sure how they were able to states they were but perhaps they should go into a hotel that is 4 stars... we had to upgrade because the first room we recieved was dirty, smelly and I didnt even know these elevators existed before.. they were aside from the other elevators!! (that was the first clue that this room wasnt going to be nice) So we asked to be changed (for a small fee of course) to another room that was VERY dated, a 25" (very old tv) and rusted ceiling fixtures ect. Bathroom was dirty and it was very noisy... As for location, its ok (that would be the only thing that was perhaps ok)! A bit away from nightlife, good restaurants ect... PLEASE VIEW PICS and you will see for yourself that this is NOT a 4 star. Ive stayed here in the past and my room was better but again not a 4 star. Perhaps management has changed?

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Edd60
Reviews.Content: The Delta chealsea is huge, as is the main lobby it looks more like a shopping mall or train station than a hotel. we had a room on 17th floor it was a good sizewith two very comfy queen beds, room was clean and tidy although there were a few marks and scuffs on the wallpaper and door trims. had a bit of trouble opening the patio doors and the balcony was small and the view was a bit disapiontting . the pool on 27 is fab!! we didnt eat in hotel as there is a great selection of resturants in the area, this hotel is in a great location for exploring the city , all in all we had a pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, but very noisy - and not that 'refurbished'”
Reviews.Author: DutchJournalist
Reviews.Content: Do you need a silent surrounding when you sleep? Don't go here! The rooms are very noisy, mostly because of the street noise that wont be blocked by the windows - especially on the north side. After one night the staff moved me to another room, which was on the southeast side and was a little bit more quiet. The beds are really great, so i slept like a baby. The location of the hotel is quite good if you want to see the city, its in the middle of the center. Nice adult pool-with-a-view on the 27th floor, good staff. There are a lot of great restaurants in the surrounding area, so don't bother to eat inside if you don't like it. The rooms were 'refurbished' they said, but it's not that big of a deal. It still looks a bit outdated, but you'll be staying in the hotel to be in the city, not to stay in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Smack in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: wanderers26
Reviews.Content: Delta Chelsea was wonderful. Best location ever. We walked all over the city, never having to use our car. Upon checking in, the lovely check in person upgraded us to a newly renovated room at no extra cost. Everyone from maids to doormen were friendly, always smiling---The room was large, modern and clean. Loved the all the choices in the market style restaurants that didn't charge an arm and leg for many types of tasty food items. Just love Canada, Canadians are always a polite and friendly bunch. The cost of parking at $25 per day was, I thought, high but it was very easy to get to the enclosed garage and car if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: keithb789
Reviews.Content: If thinking about booking a room at Delta Chelsea, spend a few extra bucks to get a "Premier Room". I didn't so had an unrefurbished room with the typical ugly carpeting and bedspread, etc. But I was very happy at the hotel and would stay there again. The location can't be beat - bordering Yonge Street, a couple blocks from Eaton Centre, and around the corner from the bars on Church Street.
