I appreciated having a balcony to step outside and enoy the view and nice end-of-May weather, although the balcony itself was ugly, contained no furniture and was full of pigeon droppings. The adult pool area was great - high up with a great view and nice to take photos from the sundeck up there. The restaurants downstairs are decent - I only ate breakfast there once and it was good. Staff was always pleasant and said "hello" and even though it is a big and busy hotel, it was easy to check-in, ask a question and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Arguementative Guest services???”
Reviews.Author: CDUB37
Reviews.Content: First Rule of customer service is don't argue with the customer. Andrea in guest services did just that. What happened? I returned to my room on the last night of my visit to find the do not disturb sign on my door gone which I know I placed on the door before I left. I enter my room no Don not disturb sign on the inside of the door either to find sure enough housekeeping had cleaned my room and were pretty much hands on with everything I owned in the room, suit case moved laptop opened up things on the desk neatly arranged. Now I can understand the hallway is a fairly public place someone may have taken the do not disturb sign and housekeeping didn't see it, so I call guest services to ask if it was noted that the do not disturb sign was missing for my room. A lady named Andrea picked up the phone; I asked my question and she was immediately confrontational "sir, first of all we would never enter your room if you had put the do not disturb sign on the door in the first place". I explained to Andrea that I prefer my privacy from the beginning to the end of my stay. in another words the do not disturb sign is posted out side of my room for the duration of my stay. Andrea's response is a curt "well sir I will tell you that you must have not put it on your door". I tell Andrea I actually did make sure it was on the door before I left in the morning because it had fallen off when I opened the door to leave and I had picked it up and placed it on the door. Andrea in another curt and short voice says she is going to call the manager and see what they say. ok...? 15minutes pass... Andrea calls back to tell me brashly that the manager says I didn't put the sign on my door this morning. I ask her how the manager would have that information? Andrea's condescending response was as follows "because if you had, then your room wouldn't have been cleaned" like it was the punchline to a joke. I explain to Andrea that I kind of felt a little uncomfortable with her tone and the way she was handling the situation more than the broken taboo of the do not disturb sign. she says she will talk to the front desk and call me back. before I can ask her why she would need to talk to the front desk when she's already spoken with the manager she hangs up. I did not receive a call back the rest of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: eagles34
Reviews.Content: Probably would give the hotel 4.5 out of 5. I liked most things about it. Didn't have the problems waiting for the elevators or the crowds like alot of other people had. They gave me a renovated room which was real nice but it looked like the they only renovated about 80% of it. The balcony was old like people said but looked at it as a plus to even have one because alot of high rise hotels don't anymore. Internet worked great and not too expensive. Parking was a little expensive (I think 20 in canadian) and was the only part of the hotel I didn't like alot - the lot was real tight and confusing and old. Fortunately everything is nearby so you could park your car and forget about it until you leave. Liked everything else - location and service was great. Had alot of options to eat inside the hotel that were pretty cheap. Also the bed was awesome - only hotel I slept at in a while the didn't hurt my back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: wayfare1
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel, with good service and clean rooms. Very centrally located, walking distance to many attractions and facilities, and about a two minute walk from the subway. The food in the hotel is a bit expensive (as are most hotel restaurants), but there are lots of places to eat right next to the hotel, with a 24 hour pharmacy and many convenience stores within a five minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “upgraded room: dirty, loud, checked out early”
Reviews.Author: travlhappy
Reviews.Content: Upgraded room to a newly renovated room when checking in. The bedding in the room was comfortable and seemed clean. However, the bathroom was not. The tub had dirt built-up and was nasty. I felt like I needed to wear shoes. It is a very large hotel with a lot of activity. Our room on the 16th floor did not have good insulation to keep out external noise. We heard everything in the hallway and from the neighbors throughout the stay. Stayed in a 4 star hotel at Niagara Falls the previous night and it was not like this at all. I am not sure why this hotel is 4 stars on some sites. Also the patio was shared and not finished - bare cement.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value... if you know the drill”
Reviews.Author: CheapTravelSnob
Reviews.Content: Five things you need to know: 1) Go with the upgrade: We landed the room through an unbelievable web-deal--the one that rhymes with "fire" (not "fine"). After learning the hotel's identity I was concerned about the mixed room reviews on Trip Advisor. We followed the TA advice from others to get the $20/night upgrade-it's definitely worth itl!!! The room was much newer and nicer than their baseline rooms, PLUS even after the $$$ upgrade, the total rate was still better than anything else you can find in town. (Just know you'll also get hit with a $26/day parking charge, but that's standard for downtown hotels). 2) Great location: A good home base if you're plan is to "do Toronto." There's a general buzz in the hotel lobby all the time (compared with tranquility at somewhere like the King Edward). Fits the Yonge Street feel where the full city experience is right outside your door (sights, smells, sounds, everything). If you're trying to "get away from it all," this isn't your place. 3) Convenient food options: Good food offerings within the hotel, but everything you'd want is nearby (from fine dining to pizza by the slice). Coffee was o.k., but Starbucks and Tim Horton's were both just a couple blocks away. 4) Service satisfactory (not much more). Had a couple requests of the staff during our stay. They were eventually honored, but felt begrudgingly. 5) Adult pool and fitness center a hidden gem (26th floor with plenty of state of the art work out equipment).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a huge hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolotexas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Toronto yesterday and our stay there was great. We booked on Priceline for really cheap. After reading these reviews, we opted to upgrade to a renovated room for $20 CAD + taxes per night and it was well worth it. We stayed on the 8th floor and our king bed was the most comfortable hotel bed ever. Clean, marble bathroom and a private balcony with views towards Eaton Centre were great. Only drawbacks were the touristy feel of the hotel - it is HUGE and at times felt more like an impersonal resort - tons of people, but not personalized service. Also, a fluke false fire alarm woke us (and everyone else at the hotel) at 3am on our first night and kept us up for 20 minutes. Not impressed, but wasn't the hotels fault! Oh and breakfast at their Market Garden diner was over-priced and pretty terrible. Take a few extra minutes and walk the neighborhood for a nicer, less expensive meal - we didn't do this, but wish we had!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Matusla
Reviews.Content: Location: Great downtown area Staff: Courtesy and Professional Rooms: Clean and just the right size Resturant: They have a cafeteria for the family budget and traveler, food is pretty good. Family play center on the secound floor, great pool slide 150 feet Parking: Ouch! $27.00 Internet: Ouch!! $12.50 Recommendation: Before you check in become Delta Hotel Member

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Irl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Delta Chelsea for 6 nights and found it to be a great experience. The location was perfect, just 3 minutes walk to Toronto's Eaton Centre. The staff were among the friendliest and most helpful I have come across in a very long time, all we had to do was ask and they would go oout of their way to help. We stayed on the 23rd floor with great views over the city. Room was very clean and beds were comfortable. My only negative point about the room was the TV was very dated and small. We used the adult pool and fitness centre each morning and it was a very nice experience. Pool was spotless and changing rooms were immaculate. We will definitately be staying at Delta Chelsea again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Diana287
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends stayed here for 4 nights from 1/5/09. The hotel was great, hotel staff very pleasant and helpful. It was easy to arrange tours at the hotel desk & pick up from the hotel for Niagara Falls trip and city tour. The self service buffet was ideal for breakfast. Good location for Eaton Centre shopping. Our rooms were very good and clean. Unfortunately the balconies are old and unpainted but that was the only down side. Would certainly stay there again if in Toronto. We all felt very safe in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JulesHouston
Reviews.Content: Went to a conference at the Delta Chelsea with 5 colleagues. After reading some of the reviews on here about unrenovated rooms I called and changed our reservations from standard to an upgraded concierge level which had free breakfast and evening reception and I was told their best rooms (recently renovated). We were all disappointed in our rooms. If these were the best rooms in the hotel I would not want to see the unrenovated ones. The rooms were a decent size and had a balcony but they all smelled funny, were on the dark side, and the renovations were fairly superficial. The furniture was a little modern and really didn't fit the hotel. The concierge lounge was also disappointing. The breakfast was little more than cereal, juice, and fruit. And the evening receptions was a few overcooked finger foods and you had to pay for wine, beer, and even sodas! The sodas were $2.50 and the wine was $8 a glass. I have stayed at several hotels with concierge lounges and have never been charged for a soda and often the wine and beer are free. And, as many other reviews have mentioned ,the air conditioning (or lack there of) was an issue. Toronto was having an unusually warm April with day temps in the 80's. The air conditioning was clearly not on in the hotel and it was so uncomfortable in the room however the hallways were freezing! (I thought about getting a pillow and blanket and bunking in the hallway a couple of times). I asked for a fan every day of my stay however I never got one. One of my collegues did however she said it didn't help much. With so many lovely places to stay in Toronto this would not be one I would choose again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location. Staff were very HELPFUL!”
Reviews.Author: daniellepal
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Thur. - Sun. in May. We became Delta rewards members for free before we went. When we got there we got to check in at the seperate and far less busy Delta rewards desk. And, since we were members we got a room upgrade! Sweet! Check in and out was very easy. The conceierge were very helpful. The rooms were always cleaned and the 2 bottles of free water was a nice touch. The hotel is large and shows some sign of age like scuffs or a crack in a shower tile but, overall we were very pleased. We got a great deal and the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT THE DELTA CHELSEA”
Reviews.Author: racingqueen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 10 nights at the DC and could not have been better. Think I must have stayed in a different hotel to the reviewer below !! Went there with my hubby and daughter to celebrate her forthcoming 21st. On arrival I asked if we could have a renovated room (as others had advised on here) and was given a free upgrade to a luxury room. The room was lovely. Spacious, 2 queen size beds, lovely modern decor, modern bathroom with marble unit tops. Bedding was really nice and changed every other day. The beds were to die for, the comfiest we have ever slept in. .Towels changed daily if required. Good quality complimentary toiletries. Free newspaper delivered to room each morning. Tea/coffee making machine with lots of free supplies. Our room was cleaned every day. The only complaint I had was that we were woken one evening at 11.15pm...yes pm...by maids hoovering the corridoor and cleaning the room next to us. I complained to the front desk next morning and it never happened again. The DC has numerous eating places and bars. I only tried the market garden self service one evening and have to say the hot food was expensive and poor. There is free WIFI access in the public areas around the front desk. The pool area on the top floor is really nice, theres a jacuzzi in there too. The childrens pool down stairs with the corkscrew slide is good. Slides were only open fri/sat. There are coin operated washing machines situated in the girls changing rooms. Werw good value at $2 per wash and $2 per dry and are huge so you can do a large load in one go. There are some great restaurants on the doorstep of the DC. Our faves close by were The Pickle Barrell on Yonge street,close to The Eaton Centre and Spring Rrolls in The Atrium On Bay,again on Yonge street. For a snack or drink you have to try Johnny Rocketts in Dundas Square. Its a fun authentic style diner with chrome fittings and juke box etc, the waitresses sing and dance. They do fab milk shakes. Avoid the Swiss Chalet restaurant just below the yonge street entrance of the hotel. The food was very poor and the toilets were a disgrace. We had a fab meal at Baton Rouge on front street close to the CN Tower. I had the lunch time staek special...a 12oz rib steak and oh boy was it good...it melted in your mouth. My daughter has rack of ribs and it was amazing. Great prices at lunchtime. The DC is situated between 2 subway stations...College and Dundas...each being a good 5 mins walk away. Use the gerrard street entrance for College..and the yonge street entrance for Dundas. Across the road in the college park shopping complex there is a metro supermarket which is very good. They sell lovely fresh pizza and bakery items for breakfast. We purchased a weekly TTC pass which gave us unlimited travel around Toronto (on all TTC routes) on the subway, street cars and buses and was well worth the cost of $33 dollars (adult price). However the passes are only valid from monday-sunday each week so not much point in purchasing one mid-way through the week. You can purchase a daily pass and that seemed good value too. We made a visit to the theatre to see The Jersey Boys and it was really good. purchased our tickets from the discount ticket booth in dundas square. The theatre is a 25min subway ride away. Really nice theatre in a very good area. We did the main sightseeing etc..CN tower...the beaches...china town...went to a baseball game at the rogers centre which was brilliant...purchased tickets on the door 30 mins before the game. We hired a car and went to niagara falls and the beautiful town of niagara on the lake. Just wish we had split our visit between that area and toronto as the niagara area is really lovely. On the coastal rd between niagara falls and niagara on the lake there is a totem pole park and it was fantastic. Shopped at niagara retail outlet and got some great bargains form levi's and tommy hilfiger. The eaton centre is a great place to shop in Toronto, however not for bargain hunters. As my daughter loves shopping we took the subway to yorkdale and went to the yorkdale mall. This mall was much better than the eaton centre and much more affordable. We took a limo from the airport to the hotel which cost us $55 dollars. On our return journey the hotel concierge arranged the limo back to the airport and it cost us $50 dollars. The airport express bus stops at the hotel. The cost one way is $19.99, so for a family of 3 it was cheaper to get the limo. A normal taxi is around $10 cheaper. We noticed that parking at the hotel was expensive. Around $22 a day. However there is a public car park opposite and was much cheaper. We booked this hotel through ebookers and got a good deal. The helpfulness of the staff here was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!! Hotwire says Delta Chelsea is 4-star, is actually 2-star”
Reviews.Author: mdrew
Reviews.Content: Looked like Grandma's old drapes as bed spreads - when i complained and got the upgraded room this was the only change. all photos are of the upgraded room, the prior room was even worse. Rusted, filthy, unsafe balcony. Tiny room, I could not move around without banging my knee on the TV stand, and I am a petit woman. Asked for towels 3 times in 2 hours before they came. Water damaged bathroom with cracked tiles. Black marks and dirt all over the walls. Lock on door didn't work. No air conditioning. Ancient 15" Zenith TV. Mismatched doorknobs. Rickety closet doors that donâ€™t close. Room was actually worse than Motel 6, same hair dryer though lol. Who did the Delta Chelsea bribe to get a 4-star rating???

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ABhanPune
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is a large hotel in downtown toronto and is located conveniently for being able to do work in the business district. Is surrounded by places to eat and shop and also has a water slide which will be a fun with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: tillyb
Reviews.Content: Hi. I've just spent 4 nights at the Delta Chelsea, travelling with a friend. We were both very impressed with the hotel from start to finish. When we checked in we were a bit frazzled after some nightmare treatment by immigration and customs at the Airport (apparently we were suspicious because we were only comming for 5 days and Toronto is not somewhere Tourists come!!! - the hotel was thrilled when we told them we had been told that!). After we recounted our story they gave us a room upgrade and free breakfast. The hotel was spotless and the room was lovely (incredibly comfy beds). There was sometimes a bit of a wait for the lift but nothing that bothered us. The pool area was lovely and the bars and restaurants we ate in were also really nice. It is in a central location and very close to the Eaton Shopping Centre. It is a bit of a walk down to the harbour front area and CN Tower but the taxi's were readily available and pretty cheap to us. The staff in the hotel were really helpful and friendly (a general Toronto trait from our experience of the people we met). The only thing we did find was that the air in the room was very drying. We left the window open at night and that helped. It was a general thing we found everywhere we went in the city - there was always warm air being blown over you. It may be that it was because it had been cold and the heating hadn't been turned off. It did play havoc with our sinuses and judging by the huge display of sinus remedies in the pharmacies we went in to, it is a pretty common problem. All in all though we had a thoroughly wonderful time and would definately go back to the Delta Chelse. T x

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great if you get a special offer”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night break at this hotel and have mixed feelings for it. We were originally booked into a standard room but after reading reviews on here paid the $20per night extra to upgrade to one of the newer rooms. Glad we did. Nice and spacious,huge bed. However, it was nothing special and if I had paid the rack rate I don't think I would have been very impressed. Having said that I have given it four stars and that is for the following reasons. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, and I've stayed in a number of hotels. The location was excellent. Everything was in walking distance, the only time we needed to use public transport was to get out to the zoo which is outside the city. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The woman on the concierge desk was great with any questions we had. I would avoid the restaurants for breakfast, especially the Market Garden, it was very expensive and not great. Try one of the local small places that surround the place. All in all, it was excellent value for the money we paid, and if I were to get a deal again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe reviews....”
Reviews.Author: jamessouthlondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and i arrived for a 4 night break,we had joined the delta privilige club(its free!!) and we we had 1 minute check in (we watched the others waiting at the normal check in) ,a room upgrade,$200 dollars credit on bar bills etc. The room was great, clean ,comfortable,but dated. Bars were ok restaurants basic but pricey (plenty of good cheap ones in bay street or young street,just a few minutes walk.Plenty to see in toronto,take the ferry to the islands,tranquil,no cars just nature,CN tower is a must,have a meal up the top,you pay $35 and get the lift free (no meal it will cost you $25 for the lifts alone! Use the hotel bus from the airport,$29 return cab will cost $60.

Reviews.Title: “alot of aggrevation”
Reviews.Author: sbflo
Reviews.Content: Excited to get away, the kids saved for months and months We thought we had reserved two adjoining rooms with king size beds. We arrived at 5:50pm . I stood in the check in line and listened as the term I'm sorry was repeated to each client. The rate was different, the standard room was the only one left. Poor people I thought, they must not have had reservations like me. Wrong...my turn, there were no adjoining rooms available, 'we don't guarantee room types, just the room I was told . Now five kids, two parents, we needed the adjoining room. The gentlemen was very nice and after 25 minutes found adjoining rooms. (mind you I waited for 20 minutes before I even got to this fellow) The catch, the second room wouldn't be available until after 10pm. That's ok the kids will swim anyway one room will do until then, Wrong...the pool had an emergency and was closed. I give, after a 3 hour drive we'll wait for the second room. At 9:45 pm I get a call the second room will be ready in 20 minutes and they'll send the key up. Great ,the kids are exhausted (parents too). Well at 11:10 pm I called down, shortly before midnight the key found its way to us. Did I mention the beds were full, not king sized. It got worse. April and it was 50+ out. The rooms were sweltering. I was hesitant to open the doors for the screen, worried one of the kids would end up on the balcony during the night. About 2am I called to ask if I was using the air conditioner correctly. The nice lady replied it's not on, and went on to explain it's not controlled in the individual rooms.if enough people complain I'm sure she said, it will be on tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: SomeBozo
Reviews.Content: Got my room for only US$50 on another site (rhymes with "nice line"), and was very pleased. The room looks great with really attractive comforters/blankets/pillows/etc. and nice furniture although the bathroom is small because the building is 30-40 years old and that can't be helped. The bed was good, it was quiet at night and the overall feel of the hotel is very positive and energetic. I used the free gym/pool on the 27th floor, which had a great atrium view of downtown Toronto. Food court in the lobby has lots of quality choices for under $10. I also abused the all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ joint across the street on Yonge. TIP: There's free WiFi in the food court in the lobby (you have to pay for WiFi in your room).

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: KMelvin1
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for it's location and child facilities and we were not disappointed. The hotel looks a little shabby on the outside but don't let this put you off. We had chosen a newly refurbished suite and it was lovely. There wasn't a huge amount of room for a fmaily of 4 but with the well equipped kitchen it had everything we needed, was spotless and serviced daily. The children's centre was excellent and our 2 boys (4 & 7)were well looked after by the staff. They loved being dropped off for a couple of hours while my husband and I visited the roof top adults pool or went for a meal. For the small fee it's a must and gave them space to play after a long day in the city. We visited a year ago and the boys are still receiving birthday cards in Scotland!! We had a great stay and would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but probably better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: laurameee26
Reviews.Content: We booked the Delta Chelsea for a bit of slight luxury after staying at Bond Place hotel, but it turns out that we could have quite easily carried on at Bond Place for half the price. We paid double for Delta chelsea, when I actualy prefered our room at the bond place. The lobby was nice though. Although the room was fine for what we needed, it was very dated, and the bathroom wasn't the greatest we've had in Canada. Also, I found long black hairs on the towels which didn't belong to me, being blonde! So that was pretty disgusting, wasn't impressed!! Also, we were woken up really early one morning by the maid loudly cleaning the room next door, and we could also hear the showers of the rooms around us, which got a bit annoying. But, we did get a free newspaper both mornings, which was nice. One other thing was that the internet connection cost $11.95 plus tax for 24 hours, which is way more than we've paid in any other hotel in Canada, in most hotel the internet connection has been free! So that seemed a bit of a rip off. The hotels fine for a couple of nights but I'd either pay more for a better room, or for a lower budget stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel in an ideal postion for both central and down town Toronto”
Reviews.Author: AGMK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to the USA and Canada the Delta Chelsea was one of the Hotels we stayed in during our Trip, despite being the largest in Toronto it keeps all the personal touches of a smaller hotel ,offering several places to eat and drink, a fabulous adults pool and hot tub with Gym ( thank you to the lovely lady there ) added to this there is a family pool ,play area and slide if you are travelling with children, do check out Jack Astors resturant less than 10 minutes from the hotel , we did a half day Niagara Falls trip which the hotel helped us book it was the 99$ one and worth every penny started at 12 and got us back around 8pm

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: muffin78
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Delta Toronto East (which is great) and was expecting the same standards but was sadly disappointed in the Delta Chelsea. I booked a Delta Room @ $159/night which turned out to be grubby and very worn, especially the carpet, and the mattress was lumpy and uncomfortable. On the plus side, the water pressure was great, the room was very quiet and the staff were super friendly. Book one of the renovated rooms at a higher price or stay elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Very overrated.”
Reviews.Author: aero_world
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how this hotel got its star rating. Sure, it's a big hotel in a good location. But it's just average. The room I stayed in was small and there wasn't much of a view. High-speed internet access was a rip-off. For what I paid, I wish I'd booked somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Sunday Brunch”
Reviews.Author: snlamothe
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my visitors out for brunch this morning and decided that the Delta Chelsea might be the place to go ... NOT ... I was terribly disappointed with everything. The cost was $13.95/person which is a reasonable price that I willingly paid but I was expecting to get reasonably good food and service ... NOT ... we had to clean our tables off ourselves ... no one ever came to wipe the table ... thankfully we had sanitizing wipes that we could use ... the scrambled eggs were runny and looked like they were sitting in a sauce ... the bacon was hardly cooked, the sausages were mildly browned ... one member of our group has allergies to egg, dairy and soy ... not much on your buffet for him ... another was hoping to find some fresh fruit ... none to be found ... Yes I know it's March break and was a very busy morning but is this the first year that it's busy during the March break ... have you not thought of having more staff on hand to help ... Anyhow, needless to say that I will not be taking anyone that I'm fond of to the Delta Chelsea for any meals ... I learned my lesson. I'd hate to think of wha the rooms are like.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill fast”
Reviews.Author: Halinmich
Reviews.Content: This used to be one of the nicer stop-overs in Toronto, but sadly I will not be staying here again. Check-in mob scene, not enough elevators, rooms a little spartan/dated, overrun with screaming out-of-control kids, plus they claim to take Discover Card (prefer to use to get 1% cash back, plus Discover doesn't charge the 3% foreign transaction fee), but couldn't/wouldn't bother to get through to them, so had to use a backup credit card. Food court was overpriced and had poor meals. Recommend you stay at the Courtyard Marriott instead, same or less $$ for much, much better service and meals.

Reviews.Title: “High Class Hotel with Low Class Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sleepeasy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were coming into town to spend our anniversary at the theatre and we purchased our hotel on Hotwire. Upon arrival on our floor we were greeted by a lovely young man walking down the hall in his underwear which should have been a clue of what was in store for us for the rest of the night. Our room was small overlooking the garbage bins, the tub was black and our room had a lovely 1990's 19" colour TV (so much for conservation of energy). We went to the theatre and returned after 11 PM and from that time on doors banged, people were yelling and running up and down the hall in their underwear . We complained to Management but were told they were part of a university group and they couldn't do anything about it. Finally at 2:30 AM we were moved to an UPPER LEVEL room. NOTE: HOTWIRE PURCHASERS GET LOWER CLASS ROOMS

Reviews.Title: “Very big & busy but GREAT for families!”
Reviews.Author: KatieGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice. It is massive and the reception area always seems busy as does the restaurant. It has everything that you would need as a family in a city. The first time we stayed , the weather was bad and my girls wanted to stay in the hotel one day. We went swimming in the small children's pool and had a ball in the water slide. They then went to the club where they spent a few hours which included lunch. The were reluctant to leave! On our latest visit they went to the evening club, whilst we went out for a couple of hours. Holidays with children are a joy but a couple of nice relaxing hours out on the town were great. The girls watched a video and did some Arts n Crafts and had a great night too. But even if you did not want to leave your kids in the club, it is still worth going to. The staff were so helpful. When we got back to Glasgow we discovered that my daughter had left her new cuddly toy in the hotel. I emailed to see if they had it. I got a lovely email back saying that they didn't but if I told them the make and model, they would buy one and sent it over. They girls still get cards from the hotel on their birthdays!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaNel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea from Feb. 20 to 23rd for a getaway weekend with friends. Our smaller room was renovated. It was kept spotlessly clean, esp. the bathroom. Also quiet. Beds were soooo comfy and all bedding changed each day. A very cold weekend, and one wall of this smaller room is glass going out to the balcony, so understand people's comments about a cooler room. However, heat control worked fine & heavy overdrapes were insulated if you closed them at night, so the place was quite cosy. Wanted to say something about the staff, who were all just delightful. We were thanked several times for choosing their hotel. Asked if there was anything we needed. Lots of smiles which made our stay so pleasant. We ate 3 times in the Bb33 restaurant. Friday seafood buffet with roast beef and a great dessert bar was just outstanding. All meals were good. The Market Garden Grill is a great thing because you can get a drink or bite to eat at all hours, eat there or cart it to your room. Finally, so much is within walking distance and College Park subway station is just a few steps away. Can't fault the location at all. The place is huge, but feels homey and comfortable. Will surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “plesantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: happercamper
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hotel, I wasn't sure whether to book here or not. Must say I was pleasantly surprised. I booked the "newly renovated " Premier Room. It was quite okay. Nice comfortable bed with cozy douvet. However, not sure what "newly rennovated" means at the Delta Chelsea The desk had scratches on it, the bathtup has definitely seen better days & the balcony was far from being rennovated. On the whole, the room was clean & very quiet. Would suggest that you install supportive assist bars in the shower, however, The pool & exercise room on the 27th floor was quite impressive & very clean--open longer hours than pool areas in other hotels that I have stayed at. The front desk staff,Pool staff & diningroom staff were pleasant & very helpful. If you want a wonderful meal, I would highly recommend the main hotel dining room. Moderately expenisve, but worth every penny. I was disappointed in the Market Garden (Cafeteria style eatery) for breakfast. Too expensive for a mediocre breakfast. I would definitely stay at the Delta Chelsea again for a mini break or shopping trip.

Reviews.Title: “1st class stay, comfortable & excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Cardifflovelygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days before going on to Niagara. We had a deluxe twin room which was outstanding. It was large with 2 double beds and all the usual facilities that you might need. The beds were fab with super-comfy mattresses and pillows to die for, the best nights sleep ever!!! The service we received was top notch, very friendly and excellent customer service, particularly from Reception and Concierge, who helped with maps of Toronto and places of interest etc. We ate breakfast in BB3 and it was superb!! A fantastic buffet with all sorts of fruits, breads, pastries, cereals, pancakes, bacon, eggs etc. We were absolutely stuffed and this breakfast set us up for the whole day! Excellent attentive service in here too. Slightly expensive at at $18 per head, but totally worth it!! We didnt eat in any of the other Restaurants apart from grabbing a coffee in the 'Market Garden', choosing instead to eat in Restaurants in the surrounding area. The Hotel is in a great central location and is about a 1/2hr walk from the CN Tower and attractions such as the museums and Rogers Centre. There is also a fab outdoor iceskating rink outside City Hall which is great fun. Overall, a wonderful stay with super-comfortable beds & pillows and I would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “in city get away”
Reviews.Author: ivormom
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite for the family day holiday. The room was very kid friendly (with the exception of the scary balcony). The kids borrowed games from the kid camp for the in room x box, and enjoyed the bunk beds. The room needs to be updated badly, but was clean. The kid camp was very nice and they enjoyed the "back lot" tour. The staff there friendly and it was well run. The teen room doesn't have half as much available as the pictures on the web site suggest, but is clean. The Children's pool and area is quite sad, and if you take a look at the adult pool, slum like in comparison. Since the Delta advertises being the only downtown hotel with a water slide, you would think they would put some resources in the area...truely the low point of the hotel. The buffet in 33 was great, loved the chocolate fountain and found the staff quite nice. Check in and check out were quite fast and uneventful. It was disapointing that the lounge on the 27th floor was closed, it would have been nice to see the view. Overall, worthwhile but the hotel really should fix the kids pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Average facility.”
Reviews.Author: Arlowe
Reviews.Content: I received a great price thru Priceline. That said, had I received a renovated room, my opinion would probably be more favorable. The hotel was clean and is situated in a great location - in close proximity to the subway and major shopping attractions. Those pluses could not outweigh the fact that the last time our room was renovated was probably 20 years ago. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable I've slept on in recent memory. The bathroom was acceptable - clean but very outdated as well. Not the 3.5 star i am typically accustomed to.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - Not Anywhere Near As I Expected”
Reviews.Author: 2eratics
Reviews.Content: After going through the reviews on this hotel, I was expecting it to be a bit shabby and needing a refresh. I was pleasantly surprised to find just the opposite. My room was contemporary with a bed with nice linens and a thick duvet, the furnishing were tastefully modern and the bathroom much the same. I could tell the room had received a makeover somewhat recently as there were still traces of the old '80s look mentioned in the other reviews. One thing I was glad to see and use was the retractable clothesline in the tub - don't see many of those anymore. I used the fitness facilities three times and while it was crowded mid-week, there was always equipment open. A nice touch to have fresh orange sections or other fruit after your workout plus a choice of three daily newspapers. I only tried one restaurant on site - the Bb33. The food and service was very good. The buffet had a great selection of fresh salads, pastas, prime rib and more desert items than one could eat. Check-in & out was fast with very friendly service and arranging a later check-out was no problem at all. The airport bus has a pick up at the hotel but give yourself lots of time if you take it. It takes at least 45 minutes to get through downtown plus at least another 45 minutes to get to the airport if the traffic is not horrible (this being Toronto, it usually is). I would definitely stay at the Delta Chelsea again.

Reviews.Title: “Tips for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Seaquence
Reviews.Content: We stay twice a month at the Delta Chelsea in Downtown Toronto on Gerrard St. for my wife's regular medical treatments. A key point most don't realize is that not only is this hotel convenient to all downtown attractions it is a "Pet Friendly" hotel. For a small fee you can check in with your dog and this saves us a lot of hastle as our little dog is getting too old to put in a kennel and finding a dog sitter is harder and harder these days. There is a park right outside the North entrance to walk Fido but please pick up. The rooms are ok, many are being upgraded (redecorated and refurbished). There are two pools, one for adults on the 27th floor and a kids/adult poool on the 2nd. The 27th floor also boasts a well equipped gym. The Market place grill is very expensive for cafeteria style eating but the main dining room (Bistro) is excellent although recently they discontinued their fabulous dinner buffet on week nights and only offer it on weekends. This was a major disappointment. They do have a fun sports bar and a great lounge on the main floor. The lounge offers a nice Indian Buffet for lunch. There are an incredible selection of restaurants right outside the south entrance on to Elm St. including a Steak House, Several Italian, Thai and others all within 2 minutes walk. Lots of parking underground and if you are a guest the rate is quite good for downtown parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: jen2RochesterNy
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother had a girls weekend up in toronto. I used priceline as usual but usually I pick 3 star and get a marriott which I am always happy with. I chose 3.5 star and got the Delta, I was really disapointed as I stayed there about 8 years ago and even then thought the rooms were run down. I checked out other reviews and got even more disapointed- granted we only paid $41 dollars through priceline, but I easily could have gotten 3 star marriott for the same price. I did call ahead to see if we could get a remodeled room but they said no. When I got there I asked again and they said for an additional $20 a night we could- well for $20 more we could have stayed at the sheraton. When I said no they did upgrade us free to the next level. the room was very small, but was upgraded and it was very clean with nice duvet's etc. The bathroom was not remodeled so was very old and worn, but clean. Check in however and concierge was quick and very helpful and the location was perfect especially when the wind chill was well below zero. The adult pool was very nice as well. As others have also noted it was very noisy at nightime with people out in the hallways talking/goofing around until about 3am. I just put a pillow over my head and tried to drown it out. Overall I would stay here again for this price if I could have a remodeled room as you cant beat $41.

Reviews.Title: “Had our wedding here”
Reviews.Author: mzsunnyblonde
Reviews.Content: Approximately 2/3 of our guests were from out of town (England and US) so we wanted a convenient location for them. From the start, organizing the wedding was a breeze - kudos to Reggie and Carolyn. My fiance lived in the US and I have a very busy work schedule so the fact sooooo much was included really helped me. Our guests who had the renovated rooms, loved them. The guests who got the older rooms (booked outside of the package the hotel got us) were not as happy. Location is great for the subway, reasonably priced restaurants (walk north to College and try Pogue Mahone and/or Frans). Close to Yonge Street which has a fair amount of action all the time - but is safe to walk along, even alone, at night. Staff were great. Honeymoon suite was larger than our condo! In short we couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Delta Chelsea!”
Reviews.Author: hoferz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Delta Chelsea for the first time in mid-December and had a wonderful stay. Everyone on staff that we dealt with was more than helpful, and the cleaning service was outstanding. Santa was even in the lobby most of the time! Our room was the largest room we have ever had while visiting Toronto, complete with a balcony and terry robes. The adult fitness area and pool were never crowded and it was nice not to have to hear the shrieks of children while relaxing by the pool. We were a little apprehensive about staying at â€œthe largest hotel in Torontoâ€� as we usually book smaller, boutique hotels. However, I would highly recommend the Delta Chelsea, and will never hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like Musty rooms with 20" TV's”
Reviews.Author: CDNWEB
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea was terrible. Got to the check-in and they said that all they have is two double beds in the non renovated are. They have a renovated area but they call them the premier rooms and they cost $25.00 more. I thought OK as we would prefer not to have 2 doubles. But then they did not have a king but 2 doubles in a premier room. So took my chances with the original delta room. Took the elevator up and the railing was broken inside the car (first sign). The hallway carpet was pretty worn and went inside. The room was musty and the interior was really old. The comforters looked to be from 10 years ago, my parents had the alarm clock 20 years ago and the 20" Zenith TV was well a 20" Zenith TV. We were happy to leave the next day. I would rather stay at a super 8 than a Delta room at the Delta Chelsea Would not stay there again and I would caution anyone from bidding on a 3.5*.

Reviews.Title: “ok room ; vile neighbours”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and not uncomfortable, except when somebody in an adjoining room lit up and smoked cigarette(s) around midnight. The stench woke me up. This hotel is supposed to be 100% non-smoking, and there are small balconies on each room where the nicotine fiends could have gone out to smoke - if they were at all socialized. But they weren't When I called down to the desk, they said security would be up to deal with it. I eventually fell asleep with the stink of smoke in the air. It had cleared by morning when I awoke.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night after booking a special deal through their website for a newly renovated "Signature" room. Chose this hotel because of location (airport shutlle pickup spot) and because I'm a Delta Privilege member and wanted the late check-out. Delta hotels used to be the luxury hotel brand in Canada back in the 1980's but unfortunately after checking into this hotel I think they're still living in the 1980's. Lobby did not look properly set-up as there is the Privilege check-in area when you enter but the main desks are behind that and not so clearly marked. Check-in staff was not welcoming but efficient and did not bother to direct me to where the elevators were even though she asked if this was my first stay here (it was). Once I found the elevators, had a long trek to my room which was a quiet corner room that was towards Bay Street. The room was a good size and had probably been renovated but it didn't look new or clean to me. TV was tiny (19" is what it looked like) and didn't always come in clearly. While the bed was comfortable and warm, that was about the only good thing about it. Bathroom was horrible----while it wasn't moldy or dirty it certainly felt that way. The wallboard heating unit was falling apart in the bathroom and the walls looked old and dirty. This hotel is in serious need of a gutting and renovation to bring it up to 3 star standards. Tried the fitness/pool facilities and while the area is quite large and the cardio machines newer, I still couldn't shake that old 1980's feeling so I wasn't comfortable there. Based on the price ($119/night) I wish that I had booked the Intercontinental on Hotwire.com for a couple dollars more as it looked better and also was a pickup point for the airport shuttle. I wouldn't waste my money here unless you wanted to be close to Eaton Centre/downtown and you paid less than $100/night.

Reviews.Title: “Very average facilities but has some highlights too”
Reviews.Author: Go2Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea from Nov. 11-14 on business. Upon arrival, the front desk staff were prompt and courteous. I was put in Rm. 742 ($150/night). I was disappointed with the room; although it was clean, it was small and cramped with too much furniture and worn-looking and the bedspread was something straight out of a Super8. (1990's burgundy and forest green floral, very tacky.) I was also surprised to find that it had a small balcony. I slept here the first night and was bothered by street noise and the sound of the sliding door in the next room opening and closing at all hours (not loud, just loud enough for me to hear it). The next morning, I called down to the front desk and asked if there were any quieter rooms available. I was told I could be moved to a higher floor but that I would have to pay the difference in the room rates ($20/night). I was not pleased with the extra charge but I knew I couldn't stay where I was. Again, during this call the staff were very prompt, courteous and professional. I was moved to Rm. 1847. It was about the same size as the previous room but less cramped (less furniture) and the bathroom was larger and more modern. It had a tasteful white duvet and as hoped, it was much quieter. I was happy with this room although it was nothing special for $170/night. When I checked out, I noticed that the front desk had not in fact charged me the higher room rate so I was somewhat more pleased. I didn't visit the 27th floor lounge or pool/fitness areas but I can say that of the 3 restaurants I visited (Bb33, Monarchs, market/deli), all were very good. Overall, the hotel was acceptable but not outstanding. The average rooms are helped out by good service from the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel "hummed"”
Reviews.Author: SamB77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was one of the ones which the airport shuttle bus serviced directly. We paid a little more for the convenience of this. The hotel was lovely, very grand and the staff were all very helpful. They had a food court we used for breakfast and I had a slice of the most wonderful pizza here. BUT, the entire hotel, and I mean the ENTIRE hotel hummed really loudly with what must have been the air conditioning system. The first night I was dead on my feet and crashed out after being up 24 hours straight. Then my partner woke me up at about 2am to say he couldn't sleep for the noise and wanted to move rooms. The hotel obliged which I thought was nice of them and they upgraded our room in the process. But we ended up in a noisier room so I didn't sleep either. The next day we spoke to people and they were unaware of the sound, and the staff couldn't hear it at all. We're from a tiny village in rural norfolk and it is very quiet. We're not used to air conditioning. The noise was very loud in the lobby, and there were cupboards on each corridor from which the sound was coming. We tried 5 different rooms in total and they all had the noise. In the end we had to choose the best of a bad lot and had managed to buy some ear plugs which saved the day. But the hotel was lovely other than the noise and the staff were very accommodating. If you don't mind the sound of what sounds like large industrial fans you'll be OK :o)

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: KitKat003
Reviews.Content: After booking our queen size room almost two months prior we arrived to be told we couldn't get that room. The "gentleman" at the front desk gave us the "tough luck attitude" which I was surprised with...not exactly good customer service. Upon going to our room we found the bathroom dirty, make-up on the counter and something disgusting on the floor. Then there was the bed, turned back the sheets to find a cigarette burn....non-smoking room...go figure on how that happened. Parking, they charged an arm and a leg, $30 more than what we have paid at other hotels in the area. The only reason why we stayed here was the price, $89...that was the only good thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, rooms best feature and the great restaurants nearby”
Reviews.Author: seblong
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks at the hotel on business. Rooms: Best feature. My room was modern and a good size. Food and drink: Various food options options (including a food court which if not 24 hours, then at least is open until late). To be honest, I would skip the restaurants here, and walk out to Elm Street (one of the street exits). This has lots of restaurants that are a similar price, but much better quality and less depressing than a hotel restaurant. I can't remember the name, but there's a really great little rustic-looking Italian restaurant. Services: Not in a league with the Four Seasons and the like. Quite poor. Very much a factory style hotel. Facilities: Dated. Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a 4 star hotel. Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: garyr59
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. This is no, by any stretch of the imagination, 4 star hotel. Why? 1. Poor customer service. When reserving the room I requested a very quiet room, as I am a light sleeper. When checking in, I once again asked for a very quiet room. What did I get - a room a few floors above the loading dock. Terrible service from the front desk and the front desk manager in dealing with my complaints about a freezing room. 2. Freezing room. I stayed at the hotel in November. But the room was freezing. 9:30 PM turned the thermostat way up. Nothing but cold air came out of the vents. 10 PM, phoned front desk. According to them, for some reason the entire hotel is on the same system and someone in maintenance had not turned on the heat (what???? that is the strangest thing I have heard). Maintenance just switched from A/C to heat and give it 30 minutes. Waited longer, room still cold, nothing but cold air coming out of the vent. 11 PM, phoned front desk again. Same story. Maintenance just turned on the heat, wait, another 30 minutes. Still cold, still cold air coming out of vents. Phoned operator. She exclaimed, "my goodness alot of people are having problems with heat tonight". Same story, just turned on the heat, wait 30 minutes. Waited 30 minutes, no heat, cold air coming out of vent. So I contacted the front desk manager. I paid $20 for an upgraded room.Told him because of the lack of heat in the room, I wanted the $20 removed HE GRUMBLING, GRUDGINGLY accepted. Geez , I think I was resonable, I could and should have asked for a free more. Same response wait another 30 minutes. I gave up, threw 2 duvets on the bed and went to sleep. 3. The room I stayed in was renovated. One of the weirdest decorated (say cheap) hotel rooms I have seen. 3 star hotels are better looking then this. Many of the common areas of the hotel are looking worn. Would I stay here again. Absolutely not. A 3 star hotel at best. This is an extemely busy hotel. Check in and check out lines are long. Front desk staff who dont really care about guests.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveler42
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here!!!!...very dirty, rooms are so dirty,broken furniture, stained walls, when I comlained they charged me to upgrade to clean room!..what a joke...there are so many beautiful hotels in Toronto, ..Courtyard Marriot, Sheraton Center, Metropolitain...don't waste your time with this filthy place

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. The staff were very pleasantand eager to help. The check in line was a little long, however I was able to get an upgraded room. I really like the rooftop indoor pool and fitness center. Wish the rooms had free internet, as I had to go to the lobby in order to get free WIFI. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Torontonians let down by Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: suziewong101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea 14th to 17th October. Hotel VERY busy due to a spinal conference being on in Toronto. Hotel receptionist Martina was very helpful and we went through check - in within a few minutes. Our hotel room was very poor....dirty carpet (my sister refused to stand on it in her bare feet), wash hand basin marked and broken, took over 2 minutes to get hot water in bathroom, shower controls difficult to use, room smelled 'unaired'. Hotel corridor was shabby, marked walls and stained carpet. We had booked a trip to Niagara Falls and our fellow travellers raved about their recently renovated rooms. It seems we were just unlucky (could have been because we requested a room change ......from the double bed that the travel agent had booked to 2 singles) but would suggest you check that your hotel room is a renovated one. On the plus side, staff were very helpful and when I went to settle the phone bill, Martina waived the cost as it was only a small amount. Location central ...lots of restaurants in the street used for the back entrance. Beside Yonge street ...was a bit concerned as there was a few sex shops there but area busy and did not encounter any problems. Minutes away from Eaton Centre shops, a large cinema complex ,hop on hop off bus tour stop and a discounted theatre ticket booth. Concierge in hotel happy to book airport shuttle bus for you and can also arrange Niagara falls trip . (hope you get Tony D , one of the best tour guides I have EVER met) . Food in Market court pricey but quality and choice good. Torontonians are very friendly and whenever we stopped to look at a map we were asked if we needed help. Would recommend Jessie , the excellenant tour guide on the yellow bus tours and Captain Luke and partner on the harbour tour (laugh a minute) . A great trip......just need the Delta to sort out their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: Sweetpea237
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 9 nights in October 2008. We arrived 4 hours before check in (long flight from the UK) and were lucky enough to be able to check straight into our room. When we arrived there was no queue at check in. Between 3pm and 5pm each day there was a queue but these appears to be moving quickly. Our premier room was on the 19th floor. The room was of a good size, with one king size bed, TV, desk etc. The bathroom was quite small but nothing smaller than in other large Northern American cities I have visited before. The room was quieter than we expected. The air conditioning in the room worked well. There was 6 elevators serving our part of the hotel, there was always one waiting and they were very quick. The bed was very comfortable and there is a good choice of TV channels. The shower was extremely powerful! The room was one of the 'updated' ones although it wasn't spotless. It looked used but saying that it was very clean and the maids did a great job each day. The location of this hotel is great, between two subway stops each of which no more than a 5 minute stroll. Walking south of the hotel takes you down Yonge Street past the Eaton Centre and to the lake. It took us about 20 minutes to walk to Union Station and 30 minutes to the waterfront. We did not eat in any of the hotel restaurants as there is plenty of better / cheaper choice around the hotel. We did use the shop in the hotel (sells souveniors, chocolate, drinks etc), it was very convenient although the prices were a bit more than local shops as you would imagine. We found a Metro supermarket about 5 - 10 minute away on the Ryerson University campus. This has a great selection and is much cheaper than the Drug Mart stores for drinks and snacks. One gem we found was a pizza store across from the hotel, it doesn't look anything special from the out or inside but the pizzas are amazing! We booked our stay as a flight and hotel package with Expedia which meant we paid around Â£55 per night for the room. I am of the opinion that you get what you pay for and that a hotel room in a city is mainly for sleeping in. We thought this was very good value for the facilities and location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manc_Dwarf
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is good. Only 5 mins walk from the nearest subway and many shops are located within a short walk. I stayed here for 2 weeks on business and was upgraded to a club room. I would recommend this for business travellers as it gives you access to the club lounge where you can have breakfast and evening snacks. Room was good. Spacious and very comfrotable bed. The evening turn down service providing fresh ice and chocolates was also a very nice touch. The bathrrom was also good with a good shower and decent sized bath. The resaturants in this hotel were not so good in my opinion. More like canteen buffet style places which could be done so much better for the type of hotel this was and the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Busy - but has good points”
Reviews.Author: Rantin rover
Reviews.Content: We tried to get a walk-in booking at the Royal York however they only had rooms remaining at a rate which even Richard Branson would baulk at! Nevertheless the helpful receptionist suggested that she could contact their â€œsisterâ€� hotel - The Delta Chelsea - to check out availability. She got the details, confirmed acceptable and booked us in. A short taxi-ride away we were checked in at the â€œPrivilegeâ€� desk of the Delta Chelsea which was very quiet by comparison to the organised chaos of the hotel lobby and the main reception. This is a very large hotel and could be intimidating for some - the lobby appears at most times to have all the frenzy of a shopping mall on a Saturday afternoon as people criss-cross in all directions! It would be a good warm-up for the Eaton Centre. The lifts are quick and efficient - just make sure you get directions to the correct one to take you to your room because there are quite a number of them. Our room was on the upper levels overlooking Barbara Ann Scott Park on the Gerrard Street West side of the building and had been refurbished. We found the dÃ©cor a bit dark for our liking however everything was tastefully done. The two double beds were comfortable and the room had all the usual facilities you would expect of a decent hotel. The ensuite was small but functional. We had a narrow balcony overlooking the park however it took a moment or two to have the courage to step out on to it since it looked like an â€œoriginalâ€� feature of the building and we were quite a height from the walkway! Needless to say we tried it - separately - and survived! At night the view gave you a definite feeling of being â€œdowntown" amongst the city lights. As our arrival was quite late we didnâ€™t venture out onto the streets in search of a place for dinner and instead decided to try the hotel restaurant. The â€œMarket Gardenâ€� looked about as relaxing as the hotel lobby and appeared to serve up snacks - handy for families. We opted for â€œBb33â€� which was also on the ground level however is a bit more â€œupmarketâ€� as opposed to â€œmarket gardenâ€�. The waiter was very friendly and engaged in a bit of chat, the atmosphere was relaxed, the food very good and the wine list reasonable. We also had breakfast in here in the morning and experienced similar service and good food. No complaints from us in this regard. Unusually the pool and gym is on the 27th floor and our curiosity got the better of us to have a look at these facilities, Although we didnâ€™t really have the time to use them they both appeared to be modern and were reasonably busy at the time we visited - the pool is not very large. There is a bar on this level too however we didn't use it because we hadnâ€™t realised the previous nght that it existed - we only stayed for the one night. The hotel location is convenient for shopping however is located quite a distance from the CN Tower and harbour. Fortunately it is not far to the subway at College or Dundas and you can get down to Union station in a few minutes or alternatively a half hour or so if you stroll through the streets. A Day ticket on the subway is cheap. Surprisingly there are a few â€œadultâ€� entertainment places in the vicinity of the hotel which a previous TA member has commented upon to place those with children on guard possibly for awkward questions! Sadly my wife wouldnâ€™t let me visit them - even for research purposes! Overall we were happy enough with our short stay and would recommend the hotel based on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachboybill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Delta Chelsea for 4 nights in Sept, found no fault at all with this hotel. very central, Young St just around the corner wth all shops, theatres, eateries of all descriptions on the doorstep. the Delta is very busy but staff we encounterd wre very helpful, we had morning coffee in the Market Garden which was good (a mug of coffee and large muffin, cooked in font of you, was good way to start our travels. Our room was very comfy, 2 large beds,tv,coffee maker, free morning paper, wash room was a bit on small side but ok. room was spotless and cleaned every day. balcony gave view of garden across Gerrard St. Din not eat in Delta but many restuarants very close to hotel we had a great stay at Delta Chelsea and would go back anytime

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea- loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bruinsgrrl
Reviews.Content: For a family trip this past July we booked two rooms at the Delta Chelsea. We booked the rooms through Priceline & were very happy with the price we paid. Some of the reviews had us worried since we were traveling with parents but we were all pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a busy part of the city near Eaton Centre. We were in the city for the Hockey Hall of Fame & found the walk easy but the hotel is also close to subway stations. There are a couple of restraunts in the hotel itself but we didn't eat there. We did find a great pub right around the corner that we stopped in to eat & later on for a few drinks. Check-in was a bit hectic but not slow, we were told our rooms weren't ready but they would upgrade us to some that were. The room was very clean, comfortable, & had a small balcony with a beautiful city view which we loved. My father was the only one that managed to get to the Deck 27 area & was impressed by the view of the CN Tower. We were traveling with two teenaged boys who were looking forward to the pool/arcade area & were highly disappointed to find they were too young for the adult pool & too big for the children's area.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed”
Reviews.Author: almarob
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the Delta Chelsea (especially having read some of the reviews before we left!). Check in was swift and uncomplicated. The room was large (on the 12th floor), very clean and well appointed. Best of all it was quiet. The location is excellent - especially if you like shopping. We had breakfast in the Market Place and once you had pinpointed where everything was, it was good. We would recommend the 'Hop on Hop off' buses for a trip round Toronto and of course a visit to the Niagara Falls is essential.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Tobesk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights at the Delta Chelsea and overall were impressed with the hotel. It has an excellent location, right in the centre of things with the Eaton Centre just up the road and 2 TTC subway stations nearby. The hotel is massive, it has 4 entrances and there are 3 different banks of lifts to service all the rooms. Check in time can be quite chaotic due to the large quantities of guests but the long line always seemed to move quickly. One way to avoid this is to sign up for the free Delta Privilege scheme (thanks to the other reviewer on here that recommended this). This gives you a separate reception area (never saw a queue here) and other benefits such as a 6 p.m. check out. The hotel facilities were good, a kids pool area (which we didn't visit) and an adults only spa area called Deck 27 with a pool, spa (this was hot but there were no bubbles) and fitness equipment. There are a number of restaurants including the Market Place which is self service where we found the quality of food good and the prices comparable for a city centre for dinner although sandwiches seemed expensive and we weren't that impressed with breakfast. We stayed in a deluxe room which was spacious, well equipped and maintained and always clean. The only problem we had with the room was the temperature, we couldn't make it feel cool using the climate control (which was very old). However, the only time we really felt the room to be hot was when walking in from the air conditioned corridor otherwise it was quite comfortable. We did have doors that opened onto a balcony with city views so these could have been opened if the heat had become a problem. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would make this hotel our first choice if visiting Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MallyBeckenham
Reviews.Content: When we opened the door to our room we were shocked at how bad it was considering the star rating of the hotel and cost. The room was dark, dingy, carpets old and stained, seriously needed renovation and repair. The bathroom was horrible, the shower looked so old and dirty, the tiles seriously needed cleaning and/or replacing. Generally, this was not a pleasent or luxurious room by any stretch of the imagination! I had to call housekeeping as the bath had no plug stopper so it couldn't be used! The 2nd room we had (we took a break to Niagara half way through our trip and were rechecked into a different room) the bathroom had a plug stopper that didn't fit and again the room was as gloomy depressing and dirty. Although we did not intend spending any great length of time in our room we still didn't want one this bad! We ate only once in the hotel (Market Garden) as were starving and wanted sandwiches on arrival. The food was seriously overpriced and so we never used any restaurants again. Other bad points: The queues at check in desk long, the housekeeper knocking at 08:00 (both times) on departure, despite check out time being 11:00am.... in fact the last time we checked out the housekeeper actually walked in without knocking at 08:00. During our first stay my partner left his debit card in a drawer. The housekeeper handed it into lost and found and despite it having his name on it and the hotel being able to match it to our details and information, no attempt was made to tell us this had been found even when we checked back in (when we realised it was missing). From a tourist perspective we didn't even find the location great, it was a bit of a walk from the harbour, CN tower and major attractions. We didn't mind walking but there were plenty of better located hotels. A few positives - the gym was well equipped and modern and the swimming pool great. The view from the roof was also good. It was also nice to have a newspaper delivered each morning free of charge to all rooms. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea Hotel Toronto, a Good experience”
Reviews.Author: BulldogGdansk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 10 days in September 2008, due to attending a family wedding. To be honest, I had read some quite disparaging reviews of this hotel before I went to Toronto. I found the hotel to be excellent. The staff could not have been more polite and helpful. The location of the hotel is in the city centre and within for the reasonably fit, easy walking distance of every part of the city. I asked the concierge staff for directions to a location outside the city and they not only called a taxi for me but downloaded and printed off a Google map of the location and directions from the hotel, walked with me to the Bay Street entrance and handed the directions to the driver. All in all a very good experience and if staying in Toronto, I would recommend his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I got it for a deal”
Reviews.Author: MelWtravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in August 2008. I have to admit that the hotel is huge and offers alot of ammenities to clients but there might be too many things that make it confusing (ie: color-coded elevators depending on your floor). Check in was fast and the clerk was quite friendly, let me check in eventhough i was a couple hours before check in time. The room was nice and clean but definately not for the price. I was very glad that I was able to get this at half the price of friends of mine who also stayed here. My biggest complaint would have to be how thin the walls are. We were kept up most of the night by a family next door. They didn't even seem to be yelling but we could clearly hear them through the walls. The food at the "cafeteria" restaurant isn't the best either, and for the price you're better to go out to a restaurant. We had drinks at night at the pub as well and the service was so slow, it took forever to get our orders! I think that it's a nice hotel but overpriced for what you get. Oh, yeah, and parking is an extra $25.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute WORST experience”
Reviews.Author: Moopoint
Reviews.Content: Check in was frantic, not sure what was happening in the area that caused the long line at registration or why the lobby was packed full of people, but front desk staff were nice enough. Then I got to the room. Apparently they don't tell you at check in if you have one of their 'older' rooms that have not been renovated. The room had stained carpeting, stained mattress, stained and ripped striped wallpaper, no internet connection (I was here on business!!) The headboard was broken, lamps were crooked on the wall, windows also had smears of undetermined origin. The bathroom? Cracked tile, dirty grout, drain plugs attached by chains (do they even make those anymore?) I called the front desk and they offered me a free breakfast for my trouble - well, duh, if the room was any indication of the food around here, forget it. No other rooms available, no other room in the area. I was too late to check out without being charged but I only stayed one night - so not worth 250.00 a night, what a miserable pit of a room. I will certainly never stay here again, and I will warn anyone in my company that may have business in Toronto to stay far far far away from the Delta Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel clean, staff efficient and in excellent position”
Reviews.Author: jonathang
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here from Sept 13 to 19th on our first visit to Canada. I can only praise this hotel - it has plenty of amenities, its clean, the staff are friendly and efficient and its in great position. Our only gripe would be that the hotel food is expensive - but you can't have everything. Overall this is very good value, and I would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in this vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Extratraveltocome
Reviews.Content: Our check in was fine and after telling of our last hotel bad experience were promised an upgrade. If what we got was an upgrade I would hate to see what we were suppose to get. We requested a bar fridge to be brought up, which we are still waiting for. The room was average and because of the size of the hotel it nearly required a packed lunch to get to and from the lobby. We and I know other guests we spoke to found the elevator system rather confusing. For what we paid I believe we could of found a room with a bit more size and comfort. I think we paid for the name and location which was quite handy to shopping and the city. The bistro restaurant was convenient and priced well enough even though it was quite crowded with "locals". Parking was convenient enough and easy to get onto the major highways. For any travellers needing to do laundry it was a little inconvenient finding (one staff member didn't even know they had one!). The travel desk staff only seemed to know about all the major spots and had trouble answering questions about anything a little out of the ordinary. Overall the hotel was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bex_K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in september, and found this a great hotel, it is also massive. Reception moved quickly and the staff were all extremely helpful. The room was a good size, with 2 double beds and a balcony. bathroom was clean, if a little small. we used the hotel as a base to explore Toronto, it is on the corner of Younge and Gerrard Streets, so is at the top end of the shopping district, and is about a 1/2 hour walk from the CN Tower and 5 minutes from the Eaton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great stat at the Delta Chelsea!”
Reviews.Author: Surby_Girl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first trip to Canada staying at the Delta Chelsea for five nights. I was a little nervous about the hotel due to the mixed reviews but I got a great rate through Lastminute/Travelocity so I decided to take the plunge. I did pay a little extra f(Â£35) to upgrade to a premium room on booking as many of the negative comments on Trip Advisor related to the "dated" standard rooms. I arrived at the hotel exhausted following a delayed 7 hour flight from LHR and received an efficient and friendly welcome from the front desk staff - as an extra bonus, they gave me a free upgrade to a deluxe room (955). Overall I found the hotel to be very good; the room was comfortable (although the bathroom was showing signs of wear) and housekeeping did an efficient job. The hotel is HUGE and the lobby was always extremely hectic although I never had to wait long to speak to any of the friendly and enthusiastic staff. The food in the Market Garden is over-priced - particularly when you bear in mind the vast choice of excellent restaurants nearby. I also don't understand why Deck 27 isn't open in the evenings or for breakfast at weekends as the view is fantastic and I am sure it would be popular. The location of the hotel is second to none; it is convenient for all of the main attractions and close to public transport links if you want to go further afield. In summary, this is a great tourist or business hotel - it isn't luxurious but is of a good standard and extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A Fancy Family Friendly Chain”
Reviews.Author: darkpluvial
Reviews.Content: When going to a concert in Toronto we decided to stay in the Delta Chelsea, located very centrally in the downtown. It was a very nice chain hotel with fancy but semi small rooms that had a stylish rich look to them. Nothing to special about the rooms besides the fact that they were of a modern elegance and the room had a balcony. They forgot our bathrobes though and even when we asked for them to be sent up, were not sent up until we asked the second time, but whatever their busy. Its quite a large hotel and very geared towards families. It was a little on the expensive side though and the restaurants and room service are also pricey. We actually ordered room service and found it very weird that the man delivering our food walked right into our room, when I was half naked and covered with a towel and proceeded to put the food on the table and come over and be paid. We did not like that... very strange. Great rooftop pool though and hot tub that overlooks the city. Very lovely. They also have a kids play pool area with a waterslide. Overall a good stay, liked the balcony a lot but it is a little on the expensive side, the rooms should be bigger to compensate. Might go there one day again with kids but theres better hotels for better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: smileymiley77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a three night stay here last month booked via priceline. We got a room for $80 a night which we thought was really reasonable, especially that the room rate on the back of the door was for $580 a night!
