Had we paid $580 a night, we may have been disappointed as the room and the bathroom were a touch small, but seeing as we didn't spend that mush time there it didn't matter. The location is great, check in was straight forward and although there was a queue, it moved quickly. The pool and gym facilities were great and the concierge was very helpful whenever we had any queries. The only bad experience we had was with room service. We ordered breakfast to save time one morning. We found it to be exceedingly over priced ($27 including service fee and gratuity) for the quality and amount of food provided. Other than that, we had a great stay there.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME location - maybe 3 star, not 4 by a long shot - good value”
Reviews.Author: lovelofi
Reviews.Content: No luxury in the room we had [#1436], but it was exactly what I expected from the reviews read here. Room was small, but functional. The room was also pretty close to the staff area that did the rooms in the morning, and the hotel was certainly lacking that "soundproof" quality of the newer hotels. The bathroom was a bit shabby, but not gross. Decent (citrus-smelling) toiletries were a plus. Got a superb deal on priceline (about $239 USD total for Friday, 9/5/08, AND Saturday, 9/6/08, nights), so I don't deserve to have any huge complaints. Huge plus = Close to Younge/Dundas square -- you feel right "in the action" just steps away from the hotel. PARKING = DO find the Public parking garage off of Elm -- it cost us $39 from Friday at 1pm to Sunday at 6pm, rather than the $28+ per day at the Chelsea. FOOD = LOVED the Salad King restaurant right around the corner, just off Younge, near Ryerson Univ., for yummy inexpensive Thai eats --- do not miss!! We visited many of the bars within walking distance of the hotel -- nothing sticks out as extremely cool. FAV experience = checking out the St. Lawrence Market on Saturday morning - HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Also, if you don't want to spend top dollar on drinks or dinner at the top floor restaurant in the hotel...try to snag a sunset soak in the hot tub at the adult pool (or just go up to snag a view) on the 26th floor...totally worth it! Check in sorta sucked....very long line, but moved ok. The lobby is super busy --- like a Vegas hotel, but...I think there's like 1500+ rooms, so that's probably normal. Another bonus = subway stop SUPER close to the hotel...a $9 ticket (for a couple or a family) will get you around the entire city on the subway, buses and trolleys for a whole day - it's awesome!

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: awaintroob
Reviews.Content: My husband, 12-year-old son and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Delta Chelsea. It's well located in downtown Toronto, convenient to shopping and public transportation. It's brilliantly designed for the traveler. The rooms are very quiet with excellent light-blocking curtains. The beds and pillows are very new and very comfortable. It's got a lot of nice touches for the tiired traveler--the up-scale cafeteria in the lobby is a very easy place to get breakfast, lunch or dinner--you can eat there, or take the food to your room if you want to eat in without bothering with room service. The rooms are quiet and the bathrooms are roomy and well equipped. My son loved the water slide. All in all an excellent choice for Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, but horribly run down and unclean”
Reviews.Author: Stunt_Girl
Reviews.Content: Our room was significantly smaller than regular hotel standard size. I was surprised by all the stains in the carpet; the carpet was so worn out and threadbare that I actually got stabbed 5 times by the nails in the floorboards UNDER the carpet. The headboard of the bed had imprints on it---I don't want to know what made the grease/sweat/skin-oil imprints, but I didn't enjoy having to clean them off myself. The 'balcony' (no access) was full of pigeon poop and cigarette butts. I know that there is no more access, but excessive amounts of poop and cigarettes are still disgusting. The are no temperature controls in the room. There is a set of ancient controls that don't work, but the air conditioning was so strong that I had to use a floor heater to counteract the cold. I love air conditioning, but 20 degrees Celsius is pretty cold, especially at night. The bathroom fixtures were ancient, probably installed in the '70s. All of this is okay for a 3 star hotel in a shabby part of town with a price to match, but I was very surprised that such a cramped, dirty, run-down room was under the Delta name and under a 4 star Delta rate. The only redeeming factor was its location, which is on Yonge and Gerrard, close to the Eaton Centre and many attractions. If you book this hotel, do it only for the location....just be prepared to pay a downtown hotel price for a terrible room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: newfie_262002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Cheslea last week from august 25-30 and got to say it was fantastic. the check in was excellent, fast and the young desk clerk that helped us was fantastic. the hotel has two pools, one fun pool (mainly for kids) that has the water slide, which is on the second floor and the other pool is for over the age of 19 on the 27th floor, it also has a gym there (if you want a gym that is...lol) We booked through the website back in may, well at least i got the price from the website but then called the 1-800 number and gave them the discount code and they gave me the room at the rate that was advertised online, which was $135.00 per night, we booked a priemier room But at the end of july i called the hotel directly to comfirm our reservations and they gave me a complementry upgrade to a deluxe room, and gave me all kinds of tips on where to get our canada's wonderland tickets and dirty dancing tickets they were great. Our room was great, great view.... i don't know what the priemier room was like, but i know i was extremely happy with our room... The only thing i wasnt happy about was the internet connection fee $11.95 per day... (( we left the laptop at home becasue i didn't want to pay that everyday, but remember there are ways to get around that, ALOT of people did bring their laptops and used them down in the lobby or the market place resturant for FREE... they do have a business centre with 4 computers there if you need a computer, it's $6.00 for 15 mins or $10.00 for half hour... but because i left mind home, i went and got a $5.00 calling card at the little gift store by the yonge street entrance and that gave me 90 mins of talk time and that lasted us all week... The Delta Cheslea has 2 bars, and 3 resturants (that we seen) the marketplace resturant is like a cafeteria style setting, where you get what you want to eat then head to the cashier ((alot of people seem to be using this but it was EXPENSIVE... 600ml bottle of coke it was $2.94... crazy)) the other resturant/bar that we did eat at was in the main lobby next to the business centre, they don't have a big selection but things like (clubhouse, nachos, wings, soups, salads, chicken tenders, and a few more bar type ideas..... there are tons of resturants just outside the hotel whether it's fast food or sit down resturants that your looking for... Right across the street on Gerrard Street there is a college square and that has a dominion store, 2 tim horton's, a richtree, kentucky fried chicken, and taco bell.... I hope this helps you all in deciding whether to go to the Delta Cheslea or not... I would go back in a heartbeat...

Reviews.Title: “Good for Kids and convenience”
Reviews.Author: njkvr
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 young children) stayed for 2 nights in a standard double/double. First time in Toronto so no prior experience in this market with which to compare our experience. Positives: (1) Market Cafe (large cafeteria style eatery open all day) made it easy to keep kids / adults fed with little fuss on any schedule - a great feature for a family on vacation. (2) Location: easy 2 block walk to subway and hence just a few minutes to all downtown and waterfront attractions; also, the immediate neighborhood ha s alot going on (shopping at massive Eaton Center is 2 blocks away, Maple Leaf Gardens around the corner for hockey season and neighboring Elm Street has some very nice neighborhood scale restaurants and pubs; (3) kid play area -- crowded, but game room and pool with water slide made it more fun than the norm for our kids. Things you might not like: (1) rooms are small, but they don't try to hide that as the online reservation interface gave us the square footage - still, if you like to spend any awake time in the room, it can be cramped; (2) check-in -- we luckily had no issue, but several times during our stay, I observed long lines at registration; (3) parking garage is a challenge (small, cramped and hard to navigate), but it is a downtown location after all; (4) large hotel, so it has feel of staying amidst a convention - if you don't deal well with large, bustling crowds- there are probably better options in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to any families traveling”
Reviews.Author: prospectgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and although the lobby is constantly busy there is not much of a wait. We took our kids (5 & 9) to the indoor pool/waterslide and they loved it. There were children of all ages using it and enjoying it. In the market garden restaurant children under 5 ate for free as long as the adult they were with paid a certain amount (10 dollars). It is a busy neighborhood but is in the center of it all. The rooms were nice the beds comfortable but was just a double. I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone staying with their family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing family pool area”
Reviews.Author: Peetabeera
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights Aug. 18 and 19th. It is in an excellent location and we found it to be very family friendly. We were, however, disappointed with a few things. We stayed in a Deluxe Room - tastefully decorated with newer furnishings and comfortable beds and pillows. The beds have duvets which is nice - but they do not have duvet covers on them. A plain white flat sheet is placed under the duvet and on top of the duvet - leaving the duvet itself exposed when the sheets move around. I can't imagine the duvets are washed after every guest so we found this to be a little off-putting. Although the room itself was clearly renovated and updated, as was the sink and shelving area in the bathroom, it appeared that the tub and shower area were in their original form. The grout around the tile was dirty, there was thick and poorly applied caulking around the tap adn tub, and the slip guards in the tub were dirty. The laundry drying cord in the shower was broken. There was a flimsy metal public bathroom-type toilet paper holder attached under the sink cabinet - and as with most public bathrooms, it was easier to take the roll off the holder than to try to make it work. We had requested a fridge and although it was not there upon our arrival, it was brought up to our room immediately when we called down about it. It was was very large and spacious for a bar-type fridge. On the second level there is a large enclosed supervised kids activity area. We just took a quick tour so I can't comment on the childcare or scheduled activities, but it looked well laid-out with lots for the younger set to do. The family pool area was disapppointing. It is very outdated and the pool is about the size of a backyard swimming pool. There are plastic chairs around the pool but getting one is nearly impossible in the evenings when the pool is busy. The evening we were there, the towels had not been replenished so we arrived with nothing and had to go back up to our room to get towels. Beware that there are height and swimming ability requirements for the waterslide. Our 4 year-old was in tears when she learned she was too short for it. Although the hotel advertises the slide extensively, we never saw anything stating the height requirement so were not prepared. The teenagers at the pool seemed to love it. We ate at the pub and the food and service were good. Overall our stay was good and the location can't be beat. The most disppointing thing for us was the pool area but the kids were fine with it and if you don't have kids, you can enjoy the adult pool upstairs which we heard was nicer. We paid $139.00CDN a night through Travelzoo.

Reviews.Title: “regular visitor”
Reviews.Author: fearmÃ³r
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in the Delta a number of times ( 5 - 7 times) in the last year, while in toronto on business and have always found the hotel to deliver as promised. It is important to ask for one of the remodeled rooms as the old stlye are not great. As i travel on my own I rarely need to interact with the staff so I'm not in a position to comment too much on the quality of service, but anytime i've needed something its been done. The location is great and the size of the hotel helps in that there is nearly always another lonely soul in the bar, if you fancy a chat over a beer. The only gripe I have is that the speed of the internet connection in the rooms is terrible, even in the middle of the night ( I try and keep to Irish time). I nearly always end up ringing the support number to get it resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: TheMoose44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found it to be a fantastic hotel. Location is good about 30 yards from Yonge St. and 250 yards from the Eaton Centre. Good restaurants and plenty of shops close by. Excellent for kids, our 9 yr old loved the long twisty slide into the pool and there is a kids room with playstations etc. The hotel's market garden restaurant is reasonably priced, we had breakfast there most days about 8 to 10 dollars for breakfast and 6 dollars for kids with plenty of choice. Rooms were spacious and ours had a balcony which overlooked Yonge St. which was great, and the bed was very comfortable. It's worth trying to get a room overlooking Yonge St or south facing towards downtown and the lake. Overall very good and we would definately stay there again. ps. Join the delta priviedge club on the delta hotels site as you get priority check,late check out and room upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea-Nice Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: lindau
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Delta Chelsea. After reading the mixed reviews, I have to admit I was a little nervous about my choice. However, I found it to be a nice hotel in a great location. Check-in was a breeze, although I have to say I think we beat the rush. We arrived around 1:00 on a Thursday and they had rooms ready for us (even gave us a choice of floors!). We checked in quickly and were out exploring Toronto by 2:00. However, as we got closer to the weekend, the lobby got busier and busier and there always seemed to be a line at check-in. Our room was fineâ€”I booked a â€œdeluxeâ€� with two double beds. The dÃ©cor had definitely been updated and I didnâ€™t find this room to be dark like some other reviews had mentioned. We were on the 17th floor and had a balcony that you could actually step out on and have a little bit of a view. The room and bathroom were clean and housekeeping did a great job. My only complaint was that I had requested a refrigerator with my reservation which I forgot to mention at check-in, so there wasnâ€™t one in the room. I called down and requested one and then we stepped out. When we returned at 10:30 that night, there still was no fridge. I called again and they promised one within half an hour. When it didnâ€™t arrive at bedtime, I called and cancelled it. They apologized, but I basically gave up on getting a fridge. As for the hotel itself, the kids loved the family poolâ€”my 10-year-old daughter went down the waterslide at least 50 times on the first day. It is also supervised and if your child is under 5â€™ tall, they have to take a quick swimming test to go down the slide. It is quite busy and loud (so loud I had a hard time concentrating on my book), but itâ€™s great for the kids. There is a nicer adult pool area on the 26th floor which I checked out but didnâ€™t get to use (sadly). We ate twice in the Marketplace Restaurant (cafeteria style) just for convenience, but itâ€™s a bit overpriced and the food is mediocre. I do want to emphasize that this is a very big, busy hotel. There are lots of families and people there for weddings, business events, etc. The lobby is always bustling. They have an information desk where you can book tours or simply ask directions or for a restaurant recommendation. (Which we did one night and had dinner at the Pickle Barrel on Yonge Street-good food with something for everyone). Parking was not a problemâ€”we left and came back once and had no trouble getting a spot, although the parking garage is a little tricky to maneuver (especially with an SUV), but I believe this is typical of city hotels. There are four separate entrances that take you onto four different streets. A word of warning: if you use the Yonge Street exit, be prepared to pass by some not so family-friendly establishments. While the street itself is fine, (itâ€™s actually a very busy street with lots of shopping and restaurantsâ€”it just has a few older questionable movie houses, etc., that have managed to survive), young children might be asking questions you might not be ready to answer. Your closest subway is Dundas, which is in the Eaton Centre shopping center (about a 10-minute walk). I paid a rate of $175/night (through the hotel website using my AAA membership) and self-parking was $23 with in-and-out privileges. Overall, I think this was a nice hotel thatâ€™s centrally located and great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Larryo
Reviews.Content: a very, very busy place. Nonstop traffic in lobby. Beds very good, location excellent. personnel very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Some highlights, good price, pool and location...but overall just satisfactaory”
Reviews.Author: jewel_leaf
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotwire, which was great as it was only $75/night for a standard room. The room was basic and on the small side. It seemed mostly clean, but one off-putting thing was there was a dead centipede like bug on the floor when we arrived - gross. Luckily no more were seen anyways. eee. The beds were comfortable. The food in the downstairs cafeteria like restaurant seemed overpriced for bland food. A highlight was the random robot thing where you walked in during check out (random and funny) and the top floor pool was nice. As well, it is right near the eaton centre so it is very walkable to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Spurplepink
Reviews.Content: This is a really fantastic hotel. The location is perfect and the staff really go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The hotel is very large and that meant that at busy times the restaurants and lobby were very hectic. Despite this we had a great stay and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea for four nights, in a standard room. The room was clean, comfortable and very nice. The restaurant was more of a cafe type service, where you queue with a tray, select your food and pay the cashier, then sit down. But was very nice and a fair price. The staff were very pleasant, and when we arrived we were given free vouchers for breakfast for each morning. Also included was a free excursion to Niagara Falls, with a Maid Of The Mist trip, Fantastic. The only down side was the underground car park, although we did find a parking space each time we parked, it was cramped and always full. Washing machines are availiable, if you don't have the budget for costly laundry services. Location was great, easy walk to the sights. Nice pool, and games room for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MegsMum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights in June with our 3 year old daughter. The check in was smooth and they even had a little goody bag for a very jet lagged kid. Room had 2 big queen beds, very clean, view is nothing to write home about but then it is in the middle of the city. It was also quiet and comfortable Very convenient restaurant and buffet downstairs - not sure of the dinner, but the breakfast was very good. They also had a kids play room on the 2nd floor which we didn't get around to seeing but apparently there was a even a rabbit the kids could stroke Location wise its was good - we walked past the Eaton centre and around the harbour to Sky Tower etc and it was definitely do'able, expecially as I was 6 months pregnant at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Amazing Location. Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: OttawaDevine
Reviews.Content: I booked a premier room for our family. Check-in was a breeze. Took 5 minutes. Staff very friendly. The room was very clean. Beds ( two doubles) very comfortable. No frills room, just a television. Standard bathroom with hairdryer. Balcony overlooked Younge Street. There is also no microwave or fridge in this room as an FYI for people with babies/ toddlers. But you get what you pay for and all we needed was a place to shower, sleep, watch some t.v. before bed and this room was very adequate for our needs. I never heard a sound at night. Very quiet even though the hotel was close to capacity and it was a weekend. Hotel pool and change rooms very clean. They do have a sauna and jacuzzi. Great indoor slide for the kids ( and big kids) hours of fun . There are also washers and dryers in the change room. They also have a kids room. Children can watch movies, play games, arts and crafts, read books etc. very nice for people with children. Lifeguards are great! Very pleasant,cheerful and attentive. Bellman do an excellent job never waited for a taxi. Concierge desk attentive and helpful. We also had dinner and breakfast at the marketplace restaurant. Food was good, convenient and made to order . There is a cocktail bar at the top of the hotel and a second restaurant which is higher end than the marketplace also on site. I would deffinately go back to The Delta Chelsea for affordability, location and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: birdtown
Reviews.Content: We cruised right through check-in and were given an upgraded room with a separate sitting area and fold-out bed. Our room had been upgraded recently and had a very nice king-sized bed and very nice bathroom. The hotel has plenty of eating establishments inside of it and within walking distance. It is just a few blocks north of Eaton centre and very close to two different subway stops (college park was the one we used). The lobby offers free wireless Internet and the business center staff is very friendly if you need to print anything. They have a separate check-in for airline crew, and I saw several crews come in during the evening. I don't know if that reflects well or poorly on the hotel. Some of the rooms might not be as nice, but our updated room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Visit”
Reviews.Author: luther23
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is in a great location, walk out the door, walk two blocks and your at Dundas Square and Eaton Mall. Our room was very nice, it has been remodeled. We did get an upgrade to a larger room Make sure you get a remodeled room. There's an adult pool on the top floor which is great---quiet! The hotel has a cafeteria-style restaurant open 6am to midnight. Not great food, but convenient. There's a great Chinese/Thai restaurant nearby on Dundas called Spring Rolls. Not very expensive---fresh food, we ate their twice. We also liked RichTree for breakfast, lunch and snacks---the best muffins and desserts. There's one in Eaton Mall and one just north of the hotel on Yonge St in a food court in an office building. And on Saturday and Sunday you can buy a family transit pass for $9---go anywhere on the subway, trolley or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Poor, Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishvoyager
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the beginning of our honeymoon in Canada at this hotel after a very delayed flight from Dublin. No one at the door to help with bags! Reception looked too big and cheap. When we checked in and went up to our 7th floor room, i got a big shock. The room was disgusting! FILTHY!The decor was dated and the walls, carpets , curtains and window, not to mention the bathroom was disgustingly dirty! We were so exhausted that we went to sleep and decided to complain the next morning! We got an upgrade to a better room which was nice but the original room was so dirty that it ruined our impression of the hotel! Not the best way to start a honeymoon! The restaurant is very dated and furniture was cheap and dirty looking. food wasn't good either! However the city of toronto was very enjoyable and the people in Canada are very friendly! Just choose any hotel other than here!

Reviews.Title: “not as expected”
Reviews.Author: naols
Reviews.Content: Advertised as biggest hotel in Canada. Pool shown in brochure is not the pool we visited. Dark ,shabby outdated room . Balcony not accessible and in a disgusting state. Food very basic , restaurants outdated ,shabby outdoor eating area not suitable due to plague of pigeons - not appealing when trying to enjoy food. won,t be back definetly wouldn,t recommend to anyone visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very good aging hotel”
Reviews.Author: WindsorTenor
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Chelsea. Parking under the hotel was convenient (with in and out privileges at no extra charge). Check-In was smooth. We were a bit early and had booked an online special rate. The rooms were not ready but we put our luggage with the Bell Captain, went and had something to eat. When we came back in, the "special" rooms were still not available, so we were upgraded to a "better" room. Other than being on a higher floor, I am not sure what the upgrade really meant. In any case, the room was average size, clean and more than adequate for the two of us. We were traveling with a friend and he was able to check into a room immediately across the hall from us. The room was clean, the toiletries were first class, the towels were fluffy and soft! If there was any down side to this hotel (albeit a very small one), it was the housekeeping staff on our first morning there. She wanted into the room and wanted to know exactly how long it was going to be before we left the room. This was at 9 AM! Overall, a very good experience and an excellent bargain for downtown Toronto, mid week in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift!”
Reviews.Author: lololadi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks in July, while attending a course in Toronto. I initially picked this hotel because it was only one of two in the city with small kitchenettes available. The website must show photographs of some of the few "premier" rooms that have had makeovers, because my room was old, smelled of smokers past (even though it was "non-smoking") and the kitchen was likely from 1970. The things that bothered me the most: 1. Line at check-in/check-out, or for any other needs was ALWAYS at least 15 minutes long. 2. I showed up at 3pm for a normal check-in time, and had to wait around until 5pm for my room to be ready. 3. The staff was never overly friendly, often impatient. 4. My room smelled old, dirty- especially the kitchen. And it was BARELY stocked with the essentials to even prepare a proper meal. 5. The lobby was a zoo, filled with loud families and small children. 6. I requested a late check out and when I returned to my room after 11am that day, my key no longer worked. Hence, had to stand in the LONG line just to get into my room so I could catch my flight. Overall, not impressed. I am glad that I was away most of the day so that I didn't have to hang out in my room. If you are into the "Times Square" scene in Toronto- near Eaton Centre, then yes, it's a good location. For me, the area was dirty, loud, and even the park across the street was sketchy. I don't recommend walking through it alone at night! I would not stay here again, and would not recommend it to anyone. Next time I'll try one of the other top 39 hotels!

Reviews.Title: “great room and location”
Reviews.Author: Mich_AuburnHills
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice standard room at a great rate. It was clean and comfortable and cozy. There were no problems in the room and the beds were comfy. I was a little worried from some of the other reviews but quickly found out that this was going to be a great stay. Even the hallways were clean, bright and cheery with carpet that looked new. The elevators worked quickly and the food serviced down below does the job. Don't miss the pool on the 27th floor. It was clean and fresh and the hottub was hot! And the view was breathtaking looking over the city. As a bonus, my room faced Gerard street allowing me a birds eye view of the pride parade without having to ever leave the room and join the crowds. Now that was a bonus. I say thumbs up, Delta!

Reviews.Title: “Dated Rooms but Top Location”
Reviews.Author: Jason670
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Delta Chelsea for one night. Check-in line is typically long, day or night, so allow extra time. Lobby and restaurants/lounge are spacious and easy to navigate. Second Cup cafe and plenty of food options for those dining in the hotel. Room was old, dreary, and in need of a renovation. Luckily is was not moldy or musty. Do not expect luxury pillows or duvets or carpeting. Each of these three are below par. We received two pillows total on a double bed, and all that I would expect is two per person. Oh well. Television and radio in room, although old, work just fine. Bed comfortable enough but definitely not the Hilton or Marriott. Pool/waterslide/hot tub excellent. Two pools to choose from. Amenities plentiful and open late hours. Location of hotel could not be better. Two blocks from two different subway stations and less than 5 minutes from City Hall and Eaton Centre. Everything is within walk; no taxis required. Location and pools sold me on this hotel. Would not return to Delta Chelsea if price exceeds $125 CAD/peak season. For this price, there are better hotels in downtown. We paid $90 on Hotwire which is great but is not worth the excessively long wait times at check in-out and poor quality of rooms. Expect a 3-star property at best, not a 4 star, period.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back.”
Reviews.Author: janiel
Reviews.Content: I felt I was in "the Bank" when we arrived to check in. It was very military style. The room we got must have been one of the cheap rooms. The pool smelled of mill dew but I think I was the only one that could smell it as all the other guest seemed to be having a great time. We had stayed in Intercontinental , Yorkville, Toronto at the beginning of our vacation and I wished we'd went back there ( What luxury). I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the City”
Reviews.Author: eliteunit1
Reviews.Content: I met 3 friends in Toronto for the Hockey Hall of fame weekend and we stayed at the Delta Chelsea for a long weekend. (Fri-Mon) This hotel was amazing. The staff was very accomadating and the rooms were very nice. I stayed in an upgraded room which had an entrance foyer, a seperate living room area and bedroom area. The view was spectacular. I could see out over the city, and at night when everything was lit up, was very nice. The city subway system was right at the corner so we didnt have far to walk to get the subway. The hotel is centrally located in aspect to the cities attractions which was nice and not to far from Yorkville (Toronto's Beverly Hills) which has some good restaurants. There are 2 bars and 3 restaurants in the hotel which were very good, food wise and service wise. The only reason I gave the rating of 4 stars instead of 5 was because the food was a bit expensive and certain areas of the hotel could use an upgrade due to the building being older. Other than that, it was near perfection.

Reviews.Title: “A good base when visiting Toronto”
Reviews.Author: AGW26
Reviews.Content: My experience with the Delta Chelsea started before we even arrived at the hotel. I contacted them to arrange a birthday cake for my husband to be delivered during our stay. They were exceptionally helpful and efficient. The hotel itself is massive, there are (I believe) 3 exits onto different streets so you really need to plan your route before you leave the hotel. We had an upgraded room, it wasn't as nice as I had expected, it was quite small and there was no plasma, which I believe was something the upgraded rooms were supposed to have. The bathroom was quite basic as well. I heard that the non upgraded rooms within the hotel weren't as nice - so be warned. There is no safe in the room, but there is a safety deposit box room, that is manned by hotel staff. We never had trouble gaining access as and when required and it actually felt safer than leaving it in your room. We never actually ate in the hotel, neither the a la carte restaurant or the family restaurant looked that appealing. Although the family restaurant was good for picking up food and coffee to go. The pub in the hotel was really good - the staff were so social and welcoming. The leisure facilities were limited. They looked nicer in the picture on the website. The main word to describe is 'small' There are loungers by the pool, but it wasn't as relaxing a place as it could have been, But it was for adults only, so that did help. The gym was well equipped. Due to it being such a large hotel, it can often feel slightly faceless, but there was still plenty of staff around should we have needed them The hotel is in a great location for downtown. The CN Tower and islands were only a subway ride away. The Eaton centre was about 10 minutes walk away. It's only an hour and 30 minutes drive from Niagra. If we were to return to Toronto, I would have no issue with staying at the Delta Chelsea again, provided it was in one of the upgraded rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff but Standard Rooms Need Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousTravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: Was booked at the Delta Chelsea in connection with a conference, and stayed for three nights in a standard room. The carpet had crumbs on the floor, the bedding was tired, and the sink was stained and had an aged rubber stopper. As a result, the room did not feel clean and fresh. On the more positive side, the staff was extremely kind and helpful, the business center was excellent, my room was a good size, and I enjoyed some of the excellent restaurants nearby (try Adega, a gem of a Portuguese restaurant). No doubt there are better hotels in Toronto, but the Delta Chelsea is adequate if you book in a standard room. I suspect that the experience is better if you book in a better class of rooms. Kudos to the Delta group in training staff to be especially helpful and courteous-- I was truly impressed by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TX_Flyer001
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, in the heart of the city Clean, nice staff, good location Needs updating on a few things, ie rooms, fitness center

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chilleruk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Delta from April 26th to May 3rd. We booked a premier room and we were upgraded on arrival to a deluxe room. The room had two double beds, so we thought terrific but we found out that an american double is a queen bed in the UK. The bed was really comfy, the room was spotlessly clean and well maintained. The facilities were good in the hotel but a bit pricey. In the evenings in Monarchs bar they insist on serving you at your table that could mean quite a wait between drinks. The self service restaurant wasn't the best. Overall the hotel was excellent, just on the edge of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: ASMITH
Reviews.Content: My husband, three children (ages 5, 6 & 8) and I spent three evenings at the Delta Chelsea in Toronto, and now it has become our hotel of choice whenever we visit Toronto in the future. The hotel staff was unbelievably friendly, professional and attentive. Everyone was always smiling, which is exactly what you want to see when you are on vacation. The kids were greeted at their own check-in service and received a gift bag that they busied themselves with in the room. We ate every breakfast and lunch at the Market Cafe inside the hotel and the food was fresh and delicious. Not to mention that our two youngest ate for free and our oldest ate for half price. The family pool, slide, arcade and kid's activity room were a huge hit with our family. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. To top it all off, we were able to walk to many places since the location is in the heart of Toronto. My thanks to Jonathan and the entire staff at the Delta Chelsea for making our vacation so wonderful. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm pretty easy going, but...”
Reviews.Author: matt811
Reviews.Content: So I booked my stay a while ago and I read all the reviews on TripAdvisor and I thought I would try it. Just so you know, I booked a standard room with a queen size bed for three nights and I got a good deal for the location. At first glance the room seemed good enough. I had read a review about dirty glasses, so I decided to check them and sure enough they were dirty. I figured I would just call the front desk and get new ones. So we went to bed that night and had a horrible sleep. The bed was rock hard. I know some people like it that way and I figured for the price I paid it was no biggie. However, once I found a long black hair on one of the towels and a "questionable" stain on the head board I had enough. In the bathroom it says on a plaque that if ONE thing is not up to par then you get your first night free. I honestly would have been happy if someone had just cleaned the stain and replaced the towel and glasses. Oh, and gotten that night free too. So I went to the front desk and they were nice enough to upgrade us to a deluxe room. After that, things were golden! So if you plan on staying here, and just get the standard room, expect a hard bed and maybe other things. If you do get a deal and have the option to upgrade, I suggest that you do. At least to one of the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Leicester_Travel_Bug
Reviews.Content: Pulling up the hotel we were greeted by fairy lights in the trees, very friendly door staff and welcoming reception. The hotel is in a superb location just off Yonge Street and extremely convenient. The hotel has excellent facilities and our room was everything we could ask for. Highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “ideal city location”
Reviews.Author: wackywolves
Reviews.Content: Date 04.04.2008 Just arrived back from Toronto, stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 4 nights, great location-central to everything worth seeing. Room was good, staff very friendly and helpful, plenty of options for eating both for families & couples. Would recommend this hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel - Reccomended for all!”
Reviews.Author: mitchell916
Reviews.Content: This was another accommodation I booked via Priceline so as was the case with previous Priceline bookings I was eagerly anticipating what I was in for as I had no prior research on the place. The Delta Chelsea is a solid hotel which looks good from the inside and is complimented with great customer service and very good pool and gym facilities. The downstairs restaurant offers a salad buffet and a dinner buffet, both of which were reasonably priced for a hotel which are both good to eat in. The rooms were fine, clean and secure with the usual amenities - Cable TV (with Setanta Sports), iron board & iron, coffee maker etc. I was here for only two days so I canâ€™t tell you much more than that but from the experience I had it showed itself to be a trustworthy establishment in downtown Toronto that I would go with again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Great Food, Beautiful Location!”
Reviews.Author: culltenn
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is a beautiful hotel with excellent customer service. The hotel offers several options for dining, including a buffet, a fine dining restaurant, and a "Deck 27" on the 27th floor offering a panoramic view of Toronto's skyline. The rooms are large and accommodating and well cleaned. The front desk employees offer great assistance in choosing local attractions and discounts for many of them. The hotel is located perfectly in the midst of several authentic restaurants. Whether you are looking for authentic Chinese, authentic Italian, or and authentic Irish Pub, you only have a short walk to any. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Toronto area.

Reviews.Title: “Great once we changed rooms”
Reviews.Author: annejumps
Reviews.Content: My Orbitz.com reservation was for a Delta Room, and on our first night, that's the room type we had (it's the cheapest of the room types). I was not terribly pleased with the room -- it was small, dingy, and not too well appointed -- but figured we'd make do. However, that night, I was awakened through the paper-thin walls by noisy people in the hallway attending a party a few doors down. Long story short, two and a half hours and three calls to the front desk later (after three visits from security), the noisy folks finally stopped. I also had a message on our room phone saying we'd be upgraded to a quieter room. We were moved to a Deluxe the next day on the other side of the hotel, and it was larger, cleaner, newer, and much quieter. The staff was great, the location was great, and this new room was great and much better value for what I was spending.

Reviews.Title: “A slightly tattered lady”
Reviews.Author: bksrmgc
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is a hotel that really needs a revamp. I arrived about 10 p.m. with a large rolling suitcase and a rolling computer bag. They did not have a anyone out front and their revolving door was too small, so I got stuck and it took another nice traveler to help me. Although it was very cold outside, the room was way overheated and the thermostat could not be adjusted. My room had sliding doors that opened onto a small balcony--don't interpret that to mean there was a view as it was the hotel rooftop and a compressor--so I had to sleep with the doors opened some and listen to the compressor all night. The condition of the room was tired, a bit shabby; wallpaper peeling in the corners and the spread had a visible patch.. The one good thing I can say is that the mattress seemed to be new as it was quite comfortable. Fortunately, I was only there one night before moving over to the Sheraton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Carleeqt
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for it's location. It was perfect. I had a doctor appt. at St. Mike's and it was within walking distance to everything. It is one block from Younge Street and close to shopping and hospitals etc. We had a deluxe room that was recently redone. It was very nice and clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathtub area could use some refreshing. They had a wonderful area for kids, although i found the pool/water slide times strange. The times posted for the pool are not necessarily the hours they are open. We were glad we asked, otherwise the kids would have been disappointed. The concierge was excellent and very helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Deanne82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with six of my girlfriends for a girls weekend. We didn't have any issues with this hotel. Clean, good location for shopping, partying, dining, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. No issues.”
Reviews.Author: Winnipeg_Dave
Reviews.Content: Hard to give a complete review of the hotel as we spent the vast majority of our time out and about and didn't use a lot of the facilities. However, a couple comments. 1. The hotel is massive and the check-in line could scare the bejeezus out of anyone. The good news is that the clerks are friendly, efficient, and the line moves quickly. 2. The adult pool and exercise room were good. The view to the downtown is quite nice. We didn't get a chance to use the cocktail lounge on the top floor. 3. The rooms are adequate although a bit cramped. They are the typical set-up for a hotel room but quite tight. A few of the reviews suggest that there are old rooms and new rooms. I don't think we were in a new room (it just didn't seem very new) but it certainly wasn't old and dreary. Everything worked just fine and looked fine. 4. Staff are friendly and helpful. 5. We had great value for our room at $129/night. I'd have no trouble recommending the place.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: AnaesDoc
Reviews.Content: Have been twice to this hotel. Both times had a clean room, and although rooms are not huge, they are an acceptable size. We were with our two kids and they had a blast in the kids play area. They were too young to use the waterslide (a child must be able to swim two widths of the pool because the waterslide 'landing' area is 4'8" deep), but mom and dad made good use of it. Pretty good waterslide, as it is completely black until you pop out the end, making it a pretty disorientating (but fun!) ride. We took advantage of the 'kids eat free' deal, so eating in the marketplace was reasonable. Otherwise we would have been complaining about the prices for food, because we found it to be on the higher side. When the market restaurant is busy they get overwhelmed. Parking at the hotel is $23 CAD per day with unlimited in/out privileges, and then a quick elevator ride into the lobby. If staying at a Delta hotel, it's worthwhile to enroll into their free Privilege program for free local phone calls and late checkout... Would definitely recommend this hotel to others. Not a cheap place, but well-situated and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: Marke18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Delta Chelsea for a City Break and had a really good time. Easy journey from the airport on the airport express (bus) and check in was quick checking us in early and staff had good sense of humour. Very centrally located for shopping at the Eaton Centre, West Chelsea and Yorkville and for all the sights. Plenty of cheap restaurants (Indian, Thai, Chinese and Carribean) within walking distance. Mosley, our chambermaid, was excellent, room was spotless every day, she was always friendly and smiling and offered good advice about Toronto, certainly the cleanest room we have ever had, the best member of staff in the whole hotel cannot recommend her enough.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel for business and service, skip the self service market food”
Reviews.Author: advcardio
Reviews.Content: Opted to book an upgraded room with the signiture bed and slept very well-good beds with clean linens and duvets. Corner room had a view and was quiet . Room service, Front desk, Bellman, Business Centre, all had very professional service and pleasant Stayed for business and used their board rooms with constant good catering service including working quietly around the room during our meetings. The only downside was the expensive -lack of flavour food at their self service market with slow staff, would suggest to anyone to just go outside and find something else. Overall, Solid hotel with good service and beds (upgrade to signature beds). Great for business or pleasure with a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great deal!”
Reviews.Author: boulianne_mel
Reviews.Content: We used the bid option on Price line and only paid 70 dollars for our double occupancy room at the Delta Chelsea. We stayed on the fourteenth floor which we were told was not renovated yet. The room was very nice. You could tell the room was dated but the sheets were nice and clean and the room smelt fresh. This was a non smoking hotel. We had a balcony that overlooked Young Street. The hotel was right near the Air Canada Centre which was of interest to us. In-room dining prices were decent. Overall great deal and a wonderful price!!!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: honestyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea for the last 2 night of our trip and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. We were checked in by lovely helpful staff and went to unpack. On entering our room we noticed it didn't resemble the photo in the brochure so went to ask at reception. They told us that the company we had booked through had booked us into a basic room. (This was lovely but not what we expected) The receptionist told us we could upgrade and when I asked how much it would be he told me that he was doing it as we spoke FREE OF CHARGE. Everything was great, the room, the staff, the pool, we just couldn't find fault. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is central to everything you could want. The staff even kept checking our flight for us as we were having a horrific snow storm the day we were flying home. Stay here it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Bad”
Reviews.Author: familyideals
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some of the bad reviews this hotel has had. We stayed for 3 nights at the start of a Tour and really found little to complain of. They had a laundry for washing, play area with a slide for children and plenty of places to dine. We were met on arrival by a very friendly doorman who made our mothers feel quite special and there was no problem at reception. The rooms were large clean and comfortable. Plenty of places to dine. We looked out onto a park and had our first sight of squirrels. Coming from Australia that was different. The hotel is right beside Younge Street and you get to see what a cosmopolitan city Toronto is. The main shopping is just down the road. I will say the hotel foyer was always busy. No matter what time of the day there seemed to be people checking in and out. Probably the busiest hotel we have stayed in. Only complaint was the very thin walls. We had a group of young noisy tourists next door and had to complain when at 3 o'clock in the morning doors were still being opened and closed constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty! Select another hotel .......Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Spindr77
Reviews.Content: The downtown location and access to the subway is fantastic! Arrived at the Delta. Don't bring a large vehicle (truck or SUV) it won't fit in the car park. However, the Vallet did accomodate us and left our vehicle in the outside area (nice blizzard while we were visiting!). The staff was all very, very friendly and helpful. Our room was very small and I think the beds were 3/4 or doubles? We sleep in a kingsize at home. Most distrubing was the 2 foot smear of blood accross the front of the shower curtain ...... not discovered until the next morning because the curtain was open. GROSS..... Public Health concern anyone? We were promptly moved to a kingsize suite, whatever......... The drinking glasses are not removed from the room to be cleaned. I was mindful of the maid cart (no glasses on it?). Individual plastic glasses were not available. Stayed at other downtown hotels and have had better experiences!

Reviews.Title: “Great summer vacation!”
Reviews.Author: fullermel
Reviews.Content: I really don't know where else you'd stay with younger kids in the downtown core. The kids enjoyed the pool and waterslide, even though it was a little crowded. They also enjoyed the "club" while mom and dad met with some friends at the lobby bar for an hour. They got to play with a rabbit. We enjoyed being close to the theatre district, and to Ontario Place and the CN Tower. We got to Toronto by train, and the Delta Chelsea was only a $6 taxi ride from Union Station. The B2 Bistro for breakfast is a slightly upscale buffet, but the food is quite good and reasonably priced. The Marketplace was very overpriced for a self-serve type restaurant. The room service was also very pricey and not extremely great. We enjoyed the luxurious bedding in the rooms, even though I did find the room a little small. I would definately go back, and made the mistake of staying somewhere else and totally regretted it. The Delta is comfortable and competatively priced for dowtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Most Horrible experience ever”
Reviews.Author: hondu05s
Reviews.Content: We were stolen from in the hotelÂ´Â¨s lobby, my mother'in'law purse was stoled in this hotel while we were on a business trip in Toronto, our passports and money were taken and the hotel still manage to charge us the extra nights we hd to stay do to the problems of oru passports. Please dont waste your money or time!

Reviews.Title: “Quick easy service”
Reviews.Author: DancinPrincess
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night stay in November. The room was nice. The service was fast and pleasant. The parking facilities were good. After my first stay at this hotel I booked it again for another event a few weeks later. This stay was a good experience and I would tell others to give this hotel a try as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, a little worn out”
Reviews.Author: Suzuki267
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in one of the "unrenovated" rooms (Green elevators, 15th floor). I like the fact that they still have balconeys, although the door almost comes off the tracks when opening and closing. Antiquated heater/AC unit can not be put on "fan only" setting. Room was decent but a bit run down - peeling wallpaper, just dim and old looking, but linens were clean, amenities were complete. TV was small and old, no bar fridge but room service booze and food would have been cheap if I'd ordered it. Adult pool lounge was not open, and they seem to avoid opening it. I mean, this was the holiday season, when else are you going to open a lounge? Pool had a ring around it; more regular cleaning is in order. Whirlpool was pleasant, but the seats were too high; to get more immersion you had to move to the middle and sit on your knees. Just an older design; I like that it was tile rather than plastic. Well equipped exercise area with lots of windows, and lots of fresh, clean towels looked inviting, but I was too lazy to work out while there. They B2 Bistro/buffet was okay but nothing special; I'm not a good one to review fancy restaurants because I eat vegan and most places suck in this regard. Another person's scallop dinner looked quite good. Breakfast "marketplace" restaurant was typically overpriced hotel breakfast and the Second Cup coffee was awful; I don't know if the pots need cleaning or what, but it was bitter, but not in the good, roasted too dark way. I went to the bagel spot across Yonge street instead; their coffee was mediocre and bagels were better priced. The bar was reasonable for an afternoon beer. Location is fantastic for exploring Toronto downtown, and outdoor parking in the neighbouring lots is reasonable for Toronto, although one of our party had their car broken into and, inexplicably, nothing stolen except a phone. My car (a Mercedes, which I would think is a bit more of a target than the Honda Civic mentioned above) was untouched. One notable plus about the Delta Chelsea was the staff friendliness; everyone from the desk to the Concierge to the housekeeping staff said Hi when you walked by and made you feel more than welcome. For about a hundred dollars for two per night (some kind of holiday deal) this was very good value; a cleaner pool and better ventilation and I'd say great value.

Reviews.Title: “Quite an experience in the Delta Chelsea Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Sammie4
Reviews.Content: This is a very centrally located hotel & only a few blocks away from Eaton Centre. The Toronto Express coach which can be picked up from Pearson Int aiport stops right outside the hotel - Gerrard Street which is a big plus for travelling to & from this hotel / airport. I had read up on this hotel prior to my reservation but wasnt quite as prepared for the `busy' reception area and the revolving doors that never seemed to stop!. Their restaurant has ample choice for all tastes and the food is of a good standard and quality. I had a corner guestroom which was very spaceous with a nice clean & airy bathroom. The conceirge & information desks were equally busy so be prepared for quite a bit of queuing when staying at this hotel, whether this is for checkin, information, conceirge, paying for breakfast/lunch/dinner etc Overall though, this is a nice hotel with friendly helpful staff who were accommodating & helpful. I would stay at this hotel again when I am next in Toronto as it is conveniently located for family. The only recommendation that I do have for this hotel is to get `more staff' especially in the reception / check in area as the waiting time to get the keys for your room is unacceptable no matter what time you may be checking in!.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: natmicstef
Reviews.Content: Very good value for a downtown hotel...room was comfortable, in good condition and clean. It is a busy hotel, has around 1500 rooms and even at midnight when I checked in there was lots of hustle and bustle. Located five minutes taxi ride away from Eaton Center - walkable but it was freezing! I booked the Toronto Airport Express, on line and the bus stops and picks up right outside the front door of the hotel - was $15.25 one way...a bargain considering a taxi is around CAD$55. It snowed quite heavily the night before and I left on the 6am bus which was at the hotel on time...stops at 4-5 other hotels en route to the airport but we got there on time too. Would definitely stay there again...value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: mcampbell7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Delta Chelsea in Sept. We had a triple room booked. However when we arrived they tried to give us a smaller than average double room. After complaining to the receptionist we were given a large triple room. The rooms themselves are shabby but are clean and warm. Compared to a lot of American hotels in the 3-4 star bracket this hotel is average. We ate in the Market Garden most nights as it was good value and the food was well cooked, so I recommend to try it. If you intend on visiting Niagara Falls as a day trip, book the bus tour through the hotel. We went on the tour that started in the morning. Well worth the money but bring a spare pair of shoes and trousers if you intend to go on Maid of the Mist - we didn't and had soggy feet the whole way home. Location of the hotel is fantastic for Yonge Street and the Eaton Centre. Shopping is OK, its not bad value but the tax applied adds up to about 14%. The CN Tower is worth a trip and though it might be dear its well worth to have your lunch or dinner in the 360 restaurant. If you have a big appetite - try the beef!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average!”
Reviews.Author: anonymous004
Reviews.Content: If this hotel has 4 stars then accommodation standards in Canada are lower than elsewhere! Although clean enough our Delta Room was decidedly shabby & well past its use by date. The bath was cracked, the hand basin was chipped down to the (rusty!) enamel & the carpet was stained & worn. The walls were so thin that you need to hope that you don't get a neighbour who coughs in the night! Let alone one who opens & closes his balcony doors & drums his fingers on the headboard all night!! The staff were decidedly disinterested, if not unhelpful, in particular where we'd booked a tour that wasn't with their preferred supplier- they must be on commission! I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone vising Toronto. An over-priced rip-off!

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: stuart2015
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August 2007 and would have to say that while there are some advantages to this hotel the overall experience was 'average'. Plus points: location was fine; free internet access downstairs; launderette in hotel; cheap self-service restaurant; staff were friendly. Minus points: our 5th floor room was dark and very 'tired' - I believe other rooms have already been refurbished - although it was a reasonable size; hotel has so many rooms that it sometimes felt you were being processed on a conveyor belt system; sometimes the lifts took ages. While I would not choose to stay here again, it would not be the end of the world if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled My Reservation!”
Reviews.Author: mrswhale
Reviews.Content: I wish I could write a review of the hotel, but seeing as how they cancelled my reservation before I could even step foot into the lobby, I can't. I had made a reservation for a trip to celebrate my husband's birthday (concert and a hotel downtown Toronto) for September '05. I booked the room three months in advance. Two days before we were to check in, someone from the Delta Chelsea called me to inform me that they were overbooked and would have to cancel my reservation. Uhhh what?! I work in hotels, I know how it works. I know that hotels overbook (mine doesn't, we feel it's a shady business to do that), but I also know the proper way of handling such overbooking. I would have much rather have preferred to get "walked" at check-in, meaning the hotel would find suitable accommodations for me at THEIR cost. No, instead I was left to fend for myself. Do you know how difficult it is to find a hotel room in the city of Toronto on a weekend where the entire city is apparently sold out? I did eventually find a room somewhere else and had a great time, but I am thoroughly unimpressed with the Delta Chelsea. Oh yeah and a friend of mine from Victoria booked at Delta Whistler and her reservation was also cancelled prior to her trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: iKirsty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea Toronto in 2005, pulling up the the hotel the lobby is gorgeous and made me feel like I was a celeb, it looks so posh. Our room was massive! The staff couldnt have been more helpful, the food was nice but a little expensive, location is perfect for everything! Will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Universal22
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, helpful staff, good location. A variety of places to have a meal or a drink. The main food area has a varied choice and reasonable prices. There is a handy bus service outside the hotel that takes you to the airport. We did not have a choice of this hotel we were part of a tour and this was our hotel but I have no faults with the cleanliness (apart from a little limescale cleaner around the shower would work a treat), of the hotel or the service. The bathroom was very small but we had a large room otherwise. The main shopping areas if thats your interest are very local, there is a large underground connecting area just a few minutes away that goes right down to the lake, very handy if the weather is bad.

Reviews.Title: “great place: great service”
Reviews.Author: amorkuz
Reviews.Content: We got a room there for half-price, $99/night. But I would say, it was worth its full price. It is one of those big respectable hotels, centrally located. The express bus from the airport, Pacific Western Airport Express has a designated stop at this hotel. Big, well lit lobby, rows of check-in windows, three groups of elevators - you get the picture. The staff at check-in was quite helpful. They did not cater to our slightest whims, but they explained clearly what they can do, what they cannot do, which options they have and when each of the rooms will be ready. We opted for a room on a lower floor available immediately. It was a right choice as there is not much difference in terms of a view. As big as the hotel is, it is surrounded by even taller buildings so that we had trouble locating our hotel from the top of CN Tower. The room was big enough, had a coffee-maker with a choice of coffee, decaf, or tea. You get a daily newspaper, Globe or something, which I found unexpectedly interesting. Usually, a newspaper from another city is filled with things totally irrelevant for you. Here I found myself reading 3-4 big articles per issue. A small complaint was the absence of heating in October: they have central heating that was not turned on yet. We decided this problem using an extra blanket from the little closet. The maids seemed to be really thoughtful about what we need in the room. Once we tossed the bed cover in the corner, the next day it was safely put away into the closet. The hotel has a policy: if the room is not cleaned properly, one of the nights is free for your stay. The policy was posted above the toilet for some reason, but it works, we had a chance to check it. It is my conviction that the quality of service is measured not by the absence of problems but the ability to solve problems when they occur. One day I stayed in our hotel room almost all day, till 4pm. I guess that is why our room was not made when we returned in the evening. I went down to complain about it. I asked for a replenishment of tea/coffee and inquired about the one-night free policy. For the latter, the guy had to consult with a supervisor. He returned after 5 minutes confirming that we will only be charged for 3 nights instead of 4. As for the tea, it was brought to us in 15 minutes. That's what I call service. Also visit the gym and the deck on the 27th floor. The deck has some nice views.

Reviews.Title: “DElta Chelsea great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tMCL
Reviews.Content: A Friend and I stayed in the Delta Chelsea for a week in August. The room was excellent and very good value for money considering there was a kitchen attached. Downstairs there is a wide range of excellent food available in the dining areas and its reasonably priced. The location is excellent and near the Eaton centre. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bus to Pearson airport leaves from outside the door. I've stayed here twice and definitely would stay again if I go back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “huge, a bit of a dump frankly”
Reviews.Author: mk14617
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference. My room needed a renovation. Carpets in the hallway (11th floor) were used and grungy. Staff was overwhelmed at check-in-out times (this is Canada's largest hotel, apparently). The health club was tiny for the size of the hotel. Location is superb, but frankly the hotel itself is quite disappointing. Perhaps other wings have been renovated, I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: ben807
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 4 nights at the Delta Chelsea while travelling in Toronto and had a great stay. We booked the hotel on priceline and, for what we paid, were very pleasantly surprised and thought it was a tremendous value (although we wouldn't have necessarily thought so, had we paid face value). The location was excellent for your average tourist, we found the hotel room & lobby to be very nice, and the staff to be very friendly. When we checked-in, we requested a room with a view, and at no extra charge were provided a great room overlooking Dundas Square- they were happy to oblige! Also, we thought the work-out facilities were good and they feature a roof-top desk that provides nice views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Lisa039
Reviews.Content: They are going through refurbishment at the moment and we were unlucky enough not to be in one of the refurbished rooms. That said, it was a perfectly adequate room, if a little oldfashioned. The Marketplace was served decent food at decent prices and room service was very tasty, if a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “So-So...”
Reviews.Author: Westportia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea as a guest of a wedding. Our flight was very late, called the hotel to confirm and arrived at 2 in the morning. The place was absolutely hopping and the lobby is very pretty. We got checked in efficiently, and collapsed into our very comfortable, but small (double) bed. The window shades are excellent, and we didn't awake until 10 am (which is unheard of for me). Our room was clean and adequate. Our 12 yr. old daughter loved the pool and the slide (on the 2nd floor)--and so did a lot of other guests, including adults. I saw video games, etc. on that floor, but we didn't use them. We made the mistake of going to the Bistro for breakfast--the buffet was fine, but $18 Canadian before the tip and taxes (which are completely outrageous). The next day, we went back with the wedding party (on a Sunday). Please be advised, that without an alcoholic beverage, the Sunday brunch starts at $29Can., but with a 15% tip and the taxes, ended up being $40!!! Definitely overpriced. However, the Marketplace (cafeteria style restaurant with lots of choices and lots of seating), was much more reasonable, and fine. The charge for internet access is $11.95 Can. We took a taxi from the airport and that was a flat fee of $46 (plus tip) each way. The service in the room was fine. However, the other reviews are right about some things. The room service remnants of other guests stayed in the hall for an entire day. It seems understaffed for such a huge place. And, in general, the days of Canada being a bargain for Americans are over. I actually plan to submit the paperwork for the VAT tax rebate, (also known as PST, GST) because I spend almost $150 Can in taxes. Yikes.

Reviews.Title: “Overhyped pit”
Reviews.Author: Global_Wanderer52
Reviews.Content: What kind of hotel offers a wedding party a group rate that's MORE expensive than what an individual can get for herself? That was the start of this disaster. Then there are: --the noisy, dirty, dilapidated rooms (mine was on the 6th floor overlooking Gerrard St.--would have loved to go out amid the pigeon poop on the balcony, but the sliding door was NAILED shut with a block of wood) --cruddy service (the maid didn't come 'til 5:30 pm, trays of food outside doors for >1 day, and the line at the check-in desk was always 15-20 people deep) --waiting in long lines for everything, BAD design on the parking (outgoing cars are forced to wait for incoming vehicles) --above all, the expense. You can easily find a TRUE 4-star hotel for probably 60% of the price of the Delta Chelsea. Seriously. I do a lot of traveling, and this hotel sucks. And I never use that word. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere in the Middle”
Reviews.Author: ifyouaskme
Reviews.Content: It's exactly what you'd expect- a gigantic, ridiculously busy convention hotel with a staff that means well but generally seem a little overwhelmed at peak periods. That said, you can't beat the location and many (though not all) rooms have been given a bit of a clean-up with new beds and slightly better bath products (June Jacobs- never heard of them but they smell nice). Plan for extra time in line if checking in or out during peak periods. The breakfast buffet area is actually quite nice. The chocolate croissants fresh from the oven were delicious, and the Second Cup coffee area was very convenient. But this is Toronto- a great overlooked big city. If you get a good rate, it's a great place to park it for a few days, but don't choose it if you plan on spending too much time in the room. I would imagine families would enjoy the family fun zone and waterslide in the winter. There is also a separate adult pool and workout area which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Down at Heel Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Dexbro
Reviews.Content: Booked the Delta Chelsea through Globespan in Scotland. Was shown as a four star hotel but as they say 'don't judge a book by it's cover'. The outside and the lobby area were okay but beyond that much of the hotel barely should have qualified for three stars. We were allocated a room of the ninth floor and on opening the door immediately smelt the stale cigarette smoke. The room decor was stuck somewhere in the 1980's and was in need of a complete makeover. Peeling paper, stained carpets, yellowing paintwork, cracked tiles and a disgusting balcony littered with cigarette ends despite the hotel being non-smoking. The room had an adjoining door to the next room through which could be heard every word of the occupants and they also smoked in the room with the smell drifting through to our room. Complaining to reception we were assured this would be dealt with but nothing changed. The corridors I saw were tired and in need of redecoration and the breakfast restaurant was similar to a school canteen with the addition of being overpriced. I would not recommend the Delta Chelsea unless they made considerable improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Great loccation!”
Reviews.Author: sylvie.mac
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed here. For this occasion we got a good rate through the hotel, but we decided to get an upgraded room for an additional $ 20.00. For this room we got a balcony facing Younge Street, a slightly bigger room and upgraded amenities. The room was nicely decorated; new linens and duvets, brand new bathroom fixures and spa products. The last two rooms were not an issue, they were decent and clean, except the rooms are on the small side. We love the location and facilities more than anything else. I love having an adult only pool and gym; it's located on the tallest floor so you get an awseome view of Toronto while you're relaxing in the jacuzzi. They have always been clean and quiet every time I use the facilities. And the family pool and waterslide is fun to use, too. We have yet to bring our daughter here, but we will since they have child care and programs. The location is awesome, just a mere two blocks from Eaton Centre and walking distance for many attractions. I know the other reviews are mixed, but we've had no issues with this hotel. The rooms, although clean, do need an upgrade, and many of them are upgraded as of now. When booking a room, ask for a newer room; they're very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bluenoser2007
Reviews.Content: Got a fantastic deal on Hotwire ($49/nite Cdn) for the two nites we stayed. The rate was for 2 double beds in one of their non renovated rooms. It would have been an additional $45/nite to upgrade to one of their deluxe rooms with a king bed in the newly renovated section. We arrived around 10:30am and were given a complimentary upgrade to the deluxe room as the attendant adivsed they weren't busy that morning. I highly recommend joining their Delta Privilege program on-line. It is free and when you get to the hotel look for the Delta Privilege desk and you get faster check in service and avoid the line-ups at the regular check in counter. We were given the upgrade because of being members!! The deluxe room had a down duvet comforter, bath robes and a nice bathroom with marble vanity. Even though we travelled without kids this trip, we still enjoyed the kids pool with the corkscrew waterslide. The adult pool was great and you could see the CN tower from the pool. We didn't use the fitness facilities but they were located at the adult pool on the 27th floor and offered a great view while working out. For a Friday night, we thought the pools would be very busy with 1500+rooms, but there were less than 10 people at the kids pool (7pm) and only 1 person at the adult pool when we arrived and noone working out! It is within walking distance of everything downtown. We took in a Leafs game and walked both to and from the Air Canada Centre...about 20 minutes. Only 2 blocks to the Eaton Centre. We walked to St. Lawrence Market too. The Airport Express bus was great and an economical way to get to/from the Airport in comfort ($29.50 round trip). You can save an additional 10% by buying tickets on line. There is a wicket at the Airport in the Arrivals section where you can purchase the tickets. There is a link on the Delta Chelsea site to the Airport Express website. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants on site, but there are lots to pick from around the hotel. Overall, we were very impressed with our Hotwire "deal" of $49/nite! Would stay there again for sure. The staff were extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Like a small city in itself!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in Toronto recently whilst visiting some friends. As it was my first visit to the city i decided on the Delta Chelsea and was not dissapointed. it took 15 mins to get up to the counter in line to check in but the guy was very corteous and even told me he'd try and get me as high up as he could without me even asking him! I ended up on an 11th floor room in the Green tower. it was nice but a little worn in the bathroom and as people have mentioned a little small. The June jacobs tolietries were a nice touch and i have to admit the hotel room was pretty quiet despite the fact there are so many other rooms nearby! For a basic room i thought the TV was tiny and kind of aged (51cm) but nonetheless they had a good selection of channels. The staff were polite on the whole and the only concern i had was one night returning late from a day and night of sightseeing to have a drunk woman sprawled across the hallway talking loudly into her cellphone. I would have thought security would have come up and told her to move along. Lobby is huge and i often got lost looking for my elevators, People were always in there at any time of Day or Night. Just watch the Yonge St entrance, I had a beggar accost me as i stepped out one day and i noticed him the next day lurking around that doorway waiting for people to come out. I never got to use the pool or gym as i only used the hotel for sleeping, But i would definitely return. My only advice to them would be to renovate the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: sebim
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well maintained and clean. It is a little out of the way from entertainment district. Great restaurants on elm street just across from the hotel. a bit seedy on young street for the price may stay again but would check other hotels first.

Reviews.Title: “This place scammed me out of 100 bucks.”
Reviews.Author: HeyThereBluEyz
Reviews.Content: I don't normally stay at this hotel when I'm in town, but I decided to give it a shot. From the outside, it's beautiful, and it's location is wonderful. The lobby is fantastic and well maintained, on par with a 4 or 5 star hotel. I arrived in town early, and called ahead to find out if it would be possible for an early check-in. I was told that if they have a room ready, they will normally accomodate my request, but if not, I was free to use the facilities while they prepared a room. When I finally did arrive at the hotel and asked for an early check in, the auditor informed me I would be charged an additional $99 for early check-in. I explained to her what I was told on the phone, and was told there would not be a charge, and would like to avoid any additional charges. The auditor was then basically pushed away and another auditor came to me and told me it would not be a problem, checked me into the hotel, and then proceeded to give me a set of room keys and went to my room on the 20th floor.
