The room keys didn't fit into the lock, so I had to go back down and have them change the type to fit into my door. I opened the door to find one of the tiniest rooms I've ever stayed in! While the bed was extremely comfortable, and the carpeting was nice, and the balcony access was definately a plus since I'm a smoker. I DID NOT have the flat screen tv in my room as advertised. This place only offers dial-up internet access for free (so 1998!!!) and charges $11 a day for high speed internet!!!! Ridiculous! To top it off, they have pop-ups that mess up your computer every five minutes! So, I get on to check my account to find out they scammed me and charged me the additional $99 for checking in 3 hours early. I'll be fighting that when I return home! Other remarks: aside from the tiny rooms, the hallways are poorly kept, with wallpaper hanging off the walls, shoddy carpeting, etc. For my money, I expect much more. I'll be going back to the hotel I usually stay at from now on. They don't try to scam money out of me, and their internet access is FREE, as is breakfast every morning!

Reviews.Title: “$215 for a shoebox!”
Reviews.Author: firefightingal
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is gorgeous, great location, etc, but for $215 a night, I would have liked to stay in a room that was slightly bigger than my walk in closet at home.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, crowded, in a bad location”
Reviews.Author: RetiredChef
Reviews.Content: The room was okay except for the ridiculous doorstop screwed into the carpet right in front of the closet so that it was guaranteed to trip you every time you went to the closet. We were promised a room with a refrigerator and a microwave -- didn't happen. We asked several times and were told it would be taken care of that day. In five days, we never got either. The food in the restaurants was strangely presented and just barely average. There was also a buffet of sorts at the full-service restaurant but it was very small and was badly set up so that it was difficult to get around. The meal was very expensive considering the quality and there was a decided lack of fresh veggies. A huge flock of unhappy tourists arrived pushing their way towards the food all at once after what appeared to be a long bus ride of some sort (not the hotel's fault actually but the group was expected) so getting to the buffet again was problematic plus there was minimal wait staff (only two servers for the entire dining room). Cost for two buffet meals plus $35 bottle of bad wine about $140; value about $50. Breakfast was even worse proportionately -- one little box of dry cereal and tiny carton of milk -- $6.00. The hotel people of whom we asked directions consistently were wrong. The busy street outside one of the three doors was a scary, low-end bunch of store fronts with the most disreputable people hanging around. Pan-handlers are everywhere and aggressive. So we took taxis and were completely ripped off every time but one. They would go around side streets and up and down one-way roads to run up the tab. One ride of about 2 miles cost over $12 while another in the opposite direction to the same starting point was $5. There appears to be no security at all around the hotel exterior and in fact, we did not see a single policeman anywhere in Toronto. That could explain the proliferation of beggars. We even had some high school kids in nice clothes with very expensive bicycles ask us for money. I just got to where I would say, "No English, go away!" as sternly as possible in a thick accent and my companion carried a big folding knife in his pocket. On the good side, there is a lovely roof-top pool and whirlpool but strangely, the bar up there was never open although the hotel pool area had loads of thirsty guests. Very weird. There is no public computer even at a fee. They told me to go to a internet cafe but didn't know where I could find one. I had stupidly put all my dining and attraction research on a flash drive so that I could leave the laptop at home. Big mistake. On the whole, we would not return to Toronto or the Delta Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Woodalls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea for a long weekend. We up graded to a delux suite and we were not disappointed - good size room/bed and balcony with good view of the city. The hotel was ideally located for sightseeing Toronto with most sites only a few blocks away. Did not eat in the restaurant: looked too much like a canteen! We would recommend the hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine166
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and had a fantastic time. The hotel is very nice and the staff are very helpful and friendly. Our room was on the 8th floor and it was a very good size and the bathroom was spacious. We had breakfast in the Market Garden, it was great with a very good choice. I found the hotel to be very quiet even although it is a very busy hotel. The location of this hotel is great. It is a 2 minute walk to the Eaton Centre (which is great) and about 20 -25 minute walk down to Front Street for the CN Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but Anonymous”
Reviews.Author: SteveC_and_family
Reviews.Content: A bustling hotel just off the edge of the main shopping district â€“ always busy in the lobby. Valet parking somewhat chaotic but a man did appear and take our car away (& bring it back!). Reasonable location but not â€˜centralâ€™ â€“ a fair walk to the downtown and entertainment districts â€“ and surrounded by somewhat seedy streets â€“ tattoo parlours and private cinemas â€“ but we didnâ€™t have any problems. Did find a couple of nice restaurants nearby. Room was reasonable but a little narrow â€“ had to yield to anyone else moving about. View was other city blocks so nothing special. Beds OK and aircon worked. No safe. Had a drink in the bar and got charged for the â€˜foodâ€™ â€“ Bombay mix â€“ that weâ€™d assumed was free.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Great Staff, Outdated and smelly room”
Reviews.Author: FrmOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance to Eaton Center, subway and not too far from Queen (Entertainment & Fashion District). As of April 2007, this hotel is a non-smoking hotel. However, if you got one of the previously smoking rooms, you still notice strong smell of smoke. We got our room thru Priceline. Checking was pleasant and smooth. We got our room on the fifth floor of the Red Elevator, which was previously smoking floor. The room is old and has very strong smell of smoke. We went back to front desk and a pleasant lady changed our room to the sixth floor, which was previously a non smoking floor. Except for the room is dated with wrinkle carpet, old furnitures and very tiny bathroom, everything else was fine. Parking: Use the parking garage on Gerrard (near corner of Gerrad and Bay) for $5/day on weekend and $12/day of weekday to avoid paying $22 parking at the hotel. Since you can walk almost everywhere from this hotel, youâ€™re may not need in-out privilege parking. On weekend, you can buy a Day Pass for $8.50 CAD which is good for 2 adults and upto 4 kids under 19 years old of unlimited ride of subway, streetcar. Restaurant: Try Sushi Sky near corner of Young and College one block from the Delta. There are number of good patio on Church st (one block North).

Reviews.Title: “A good central location”
Reviews.Author: Bonifazius
Reviews.Content: This is a busy hotel in downtown Toronto, handy for the town centre facilities, Eaton Centre, Chinatown, Financial District etc.. The hotel is large and comfortably furnished, if somewhat old-fashioned. The reception staff were quite efficient although there were often long queues at the desk. The rooms were comfortable, the bathtub was quite old, and the bathroom itself quite small. The self-service restaurant is good. A good hotel for the businessman or tourist.

Reviews.Title: “great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerOhio
Reviews.Content: I reserved the hotel thru Hotwire for great rate (about 1/2 of standard). The room we got was good for the price - but not what I would have expected from the 3.5 rating or hotel website presentation. The windows were dirty, the bathroom floor tiles were cracked, and the balcony was not clean or inviting. The location is GREAT, and it is a busy hotel with lot of traffic. Service was generally good - but I was just expecting the rooms to be a cut above.

Reviews.Title: “Fab if with the kids”
Reviews.Author: PandorasTrips
Reviews.Content: We could have stayed in a more expensive hotel, but as this was sold to us as a child friendly hotel and our agent had FOC upgraded rooms, wo we booked this one for 3 nights. The room was better than we expected and the rollaway didn't take over the room, it was a good size for 2 adults and 2 boys. I point out that we have boys, because you need just that little bit more space!! Both are fussy eaters so the Marketplace was the perfect place to piece together something they would eat. The hotel is perfect for kids, and there are quite a few milling around. The hotel was perfectly situated for us to go and explore Toronto on foot. The staff were extreemly helpful in suggesting things to do and see. Everyone was very friendly. A bonus treat was having breakfast on the top floor overlooking the city..

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: elvisd
Reviews.Content: my uncle had left a key for me at the desk, however the man working would not give it to me, and insisted i had to call my uncle and bring him down.. a bit annoying other than that the hotel was clean, the pool and gym were nice and i really couldnt get enough of the coffee they had, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: BigTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Toronto and it will likely be our last. The Delta Chelsea is the biggest hotel in the city and we largely picked it because it was advertised as family friendly and had a central location. We arrived at 10:30pm on Friday night and were checked-in promptly. We parked in the garage under the hotel (for which we were charged $23 a day plus tax). The garage ceiling was very low and some of the turns were very tight. We finally found a space about four levels down. Our room was supposedly recently renovated although we couldn't tell it. The room had a musty smell when we entered, which was an immediate turn-off. The carpet was stained and the furnishings seemed dated. We could view a bit of the city from our balcony. The room was very small even though there were only three of us. Both mornings we had our breakfast downstairs. The restaurant was not equpped to handle the number of diners and ran out of several things, including coffee and silverware. We were pleased to see that they offered free wi-fi in the restaurant area, which we ended up using to research and book another hotel. The family pool was extremely crowded (50+) and small. Because the pool was the outlet for the slide, the water was choppy and a little rough for my 7 year old. They ran out of towels and had a maid push down a cart full of towels that she folded and handed out as necessary. We checked out early and decided to spend an extra day in Niagara Falls, Ontario. I'll think twice before I book a room in such a large hotel again. Also, it'll probably be some time before we return to Canada in general. The exchange rate stinks and you are overtaxed. Our final hotel bill included a PST tax, a GST tax and a DMF (destination tax). We also learned that we can no longer get our GST tax refunded - this law changed early in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel esp. if traveling with kids”
Reviews.Author: Owynne
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried after reading some of the reviews but we had a great experience. We paid $146 for an upgraded room (web special). Very nice, completely renovated, comfortable beds, nice bathroom. The staff was friendly and helpful. It is a very busy hotel. The kid's amenities are great. The pool is fun and the kid's club is great. The staff is very nice and friendly. Our 6 yo and 2.5 yo boys loved spending time in the kid's club. Nice to have a place for them to play and have fun with other kids. The market is great for breakfast plus kids eat free. Room service was fine, a little slow, but when we checked on the food's arrival the manager comped the whole meal. Great, central location. We parked in the lot across the street - $20 per day with in and out privleges. All in all a great experience, would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting......”
Reviews.Author: mkrus57
Reviews.Content: Mammoth Hotel smack dab in the city. Location, Location, Location! A little overwhelming at first, but eventually grows on you. Everything takes a little longer, unlike checking in to a Holiday Inn Express on the road or something( given the size of this place, to be expected). The hustle and bustle grows on you. Rooms are nice size and all the staff is attentive( be patient, again, this place is huge). Our rooms were old time smokey smelling and were supposed to be non-smoking. I'm talkin' acrid old time smoke. i was on the verge of going beserk, but they took care of me and moved us ( 2 rooms) to the 21rst floor. Took a little while, but it was worth the wait. I was happy. Have a real nice lounge or two off main lobby with great cold beers etc. Very relaxing. Morning breakfast is very interesting as it is cafeteria style( and rightfully so, given the amount of guests trying to eat). Everything was very good. Very convenient underground parking garage that accommadates mini vans. Toronto is a walk, or bus, or subway kind of city. Don't think about driving around. It gets maddening. My advice is take the Gray line tour bus. A deal for 3 days with on/off priviledges. And lastly, take lotsa dough. Toronto can get pricey. All that being said, I can't wait to go back. A million things to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: spmm
Reviews.Content: Just spent 1 night at the Delta. The cost was $175CDN/ night for a "Deluxe Room" + $22CDN/ night for parking. The room was very basic and somewhat small for the price, though as others have stated, it is very close to theatres, shopping and restaurants, and does have lots of amenities on-site. Of course, many other hotels offer the same for a lesser amount. It is a very large hotel, and the lobby is massive with many travellers present at most hours. Check-in was pretty fast, however there were massive line-up's to check-out in the morning...Not sure why, as one must leave their credit card info upon check-in. There are several restaurants and bars on-site, as well as 2 pools and a gym. I would guess that one is paying for location and amenities as opposed to opulance and charm. The room was small (for $175+), but clean and it did have a balcony that we could fully access, though it held no furniture, and overlooked a roof...so not very scenic. Everything functioned fine (TV, sink, shower, phone, iron, etc.) Overall, I would state that it was a little over-priced for what was present, but it was in a very central location and offered all the services one would expect from a Delta. We probably wouldn't stay here again, and we prefer hotels with a bit more "character", personal feel and of smaller size, but it wasn't bad by any means...It was just a bit pricey for a very generic-feeling experience.

Reviews.Title: “Had better rooms here”
Reviews.Author: ShoppingBound12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many, many times. I love the location, right downtown beside the Eaton Centre. I've had several great experiences and other times not so great. Because I keep going back, I obviously enjoy it for the most part, but next time around I am going to try somewhere else. The last time I was here, I had a newly renovated room. It was beautiful! I suggest you ask for this when booking. This past weekend, we booked the family special. This included a kitchen & king size bed (all in one room), a $40 HBC gift card and a $25/per day credit for breakfast (this credit was a surprise to us). After going on and on about how great this hotel was, my boyfriend and I were extremely disappointed when we entered our room. It was very tired, carpet was torn, no dish clothes in the kitchen and the toilet was dirty around the rim. On a good note, the people working here are very nice, the bed was comfortable and it was quiet. This is really the most important thing to me. But for $191 a night, I was hoping for a nicer and more updated room. Delta Chelsea, I'm a little disappointed this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Funny experience, this little village”
Reviews.Author: My-View-on-things
Reviews.Content: What I most remember about this hotel - something I don't read in most other reviews - is the sheer size of it. With 1600 rooms at the time, it was certainly the biggest hotel I've ever been to. And you know what; I thought that was pretty funny. I was on a business trip, and spent some 10 minutes somewhere in the 'lobby' each morning, waiting for colleagues to gather. Like an ants nest! Different breakfast rooms, huge check-in counters - seperate desks for airline staff. And for the rest, I didn't have any complaints at all. Don't expect much, and you'll enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “good, not horrible, not great”
Reviews.Author: ktowntravllr
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write to get my message across clearly. The hotel was fine. Just not what I think should be expected for the price. To start we got a great deal that we heard advertised on the radio - couldn't get it on-line and had to specifically ask for it when we called. If everybody could pay the price we did, I would highly recommend the hotel - it was the best value we could find downtown. However, I've rated it based on what most hotel patrons probably pay. This is a huge (1500 rooms I think) hotel. Always very busy. Line up at the front desk all of the time, but the line always moved quickly, and the front desk staff were very pleasant and efficient. When we checked in we were told our king room wasn't available. When we balked at getting put in a queen when we booked a king they upgraded us. No problems there. But if this was an upgraded room, I can only imagine what the regular rooms are like. The room was average for a hotel, nothing more. The room was fine looking - very clean. Balcony useless because as previous reviewers have stated, there is no furniture to sit on out there. It was sweltering in the room and we could not figure out how to cool it off - turns out toggle switch on wall will never cool off the room if it's toggled to the right - perhaps a sign indicating this would be nice - other than to say 'on' for either left or right toggle there was no other instructions. We spent two nights and found the room was either freezing or hot and stuffy, we couldn't find a comfortable medium. Our room came with a $25 food voucher each day. Prices incredibly expensive but covered our breakfast (for two) each morning. I really didn't like that internet service wasn't included in the price - this really took away the convenience factor. Almost $12 for a day of internet is almost theft in my opinion, no way I'd pay it. Never checked out the kid area, but it seems that if you had kids it might be outstanding - they have a camp, waterslide etc. I liked that they had an adult only pool. Location is very good - walk up or down Yonge for the subway. So this was a good hotel, just not as good as I think they try to portray. For the right price, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay at the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: FriarBri
Reviews.Content: The only problem with this hotel is that the beds are so comfortable, it is tough to get up in the morning! Never slept in a more cozy bed with lots of big pillows. You literally have to tear yourself out of it in the morning. Really, this is a great "tourist" hotel with a very friendly and efficient staff. We arrived late and were upgraded to a superior room by a very welcoming desk clerk. The rooms are very clean and well-appointed. Bathrooms have toiletries and a good supply of nice, big towels. There is high-speed internet in the rooms, although they charge for it. The Market Garden restaurant in the lobby is great for breakfast and lunch. The roof-top health club is fantastic! Nice pool, lots of good exercise equipment, and beautiful outdoor deck with nice views of the city. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: aragornsgirl
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a weekend visit to Toronto. We stayed at the Delta Chelsea Hotel. It was Caribana weekend which is a Caribbean festival held annually. Apparently, there is a lot of trouble during this festival as evidenced by the great number of police everywhere and the heightened security in the hotel. You actually had to wear a wristband that was given to you at the time of check-in to reenter the hotel on Saturday night. The room was recently renovated. We had a deluxe King room. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in and I've stayed at a lot of nice hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfy, Not as Advertised tho”
Reviews.Author: adblink
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Delta's "Premium" rooms over the weekend July 28th-30th. Now for the price you pay for this room, don't expect anything like you would get in say Niagara Falls or what not. The room is fairly small, but still none the less very neat, very tidy and the beds and pillows are incredibly comfy. You are more paying for location, which is great actually. Your right on Young Street, and have a short walk over to the College Station for the subway which can take you all over. The one problem I had with the hotel was the apparent "balcony access" they advertised on the website. For me, I have never stayed at a hotel that had a balcony, so this was going to be an experience for me, I pictured being able to just sit out on the balcony in the evening and just relax, unfortunately this was not possible. Even though my room did have a balcony (a very small, dirty one with nothing on it ) I didn't even have a door to it! I had to climb through a small window to get out to the balcony. Some rooms from what I could see did have a door to the balcony, however they weren't any better. Before making and finalizing my reservation, I asked numerous times about the balcony, making sure every room had one and I was told "yes" each and every time, I guess they just forgot to add you can't get to alot of them? The hotel needs to do some major work to the exterior of the building, looks very ratty including all the balconies The interior of the hotel looks amazing, was very impressed with it all.

Reviews.Title: “Okay tourist hotel, but lots of details are missing”
Reviews.Author: tewks
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea hotel is in a great location for tourists visiting Toronto, as it is centrally located and a pretty easy walk to almost all of the major tourist sites. The hotel is okay, but the details are just not there. We originally booked a Delta room, but called to upgrade the room, because we wanted a balcony. When we checked in we asked if the upgrade and balcony were what we were getting, and were assured we were. When we got to the room, however, the balcony was there, but a special lock had been put ont he sliding door, so it opened no more than 8 inches. We called and complained, and were told to come to the desk to get a new room. When we got to the front desk the clerk told us they had already upgraded us (which was not true, I paid for the upgrade), but in the end they upgraded us to a Premier room. This room had a balcony we could go out on, and stand among the trash that was on the balcony and stayed there throughout our 4 night stay. Additionally, the hallways had water stains on the carpet, our bathroom had numerous broken tiles, an exhaust fan that didn't work (in fact, had no switch to start it), had a television behind the sitting chair and literally next to the bed. Whenever we asked a question of staff we were told different answers to our questions, so that we came to see it as a game to ask simple questions (like directions or whether any specific services/amenities were in the hotel). The hotel advertises free wireless internet int he lobby, but even sitting under one of the signs the signal was so weak we could not get it to work. The in-room advertising card said that internet service was $9.95/day, but ended up being $11.95. All in all, if you are just looking for a convenient place to sleep, the Delta Chelsea is okay. However, if you expect any level of service or anything even close to "nice", stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFL
Reviews.Content: I looked forward to my stay at the Delta Chelsea. I have stayed there several times, but that was at least twenty years ago when it was a "first class" hotel....before the large addition, and before the "kiddie activities." It is now a tourist hotel. Be aware that there are NOT color coded "towers"...but rather color coded floors on which particular elevators stop. I checked in for a 3 night stay and requested a "red" room....as recommended in a previous review.....wrong! The room was tiny, shabby and worst of all, it had a terrible odor. I thought I would open the balcony door to "air it out"...but that door was jammed. Also, the glass on the door and windows was filthy...almost opaque. I had traveled all day and decided to go to bed and "live with" the odor. The next moring, the smell was worse than ever....it really smelled like something had "died" in the room. I did not relish approaching the front desk with a request to move...for some reason...all to many desk clerks seem to have an "attitude" problem. Luckily, such was not the case....the desk clerk was professional and quick to move me....and apologized for the problem...when was the last time that you heard a desk clerk apologize at a U.S. hotel? The next room was "night and day" from the first....large, clean, recently renovated, and completely comfortable. My point is....how, or why, does this hotel continue (as I've read in other reviews) to have both good and bad room situations, without doing something about it? In any case, rather than "toss the dice" again at the Chelsea, I think I'll stay elsewhere next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: DWhiteBasingstoke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. Having read some of the reviews on here I was a little anxious, however, had no problems whatsoever. Check in took only 15 minutes and we were upgraded to a room on the Signature Floor (24th floor). The room and bathroom were clean and tidy and the bed comfortable. We had our breakfast each morning in The Market Garden which offered plenty of choice at a reasonable price for a downtown hotel. The Airporter and Hop On Hop Off tourist bus stops right outside the front door. Overall, I would have no qualms in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “close to many restaurants”
Reviews.Author: GS-CS_leader
Reviews.Content: Important tip for guests with cars: instead of parking in the extremely overpriced garage of the Delta Chelsea itself ("special rate" for guests = over $28/day once you add in various taxes), park in the public garage next door whose entrance is just to the left of the Elm Street entrance to the Delta Chelsea garage. At the public garage, you will have to pay each time you use it and you will have to decide in advance how long to buy your ticket for (or you may have to buy another ticket if you need to park for more time), but you can use a credit card at the ticket machine, and the rates are much cheaper than the hotel's rates: for example, 12 overnight hours (6pm-6am) cost only $6. Our room had two standard double beds. It is rare these days for mid-priced hotels to have beds smaller than queen size, but the room was definitely too small for bigger beds. As it was, the space between the foot of the beds and the dresser was tighter than I'm used to. The end of the room with the upholstered chair and small table and desk was also not particularly roomy, so that direction would also not have tolerated the additional width of larger beds. The room seemed to have been renovated reasonably recently, but the outside balcony had an old rough cement floor and the paint on the divider from the balcony next door was chipped and peeling. The bathroom had a nice granite (or synthetic) counter, but the sink bowl had a long crack along the bottom. The bathroom items like shampoo and soap were nice "boutique" types with pleasant and mild citrus scents. There is free WiFi in the lobby. You have to pay an additional fee of approx $11/day to get Internet service in your room. We did not pay for this service. I found a wireless keyboard in the dresser, so presumably it could be used to access the Internet through the TV. We had breakfast one morning at the Marketplace Cafe in the hotel ground floor. It is done in food court "cafeteria" style, but you can get made-to-order hot dishes such as an omelette platter with potatoes and toast for reasonable prices ($6-8). It was a better breakfast at a better price than the one we had at the vegetarian restaurant right next door on Elm St. There are many different restaurants on Elm Street, right next door or across the street from the hotel. This was convenient when we came in later than we planned on the first night and wanted to get a decent dinner without having to drive somewhere. We did not use the pool because we didn't have time, but the hotel info says that it has a pool with a really long water slide with part of the tube going outside of the building which we saw from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Friday night”
Reviews.Author: DarrenA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on a Friday night. The room was small for the price, but the bed was comfortable. Unfortunately the room door is not very soundproof and we heard people returning to their rooms every hour all night long. The noisiest person was the bellhop at 5am helping someone check in to their room. Not a good night's sleep. The staff were helpful though. When we complained about the noise, we were offered a free breakfast. When we needed to find a particular restaurant, we were given a map with good directions. It's pricey for what you get, but I figure you're paying for the location more than for the hotel room. Next time we'll try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms and friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ballybrick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 very comfortable nights. Situated in the heart of downtown Toronto its within easy walking distance of good restaurants, shopping centres, the waterfront and many attractions. The airport bus sets down and picks up from the hotel, The subway is within a few yards as is the PATH underground walkway. Staff were friendly and helpful and service very good. The only downside for me was the Garden Restaurant within the hotel that was very much a grab and run type self service cafe. The nearby restaurants however compensated. Try "35 Elm St" or Frascati's within yards of the hotel if you like Itialian.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanG001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night. Room was very good. It is easy to get to other parts of the city from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room tired, kids program wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cookie43
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Delta was mixed. First, the staff was terrific, and the kids program was great. The upgraded room was tired and the bathroom was a bit grubby, chipped tile, peeling wallpaper etc... I would only stay here again if I needed the kids program. They have many activities for the children. You can leave a child in their care for 2 and a half hours for $5.00 anytime until 10:00 at night. They have Camp Chelsea, $25 for the day and cheaper for the second child, lunch and dinner included. $10.00 per half day. That alone is worth the stay if you need that service.

Reviews.Title: “Room Small for Price Paid”
Reviews.Author: HotelPrincess67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea for only one night - Thur June 5, 2007. Price was expensive but I needed a hotel for one night (I decided last minute to come to Toronto 1 day early). For the price I paid, the room was VERY small. I had read the reviews and noticed a few others had the same comment....room small for price paid.... they were correct and I agree. Rooms are too small for what you pay! One problem we had with the bed was, when we tried to sit up to eat, we would rest our backs against the headboard/wall, and the bed would slide away from the wall....! Ridiculous! We had to prop the iron board up against the wheels of the bed and the other wall to stop it from rolling. Bathroom sink - drain got stuck in "close" position so my boyfriend had to play "mr. fix it again" and try to unblock it.... Not impressed....! Restaurant on site - Garden Market, I think that's the name was good.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: grumpy-tourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a tour group, so better rooms will be available. Our room in the blue tower (each tower has colour coded lifts) was quite small and a bit tired looking. No frills, and only a coffeee machine. Hotel is situated in a good location for restaurants and bars along Elm and Younge Streets, although you may be unlucky and experience some aggressive begging, especially in Elm. Buffet style breakfast was ok, but there are several coffee shops nearby with better variety and much better coffee! Did not sample what was on offer in the evenings, but was told by others that the food and service were fine, but again nothing too exciting......again Elm St was the winner here. Overall; a decent location for exploring Toronto with average rooms, service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonodalove
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Delta Chelsea on June 3-6th. The hotel is in a great location, the room is adequate and most of the staff was nice. They have a laundry facility that is a wonderful thing with you are trying to pack light. The food in the market place in the hotel is very expensive and we didnt find it all that appealing. In a pinch it will do. The concierge was not that helpful and the service there could be better. The room was fine and the decor was new. We stayed in the deluxe room which has been renovated recently so we were fine. We ordered room service and they did a great job quick and correctly. Right now the Canadian Government had repelled the GST and HST rebate so you will no longer get that back just FYI. All in all it was an average stay at best but I would probably try another hotel if we come back because for the money I think we might be able to do a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea toronto - Could do better”
Reviews.Author: OlaWatford
Reviews.Content: We visited here on the final leg of what was a wonderful holiday in Canada. We arrived at 8.30pm and after waiting for 30 minutes to check in were told by a totally unconcerned member of staff that our room was not ready. When we finally got to our room is was 'Sad' completely in need of a refurbishment. When buying food at the market place the checkout person was on a personal call - and even the presence of what I can only imagine was the restaurant manager , she carried on regardless. Next the concierge when asked re storage of baggage said it was the duty of the bell cptain and then promptly left his desk. The attitude of all staff except the cleaning and bell captain when he eventually arrived was ' just couldn't care less.' It was very disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Alright Hotel - FAB location”
Reviews.Author: ckdjr60301
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights at the last minute for a quick roadtrip. I took my Pug and we drove to Toronto from Chicago. When I checked in the hotel, the front desk lady knew my dog's name from my profile and couldn't have made us feel more welcome. The concierge and the bell guys all greeted the dog as well as me. The first room I stayed in was loud and not acceptable. I complained and they immediately moved me to a GREAT room which had been recently remodeled. This hotel was walking distance to pretty much everywhere I wanted to, especially the Church & Wellesley area. I had a great stay and would defintiely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gaz1
Reviews.Content: Hi all. First off, I'm sorry for posting what some may see as an "out of date" review but I stayed here in August 2004. The Room wasnt great but was clean and tidy (which is what really counts) and had a small balcony that was great for watching the city life. The Breakfast buffet was good enough for me as was the seating area. The Hotel also has a buffet resturant which we dined in twice if I recall correctly (most of the time we ate out because we wanted to see the city) . It is quite centrally located and you can step out the back door onto "Younge street". The CN tower is in walking distance as is the ferry for center island (although we were lazy and took a taxi down to the docks to get to the island - LOL) It was a blazing hot day on the island and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, the view of the Toronto coastline from the island is a must take photograph. We also were able to book an excursion to Niagara falls through the hotel which was superb. The Driver Albert really went out of his way to be friendly. As I said, apologies for posting an almost 3 year old review but I hope it helps. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Well... Not sure!”
Reviews.Author: Iwanttogotobrazil
Reviews.Content: We spend a familly weekend at that Hotel. First, it is very well located. Walking distance from CN Tower, right on famous Younge street. Second, it is very clean and beautifull. Employees are nice but sometimes, are looking overwhelmed even if there wasn't that much people. The kids facilities are very nice, clean and in good working order. On the negative side of it, we booked for a room with 2 queen beds but got 2 54'' instead, they advertise a pool for the kids with a 4 storey high corkscrew indoor water slide... but the pool is on the second floor!!!! They advertise kids eats for free but you almost feel cheap when you buy their meals, actualy sometimes you feel like if you rob the hotel. And the restaurant on the 27 floor was closed all weekend long. It must be because it is Toronto!!!!!! It wouldn't happen in Montreal, New York or Chicago, make no mistake about it. Over all, it's not a must, but it's not a no no.

Reviews.Title: “if you don't manage to get the upgraded room, don't bother”
Reviews.Author: pongowaring
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 days in total with a 2 day stop at Niagra Falls in the middle. We were upgraded on our first 4 nights. Lovely room, good bathroom and the shower worked well. However our second visit was not so great to start with. We were put in the "standard" room. It was horrid. The room was small, inadequate storage and a bathroom that was tiny. The walls were marked and the carpet worn. We did query the room- Front of house confirmed it was a two person room in a four star hotel. We begged to differ. We have both stayed in better travel lodges. The room also appeared to smell of smoke (the hotel is supposed to be smoke free) and the bed was not big enough! We were unable to move rooms that night as we checked in late and the staff informed us that the hotel was full. We continued to complain and were eventually moved to the "upgraded" room the next day which was to the standard that I would expect for a hotel in this price bracket. In short this hotel does not meet the four star rating in the standard room. The upgraded rooms were nice. We also used the brasserie at breakfast- well priced and a good buffet. Front of house and bellboys very helpful. Concierge did not seem that knowledgable to us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, welcoming and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Teacher323
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Delta Chelsea, Toronto and we couldn't have been happier with our accommodations. We arrived before check in and a King-Bed room was not available. We we given the option to wait or take a double-bed room. I voiced some regrets and was promptly offered a voucher for a free dinner at one of the restaurants in the hotel. Since it was early in the day, we took the double-bed room. (We were told we could change to a King tomorrow, if we wanted.) From that moment on, everyone from the concierge to the chef making our breakfast omelettes, bent over backwards to make sure our stay was a good one. Did I mention LOCATION... the Delta is located in the Downtown section of Toronto. It is an easy walk to shops, malls and restaurants. It is just across the street from the College subway stop. You can get just about anywhere by using the mass transit system (trolley, bus & metro.) There is a 24 hour food market , food court and ATM in the underground passage to the College subway stop. This is an added plus for families on a tighter budget. Our room was a Deluxe, none the less, I would have liked a little more room. The beds and linens were superior, topped with a cozy down comforter. The tower we were in was one of the recently renovated ... so be sure to ask for that. You pay extra for the internet, something I wish more hotels would just include. There is a kids pool & fun center separate from the adult pool and sauna. So if your looking for peace & quiet you can find it here. Housekeeping kept our rooms clean and inviting. All in all, this was agreat stay. I have heard some people were able to get a room on Priceline ... so check there. We paid the going rate of $200 for a deluxe and we still feel we got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: junxuj
Reviews.Content: Once one leaves the grand lobby, the rooms are rather small, very run down and badly in need of renovation and updating, not to mention poor value for the money. Plus, there is no internet available in rooms on the lower floors. The non-smoking room that we were in had clearly been a smoking room and had not been cleaned properly since then. One saving grace: the staff is very pleasant and went out of their way to accommodate us and make our stay with a small baby as easy as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: rgscotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a two centre offer to Toronto & Niagara Falls. Hotel is very very large, takes up a whole block. There are door to 4 different streets. Large clean lobby, great service from staff. Rooms were of a good size with 2 double beds, TV, Balcony, Bathroom with Shower over bath. Clean and well looked after. a couple of good resturant's but cheaper food options out and about. Handy gift shop with typical tourist tatt, newspapers and magazines etc. Deck 27 is equipped with a fair sized pool, sauna, jacuzzi, etc. I would stay here again, no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Griffindor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chelsea for the weekend. The room was small, but comfortable and clean. The location is excellent for shopping and dining. My only warning is that if you purchase a package with a food credit, make sure that you keep your receipts. We had a meal credit of $25 per day which we used in one of the restaurants. When we went to check out they had charged us the full cost of one meal (claimed that they had already taken off the $25) and there was another charge against our room that wasn't even ours. Fortunately we had our receipts to prove what the totals were. The hotel, was very good about it, removing all food charges from our bill, however, a hoped for quick check out took over half an hour, while they searched through restaurant receipts.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ng1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea for 6 nights during the mid part of our honeymoon. Upon arrival our first thoughts were positive, very grand lobby, helpful and friendly staff. Then we got to our 5th floor room. The smell of damp and mildew was overwhelming, the decor was plain dreadful and the general cleanliness was poor. Straight back down to reception, after much debate and a manager coming over we had our room changed - upto the 12th floor. Same decor but no smell of damp and slightly cleaner. A very poor hotel extremely overrated and a long walk from anywhere. Do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mazyar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Delta Chelsea twice now. Once in March during March break and then more recently over Easter. The first time we weren't sure what to expect. However, we were more than pleased so we returned a second time. I really can't praise it too much. The room (make sure you get a renovated one) was more than comfortable and very clean. The staff was extremely helpful. My son and I both enjoyed the slide pool and I, the adult one. The hotel is located right downtown, so it's a great location. Easy to pop back to if you want to rest or drop off your shopping. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: ftbllgrl899
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived in my room at the Delta Chelsea in Toronto. We had a king bed , a view of the CN tower, and a little balcony right off the room. The staff was very friendly and accomodating; the room was clean and comfortable. The only downsides-there were some problems with the elevators and I found the food in the Market Cafe to be quite overpriced (we paid approximately $25 CAN for breakfast!). The hotel offers parking for $23 CAN per day with unlimited in/out privileges. The other option is to park in one of the lots around the hotel for $8 per day, not including in/out privileges or guarantee of finding a spot. For an additional $6 ($29 CAN per day) you can take advantage of the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Unfriendly & Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: RichmondHillSylvia
Reviews.Content: Want to warn others not to make the mistake I have made. Kids saw an ad in a newspaper about a waterside in Delta Chelsea and wanted to go. What a big mistake. We arrived at 4 and were supposed to have 2 rooms on the same floor as was promised to us by reservations. None were ready. Nobody even bothered to say "sorry". We had to wait in the lobby for an hour !!! When we finally got to the room they were disgusting - old dirty carpets, stained curtains and smelling of cigarettes. (In non-smoking rooms). We have asked for a manager - NONE was available. Demanded normal rooms from front desk... We were finally (by six) given two semi-clean rooms. Floor we stayed on was dirty, carpets worn out, lights broken. What a DUMP for over $ 130 per room per night ! Even the pool and famous waterside were dirty Save your money - go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: sjdee
Reviews.Content: I must say that the Delta Chelsea is in a great location in the heart of downtown Toronto. However, my husband and I agreed we will never stay at this hotel again. These are our reasons: 1) The kids pool was very small and over-chlorinated and dingy. The waterslide was not always available at child friendly times. (between 6pm and 8pm). 2) We had an old room on the 16th floor. The fans didn't work, the TV was blurry and it was very run down. At 2am our first night we asked to move because we couldn't sleep. The noise from outside was so great that we felt we were sleeping outdoors on the street. While the staff was accomodating and moved us to a quieter, more updated room, it was a pain moving all our stuff and our small children. 3) Our second night there the fire alarm went off at 11pm and scared our children. The first three floors were evacuated and a voice came on every few minutes over the intercom to make a statement about the fire alarm. This false alarm took a good hour out of our sleep time. Even when they said all was well they repeated it at least 3 times over a 10 minute period. We had to calm our children down too. 4) The elevators were not reliable either, one was always broken down. 5) While kids eat "free", it is still cheaper to go to surrounding restaraunts outside the hotel. What is the point of a hotel if you can't get a good night's sleep there? We were disapointed in choosing this hotel. If you get a new room on a quiet side of the building, and don't bring children, expecting for them to have a good time at the hotel, and don't have a false alarm ringing...you may actually get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “good 1st impression undone somewhat”
Reviews.Author: trets7
Reviews.Content: stayed here Nov 2006 and although i liked the hotel certain things took the shine off our stay. First the good points, The Location was excellent and the drive into to the lobby when we arrived impressed me and made me feel i had choosen well. rooms were clean comfy and bathrooms okay, staff on the whole were very friendly. however the following occured meaning i can not give this Hotel more than 3 stars. Television had poor worn out picture , not a big gripe i admit but still noted we tried to get some extra pillows after we arrived afer our flight from england, nothing arrived after 20 mins so we said we want to sleep and not to bother, an hour later we were distrubed by room service delivring our pillows. food in for breakfast was pricey and not worth the price. on night three we were awoken at 3 am by the fire alarm going off, after preparing to evacuate the tannoy told us to stay in a room and await futher announcements, this happened in the corridor outside our room, where a fellow blurry eyed guest informed me he had stayed here 20 times in 12 months and this was his 5th fire alarm. the announcments then continued for 25 mins. not good on arrving home i found the credit card i check in with debited $160 for unknown servces by the hotel. i was refund without hassel when i rang the hotel, but it should not really have happened would i stay here again, if the price was good enough yes, however i expect better from a top class hotel to make me come back at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, good price”
Reviews.Author: kluanerevgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night in early March. I felt the rate was good for right downtown and for us, the fact it's a very short walk to the bus station was key. We did not eat at the hotel at all but hubby and I went for a quick drink or 2 in the lounge which has a wonderful view. The service was prompt and friendly and we quite enjoyed ourselves. The hotel itself is nothing special but our room was clean and we did not experience lots of extra noise, which I found surprising as it was a weekend. There were lots of kids, lots of theatre goers and essentially, a very varied clientele as far as I could see. Yup, elevators were a tad slow and crowded but that's not the type of something that affects my experience normally. The staff we encountered were polite and eager to help. All in all, I would stay there again as it did suit our purposes just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Need to fix things up!”
Reviews.Author: jasfinch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta Chelsea quite a few times and feel that the hotel is quickly deteriorating. My husband and two sons aged 7 & 5 and I stayed at this location this past weekend. We were quite excited about the prospect of enjoying the March Break activities. The following is a breakdown of our experience: Parking-Approximately $25 per day in a very tight underground lot. Check-in-Very quick since I am part of the Delta club. Felt bad for the people who had to stand in the very long line. Room-Stayed in the rooms accessible by the blue elevator. Quite small and the furnishings are getting pretty rough. The bathroom was in terrible shape with hair all over and a stained shower curtain. Pool-Had to schedule pool time in one hour blocks. Allowed to schedule two times per day. Could not be scheduled a day in advance. The pool deck was very, very dirty. The pool itself was extremely cloudy from the large amounts of chlorine and was freezing. My sons LOVED the waterslide! There were lots of extra activities that we would have liked to take part in but were not able to as they conflicted with our scheduled pool time. The staff certainly seemed as though they were trying very hard to make everyone have a great time. The complimentary drinks and popcorn in the lobby were a bit hit. A pretty good time overall!

Reviews.Title: “good for kids”
Reviews.Author: frtie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for kids. the pool, slide and kids center as well as the staff was perfect. Very friendly and clean. Our room was not a renovated room but it was still nice and clean. the concierge was very helpfull with giving directions and provided information on things to see. The only negative about this hotel is the food. the Garden Market was very bad, not many choices and the taste was below average. Kids do not have access to all hotel restaurants, so I can only comment on the familly restaurant. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will use this hotel next trip to Toronto Julie Fontaine, Quebec City

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water, No Extras as Advertised, No Fun!”
Reviews.Author: fivefive
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our 17th wedding anniversary by taking our three children on a weekend to Toronto - an economical choice for a one and a half income brood who are an hour's drive across the border to Canada. After a few nights of web-based research, we decided the Delta Chelsea's Family Fun package would be the best choice: a two bedroom suite, with a creativity center in-room for the kids, along with a hotel pool, a kids play room, and a filled cookie jar when you arrive as well as a kids special check-in package to make them feel special. We even noted in the comments section of the reservation form on-line that this was a big deal for us - our kids first big hotel stay and a special family occasion. Everyone was excited! The room - dirty with ripped bed linens. No cookies, no special check in package, no bathrobes. The "creativity center" in the room was a dirty children's table from Ikea with a worn-out blackboard tacked to the wall outside the bedroom hall.The staff? Had no idea what the Family Fun package was. After swimming in the filthy hotel pool that was tiled in a funky mildew - we paid $400 to sleep in chlorine-covered filth as we had no hot water in our room. The desk offer no help and told us we would just have to wait...till the the next day @ check out to bathe. The rooms smelled of mildew, the carpets were crunchy from the crumbs left by the last unfortunate family to stay there. It was a shabby hotel - that is horribly misrepresented on the web. Oh! The playroom was a disgustingly worn-out room with a dirty pen that housed a frightened rabbit sitting on a soiled towel surrounded by his own feces. What says family vacation more than that? My advice: don't ruin your hard-earned vacation time by staying @ the Delta Chelsea. A total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding for children”
Reviews.Author: nomadic_family
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have EVER stayed in for families. They start with having a children's check-in desk where your child gets a welcome gift. We booked the 2 bedroom family suite which had a separate room for our 3 yr old complete with bunk and nightlight. There was a full kitchen (including oven), childrens table and chairs and play area (blackboard chalk) in the room too, and a little toy waiting for her on arrival. She LOVED it. There is also an amazing children's room downstairs full of toys and craft projects and lovely helpful staff. They will even do childcare for 2 hrs. There is a coin washer and drier and a small but good pool, well supervised. The kids need be bigger for the water slide (height and swimming skill restrictions), but it is fast and scary so I understand that. The gym and top-floor pool was closed, but they have set up a fine alternative gym temporarily. The shop downstairs for food is handy but expensive. A large shopping mall is just 2 minutes down the road. Overall, I can't ever expect to stay better hotel than this when I travel with my daughter. Gold stars from us all round.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HandballYaz
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is its location. Right on Yonge street in downtown Toronto. It's probably a 20 minute walk from Chinatown, 10 minutes from the Eaton's Centre and City Hall. The subway stops right across the street at College Park mall. Surprisingly there aren't that many bars and restaurants in this area of Toronto, but there are plenty a few subway stops away. The hotel features a typically expensive indoor parking lot which occasionally sells out, but there are surface lots in the near vicinity should that happen. The rooms are at a typical North American standard for size and cleanliness - quite acceptable. The hotel features a very nice workout area on an upper floor affording good views of the south-west of Toronto. There's also a pool. The only detraction of the hotel is the check-in; the lobby is perpetually busy and sometimes it takes over 30 minutes to check in. That said, my room was available without any problem, and they feature an express check-out where you drop your receipt in a box and you're done. I always stay here when in Toronto and will continue to do so. One piece of advice is to shop around on the internet as I find prices at this hotel to vary a lot between the various hotel booking sites.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Linda77
Reviews.Content: this is my favourite hotel in the world. the staff are so helpful and friendly , the location is central - ride beside the eaton centre and off yonge street - the subway is just across the street. there is a small gym and pool - unusual for such a central location and the views from the 27th floor breakfast cafe are breathtaking. rooms are spacious with balconies so you can sit out and look over the city. i've visited this hotel almost every year for over 10years and if i'm in toronto ths is where you'll find me

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MixedGrill
Reviews.Content: Me and my Son stayed here for two nights over xmas,I had booked on the hotel website for a great deal of $89.00(CAD) for a room in the north tower.When we arrived we were offerd an upgrade to a newly refurbished room in the south tower for only $25.00 more! Great location and I would stay here again. Good pint of Guinness and good food at The Wolf and Firkin on Elm Street in between Bay and Younge.

Reviews.Title: “Happy pride”
Reviews.Author: melanie22pink
Reviews.Content: The first day of my stay was great! My room was clean the manger left fruit and bottle water in the room. We were less than four blocks away from pride fest. After the second day it seems like house keeping stop caring. The house keeping manger was out side trying to get people to sign a paper to get her job back. The beds were stop be being made. Overall I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “In The Heart Of Things....”
Reviews.Author: shellfitzy
Reviews.Content: Massive Hotel in the heart of Toronto over 1000 rooms overlooking the longest Street in the World, Yonge St. An ideal place to stay for easy access to everywhere. The rooms could do with a revamp/facelift as they were a little dated but comfortable for a short stay. Buffet restaurant was ideal for quick food however, the bar food was more enjoyable. Staff friendly especially the bellhops at reception, they were more informative than the concierge. Better knowledge of transportation to and from the airport etc. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate tourist hotel for short stays”
Reviews.Author: TravellerM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea in October on the final leg of a touring holiday of America and Canada for 3 nights. We travelled from the airport by bus and tube which I would recommend to anyone who is on a budget and doesn't mind lugging cases around for a while, as taxis and coach transfers cost a fortune - just ask for details at the information desk on arrival. My first impressions of the hotel from the outside weren't that great as it isn't the nicest building (architecturally) I have seen and was a bit of a concrete eyesore. The foyer was nice inside though and the reception staff were polite and helpful. The hotel has a lot of rooms and there are different elevators to take you to different floor levels. Our room was on the 24th floor. It wasn't the best room I've stayed in and could probably have done with a lick of paint and some refreshing of furniture, etc. It did have a balcony (which I didn't dare set foot on - I don't like heights). It was adequate for our stay - although I would have been a bit disappointed if we'd booked in for longer. We ate at the market hall on the first night which is a collection of different varieties of food from salads to pizza, hot and cold beverages, etc. It wasn't fantastic. We went for a salad each and it was probably the worst salad I have ever tasted. It wasn't particularly fresh, the sweetcorn was burnt (who can burn sweetcorn!) and the beetroot just tasted odd. We left most of it. We did have a free continental breakfast which was a pastry and muffin plus a beverage and a small cup of juice. That was the best thing about the market place but I'm not saying that was great either! I thought the prices were too expensive considering the quality of the food. We ate at the Eaton Centre for the rest of our stay! We didn't eat at any other restaurants at the hotel as these were more expensive than the market place and we didn't want to risk wasting our money - although they could have been very nice. We checked out the pool area (which looked very nice, although a little small for the amount of guests) which is on the 26th floor and the cocktail bar on the same floor (which oddly was only open at weekends). We also drank in the bar in the lobby area which (again) wasn't great and I didn't really rate the red wine we had! With all the gripes we had with food the Delta Chelsea was located very well just up from the Eaton Centre and close to subway stations. All in all the Delta Chelsea was OK but I would eat somewhere else during your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: missfendiuk
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, i was upgraded FREE to Deluxe room just because I asked for it and the receptionist said "of course for free"!!!! Also the buffett breakfast was delicious the room was so spacious, comfy and all.. Only thing is although it was deluxe it had no fridge!!!! Location to everywhere is convienent. Staff were friendly too

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: hooverbunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a non-smoking Delta king bed room on the 20th floor. Room was small, but very clean, bathroom was nice, water pressure is good, even when people in the next room were using their water at the same time. Our room had a balcony facing Yonge St, so it was a little noisy at times from the sirens. The staff was really nice and helpful. Heated underground parking in the hotel was $23 a day, but you do get in/out privileges. Some of the parking spots were small, and the corners are very tight (we saw lots of scrapes on the parkade rails and walls). Internet (wired) is $11.95 per day, but being techies, we wouldn't call it high speed. Good enough to check email, but it was so slow when we used it to search for attraction locations and directions. Unfortunately, the hotel is still "upgrading" their cable service, so we only had 30 channels, and 5 of them weren't watchable. A co-worker in a room on the 7th floor had 50 channels, and another co-worker was like us - only 30. Overall, a great place to stay because the rooms were clean, staff was friendly and helpful, many attractions and great restaurants are walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “V Good Hotel for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Swiftly
Reviews.Content: In Toronto for holiday. Stayed 1 night in Delta Chelsea then drove down to Niagara for a couple of nights and then back to Delta Chelsea for 3 nights. First time in Canada and loved it. The hotel was very big and busy (didn't know before hand but the aids conference was on at the time!) but the service was still very good. We were on the 22nd floor but the lifts were quick. The breakfast was fantastic. Ate in the market place one night for a quick pizza which was ok as it had been a long day and we wanted something quick to eat. (Although it really annoyed me that I couldn't take a bottle of beer bought in the market place back to my room.) Ate in the restaurant which had a nice (relatively) expensive menu for adults but the childrens menu was unbelievably rubbish e.g. peanut butter & jelly sandwhich!! Maybe children do not normally eat in the restaurant but we ended up ordering a meal off the adult menu. Rooms are not big but are fine (2 adults plus 1 child) Request refurbished room. Overall very Good. (ps Slide in swimming Pool was great.) Location good.

Reviews.Title: “what a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: djlcais
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference in Toronto - discounted rooms for conference attendees were available at the King Edward - a high-end historic hotel - the type of hotel I usually frequent . Based on reviews from Tripadvisor, I passed on the King Edward (the $30.00 breakfast troubled me) I booked a deluxe room at the Delta Chelsea instead. Wow - the room was 167.00 and similar to rooms in New York that I have spent 450.00 per night at. Very comfortable bed, modern, clean, gorgeous bathroom. Discovered that I had left my cell phone charger at the airport during security check - called housekeeping, they told me to come down to their office - two members of the housekeeping staff personally assisted me in finding a charger from the Lost-and-Found that would fit my Verizon phone. Nice, quick, inexpensive restaurant for breakfast. This is a big hotel, but the elevators are fast and I never waited more than 60 seconds - great treadmills in the fitness center on the upper floor. I am in Toronto three or four times a year - generally stay at the Suttton Place Hotel which is quite nice - but not nearly as nice a room as a deluxe room at the Delta Chelsea - and the DC is much cheaper. I have a new favorite hotel in Toronto - I'll be back at the Delta Chelsea

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: brad2103
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is ideally situated for sightseeing in Toronto. The hotel is extremely comfortable and offers a wide variety of restaurants (five all together) so we were spoilt for choice! The rooms were very comfortable, and the staff more than helpful. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: I got this hote through Priceline as a 3 star hotel. Some publications put it as 4 star. I would rate it as 2.5 at most, that is if most of the rooms are like mine. For the rate I got, I am not complaining, but if I had to pay the going rate, I would have. The positives are that it is centrally located. I flew into Toronto and took the bus and subway. It got me here in about an hour. I think that is even faster then the airport shuttles that stop at several hotels. A car is not necessary if you are exploring downtown. The room was on the small side. I would think that if you reserve on Priceline, that is what you get. At check in, I was told I had a non-smoking room, when I got to floor, it stunk from smoke. When I entered the room, it reeked from smoke. I went back to the lobby and was given a room one floor above. While it was a non-smoking room, I could smell cigarette smoke through the vents. The climate control did not work well. All it blew was cold air. The room was clean. The bathroom sink did not drain well. As with other large downtown hotels, you are nickel and dimed for just about everything. To sum it up, I wouldn't mind staying here again if I win the bid on Priceline, but would never book it as my choice for the rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin54
Reviews.Content: We had a really fabulous stay at the Delta Chelsea and would stay again and highly recommend it to all friends, collegues etc

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I had read some bad reviews and was a little concerned about staying here, but my fears were unfounded. I stayed for 7 nights while attending the International AIDS Conference. I noticed many other delegates staying at the hotel while I was there. Yes, the lobby is busy and bustling, but that is no reason to complain! I found it just created a "homely" atmosphere and I was interested to see all the diverse groups of people we had staying there. When I arrived, there was no queue for checking in. The girl at the desk was extremely polite and helpful, and I was able to upgrade my room to one of the Deluxe rooms for only $20/night instead of $45/night. My room was very nice. I was impressed with the redecorating that had been done. Hopefully they will eventually get around to redecorating all the rooms, and the corridors (which were a little worse for wear, but who cares they are just corridors!) The room was serviced beautifully everyday, and I was extremely impressed with the food from the Market Garden and from the Pub. I didn't eat at the Bistro but it looked great as well. The concierge was very helpful, especially with regard to picking my bags up from my room on the day of departure and ordering a limery car to take me to the airport. The hotel is very close to the Eaton Centre, a HUGE shopping mall that I visited a couple of times. There are nice restaurants nearby, and the subway is only one block away. The pool and spa on the top floor was nice, and hardly ever busy. I had a relaxing swim and nobody was in the pool or the spa at the same time as me. The gym also looked good although I didn't get around to trying it out. I was very happy with the hotel and feel that many of the people writing the bad reviews are just TOO PICKY!! There is really no need to complain about some of the things they were moaning about, I honestly think some people have ridiculous expectations! I found the staff to be friendly and courteous at all times - perhaps they are rude when guests have a bad attitude?!! I would happily stay at the Delta Chelsea again, and would recommend it to anybody. It sure does seem like a great place for families, I'm sure my boys would have loved the water slide and the kids area.

Reviews.Title: “An Expensive Headache”
Reviews.Author: worker1bee
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Delta Chelsea Hotel in Toronto - the service and policies are very poorly advertised, written, and clarified to incoming customers and don't reflect well on its 4 star rating. I arrived at Gerrard Street after a 10 hour drive to be greeted by hotel workers protesting their recent suspensions. I needed a police escort to enter the garage to park my car. Hotel desk staff ignored the situation out front, and pretended it didn't exist. The receptionist I dealt with lied about the quoted balance being charged to my credit cards that day. I wasn't informed about the hotel policy of requiring an additional $200.00 deposit at check in time. I found out about this when checking out and reviewing my bill. (The hotel staff and management I dealt with wouldn't provide a paper statement verifying this fact at check in. You are forced to check your credit card history / activity for the hotel's charges to your credit card.) While most of the desk staff are personable and professional, there are employees who need updating and retraining in customer relations. Food from the restaurants and room service is of average quality - very disappointing for the expense incurred. Although this is a very convenient location to shops and other attractions, it borders a seamy section of the city. I wouldn't recommend walking near the Yonge Street entrance after 9:00 pm at night - many street people congregate in the area with questionable activity occurring. Travel buses also arrive continually at the hotel - the lobby resembles Union Station, with staff difficult to find. I discovered there is a communication disconnect (miscommunication) occurring between AAA in the U.S., CAA in Canada, and the hotel regarding reservation policies, etc. AAA recommended this hotel, but I wouldn't visit or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Delta Chelsea hotel”
Reviews.Author: robbycox
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Delta Chelsea hotel in down town Toronto, and did all the touristy things whilst in the city, visited C.N. tower, a Blue Jays baseball match, a behind the scenes Rogers stadium tour, shopped â€˜till we dropped in the Eaton Center and walked for miles and miles in the underground â€œpathâ€� shopping malls that are under the city! On the saturday there was the Caribana festival parade and there was an influx of guests to the Delta Chelsea that were obviously in town just for the festival, over the weekend the hotel corridors seemed to be the place to party for some reason. We had to, unfortunately, call the hotel front desk twice over the weekend in the early hours of the morning, to ask them to send security to stop the noise from the corridors. Don't get me wrong, i like to party, but this was at 02:30 in the morning and we'd had some very fun and busy days touring the city so we needed to sleep. Not an unreasonable request! Admittedly upon my asking securiy was sent and after each time things did quieten down for a little while. Some of the other guests aside, the hotel itself we really enjoyed, friendly and helpful staff, the food in the market place restaurant was suberb with a wide array of reasonably priced dishes ranging from snacks to meals. The room we were alocated had recently been refurbished and was clean and tidy. Housekeeping was always done to the highest standard. All in all i'd probably recommend the Delta Chelsea hotel, just not on the Caribana weekend unless you actually want a few sleepless nights!

Reviews.Title: “Pool was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Small_family_mom
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel in large part because of the pool with a tube slide and because it promoted itself as kid-friendly. The pool was much smaller than it looked in the photos. It was crowded and the water seemed a bit cloudy. My daughter did the slide once. Other aspects of the hotel were okay. It was a block from a subway station. The room was fine but generally ordinary. Basically, it wasn't anything special and if we go to Toronto again, we'll try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: rchanning
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Delta Chelsea hotel .and was very satisfied with my room and the service I received. The room was spacious and clean and the two restaurants in the hotel offered good choices at a reasonable price. There is a wonderful pool and healthclub on the top floor of the hotel with a great view of the city The hotel is very centrally located close to the subway, and shopping and some good restaurants. I was very impressed with the friendly efficient service I received from all members of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Petalle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the hotel this Sunday. I had read some bad reviews before I left and was really worried, so I was very pleasantly surprised. Our room was a bit old fashioned but clean and well looked after. There were lots of little extras, like a washing line in the bathroom for swimming costumes, ice for buckets, towels for swimming etc. which we have not had in other places. We found the elevators easy to use and very quick. The children's pool was crowded but fun, and I often had the adult pool to myself for ten minutes. It was never crowded and the adult changing rooms had a spinner which dried costumes, plus shower gel, shampoo, hand lotion, hair gel etc. We loved the bustle of the hotel, found the staff very friendly and helpful; there was always someone to go to if needed. The food in the Market Garden was great. I looked forward to my meals every day. Our room overlooked Yonge Street, including Zanzibars's an adult club, but it all added to the atmosphere of staying in a big city and the lights at night were spectacular. We did have a problem with our toilet cistern and condensation soaking our bathroom floor and were disappointed when they forgot to put it right one day but when we got back to them it was sorted in ten minutes. There was easy access from the hotel to the efficient transport system. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: Tripticket
Reviews.Content: I know Delta Chelsea makes a great deal out of the "Family" appeal of its property but I wasn't that impressed. The good: The rooms were nicely decorated with a modern "crate and Barrell" feel. Beds were very comfortable. The bad: Very expensive for what you get. Family Pool is very very small and packed. Total chaos. Kids (910 & 7) liked the corkscrew slide but pretty standard if your kids have ever gone on a water slide before. They only did it twice. Our third child (4) was intimidated by all the craziness in the family pool area. They do not have a shallow area where a toddler can stand sit, etc. When they say "kiddy pool" I'm not sure what they mean becuase there is not kiddy pool around as the family pool is 3.5 feet deep. DO NOT go here just for the pool draw. Not worth it. Parking lot underground is like 5'4" so your suv/van may not fit. You could valet park for $29 a day (plus tip) or, as I did, park in the adjacent (to main lobby) lot for $20 for 24 hours. The hotel staff were professional if a bit impersonal (to be expected on a packed weekend in a big city). No real smiles except for the bellman. You sort of have to fend for yourself here. There are a million elevators for all different floors and the lobby was chaotic with seemingly the entire visiting population staying here. Elevators were small and took forever - you could not fit a luggage cart in the guest elevators - so you either have to have the bellman take it up - or you carry it piece by piece. Rooms were a bit small but very nice, phone reservations promised up a king and pullout couch, but we got two doubles. Lukewarm water in the showers but they did give a $70 rate reduction for the trouble. Views are just ok. Next time I think we will stay in a hotel ouside of the city like Missagua or Oakville and save a bit. Hockey Hall of Fame is very well done. If you like Hockey at all - you will love the hall of fame. Get to kiss the Cup.

Reviews.Title: “SICK???, TOO BAD !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: homeisniagarafalls
