Reviews.Content: I arrived in Toronto on July 18'th, on a last minute flight. I was to have surgery at one of the Hospitals, and with a few extra minutes to spare, I went straight to the hotel to book a room. The Chelsea had been recommended by the Hospital staff who told me that you will get a discount if you are a patient (ie: out of town guests with medical proof). As I was checking in, I explained that I was here for surgery and was wondering what discount applied. The young man then told me (with not a very nice look in his eyes), "that's too bad, because we are running at slightly more than half capacity, so we don't have to offer any discount". I left it at that, but I am hoping that the thousands of people who travel to Toronto for medical reasons will bypass this hotel, and for all the thousands of Hospital staff not to recommend this very cruel hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All in all -- OK”
Reviews.Author: dcbarg1974
Reviews.Content: Well ... there's good and bad here. The good first. Very well appointed rooms, updated furniture, essentially pretty clean, comfortable beds, and plenty of eating options. And, for $159 CAD for a hotel in the center of a major city like Toronto, we were rather happy with our choice. But .. with the good comes the bad, and there is some of that here too. The lobby area was virtually always crowded, with scores of people coming and going in a somewhat small space. There was a stain on our comforter. And the concierge -- probably given the number of people seeking help -- was a little less than interested in helping, and gave us some pretty lousy advice. So... worth the stay if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great staff and fine restaurants....”
Reviews.Author: Car Keys
Reviews.Content: Our accommodations were one of the updated rooms; very pleasant and just large enough to suit us. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly or more helpful, so for our next trip to Toronto, we will be sure to book back into the Delta Chelsea, which is also very centrally located. From the hotel we were able to walk to many Toronto points of interest and had just a 10 minute drive to the harbor front. The hotel has some very good restaurants (the breakfast brunch served at their Market Place Restaurant patio is a great way to start the day) and several comfortable lounges (their Elm Street Lounge is the perfect place to wind down at the end of a hot summer's day), but we also discovered the greatest little Italian restaurant just outside the hotel's Elm Street exit, named, quite appropriately, 35 Elm Street. In fact, there are several very good restaurants on the stretch of Elm Street directly opposite the hotel. With so many fine places to dine at the hotel or very close by, and with shopping just around the corner at Eaton Place, we hardly had to use our rental car. Everything about the Delta Chelsea Hotel contributed to a very enjoyable and relaxing week in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified 3-Star, Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an unrenovated room on the 21st floor which was definitely not of 4-star calibre. First, the overall atmosphere of the hotel is hectic and dated at best, dinghy and rundown at worst. My room had several small problems which added up to a highly dissatisfactory stay considering this is supposed to be a business-standard hotel. The smoke detector was hanging from a wire, the TV was old and small, the door handle on the extremely rundown screen door leading to the balcony had been broken off, there were spots on the glasses, the counterspace in the bathroom was not sufficient for two people, the in-room movies were offline due to being "upgraded" for the duration of my 3 day stay, there was no minibar or 24 hour room service, no in-room internet available for pay or otherwise and the decor was extremely dated. The service was also not particularly good. I received no assistance when entering the hotel (no doorman, bellman or automatic doors) and was not offered help with my luggage when I checked in at the front desk. I couldn't believe this oversight considering I was visibly struggling with a large suitcase, garment bag, carry-on and large computer bag (I was in the process of moving). Overall, I got the impression that this was a glorified 3-star hotel and not a 4-star as the Delta chain is known for. The amenities are there but the service, room quality and atmosphere of the public areas are poor and very dated in comparison to other major business hotels in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Taf1426
Reviews.Content: Checked out of the Delta Chelsea on on 6/18/06. I booked my room via hotwire for $68 per night. The hotel offers the old rooms & remodeled rooms. Make sure you inquire as to which room you will receive. The front desk offered an upgrade to the remodeled rooms for an additional $30 per night. I opted to keep the the old room with the carpet stains and shower grout that look like it had not been cleaned in years. Except for these 2 problems the room was maintained. The hotel is a in a great location. It's a block away from the subway station and around the corner from Eaton Centre (shopping). The Airport Express shuttle stops at this hotel which is a plus for getting to Pearson airport. They offer restaurants, night club and pub on site which was nice if you did not want to leave the hotel. I would book this hotel again, but I would not pay $150 fee I've seen on other websites for an old room. When I checked out I did not owe the hotel any money, yet they still have $100 holding on my credit card. I had to contact the Delta Chelsea for them to inform me that they keep a hold on my credit card for 3-4 business days after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “why the jump in price?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times in the past. That was due to good service and reasonable prices. The rooms are on the small side but we were given a reasonable rate and now looking at the rates they have almost doubled or more. Is there new management here? What is going on? A lot of the rooms have become very dated and certainly not in the best shape recently. We have always loved the treatment in the past from staff--very accommodating but this hotel does not warrant the rates recently indicated. I like going there because of nostalgia but the prices are really not in line with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay.”
Reviews.Author: johnboy007
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was no queues We stayed for three nights and stayed in the signature rooms we found them to be very comfortable, but a bit smaller than we thought. We used the gym and pool a few times we liked the signature lounge where we could go for a drink, breakfast or nibbles when we wanted too. We had a pleasent stay its an ideal base to get to from airport and close to shops.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds!”
Reviews.Author: amz470
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 evening. Check-in was a little longer than expected but the lobby was really busy! My travel partner said this wasn't unusual for this hotel. Location is great as it is accessible to everything (we were there to shop)! We stayed in a newly renovated room which was very clean and tidy. The new beds are fantastic! Overall, considering you're downtown you would never know because it seemed relatively quiet. Parking is much too expensive but I don't know if you'd find it much different anywhere else downtown. Check-out was super easy and quick! A very nice hotel to stay in and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Like Sleeping in an Airport”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At 1,600 plus rooms, this is Canada's largest hotel . . . and they're proud of that. The place is reasonably filthy and certainly chaotic. The wait for room service at 07:30 was a casual ONE HOUR. Avoid at all costs. It's truly awful.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in the heart of downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Labatt
Reviews.Content: While some of the reviews were critical, I liked staying at this hotel. It is a large, downtown hotel, and it has that urban hotel feeling. I was in one of the unrenovated rooms, and while the floor is a bit worn around the edges, it was clean and well maintained, and perfectly adequate. The hotel's staff gave very good service. While I don't have children, it would be a great place for kids -- the kids pool area, complete with huge water slide, would keep them very entertained. If my nearly 7-year-old nephew had been with us, we never would have gotten him out of it. The hotel also has an excellent fitness area, really comparable to some private gyms. I was very pleased with the hotel, and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: amylynn83
Reviews.Content: Our room was around $320/night. For that price, you'd think that they'd have free wireless or a continental breakfast...even parking. If you stay here, you'll pay for everything (you're better off at a Ramada or Days Inn). Parking was $23 for 24 hours (we'd already parked next to the hotel and since we had to move our car, we ended up paying for parking twice - at the lot beside the hotel and then for the hotel). The rooms are nice, but plain. You're not gaining anything by staying here. The location is excellent but that's about the only advantage.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Fearful
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were guests of the hotel from May 5-May 11, while he attended the International Trademarks Conference (I.N.T.A.). For the purpose of context, we have been to Toronto multiple times and have stayed at the Intercontinental, the Park, the Mariott, the Metropolitan, Manual Life Suites, etc. The Delta was an official I.N.T.A hotel; Privilege check-in/out and a recently refurbished room were part of the reservation package. We had an I.N.T.A. rate of $214.00 This is an extremely large facility and a busy one. We found the mainfloor public spaces to be crowded and frenetic. It was a challenge making our way to the elevator. Once on our room floor, the atmosphere was positively tranquil. Our room, on the 17th floor, faced Bloor, a very busy street with lots of foot and automobile traffic. We heard nothing, except when we opened the door to the balcony. The sliding door with screen was a nice touch and we liked the ability to get some "fresh" air. Bedding was terrific-great down pillows, comforter, and linen. The TV was in an akward location- instead of looking forward, we had to look to our left. Coffeemaker and complimentary coffee and tea in the room but no fridge. The bathroom was fairly standard. Housekeeping was spotty. Not all surfaces were wiped down daily and staff several times forgot to leave us coffee, mouth wash, and shampoo. A sorry looking dying yellow rose was not replaced during our stay. We liked the hotel's location. We enjoy walking and appreciated that the hotel is midway between Bloor and the convention centre and just off Younge. We never used room service and ate in the hotel only once. Breakfast at the market garden restaurant is dubiously noteworthy for its institutional food and lack of grace.There are, however, several restaurants on Elm, beside the hotel. Adega, a Portugese fish place was very good for dinner. The bottom line for these reviews is ultimately, would one stay again. The answer is that, providing prximity to a particular location was not essential (the courthouse, for example), we likely would.

Reviews.Title: “Always superb at the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: MsManda
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the DC on two occasions once in an premier room and second time in the signature club area. We found it really excellent and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Checkin can get a little crazy in the evenings especially with the mound of airline crews checking in (Lufthansa, Japan Airlines, Austrian, Cathay) But its interesting to see all the different crews. Lifts are situated all around (We got stuck in one at 5 months pregnant and we were out in less than a minute, they were so compassionate!) The rooms are so clean and you get ice in your room and a bathrobe which is a really nice touch. There is also a turn down service in the evenings with a little weather summary for the next day and a chocolate. We are pretty low maintenance being Irish goverment middle managment but we thought these were lovely extras. The swimming pool and solarium were excellent with towels provided. We didn't eat in the hotel that much as it was a wee bit pricey for us, there were plenty of ethnic restaurants nearby. We did order room service one night ( our arrival night) and it was reasonably priced. There is also a coffee maker inthe room. There is a TV but I must say that Canadian TV is so repetitive, they would make a news story out of a paper bag, they would have an outside broadcast van at the opening of a new door. we were going potty!! Nothing that the DC could have helped but maybe a couple of international channels to reflect their wide client base? we were watching a US show that was out here three years ago. The signature club was excellent, there is tea and coffee and snack/smorgasbord to get tucked into. The staff are really interested in all the guests and it is a really nice place to read a paper and relax. No children allowed which was a bonus then but not now! We also met the same guests on our second stay as we did on our first which was nice. It is also really centrally located with exits on Gerrard, Dundas, Bay and Yonge. My husband has told me to add that it is very close to Zanzibar which may interest some of you roving batchelors! There is also some really good shops on Yonge for music Sam the music man and HMV. Staff are exceptionally well trained from checkin to concierge everyone had a smile and nothing was too much trouble. Almost in a old world charm way. The staff had remembered us from our last trip and gave us some little goodies which is hard to fathom in a hotel of the size and client base. The Delta Chelsea is very hard to beat, it is centrally located and has great facilities. The staff are the best I've ever seen and we will certainly be going back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days and while I agree it was dissapointing that the adult facility was closed they had signage in various areas throughout the hotel and when I made the reservation I was informed of the closure. When the centre did reopen it was beautiful. Very nice views and the equipment is top notch. The rooms were newly renovated so judging from the other reviews we must have gotten lucky with the new room. The room still even smelled new. I really enjoyed my stay at the Chelsea and would recommend it for anyone. Hopefully you get a new room.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a try”
Reviews.Author: jeffgoods
Reviews.Content: Hotel has been in Toronto for some time, but our room was updated and redecorated with all new stuff. I'm not sure the AC worked but we liked the small balcony and a screen on the sliding door unit. Bedding was nice. Our room was not too big. Top floor adult pool and gym was very nice (no kids allowed). Note that this pool was out of service for some time and effected our stay for 2 days. They moved the adult swimming down to the family pool which cut in on kids swim time. Family pool and hot tub was not very big and was very busy when the slide was open. We complained and they adjusted our room rate. We were also not told that the slide is only open from 4 to 8pm. Parking is underground for $23.00 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: gammij
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Toronto. We have two kids and they loved the place. The swimming pool with water slide was really cool for the kids and my wife and I. The hot tub and the sauna in the changing room really helped us to relax. We upgraded to a premier room. After reading the reviews here I was a little aprehensive so when they told me that the room had just been re done I took the upgrade. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed was comfortable and the balcony offered a great view of the city. I did have to stop the kids from hitting the railing because it reverberated up and down the rooms. We were on the 23rd Floor so street noise was minimal. The location is great, just a quick jump to the subway and the Eaton Centre, Chinatown is a quick walk as are the markets. If you have kids I highly recommend the Ontario Science Centre. That place rocks. I will definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time !!!!”
Reviews.Author: beathogs
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Toronto as a single traveller and booked this hotel as part of a package deal before I read some of the terrible reviews about the rooms etc. En route to the hotel I was quite apprehensive about what I would find but my concerns proved to be unfounded. After checking in I discovered that my room had already been allocated and made my way back down to reception to sort it out. Perhaps they were expecting me to complain or perhaps the staff were genuinely being helpful but they upgraded my room and accompanied me there to make sure it was acceptable. I stayed in a premier room with 2 double beds on the 7th floor and it was lovely, clean, well aired, spacious and obviously renovated quite recently. Ok so the view wasn't great but I didn't plan on spending my holiday gazing out of the hotel window. I don't understand why someone would leave a hotel and write a terrible review if they were unhappy about the size of the room when all it would take to change this would be a polite conversation. The hotel is massive but all of the staff that I had dealings with were polite and efficient. I ate breakfast at the hotel and found that there was a wide variety to choose from and it was reasonably priced. All of my sightseeing and shopping was done on foot from the hotel which is situated in an ideal location for shops and tourist attractions. Concierge staff assisted me to book excellent seats at the Princess of Wales theatre to see the Lord of the Rings which was amazing. Overall this is a big, busy hotel with excellent ameneties in an excellent location and don't be put off by some of the reviews. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Delta Chelsea and would not hesitate in recommending it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kizzi32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea with our two children aged 4 & 7 in April 06. THE ROOMS: I would have to agree with other reveiws in regards to the rooms, they were not very spacious and a little tierd looking, and we did get a lot of street noise, however the cleanliness of the hotel/room was good. You could probaly comare the rooms to your 'Travel Lodge' standard in the UK. LOCATION: The hotel is located in a great location for shopping and the Eaton centre is close by. It very easy to get to all the main areas/attractions and the 'College' subway connection is very close, and very easy and cheap to use (far better than the London Underground). There are some excellent dining places in easy walking distance. FACILITIES: The hotel is a good place to stay if you have children as the Kids Swimming Pool is flexible on the opending hours, and has a fun waterslide for kids that can swim approx '20m', it also has a large jacuzzi that our boys enjoyed. The childrens play area is staffed by really friendly and fun staff who could not have been more helful, and you can leave the children in there for up to 2 and half hours for a nominal fee of just under app. Â£1.25 per hour!, while you have some 'you' time or go for a swim in the 'Adults' only pool upstairs, This is a nice area and has great veiws over the City and the CN Tower, the gym equiptment is set up so you have the best veiw and there is a pool and Jacuzzi too. The Childrens play area also organises a fun games night for the kids at the weekend and has a movie night. HOTEL DINING: During our stay the staff were very friendly and the food was of a good standard with a good breakfast buffet in the 'Bb33' restaurant. However the 'Market Garden' self service dining area is somewhere best avoided unless you are in a rush, as the staff there could have done with a customer service course!.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel2006
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for business purposes a few times, most recently in January 2006. Pros- -Central downtown-you can walk to most major attractions; subway is walking distance -has a fitness centre and pool for adults and general pool/waterslide for kids -service is good Cons -Rooms are average, nothing spectacular. Some are being renovated -From your room you can hear street noise...the hotel is on a major street in Toronto It's not a bad hotel to stay in if you want to be in central Toronto

Reviews.Title: “great customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea in jan 2006. The staff were incredibly help full making sure that our holiday went without a hitch. I had read lots of negative reports about the hotel and was slightly aprehensive about staying here. I can't believe that people could write these things. This hotel is in a perfect situation if you love to shop, everything is in comfortable walking distance. Monachs Bar is a must on a friday night i've never seen anything like it!!!!!!!!!! I can't wait to come back..

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: UncleMike
Reviews.Content: I booked myself and some work colleagues into this hotel over January / February 2006. The surprising thing is how much the "basic" $150 rooms can vary. A few (such as room 2407 !!) have a balcony, a good view of the CN Tower and Dundas Square. But most are tiny, barely big enough to house a double bed, and in dire need of renovation. And, although you can request one of the larger rooms, they can't guarantee you'll get one. So you could find you'll check in and be left with a claustrophobic room. For the final of our three weekends in Toronto, I'd had enough, cancelled our reseration. My room at the Delta was tiny, over-heated, and you couldn't open a window or cool the room down at all. I paid an extra $10-$15 per room per night extra and stayed in the Marriott Courtyard instead. In comparasion, it's a thing of beauty! It's just up the road (College Street subway, still on Yonge) but the rooms are big, spacious, up-to-date rooms, one queen or two double beds per room, and (gasp) enough staff to efficiently handle checking in and out quickly. And you get in-room internet free of charge. The downside: well, the Marriott Courtyard's swimming pool is tiny, and not a patch on the family-friendly pool at the Delta. But it actually feels like a place you WANT to come back to after a hard day of exploring !! The Delta Chelsea maybe the biggest, but it needs to seriously spend some money to become the best. Avoid. Michael, Bristol, UK

Reviews.Title: “Desperatly needs renovation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nickypoo
Reviews.Content: Carpet stained badly, small room high price much better hotels can be found for the money. Sad to say but the Delta Chelsea belongs to a bygone age and is riding on its repution that it no longer deserves. No upgrades available for "Delta Privilege" members, I will not be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Going Downhill Fast”
Reviews.Author: GR_Traveling_Guy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Delta Chelsea on many previous trips, and have always been delighted. This past trip was a huge disappointment. The owners are allowing this property to go downhill fast. The rooms were generally rundown. We had one suite and one double room. Some of the furniture was simply deplorable -- stained, scratched, marked, and otherwise broken down. We had a kitchenette in the suite, but no table or chairs at which to eat. Walls were heavily marked everywhere. The balconies were filthy. EVERYTHING needed painting. The self-serve restaurant was mediocre, and the furniture very rundown. The doormen and the bellmen are the laziest I have seen anywhere. I never saw them help one person with luggage. We definitely would not stay here again. There are far better places in Toronto at the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “Descending house”
Reviews.Author: MrT097
Reviews.Content: Checked in the Delta Chelsea for my first stay in TO. Although I stated clearly, that I liked a room away from lift or icecubers, I got a room near a vending machine area. Very noisy. The room itself was worn but clean. Balcony was walkable but full of pigeon's droppings. Some of the wallpaper was falling down in the bathroom. Housekeeping was ok, but forgot making up the room on new year's day. Breakfast is too expensive, you can have better and cheaper breakfast at College Center, which is half a block away. Concierge desk is busy round the clock, best way to get tickets is via telephone. Gym and spa were very busy and for that reason not that clean. I booked the hotel via a travel agent in Germany, got a really good price. Once again: you get what you pay for, don't expect too much from the Delta Chelsea. Next time in TO I will surely stay in a hotel near Queen or King.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all interested in customers once booked in.”
Reviews.Author: TAYLORKANE
Reviews.Content: After traveling to Toronto for some 21hrs with airport delays we arrived approximatley 21.00HRS, No one helped with the luggage or even greeted us at the entrance. Once we had booked in we made are way to the room on the 21st floor, very noisey with sirens and traffic going by most of the evening and early hour of the morning.Carpets were very dirty in the hotel room we were given, also windows curtains and doors very dirty. We enquired about holiday entertaiment only to be informed that their were no entertaiment for guests as it was a quite periode and they had closed all the bars over the Christmas holiday,Only one tree was the christmas decor,no other holiday decor. When we enquired about entertainment in the only bar open on Christmas eve the bar tender said his manager would allow him to stay open after midnight if it got busy.In general no personel at the hotel spoke to us at all during are stay, no enqireys were made to how we were enjoying are stay, or if they could help in any way. On leaving the hotel we got are own taxi and carried are own luggage to that cab, The doorman said on us getting into the cab, I hope you enjoyed your stay and hope you return again. My replie, I don't think so and i will be sure to tell all my Friends in England the same.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ealingtraveller
Reviews.Content: Read some bad reviews about this hotel but was pleased when we arrived. We only waited a couple of minutes to check in & upgraded to a signature room which wasn't to expensive & included breakfast in the signature lounge. The room was well decorated & clean. The pool on the top floor was o.k. The bars were fine but quite expensive. I would stay there again but only in one of the signature rooms as the reviews for the standard rooms is not great

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: CarolSkid
Reviews.Content: For anyone who is looking to shop in Toronto, then the Delta Chelsea is very central to all ameneties. The Eaton Centre is just a 5minute walk away. The subway is also close by to get to the Yorkdale shopping centre outside Toronto. Cost just $5c return. We were initially booked into a basic room but upgraded on arrival to a signature room, which we were very impressed with. Newly decorated and with a very sumptious comfy bed! Everyone we met was very helpful and was always aiming to ensure we were happy with everything. Breakfast in the Market Garden on the ground floor was more than plentiful. Lots of choice for young and old, and not too pricey. Didn't have a problem checking in or out as previously stated by others. We were there for 5 nights and never saw queues in reception. Great italian restaurant around the corner of hotel called Frascati, which we would recommend. We decided to get a taxi from the airport which cost $43. The bus is cheaper but it takes nearly 2-3 times as long because of all the stops it makes. It costs an extra $10 one way, well worth the endless stops! Overall found this hotel to be more than expected and would definately recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Lynda21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea In April 2005. It was amazing. The lobby is beautiful and the staff are very helpful. The restaurant has a great selection of meals and snacks, the prices are realistic seeing as this is a major hotel in a major city! The breakfast in BB Bistro is gorgeous. There are cereals,fruit,yoghurts,pastries,muffins,and a wide selection on the cooked breakfast plates. The rooms are not hufe but very clean and temperature is always exactly right. The swimming pool at the top of the hotel is very nice, its great to sit in the jacuzzi whilst looking out over Toronto. And if you are not a swimmer there is a small coffee bar on this floor which serves continental breakfast. All in all I would say this hotel is 5star. Its location is central also which makes it ideal. I loved it so much that i am going back in March 2006!

Reviews.Title: “"Serious Issues!!"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have went to the Delta Chelsea twice. The first time that we went.. was very nice.. no problems.. we went the next year during March Break.. we were upset .. we waited over 3 hours in chek-in because there were some arguements and problems with a person who came saying that they ahd booked.. I personally wished that they could have had faster service. We went to the the dinner area.. we went for supper.. the kids ordered chicken fingers and fries.. I myself got a burger and fries. The chicken was only 3 peices that were small.. small for infants!! They only had put a few fries on the plate.. My burger was tiny.. Not the best.. Smaller than McDonalds!! When I complained about it tehy did nothing!! We went to the pool, The staff were very unfriendly! in a rough, rude manor and were rude to mty son, 12 when he asked to go on the water slide with a life jacket! Very rude adn nasty. The rooms were okay.. teh blaconies were dark adn dingy.. Terrible! The windows had fingerprints and dust.. Very bad!! Teh TV had no sound and there was nothing good on! WE complained about it but the staff refused to help. They called a man who lives all the way in Chicago about it but he said he would be down in 3 days. Unfortunately for us.. we were leaving in less than three days! I personally would not recommend this place. It's okay the first time.. but if you really check it out there are many flaws that people should not have to deal with on vacation or business!! Not acceptable!! Serious Issues!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but suffers from Wal-Martism”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta Chelsea twice. In the winter of 2004 and 2003. The summer prices for downtown Toronto are unaffordable but there are a lot of good bargains if you can bare the winter blast of Ontario. The first time I stayed at the Delta Chelsea with my best girlfriend for a weekend of shopping. The hotel was close to the Eaton Centre which is the gigantic mall and that is where we ended up spending most of our time due to a sudden blizzard. Our room was warm and the beds were REALLY comfortable. The adult pool area is nice and peaceful with gorgeous night views. The family pool area has a really fun water slide that you really can't pass up. We had a nice shock at check-out. We were under the impression that parking was $25 for the weekend but turned out to be $25/day. The taxes on hotel stays in Toronto are really high and because we booked through Expedia we were not able to get the taxes refunded at the border. We also did not realize that EVERY time we picked up our phone it cost us like $2. We had made lots of local calls trying to find something to do out of the elements and had used calling cards to call home and check messages and what not and had racked up a near tear inducing bill. The PPV selection during our stay was also very grim. We ended up watching The Animal. BLEH. Its sad when a Rob Schneider movie is your best option. The second time I stayed the the DC was with a group of friends (4 of us in total) and we again got the delta room (2 beds) however this time it was much older and grimier. It was quite noisey this time. The Delta Rooms are small and the double room last time was fine but with 4 adults it just doesn't cut it. This time we had gotten a package and parking was supposed to be complimentary however the attendent tried to charge us anyway and it ended up being a big headache and a lot of time wasted. The best thing about the DC was there was ALWAYS a cab out front and there is a ton in the area. Internet cafes, nail salons, record stores, etc etc. If you have a big group and need a block of rooms I'd highly recommend the chelsea, but if you are just a couple or two looking for a getaway I'd definitly seek out somewhere more quaint and personal. Afterall it is the biggest hotel in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday Camp”
Reviews.Author: personwales
Reviews.Content: This is Butlins in the form of a hotel. The hotel is noisy, busy and stressful. Whilst we were there the adult only tiny bar and swimming pool area was being renovated. To get to it you had to go over builder's equipment. The rooms are OK but old and worn. It was so awful that we left early.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: jbberkeleytraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Chelsea for a conference in November 2005. The room I was in was fine, nothing great or terrible. Three flaws stood out during my stay: 1) noise from other hotel rooms carried fairly strongly into our room, which was a bit annoying. 2) The casual cafe on the ground floor has rude staff at the coffee station, and the pastries are horribly expensive (but not very good), even worse than airport prices. 3) The greatest nuisance of the hotel is that not all of the rooms have high-speed internet capability. This means that if your room has it, you can pay $10 (CAN) per 24 hours, but if your room doesn't you have to go to one of two computers in the business center, where you will pay $6/30 minutes, a pretty rotten alternative for business travelers who need to log on several times daily for short periods. I hope that they plan to upgrade all rooms for high-speed use. The concierge service seems inadequate for a hotel of its size, as I was kept waiting for nearly 20 minutes when I had very simple questions, and finally a bellman offered to help (which was very kind of him). On the plus side, the housekeeping staff were attentive and kind, especially as they kept someone from getting into our room to "look for a left-behind jacket" because they knew the man was lying about having stayed in our room the night before!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BMW70
Reviews.Content: It was a bit old in parts of the building, but we have stayed at much worse. Great Restaurant and pool on the 15th floor. We appreciated having a full laundry available, quite a necessity when on a world trip. Very handy to a huge shopping mall on Young Street. Also handy to a reasonably priced e-cafe, also necessary when touring the world. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the older rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ML_BV
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Delta Chelsea for business a few times in the past year and the experience was mostly OK until I got assigned a room in an obviously older part of the hotel (using the Green elevators). On my most recent visit, the room I got was dark and dingy, the carpet and wallpaper dirty or worned out (difficult to tell the difference), the bathtub grey, with a view on a cement wall. I thought that was bad until I woke up in the morning to to find that there was no water pressure in the room. When I was finally able to get in touch with someone (took me 15 minutes of trying the front desk, the operator, housekeeping) I was told that the problem would be fixed in 30 minutes - too late for me to be able to make my morning business meeting. I used bottle water at my expense to clean up. I checked out using once again the deficient express checkout (the bill is rarely ready for pickup downstairs)and no one ever apologized for this very serious incident despite having sent a survey form back to the hotel. If the equipment is in as bad of a shape as some of the rooms, no wonder the hotel experiences technical problems. Since I don't want to risk staying in such a horrible room during my business trips, I am staying in another hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “No Courtyard marriot (Young St)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well as a person who stays in a few hotels for business and also a person who cordinates functions. The delta was no hell. I had complaints from the room, to cost, to housekeeping from all my delegates. Courtyard is where it is at. Oh yes, i almost forgot, Delta = Dial-up and Courtyard = High Speed in rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: crozierio
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Toronto hotels. Don't stay here! Why? well, there is the dirty carpets, unpainted walls and balconies, shoebox sized rooms, outdated decorating and more. And this was after asking for a better room! Take your chances on Hotwire or stay at the Sheraton, Westin, Hav-a-Nap, whatever. I rarely leave bad reviews but I thought I would try to make your Toronto experience better. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always my choice”
Reviews.Author: Curiousquest
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Delta Chelsea 4 times in the past two years and despite its minor annoyances, I always go there again. It's not a luxury hotel but its nice and its a great deal. Pros - Location right on Yonge Street. The premier rooms have balconies that overlook Yonge. Highly recommended. Here's the best part: the hotel has an adults only lounge and pool with a glass roof that overlooks the cityscape. The pool and jacuzzi are nice but smaller. In the summer, the deck is open for tanning, lounging, etc. The view from here is great. Although don't expect to see the CN Tower. The deck faces the opposite direction. Very relaxing though. Rooms are always nice and food in the lobby is pretty good. They have a pretty good spread and variety of dishes. They do have a kids activity center too, with their own pool with slide, etc. Cons - Parking is a wreck! 2 of the 4 times I've been here, we had to wait for a spot in the garage and once there were no spots. But they offered valet parking for the same rate due to the inconvenience. The garage is very small and hard to maneuver even if you have a smaller car. With that said though, they let us keep our car there for 24 hours, even AFTER we had checked out which was sooo convenient. Saved us an additional 17 dollars or so in another lot. The rooms are a decent size but can be a bit claustrophobic which is why we always book the premier rooms. Oh, and check in can be obnoxious. I recommend getting there before check in time, or after, not during. It can be a madhouse. Everytime we go to Toronto, we get so close to booking somewhere else just to try something new, but in the end, we always book with the Delta Chelsea. The reason? We never seem to find a better deal. There ARE minor annoyances. However, in the end, the perks are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad !”
Reviews.Author: Jetstreamartin
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for several nights at this hotel and the best aspect is probably the location. I tried all of the food and drink outlets and the Bistro/Brasserie 33 was definitely the best. The worst was the self service Market Garden at breakfast which was noisy and chaotic. My room was generally OK, clean and comfortable but the windows looked like they hadn't been washed in a year. The pool and leisure areas were very well managed and spotless. The staff throughout were always friendly and helpful, despite having to deal with numerous tour groups who always crowded the lobby with their arrivals and departures. Would I stay there again ? Maybe, but I would check other nearby hotels in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded - Old and dirty - but great with kids !”
Reviews.Author: kikipou
Reviews.Content: If you don't have kids, don't bother reading that review : the hotel is SO crowded, noisy, old fashioned (not vintage : falling appart !) it's like a train station in New York ! Forget it. If you have kids, you might reconsider : they had a ball ! Free popcorn, free animal shaped baloons, THE inside/outside water slide they ride over and over and over / the miniclub so you can go shopping (the great shopping centers are just a block away) / little gifts on arrival and a staff that enjoy your little brats ! But beware : the rooms are small, dirty (not from actual lack of cleaning - stained is more proper), upholstery is fading from exhaustion, bathrooms are even smaller and also dirty looking (though well cleaned by maids). And you are permanently stressed by the flow of tourists - have to wait in line just to get to the elevator. It's a factory ! And it's expensive ! NB : was there in July 2005.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lusk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Delta Chelsea in the middle of September for 5 nights at the start of our trip around Ontario, we were so impressed with this hotel we stayed here on the last night of our trip one week ago. Location is good, didn't feel threatned or unsafe in any way at night in the area around the hotel as some other views have stated. I have to commend the staff very helpful and genuinely friendly, always ready to help with queries we had about Toronto and how to get to certain places. The lobby are was very busy but I felt it added to the character of the place, in no way did I fell it was impersonal or cold. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone, its so good we cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: WilsonFamilyScotland
Reviews.Content: September 26th Husband and wife from Scotland Just returned from a weeks stay at the Delta Chelsea in Toronto I found this hotel excellent value for money.Staff were very polite and helpful. Meals in the Monarch Bar were good value for money and the Market Place Restaurant had a good selection of dishes on their menu. Staff on the front desk were willing to help you with any problem that might occur during your stay. The location of the hotel is ideal for the Eaton Centre and is not far from plenty of restaurants and bars. If my wife and myself ever go back to Toronto this will be the hotel that we would be staying at. Overall an excellent hotel with friendly and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Newtraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Delta Chelsea. Checked in a 4pm and our room was not available until 6pm. The room was clean and quiet. Once our room was available check in was great, as well as check-out. Timing was everything as the lines can be long in this large hotel. There are several restaurants and pubs within the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel so am not sure how the food is. We were at a convention at the hotel and heard from many that the prices in the bars were high. The hotel is convenient to public transportation and within walking distance of many things.

Reviews.Title: “Was clean and very comfortable with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Mr.Babies
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a park and fly coming back from Barcelo Maya Mexico. Very nice, very comfortable and they even have robes for you to use. I recommend it. One of the nicest places I have stayed for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea The Best of Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: wwe_j_b_l
Reviews.Content: We have been here 3 times in the pass because my son had surgery at Sick Kids and wanted to stay near the hospital. They had a special on for the summer. You got addmission for the Canadian National Exabetion, $10.00 Gift Card for Grand and Toy and 1 night accomendation for only $139. The cheapest of most Downtown Hotels. We had a newer room and it was clean and kept up to date. This is the best hotel in Toronto. THe Lunch Buffet and BB3B was great but a little pricy.All the staff were kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, great pool for adults but a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: GroverSmiths
Reviews.Content: Its a big hotel and excellent rooms - particularly if you are in premier plus rooms. Nice modern decor and very comfy duvets. Bathrooms are large and very well appointed. We really enjoyed our stay at the Delta but you need to be aware of the following: a) dont expect individual service. Its a massive hotel with people checking in around the clock. We booked a premier plus room which wasnt available when we arrived. After some discussion, a premier plus room was found... b) there are balconies on a lot of rooms which is great for looking out at the skyline but balconies on the south tower are very very run down. No chairs and dirty. Compared to the room interior - this was very disappointing and the hotel should not be advertising balconies as 'habitable'. c) parking is a nightmare. Even if you have booked into the hotel - there's no guarantee of a parking space and you may need to use a nearby garage d) the adult deck is for adults (not surprisingly) but this is a real shame if you have teenagers with you who would like to swim. There are no facilities for 'proper' swimming on the family deck - merely a pool into which the big waterslide runs. The slide is great fun but it is a shame that there are no other faciliites for teenagers. The family area is much more geared towards young kids (and is very good). The hotel should consider changing the age (perhaps to 14) for clients in the adult pool at particular times. We would stay here again though, for the location (close to all the Yonge St shops and restaurants and Eaton Centre), quality of rooms and the pool and gym but will come back when the children are older!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Delta Chelsea many times. The last was no exception. The central location was perfect for sightseeing and visiting downtown Toronto. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. It is very fine!

Reviews.Title: “Hold on! This is actually an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller-Bajan
Reviews.Content: After reading all the horrible reviews of this hotel, frankly I was scared to go! BUT this hotel was ok, it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. Here's a summary of pros and cons Pros (1) Great location. There are loads of shops and restaurants nearby plus the Eaton centre and the subway. (2) Shuttle service to and from the airport which is cheaper than a taxi. The only thing is the shuttle also stops at other hotels (3) The room is adequate. It was a regular room and it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom also had new fixtures in it. (4) I found the staff generally nice and helpful Cons (1) The lobby is always busy and most times you will find a line to check in/out (2) If you enjoy the hot water shower too much, the steam will actually trigger the alarm. I wasn't there long when it started and front desk knows this is a problem because they could tell me what it was right away (3) SMOKERS WHO USE NON SMOKING ROOMS!! Oh my goodness, this is my absolute gripe because my room was non smoking but it smelt of cigarette smoke. When I contacted house keeping, she explained that this was a problem they had. PLEASE SMOKERS KEEP IN YOUR DESIGNATED AREA Don't be discouraged by reviews of hotels. If the price and location suits you, then try it. Your experience will probably be different to mine or others. I've been to more "high end" hotels and got the same kind of service and room as the Delta Chelsea

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the delta chelsea on gerrard st. my room was premier not the average room it was above average. But when we checked in the room was basically the same as motel 8 on the side of the highway,old carpet,old setup, old bathroom,etc... I mean the ammenities at this hotel where great except the pool which was small and stunk, The very same day that i checked in, i went to see the manager of the hotel and told her that i was very unpleased with the room we received for the amount i was paying and she told me that she would cut my costs in half so i agreed i mean why not right! im downtown right on younge st. paying 99$ a night was worth it but 170$ plus taxes forget about it! overall it was worth the 99$ a night but watch out because the only room that are supposedly nice are the premier plus running from 220$ plus and i think its the only thing that makes the hotel 4 ****'s because the rest sucks! would not stay there again i was just satisfied i was offered a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, Avoid, Avoid”
Reviews.Author: wsjgr
Reviews.Content: If you are seeking a completely average or slightly below average hotel experience, the Delta Chelsea is for you! Set your expectations low and prepare to be underwhelmed. To be fair, I'll start with the positives: - my kids loved the family swimming pool and waterslide. - the adult swim area was top notch with a great view. - the location is great for all the Toronto tourist and shopping sites. - rooms were clean enough although the decor was a bit old/lacking. Hall carpets were dirty. - *some* of the staff were friendly (housekeeping, front desk) Reasons we would never consider going back: - constant room screw ups - room reserved was "out of order" so we were placed in another one night with the promise of the right one the next day. Were told to call back. Did so repeatedly (hours apart) only to be told to call back again because they could not accommodate the request yet. Finally, we were told we would go into a room in the same floor thus avoiding the wretchedly overcrowded elevators - but not for another few hours. Came back from dinner to get into our room. The cheerful front desk person issued me keys which were on a vastly different floor and different set of elevators. Resigned, I trudged up - only to find that someone was in there already! Back to the lobby to wait on line again. Got the right room - not on the same floor again so the family packed everything up, waited for three elevators to find one with enough room, down to the lobby and up the other elevators (similar wait). The room was not worth the trouble. - The crowded elevators make you want to die. - The constantly busy lobby gets tedious to wade through. - We had a surly waiter in one of the restaurants. The front desk clerks, although friendly, couldn't figure out much without constantly confering with the manager. They would go in the back for five minutes at a time, leaving us to scratch our heads and tap on the counter. - All food options are overpriced for the quality and service. - As I guess should be expected for such a large hotel, it was impersonal - kind of like a room off of Grand Central Station. In summary, never again will we stay there. It made for a decidely average experience. I would rather spend a few extra bucks (we spent over $200 for an upgraded room at the Delta) and stay someplace with something charming about it. The prices for food, etc. would not bother us if the quality was there.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights and it was a great experience. Very friendly staff. Very clean. Nice pool area on top of the building. The best place to get your breakfast just cross Yonge Street and thereÂ´s a little Croissanterie. When IÂ´m back in Toronto, I will defenately stay again at Delta Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Delta Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Wendy15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea in Feb 05. Was a bit apprehensive beforehand having read some poor reviews, but the stay was very good. Rooms, clean and comfortfortable and the reception staff and concierge desk could not have been more helpfu. They arranged, trips/car hire and restaurant bookings and remembered our names! Would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: kkinne
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a chance on the Delta Chelsea in Toronto because we love the Delta in Montreal -- but the Toronto version couldn't compare to its sister hotel in Montreal. While there are a number of nice things about the Delta Chelsea (lots of activity, nice lobby, good restaurant, popcorn for the kids at check-in) on balance it just was't that nice. We booked a "suite" which turned out to be two basic connecting rooms with a desk and couch in one of the two rooms. The carpets were torn and the room was old and worn-out. We traveled with our 4 young kids who were excited about the hotel's indoor waterslide. While the water slide was fun, the pool area was dirty and the lifeguards didn't seem to care about water safety. The area around the hotel is a little "seedy", but there is a large mall within walking distance which is nice. If you have an opportunity to stay somewhere else, don't book a room at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea........great hotel-great location”
Reviews.Author: hungryhoss
Reviews.Content: Having just read a few of the negative reviews for the delta chelsea, i have to post this review. My wife and i stayed at the delta in june this year we found the hotel great in all aspects. We both enjoy eating out, shopping and seeing the sights......staying at the delta meant everything in toronto is accessible, the location is PERFECT. The hotel was very busy but staff were helpful and the standards were good. When we visit toronto again.......which we will (fantastic place) we will certainly use this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights as part of a tour of Ontario. Hotel is well situated and reasonably priced for a city centre. Rooms were a good size and clean but perhaps in need of some redecoration. Staff were in the main civil and helpful but we couldn't help but notice that the Reception/Lobby was constantly busy and nowhere near enough staff on duty to deal with the long lines. Hotel facilities were good and there were many good restaurants easily within walking distance. Overall a pleasant stay and I certainly would not rule out using this hotel again if we were in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Taffygirl
Reviews.Content: Why is this hotel talked about in almost every tourist guide? We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a 2 week holiday in Ontario. It was easily the worst hotel of all. The first impression of the lobby was not good... it was like a train station! Extremely busy, long lines and very noisy. We thought we had arrived at a busy time but to be honest I never saw it quiet. This hotel is so huge and anonymous. The staff were pleasant enough but looked stressed most of the time and I don't feel we had any personal attention. The kids pool is good and there are plenty of activities for small children but be warned these areas get very busy! The adults pool was great and there is a bar on 27th floor but it was closed on one of the nights for a private function.The Market Garden restaurant had a good variety of food but again, long lines were very frustrating. We were upgraded to a premium room because there were no standards available, but if this was premium I would not have wanted to stay in standard! Outdated decor, stained carpet and the balcony was awful with peeling paint. The location of this hotel is convenient for subways etc but that's probably the best thing it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: MichaelChristine
Reviews.Content: New to Toronto, and chose this hotel, for our out of town wedding guests. Although we had heard some negative things about this Delta Hotel, due to a convention in town, we were in somewhat of a bind. We had many of our guests stay at another hotel, but we had to book the last 5 rooms at the Delta. What a disaster. The hotel is overcrowded, dated, thus requiring a huge facelift. Also, the staff is extremely under trained. Overall, I would give this place 2 Stars. This is being generous. Only the location and price, which is excellent, is preventing my rating as a 1 Star. There are many better choices in Toronto. Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “we had good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we booked two adjoining Delta class rooms and stayed for 8 nights at a negotiated rate of $149 pr pn. Yes its busy and not that personal but we expected that as its a very very large hotel. The rooms were fine and if you show respect and tip the room cleaners they will keep you supplied with all the tea/coffe/toiletries and bottled water you could possibly use. lots written already about this hotel so will only add that the concierge is extremly useful and helped me get a good deal on a hire car. The hotel is a brilliant location for all downtown attractions. i encourage anyone to use the buses and subway trains, they are cheap easy clean and safe. Finally the buffet meal option in the hotels BB Bistro is excellent value all you can eat and above average quality that you would normally get. In Summary - good hotel base for Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Basically the hotel is very nice, 4* in every way. The parking was $22 canadian which wasn't too bad. Parking across the street in a lot was $20 so I think their parking was reasonable. We only stayed one night. The hotel is well located, just off Yonge street which is "the street" in Toronto. We walked around the city and then came back and went for a swim in the pool on the 27th floor. The hottub has a view overlooking the downtown skyscrapers including the CN tower. Later that night I took my camera back up to take some night photos and I got some great photos. Overall if you get this hotel you will not be disappointed!! Some additional notes: internet is an extra $11/day (didn't get it), contental breakfast is $11 (we skipped this and went to a coffee shop). They had some reasonably-priced food like a giant slice of pizza for around $5. We ate at Swiss Chalet which was cheap and good. Don't laugh. :) Finally, we got this hotel through priceline for $80 so if you get it at a good price it's a good deal but I can't judge it for its value since we didn't pay "retail" price.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Dump!”
Reviews.Author: connect2source
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel because my experience at other Delta Properties had been quite good. Upon arrival I noticed that the glass doors were filthly, always a bad sign. I had booked a "premier room" as a just in case insurance policy, so expected at least a clean updated room. After a speedy check in, I arrived on the ninth floor via the Red Elevators, upon exiting, I immediately noticed that the decor was dated, worn, sort of run down 1987 ish, as I approached my room, the carpet I walked on was horribly worn with huge dark stains everywhere. I questioned whether this was still a Delta property as it looked more like a Motel 6. Upon entering my room, the dissappointment intensified. The room decor followed run down, worn and soiled 80's theme and had musty, mouldy odour. The carpet , of course was very soiled, the linings under both airchairs were hanging to the floor, the bedspreads were stained and the blankets were so soiled that I removed them and threw them in the closet as I feared catching something if I so much as touched them. I deceided to check out the patio which lacked any furniture, was covered in bird droppings and had peeling paint everywhere. I noted the lack of a mini bar or fridge which I become accustomed to at Delta properties, I decided to call for the possibility of obtaining a fridge. I was told there was a waiting list. The Bathroom was in fair condition but had a urine smell and was quite mouldly. As I unpacked i dropped a small item under to bed, when I retreived it, I noticed food debris everywhere under both beds, chips, crumb, hair etc. Upon returning from a dinner in closeby Yorkville, I noticed that housekeeping had brought me a fridge. In keeping with the revolting standards of this propertiy , they had placed the small bar fridge upon a wooden box which was damp and covered in mould. I've complained and written to Delta, I have yet to hear a response but anyone connected with this chain, which is owned by Fairmont Hotels should be ashamed and appalled. Avoid this one at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Older but okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night. The hotel was busy. Everyone working there was helpful and courteous. The rooms are a bit outdated but clean. The kids pool area was great. My kids loved the slide. You get what you pay for. Was it the best I've stayed at? No. Neither was it the worst. The parking garage was cramped. Kind of hard to move a mini-van around in. The rooms are on the small size.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Delta wherever I go, just because I know I'll generally get great service, a decent room and a pretty good price. I'm a Delta privilage member which is a good thing for this hotel as the front desk was a zoo! As a Delta Privelege member, you get the express check in line which had nobody in it. This hotel has 2000 rooms, so the front area is very busy all the time. Checking In: Check in was great, but, upon arriving to our room we noticed it was SOMEONE ELSE'S! Bags etc laying around. Shocked, we rushed back downstairs and were immediatly upgraded with two free breakfast coupons for the next day. The staff were very apologetic and said the room looked unoccupied in the computer. Not a big deal, but, I'm hoping they notified the person staying in that room! What if we walked in on something ;) The Room: The room was a newly renovated room and it was fantastic. Very comfy bed, very clean and smelled brand new. The cleaning staff were extremely friendly; always saying hi in the hallways and have a good day. One lady even left me a thank you note for leaving her a tip. Dining: The restuarant food was pretty good, but the service was not! The first breakfast we had at EB's (buffet) completely ignored us. We didn't get our coffee until after we were done and even had to go find her. Our plates were never cleared inbetween trips and they were quite rude. This was also noticed by the staff in the main resturant (forget the name). The restaurant/lounge on the 27th floor was an a great place to unwind and relax with a decent view. Pools: They have two pools here.. One for kids, and one for adults (with a tanning deck on the roof). Both pools looked decent. Location: The location was fantastic. Right in the heart of everything, and a short cab ride anywhere in the downtown core. They had a festival going on across the street during one evening and it was a 2-3 minute walk to go see what was going on. Right off Young street with lots of shopping and things to keep you occupied if you are sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Delta Chelsea was terrible from the very beginning. Upon check in I was repeatedly told (3 times) by the person at the front desk that I reserved a room with 2 double beds when I had reservation paperwork that clearly stated my reservation was made for a room with a king size bed. After that situation the person at the front desk sent me to the wrong set of elevators (specific elevators only go to certian floors). Upon entering my room I noticed a very large dark stain in the center of the carpeting and when I made the turn around the bed there was another huge stain on the rug. I looked at the window and noticed that the window sheers were torn in multiple places. I called the front desk and requested another room and was told there was nothing they could do because nothing else was available. It was not until I demanded that they switch my room that they put me into a different room (which all they did was put me into a room of a guest that had not checked in yet and then gave them the dirty room). The reason I know this is because after the house keeping person came and inspected the dirty room and took me to the other room I went to the front desk to get the room key for my new room. At that time I was then told that I had not paid and they needed my credit card again. I asked to speak to a manager and was given a run around before eventually the front desk person realized that they had already put another customer into the room that was unacceptable to me and that she was looking up the other customers reservation information. The second room I was placed in was still not what I was expecting either. There was still a large coffee stain on the carpeting, the balcony had obviously not been checked from the last occupant because there were empty alcohol bottles left on the balcony, and there were brownie crumbs underneath the bed when I noticed that one of the legs which held up the center portion of the bed was missing and that was why the bed sagged toward the middle. The Delta Chelsea definitely is not worth the price no matter how much you pay. Especially since they charge you 25 dollars Canadian (with gst) per day to park in the garage on top of what you are already paying for your room. The rooms and facilities are not well maintained and the front desk personnel need some more training because they are unprofessional by my standards. I would suggest individuals stay clear of this hotel and save their time and money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly and Central”
Reviews.Author: benceltic
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions in June and found it to be excellent in comparison to other hotels during three weeks of travelling throughout Ontario and Quebec. The check in was friendly and accommodated our early arrival on each occasion, all staff were polite and couteous and housekeeping bent over backwards to give us a fridge, kettle and crib at no extra charge. Staff on two occasions waived away offers of tips and the Market Garden restaurant provided a variety of 24 hour food at a great price. this is the biggest hotel in canada, so don't expect particularly personal service, but the rooms are big enough, cleanliness was not a problem and location was central to everything Toronto has to offer. you get a free paper to your room each morning, there is a kids pool on the second floor with a slide and a quieter adults pool on the roof, but note that you cannot order drinks to your room, you must go to one of the hotel bars.

Reviews.Title: “Only at a low price (<$100us/night)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was okay for $114cnd/night. Had rooms in the south tower, on 8th floor. Hotel was busy, but this did not cause any problems with lines at check in/out, the hotel desk took forever to answer the phone on two occasions though. Hotel Negatives: 1) Central reservations messed up dates for our stay, Hotel was able to correct when I called to confirm. 2) Air conditioner was not working in one of the rooms, hotel handled this issue very poorly (basically did nothing) 3) Rooms on the dirty side, some stains on the carpets and walls. 4) Closet doors in both rooms were difficult to open, due to missing parts and loose screws. 5) Rooms showing a lot of wear definitely in need of renovation. Hotel Positives: 1) Kids liked the pool, cool slide. 2) If you're ok with Younge St., this is a good central location in downtown. Probably would not stay here again, although if offered the $168us savings (for two rooms over 3 nights) I might be tempted. If I was getting only one room, and didn't have the kids along, there's no way I'd return...

Reviews.Title: “Big but still provides the personal touch”
Reviews.Author: Iris
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel last week as part of a package holiday and we were a bit worried when we read some of the reviews but we needn't have been concerned.The service was first class from the check-in desk to the housekeeping staff who had a pleasant greeting for us when we met on the corridor. The room was spacious and well furnished and the bathroom was large and well stocked with nice toiletries and big towels were plentiful. Breakfast in the Market Place restaurant provided a good variety for all tastes and very good value also. Steve,the concierge,was especially helpful in arranging tours and theatre tickets and had exquisite good manners. The Delta certainly provides the personal touch and was a great central base for our first visit to beautiful Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: hersoton
Reviews.Content: Looking at some of the other reviews on the Delta Chelsea, I'm not quite sure we all stayed in the same hotel!! I stayed at the hotel for 10 nights at the beginning of April 05. The trip combined business and leisure, so I was accompanied by my sister for half the visit and on my own for the remainder. As both a business and tourist hotel it fulfilled all my needs perfectly!! The location is great. It's one block from the metro, and one block from the Eaton Centre. There are dozens of great resturants within a few minutes walk. The room was excellent - I was somehow fortunate in having not only two double beds but also a lounge area with sofa, chair and coffee table. Beds very comfy, and loads of storage space. Bathroom and other fixtures and fittings all fine. However it is the range of facilitites that make this hotel. The Marketplace resturant is excellent - no need to pay a fortune for breakfast if you just want a coffee and a bowl of cereal (CAN $5). No need to order expensive room service when you can help yourself to whatever you want and carry it back to your room (e.g. delicious pasta dishes for CAN$8, great soup and salad for even less). Consequenty didn't sample the more upmarket Bistro resturant (too many excellent resturants nearby), but it looked pretty good! Other facilities include two quite different bars; one a sports bar with free popcorn, the other more of a wine bar, but both with great value wines, beers and cocktails. Also, there is a very useful shop, and two great pool areas. One is deck 27 which is for adults only and also has a good gym, a great jacuzzi and views of the CN tower. The other is definitely more municipal; designed for famillies, with a flume, a huge oblong family jacuzzi and a very useful mini laundrette (in the women's changing area - not sure if the men had one too!). This area definitely lacks ambiance, but is I imagine a great facility if you have kids (it also includes a creche area). Probably the least succesful public area is the Deck 27 cocktail bar; great drinks, great views - but alas only open from 8pm on Friday and Saturday nights!!!! No use for a sundowner - the sun is well and truly down before it even opens!! Can only assume it opens earlier and more frequently in summer but why not all year round I have no idea....... So apart from this were there any other downsides? Well, I guess if you were totally allergic to children then you might be happier elsewhere, but I certainly didn't find them intrusive and there are plenty of 'adult only' spaces. Equally if you are allergic to big hotels then you might prefer to stay elsewhere, but frankly the pay off in terms of facilities is worth having (and note there is an excellent colour coded lift system which means you never wait more than half a minute for the lift - unlike some large hotels!). Also internet access was at typical (i.e expensive) hotel rates - but there is a great internet cafe right outside the door (Yonge St Entrance) - CAN $3 an hour! However, perhaps the greatest 'lure', especially for UK travellers, is the price of this hotel. I paid just Â£42 per night for the room (which could have easily taken two adults and two kids) booking with 'Globespan' in the UK. It goes up a bit in summer, but is still great value for a city centre hotel! All in all I believe the Delta Chelsea offers a great base in Toronto, and next time I visit the city it would certainly be my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Delta Provided Everything We Needed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I stayed at The Delta Chelsea during the summer of 2004 in June. It was my fiance's second stay in Toronto and my first. I picked this hotel through some internet research and found the price formidable especially for a downtown location. Everyone knows that hotels charge an arm and a leg for a stay in any downtown room so the price I found on the internet was great! It was a rate of approximately $109.00 CND; considering that I am from the US, the price was cool! We got there early, about 11 am, so from working at a hotel myself, I didn't expect the room to be ready until after 3pm anyway. They had it ready at 1pm so no complaints there. Speaking of complaints, it seems that some people just can't stay anywhere without saying something bad about something. The pool area was great! It was heated which was great! The room was clean which was great! The service was fast which was great! I've never seen a housekeeping staff make sure that you don't want service because they didn't want to leave until they were sure you had all your stuff which was great! The front desk staff was great! The concierge was great! The atmosphere was great! (Could come off that $22 a night parking fee, though.) I mean, when you are out of town on pleasure, do you really expect to stay in the hotel room long enough to inspect the individual carpet fibers? Let"s be real! We walked to almost everywhere we went. It's near shopping and dining and smack dab in the middle of a wondeful city and it's downtown area. Some people complained about prices going up: it's called inflation. Expect it wherever you go! Bottom line, the Delta Chelsea is a wonderful place to stay with satisfactory accomodations especially if you are looking for a comfortable place to sleep and return to after a long day of sightseeing. GO FOR IT!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located centrally downtown within walking distance of shops and mall and short cab ride to the Air Canada Center and Skydome. The lobby is always a zoo and very busy, but clean and accomodating. Unforunately, you don't sleep in the lobby. The rooms are older with stains in carpet and outdated facilities. You wouldn't be able to tell the difference between a Comfort Inn or the Delta, other than the fact you can stay in a nice Comfort Inn for half the price. For the price of this hotel, go stay at the Sheraton or Westin downtown for the same price. They are much cleaner and more modern with much newer bathrooms and more comfortable beds. This hotel definitely brings down the Delta name.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families, Singles? Not so much”
Reviews.Author: MargoDonohue
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is fine. The location is absolutely perfect, within walking distance of the main shopping strip and the museums. But you should be warned that they cater to families. I went on a holiday weekend alone and could not believe the number of screaming kids in the lobby. It never ended! The lines for the elevators was constant. Service was very good but try to avoid ordering your meals in your rooms as the food was only "eh." I am guessing during the week it is a little more quiet. The hotel is a fine deal money wise and the adults only pool/gym was a nice break from the kiddies. The Bistro downstairs makes a good steak and a yummy Ceasar salad. Rooms are good sized but the decor is more than just a little dated. Bathroom tubs are tiny but clean. That said, the location again is perfect. It is in the heart of downtown but very safe. The views are nice and the staff is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “march break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at the Delta Chelsea last week as well. Friendly Staff and amazing customer service!! It was quite busy and plenty of kids running around. I believe that the reason for this was that it was March/Spring Break and every parent in and out of the city and their kids were booked in that hotel. Since they have an indoor waterslide....that would explain it. I stay there on business a lot and it can be quiet a lot of times. Overall it's a hotel that I would come back to. Never boring!!

Reviews.Title: “No Parking at the Delta Chelsea,Downtown toronto”
Reviews.Author: j-nine1968
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Delta Chelsea was ok except for the fact that when we arrived we were instructed to go around back because we couldn't park underground because we have a mini van. The Valet parking attendant said that there was no problem with the underground parking . After searching the entire lot there was nothing available and by the time we got above ground our van was over heating. My husband went in and complained and was told that there were lots around the hotel that we could use and that they would deduct the automatic parking fee from our bill. There was no apology.

Reviews.Title: “Staff at wrong hotel??!??”
Reviews.Author: kdscott
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival into the lobby, you certainly feel like your in for something more than you actually get! All staff here are the most friendly I've had the pleasure of dealing with, courtious and smiling, they are ready to help with whatever they can. However, that seems to end once you cram yourself into the elevator and open the room door. The rooms are certainly in need of a major overhaul, and I think the cleaning staff can use some tips on what they are supposed to accomplish. Our room, albeit non-smoking, reeked of smoke from other rooms/floors, the beds left me and my partner stiff and sore, and the size of the rooms are something you'd certainly see in a small London hotel. The location is great and the pool is relaxing, but I would recommend looking around, you can certainly find a much cleaner and better hotel for an extra $20 or so.

Reviews.Title: “Smoker? Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: KikiConsuelas
Reviews.Content: The lobby is fantastic, the staff is friendly and the Consierge is more than ready and willing to find an answer for any questions you may have... But if you need a smoke like many Canadians do, do NOT stay here... Part of an enjoyable stay for me when I travel is the ambiance in the room.
