Granted smoking is a non-attractive habit, I have fallen victim to the occasional nicotine fix and like to have a cigarette or two in my hotel room... Now I'm not too sure how the other rooms would fare... but the smoking rooms are a nostalgic step back to what a 5 star room looked like back in the mid 70's... The decor was WAY out of date, the bed was as hard as a rock, there was no internet connection and the couch and curves in the seats from the thousands of people who have parked their arses on it... I have stayed in other hotels downtown TO that were the same price and their smoking rooms were just as classy and up-to-date as their non-smoking rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: dgrant
Reviews.Content: We got a deal at $99 in October 2004. Great location right in downtown. Pool was very nice, a little small but that's pretty standard. Nice hot tub too. We actually ended up upgrading to a better suite which ended up being like $135 or something. It was on some special floor and had turn-down service and a few other things. Not worth it at all. If you can get into this hotel for $99 or anything else which is cheap, stay here, it's pretty nice. But don't bother upgrading at all to a better suite, it's not much difference.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Chelsea Hotel Horror”
Reviews.Author: Kaspian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea in downtown Toronto from February 12 -13, 2005. I guess when they rated this hotel a four-star it must have been absolutely empty of people, because if you like waiting in a line-up for check-in, waiting to get into a crammed elevator, waiting to get down to the garage, and then waiting an hour-and-half in a car line-up to get out of the parking garage--this is for you! Fancy pools or not, screw this place! The rooms were small and average for a hotel--good towels, etc., but as a whole not excessively clean and the furniture is a little worn. Nice view of Younge Street from the 22nd floor. The pop machine was empty our whole stay--over two days. The only pop left that we were able to get out of it was "Mellow Yellow". All the hallways on our floor smelled of reefer the whole night. (And they promote this as a great place for kids to stay?) The adult pool area on the 27th floor was the only redeeming quality to this hotel--not very deep but clean and well kept. The sauna was also fine and hot, but the jacuzzi wasn't very powerful. The pool and front desk staff were both very friendly. It can take up to 20 minutes just to get down to the lobby because the elevator is always so packed, people getting on at all the floors, and pushing the wrong button. (They always push "2" instead of "Lobby.") There are way too many people in too small a space--if a fire ever broke out here everybody would be trampled to death. Don't waste your time--there has to be a better hotel in Toronto's core with a pool. (And believe me, you'll be wasting lots, and lots, and lots of time.)

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed February 4 and 5, 2005 during Toronto's "WinterCity" promotion. Our room was on the 23rd floor. King size bed was very comfortable, room was clean, balcony overlooked Yonge Street (which was a bit noisy on Saturday night...but that's Yonge St on any Saturday night!). Check in staff was good. Our vehicle was larger than the 5'6" self-park limit that their underground parking lot could accommodate, so we were given valet parking for the same price as self-parking at check in...although we did have to dispute the full-price that showed up on our bill. The adult recreation area was adequate...although the pool temperature was a bit too cool for my liking. The kids' pool and waterslide were over-run with people on Friday night but a little better on Saturday night. Location was excellent. We walked everywhere! I had stayed once before while visiting a family member at Mt Sinai Hospital...they have special "medical rates" if you request them...so I knew what I was in for. I would have no problem recommending this hotel for weekend getaways. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: angelabMaidstone
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel after being disappointed with Bond Place. Check in desk were very helpful and told us about the hotel. The help yourself restaurant was good, although the Hot breakfast wasn't that hot. We were put on the 15th floor overlooking Younge Street, great view. We had a paper every day and the cleaning staff were prompt. This is an ideal location for visiting toronto, subway, path and restaurants in touching distance of hotel. If we ever went back then this would be our choice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: elco1994l
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto 2nd weekend in nov/04 to take in the CFL Eastern semifinal game at skydome and decided to stay at the delta because of the special seasonal rate, which by far was the cheapest of all the major downtown hotels. Booked a premium room at a rate of $119 for the night , yes parking was very expensive at $22. We arrived at hotel early around 2pm on friday and were checked in quickly by courteous staff and yes the hotel lobby is large and very busy. Our room was nice with 2 beds and nicely decorated. Once in the room we wanted a minifridge, no problem it was brought up, later on wanted bath robes , again no problem they were brought up. We had no phone book in the room and wanted to contact some local restaurants, no problem called down to the bell desk and they got me the numbers, later on that same night around midnight wanted some honey for our hot totes, again no problem it was brought up no questions asked. Wanted a late check out no problem, checked out at 2pm Each time i called down they called me by name. With that being said we decided to stay one extra night thanks to the excellent service and attention we received. Nice quite pool on the 25th floor with amazing views and a nice pub that is attached to the area. Have stayed at many hotels in toronto and across the country and must say the service here was the best hands down.

Reviews.Title: “happy new year”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (seniors) decided to kick up our heels and ring in the New Year inToronto. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful at a very busy time of year. Our room was comfortable, the food was great and we plan to repeat our visit as we celebrate other important dates.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea for the second time in October this year. We stayed here in 2002 and thought it was so good we decided to return despite being put off by some of the poor reviews on this site. The staff at check in were helpful, and the queue was not bad at all as we checked in late, although the lobby was very busy at check out. The room we were in had two double beds so was a little tight to manoeuvre around in. Previously stayed in a king room, which was much better. The bathroom was small but clean, as was the rest of our room. I agree that some of the decoration is starting to look dated and that the balcony was dirty but we had no use for the balcony anyway. This is more than made up for by the good location of this hotel. It is close for the Eaton Centre and Bloor Street for shopping and is walking distance from most of the attractions. The subway is only one block away. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: UkLioness
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Chelsea in early November 2004. We were very wary because we had seen some bad reviews of the hotel, but we found the staff to be very friendly and check-in was very swift. We were dreading seeing our hotel room and were happy to find it clean and cosy. We were on the 7th floor and had a balcony so we had a decent view of Gerrard St. The airport shuttle bus also came in very handy and for $15.50 you cannot go wrong, although on the way from the airport the Delta is one of the last hotels in line for drop-off. I would thoroughly recommend the Delta Chelsea and we would definitely stay at the Delta Chelsea the next time we are in Toronto as it is in a great location and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for RISING prices!”
Reviews.Author: perkuton
Reviews.Content: We found the staff here very friendly for the most part but the room looked liked it hasn't been touched in 20 years. I realize they like the old look but the battered furniture was a bit much. The maid took our used coffee cups but failed to leave clean ones and didn't even bother to take the used drinking glasses. The location isn't bad, within walking distance to the subway and many restaurants plus Eaton so that was a plus. But make sure you do not order ANYTHING from room service, our $24.00 (CDN) order ended up being $39.00 (CDN) after they slapped on the service charges and taxes. We were very unhappy with that!

Reviews.Title: “good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Chelsea in 1980 and again when we first moved to Canada in 1981. The big remodel had not been done yet, so the hotel was smaller, but the service was great at the time. Since moving back to the states, I have stayed at the Chelsea numerous times when visiting Toronto. The same always holds true--book months ahead of time, book with the hotel directly, and ask for a room facing south---never have I been able to get the south facing room. Even if I am there at 3 o'clock check in. The front desk people are generally rude. The doormen and porters are generally very helpful. The rooms are average--nothing special, but if you are not going to spend a lot of time in your room, they do just fine. I stayed in a suite just once--it was average, also--a bit of a disappoinment in size and luxury. I would only recommend the suite if you are staying longer than a few days or if you need a lot of room. The suite was not suitable for entertaining. The best part of the Chelsea, though, is the location. You can't beat it. Everything is close or within walking distance, and the subway is just north across the street. I overlook the rudeness on check-in and the rooms facing anywhere but south--location is just too important.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pcbdoug
Reviews.Content: The Delta Chelsea is in a great location and the staff is helpful and cooperative, but the hotel needs to be refurbished. My room (632) was small, and the bathroom was very small. The furnishings were okay, but the carpet was dirty and the balcony was disgusting. I suggest you not even look at the balcony. However, the location of the hotel is so great, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “busy but smooth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights and loved it..check in / out was perfect...staff is very nice and extremely efficient..avoid the breakfast buffet in the grill but all other meals were above average...location is great you can walk to everything...many , many great restaurants / bars just out the front door...have fun in TO.....

Reviews.Title: “A bed factory”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I've stayed in. It is tired and in need of redecorating. The non-smoking rooms stank of smoke. The room was not large enough to fit the suitcase in without putting it somewhere we would trip over it. Dank and musty - I dread to think when the room was last cleaned properly. The hotel was really busy and reminded us of a bed factory - very impersonal and very over-priced. The best thing was the location - and Toronto is such a fabulous city even the hotel couldn't put me off.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the "Time for Toronto" package that included a one night stay at the Delta Chelsea, the musical "Hair Spray," city tour, and supper. Although, only a one night stay, we enjoyed our room, that was clean and comfortable. Being on the 19th floor, the north view was excellent. We have stayed at the Delta Chelsea before with our kids. It is our favorite place while in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “delta chelsa a lot of luxury for a little price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta for 14 nights and found the staff to be pleasant and eager to help you enjoy your vacation.Travelling with children in a city is often difficult with frequent cries of I,m bored ,however the Delta provides even the fussiest of kids with entertainment and fun things to do .They even have their own kids camp with trained leaders who for a minimal fee will entertain and feed your little darlings to allow you some time to yourselves .Babysitting is also provided on request. The rooms were clean and spacious ,food availible at all hours .A choice of bars within the hotel. All in all I will return .

Reviews.Title: “Too Much to Deal With........”
Reviews.Author: pawpaw
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Toronto 8/28 - 8/30 for a Blue Jays/Yankee game and decided to stay at the Delta Chelsea as we have done in the past. It's been years but we were always satisfied before. Well, things change..... When booking, we requested an early check-in as we were contemplating attending the Saturday game as well as Sunday. Early check-ins are not guaranteed and we understand this completely. Upon arrival, the lobby was an absolute zoo. The crowd was huge and, to make matters worse, they had set up activities to keep the hundreds of children occupied i.e face painting, an annoying "Lost in Space" throw back of a robot (which tried to engage my husband in amusing banter as he waited in long lines - not appreciated), free popcorn (half of which ended up on the floor), etc...I don't understand why they had to turn the lobby into a carnival when they knew it was going to be busy. Why can't children occupy themselves and/or their parents keep an eye on them?? This is a very nice lobby which I would have prefered to relax in as I waited two hours for my room. Instead, it was turned into Romper Room for the afternoon. The desk staff asked for customer patience and understanding due to how busy they were because of the game. Well, I am courteous and understanding but management knew they were going to have a full house that evening (over 1500 rooms occupied) and that people would all want to check-in prior to the game so let's schedule every front desk person and housekeeper we have in order to make that happen, OK. We completed initial check in, in which we were told we could upgrade for extra $$ to a room we had initally reserved anyway, which we declined, politely mentioning the word "scam" to them and then one similar magically appeared afterall. Go figure. We were told to return at 3:00 PM. We left, had lunch and returned at 3:00 PM. The room is still not ready. Waited until 3:30 PM and, now with no chance to make it to the game even if we wanted too, husband went up to the desk and requested compensation of some kind for the delay. At 4:00, our room was ready and we had free breakfast for both mornings. Although slow and begging for mercy, the front desk staff were friendly and willing to compensate and long as you were courteous in return. This is good business I guess but let's avoid the situation to begin with. The room was small but cozy, decorated quite nicely. Bathroom was equipped with nice amenties and ample fluffy towels but the floor was filthy and the ceiling moldy. Very small TV. Nice but worn furnishing. A small dirty door led out to a very cramped balcony with no chairs. You wouldn't want to sit out there anyway; bird droppings and pieces of rusty old wire (?). I felt like I needed a shot after I came back in from there!!! Ice was a mile down the hall; good exercise I guess. Hooray!!! An adult only pool area on the 27th floor. First, we ventured down to the Family Fun area as we heard they had a new water slide and we wanted to check that out. Upon entering, I discovered the zoo had moved from the lobby to this pool area! This is a great place for families but it was loud and crowded so no slide for us. The adult only area is quite nice and clean. The fitness area is connected but not separated so all this great equipment is in a very hot area. I found it difficult to use the treadmill. The pool was clean and refreshing; the hot tub was perfect tempature but very heavily clorinated. The view from this area was great. It's open till midnight. Don't try to utilize the deck area for a little private champagne drinking late at night; pool attendant is right there to inform you of the rules, which, by the way, were posted but we felt a little sneaky. No problem. We were quite understanding. Our breakfasts were very good. Nice outside dining area off The Market Place. a rather rude cashier gal Sat. morning though..... We found the staff in general to be helpful - answering questions, giving directions, providing free newspapers. Scam in lobby - a professional gal sitting at a desk offering your visitor tax refund right there. After she processes the paperwork, you're informed of a huge surcharge!! She lies and tells us there are surcharges if you stop at he bridge on the way back. We travel to Canada quite a bit and this is not true. Now, for those who don't want ot stop on the way back, this is a convenience and be my guest but he fact that here is no indication of a surcharge on her signs AND the representative flat out lies to you, this is not appropriate so we went right to the front desk and spoke to management. They informed us that she is not affiliated with the hotel; well, that should also probably be on one her signs. Front desk staff did confront the girl along with us and she promptly cancelled our paperwork, assuring us we would have no problem at the bridge refund place....and we did not. We confronted her about her statement reagrding the surcharge at the bridge and she was somewhat silent. We informed the hotel staff that, although not affiliated with the hotel, it is in fact a reflection of the Delta Chelsea if you allow "businesses" like this (misleading tourists) in your lobby. Goodness sake, they have large signs on the doors of the hotel leading out to Yonge Street that indicate ricshaw drivers/service are not affiliated with the Delta Chelsea "assume own risk...." but it's OK for a scam to go on right in the lobby?!?!? When I think of all the unknowing tourist in and out of that hotel who fell for that......ugh! So, that was our recent experience at the Delta Chelsea. Be prepared, be alert. It's a nice hotel that eludes class, it just falls short in some key areas and requests your understanding. I guess I'm just not in the mood to "understand" when I'm paying high prices to stay in what I expect to be a classy place. I shouldn't have to think twice when I'm trying to enjoy a getaway weekend and certainly should not have to tolerate that many ups and downs, right?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta Chelsea one night this past weekend. The room was very small but the rate was very fair for the hotel's location. It's within walking distance of Eaton Centre, lots of other shops, restaurants, theaters, etc. The food was very overpriced for what we got, I thought. Overall though, it was a real nice visit. Loved Toronto. I agree with others posters who mention that the hotel needs some updating. The balcony was very dirty, the windows were dirty, didn't really entice you to step outside.

Reviews.Title: “Usually a reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: farrelli
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there many times but often consider changing. It's usually a fair value for the price. The rooms are sometimes bad but they'll move you to an OK one. Ask to be put in the newer wing. If something's wrong (as something ALWAYS is) they'll compensate you. This is their best feature. Worst features - not much control over room temperature, for-pay internet access, stained towels. Location is also not squarely downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel not Worth the big bucks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I donÃ¨t want to be too hard on them. Delta Chelsea is a quality hotel, nice rooms (But small...), quick checkin-checkout, nice location in downtown Toronto but charging way too much compare to the real 4-5 stars hotel in downtown TO. This is a 3 star hotel, no more. Room Rate are about 25% too high, they charge only 22$ a night for parking(!!!!!!!!!) when they advertise 7$ outside in order to trick you. Food is way too much for what you get. A croissant, milk and yogourt for only 10$(!!!). For the same room rate, I'd rather stay in a nicer hotel for if the city is sold out, you will still be ok if you don't mind paying 22$ for parking. Thanks!

HotelInfo.Name: Delta Chelsea
HotelInfo.Address: 33 Gerrard Street W., Toronto, Ontario M5G 1Z4, Canada
